text: The box arrived in good shape and cereal is fresh.
The box arrived in good shape and cereal is fresh.
The box arrived in good shape and cereal is fresh.  I
The bag arrived in good shape and the pretzels were fresh.

This is a nice little oil diffuser and humidifier.  It is about the size of a softball.  The only way to plug it in is through USB.  I love this for a few reasons.  First it does not use much electricity.  2nd, every humidifier I have ever used is made in a way that the water holding tank can not be opened to clean.  What a pain!  I have thrown away quite a few.  This one can be.  The water in it lasts about 2 1/2- to 3 days. The only essential oil I have right now is peppermint.  When this oil diffuser/humidifier arrived, I filled it and added 6 drops of peppermint oil.  In a few minutes, the entire house filled with peppermint!  The smell lasted about an hour.  Peppermint oil is very strong to begin with which I am sure helps, but I imagine any other oil would not be too different.  For such a small humidifier, I am very impressed! I received this humidifier in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

I have honestly been through about 6 different kinds of mops in the last 6 years and it has been frustrating.  I first saw the spin mop a few months ago and really wanted to try one, but never got around to buying one.  I finally had the chance to try this one and I am incredibly happy!  I understand there are electric ones.  I am pleased this one is not.  I think an electric one would probably end up dying at some point when there really is no way for this to fail.  However, if you are older or if you are buying for someone older who will have trouble pushing down on the handle, electric would probably be better.  There are 2 spin areas, 1 in the bucket and 1 on top.  The spin basket takes almost no effort at all to use, but the spin area in the bucket does take some effort, most likely because of the water.  The spin area in the bucket cleans off your mop head  while the spin basket dries the mop head for you.  The microfiber mop head could not be more perfect.  I have been able to get in and around places that I normally have to handwash like along the walls, in corners, under the heaters.  I have washed the mop heads in the washer, but I washed them by themselves and they held up great.  I left them hang to dry.  LOVE LOVE LOVE this mop!! I received this spin mop in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

I really love these!! They look great with the stainless steel tops and glass bottoms.  They make it so easy to put oil and finger on my subs, salads, vinegar on my fries, oiling my pans and so on.  They spray more of a mist I think is the right word for it.  Not too much comes out, so there are no worries about too much coming out. Since oil is thicker, it has a slightly harder time spraying, but still works well.  Filling the bottles is easy and so far I have had no issues with filling, using or cleaning.  I love these little bottles and hope to have them around for a long time!  I received these oil and vinegar sprayers in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.​

This is a strong, very durable bike lock!  The 6 ft length provides enough leeway for wherever you need to lock up your bike while the 1/2 inch in diameter cable (including the thick, heavy duty tubing) makes it harder than normal for your regular joe with regular tools to cut it.  The lock is a little shaky when connected to the mounting bracket.  I did put it through a pretty hard test and it held pretty well.  I love that you can choose your own combo, and it is easy to set (4 steps - included instructions).  Great bike lock!  I received this lock in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

I have had quite a few of these hoses.  This one is actually the best quality I have had so far!  They are equipped with nice brass connectors.  The hose is itself uses a thicker material than the ones I have used in the past.  The sprayer is not bad either.  The trick with these hoses is to ensure that all the water is emptied from the hose when you are finished with it at the end of the day.  I figured this out with the first couple that I had (not this brand).  Leaving the water in seemed to weaken the hoses.  I have not had left the water in this one to see if it would weaken it.  I just have not wanted to take that chance.  I do love how light and portable these are.  I have used this one quite a few times and it still shrinks and works great.  I received​ this hose in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

This is a great little water filter.  I love that it is compact, makes it perfect for hiking, camping etc when you usually do not want to carry a lot of weight.  Our family, like a lot of other families is preparing for the unthinkable.  We like to have enough supplies for whatever may come to ensure we did everything possible for our kids.  A way to have drinkable water at all times is on the top of our list.  Unfortuneatly, I had no way of testing the water after being filtered, so for now, I tested it on our tap water.  For reasons unknown, once in awhile our tap water turns brown.  Needless to say, we do not drink the tap water.  I waited for that time to come, to finally test out the filter  (took about a month).  The filter did great!  The brown water came out clear and tasted great!  I do plan on finding a way to test the water before I buy one for each member of the family, but for now I am convinced!  Great product.  I recieved this product in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

This is a great little light! It is about the size of a softball, maybe a little smaller (It has been some time since I have held a softball).  Incredibly easy to use.  Once you receive it, just set it in water and it will light up. To turn it off, take it out of the water.  No actual buttons mean less chance for the inside to get water in it.  There are 2 sensor like buttons on the bottom.  I tried to get the battery cover off, but failed miserably, it is on there very well.  Hoping when the time comes, that my husband can get it off. I have not yet hit the 30-hour​ mark, so I can not verify the length of use, however, it is very bright.  The mode and colors change while in use.  This is a fun little toy at a decent price.  Depending on the size of the pool, pond or whatever you want to put them in, you may want more than one.  Great product!  I received this product in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

We wanted these more for camping than on the grill.  Since I received these after we were finished camping for awhile, I did get a chance to try them on the grill.  They are plenty big enough, which is great.  We cooked pork chops and steaks on them and had no issues.  The meat had grill marks, cooked quite well and tasted delicious!  The downside for us was that the packaging states you should not use metal on them.  We did not own plastic or silicone spatulas/tongs.  The feel of the mat made me think I could get away with our metal ones on it, but decided not to chance it. We went and bought new utensils and I guess we will just pack them with the rest of our camping gear.  Other than that, very impressed.  I received this product in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.  ​

This light travels a long way.  It took some time to get here (about 3 weeks) but did arrive in perfect working order.  I got the 18 cm long light.  It is not that big, but it is very bright and It work great. I am using it in my laundry room right now.  I have the light plugged into a USB plug in a regular outlet.  There is an on/off switch which I loveI  It is a simple push of a small button. My only downside is the cord length is not very long.  They are currently selling this light for about $4 which is a really great price for what you get.  These are perfect for any space that needs extra light  They are thin, so the light itself is not an eyesore.  Aside from the cord (With a little effort you can find a way to conceal or hide the wires, depending on the setup you have at home.) I will be adding pictures in a day or so.  Great product for the price.  I received this light in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

These body wraps are fairly easy to use, once you get use to them and the process.  I have used several different wraps in the past and I really like these for how they leave my skin feeling afterward.  I guess refreshed would some it up.  The thing about wraps is, they are temporary weight loss, but they do work! I like to use them right after a shower to make sure the area is clean.  While the bandages were soaking, I mixed the clay.  I wanted to make sure I pulled the bandages, rung them out and put them on before they had a lot of time to cool.  I like to pull the bandages from the water while they are still hot (just not to the point where it would burn my skin).  I then used saran wrap and wrapped myself as tight as I could.  Having someone help you do this, works to your advantage.  It is not that easy wrapping yourself tightly with saran wrap.  The saran wrap helps keep the area warm and the mess from the clay getting on your furniture or clothing.  That is pretty much it.. Leave on about an hour and wipe off.  Smell is not terrible and leaves your skin feeling great!  After a few uses, I could really start to see a change.  I received this product in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

This is a nice air compressor.  I love that it comes with all the tips needed to fill several different air filled objects.  It can be plugged into a regular outlet or into the car cigarette outlet.  Both wires are plenty long enough. It is loud like an air compressor.  Seems to be well enough made.  I first used it to top off my kids balls that have been losing air the past couple years.  I then tried it on my 2 of our pool floaties just to see how it worked (It is getting to cold for swimming).  My husband also used it to fill 2 of the tires on the car, that needed just a touch of air.  We experienced no issues filling any of them.  I received this product in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.
Very cute, kids loved it.
Great movie! Very funny :-)
Mine did not work. From the beginning, it only showed half numbers or sometimes no numbers at all.I received this product at a discount for an honest, unbiased opinion,

My husband is a woodworker, carpenter and all around handyman.  He comes home often with caked on muddy shoes and speaking as the one who cleans our floors, I love this little guy!!! I was slightly worried that it would be to big and take up a lot of space, but it does not.  The base of the cleaner is solid and very durable with thick wooden sides and bottom with a metal surrounding.  The bristles are tough and long.  I had a somewhat hard time bending them to try and get a good picture of how thick they are.  I have no worries that they will wear out anytime soon. The center of the bottom is left opened.  There is mounting hardware included so you can secure it to the floor and not have to worry about it sliding around as you drag your shoes through.  If you need to clean mud, I recommend letting it dry first.  It does an awesome job getting the majority of the dirt and dust off of his shoes with minimarl effort.  Overall the product is made well and works great!  I recieved this product in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

The reason I really wanted this was because my husband started to hand make the  handles for our basic kitchen knives.  He bought very expensive blades for these knives.  You can see in the pictures the handles are not quite finished yet.  When your knives get thrown around in your kitchen drawer or in a knife bin, they get dull.  If you place them on the wall on a magnetic knife holder, they do not.  Unfortunately when I ordered this, we were supposed to be moving.  At our current house, we have no great place to put this where our younger kids can not get to it.  We later decided to wait another year before moving.  This means it will be another year before we can use it. I did try the holder out.  I placed all of our basic HEAVY kitchen knives on the holder, but I am holding it.  This is a really nice magnetic knife holder.  It is very heavy duty.  After having all the knives on it, I shook it around, played with it and pulled the knives on and off.  The magnets are very strong. The knives held great!  I can not wait until we can get this on the wall to use all the time!  I received this magnetic knife holder in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

This is a pretty decent little set.  I had never tried a garlic peeler before so this was new to me and I must say that I was impressed.  The peel did come off with ease and within seconds.  The Rocker also worked well grating and mincing.  I would say these tools are more someone who uses  a lot of garlic at one time.  Maybe it is my lack of dishwasher but I would not go through the work of pulling this out, using,  then the washing for a small clove.  However, when I am in a hurry and need to do a lot, this would quickly get the job done! I received this set in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

This is the first kind of pan like this that I have ever seen.  The design is brilliant.  You first add water, wine, etc to the ring, place your pan on the burner, then heat your stove to medium and place your food on the pan to cook.  I love that you can (should) add water, or flavored liquid in the ring.  I am not 100% sure why you need to do this, but I do know that it does help keep it moist and is an awesome way to add flavoring.  So far we made cilantro chicken and pork chops on it.  Both came out delicious! Tender, juicy, and flavorful. The pan is made from a thin metal.  But has not made a difference.  I do not see the non-stick coating lasting to long (I am used to this, happens to all my non-stick pans)  I just eventually scrub it off to ensure that it does not get in my food.  Other then that, I am very please with my indoor stove top grill!  I received this product in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

This is a cute shirt.  Definitely a casual look.  The shirt fits great and looks good.  I did measure myself before ordering.  It is also made well.  I found that because of the ties in the back, the shirt keeps you cooler on really hot days.  My only downside is that finding a bra that looks good with it is a bit of challenge unless you have one with a clear backing or something that just covers your boobs. It would of been nice it the shirt had an extra layer of tighter material in the front inside, so wearing a bra is unnecessary.  I received this shirt at a discounted price in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

I tried these and the 1 foot cords and I love them both!  They are heavy duty, so they are able to handle bigger appliances.  With the pack of 2, if 6 feet is not quite enough, you can put 2 together and make a 12 foot cord.  Right now, I have one plugged into our fish tank power strip and the other  plugged into our microwave.  We have not had any issues at all.  We have other heavy duty extension cords but they are for my husbands work and are also about 15 feet long, so not ideal for in the house.  Now I can finally move our larger appliances and electronics anywhere I want, without needing to think about the outlets first and I am thrilled!  I received this product in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

I love this idea! I can not count the amount of times that I have moved around our furniture and electronics only to find that I needed just a few more inches to plug in the electronic where I moved it.  It is such a pain!  I have quite a few extension cords, but they are normally 6 feet longer then they need to be and makes more work for me when I try to hide the cord.  These are perfect. They give me just the right amount of extra cord.  Since a lot cords do have that big, bulky plug to them, you can not always use every plug in a power strip.  These make that possible.  These extension cords are thick, durable and well made.  I just need about 15 more of them :-) Great product!  I received this product in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

Just in the past year or so, I have learned the importance of a great coaxial cable wire.  We only use analog TV and streaming services.  The cable wires outside were installed when the previous tenants ordered cable, so they were somewhat new.  I used those and a couple old cable wires that we owned to hook up to an antenna in the attic.  It was a great setup, or so I thought.  We had gotten more channels than ever, they all came in more clear and we did not have the terrible sight of an antenna and cable wires all over our rooms that needed to be adjusted every time we wanted other channels.  We used that setup for 3 years.  About a year ago, we decided to switch to an internet connected through cable (just internet, no cable).  We installed it ourselves, but they sent new wires and such.  I decided to use the coaxial cables sent to connect our TV to the antenna setup and the current coaxial cable to connect to the modem.  Just by switching that one coaxial cable, I we got a few more channels.  I know it was the cable wire because none of the other TV's had any sort of change.  I was thrilled!This is a very nice kit.  I love that they include a splitter and an assist wrench.  I do not know about anyone else reading this, but trying to screw them in is a pain in butt.  Everything is nicely packaged and easy to set up.  If these are hand packaged by tech professionals, they took care of their products which is a good sign.  You can tell that nice, durable materials are used. I used the splitter where my outside cables connect, and one of the 6 foot cables in the attic to connect from the wall outlet to the antenna.  Everything works great!  The only downside for me is that the coaxial cables are only 6 feet.  Depending on where your setup is and what you are connecting, 6 feet could be a good or bad thing.  If your setup is close to where you connect, great! Less cable mess.  If you are like me and change up the rooms in your house often, then 6 feet doesn't give you to much room to go on.  Now if you didn't plan on using both cables at the same time, you could use the splitter and both 6 foot cables to make a 12 foot and give yourself more room to work with.  I received this kit in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

I really love this bowl!! I hate pouring my noodles and hot water with the strainer in the sink.  The steam pulls up really gross bacteria from in the drain.  I do not always have my husband to help so this is perfect for me! You have to start slowly pouring the water out or it will splash up on you when the noodles it.  The only issue we have had with it, is that it is not big enough to pour a family sized pot of noodles in.  We have fixed this problem by placing our regular strainer in the bowl, this way we can still pour from the side of the sink and fit all the noodles in.  I have used this bowl for rinsing grapes, lettuce, potatoes, noodles, blueberries, and raspberries.  It has worked well for all.  My only complaint was that I could not remove the strainer so I thought it was glued in.  Apparently you can, so I guess my problem is that I was not trying hard enough :-).  Such a great and useful product!  I received this product in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

Oo I really love these!! Such a cute ideaI just started homeschooling my 1st grader, where my 4 year old participates and my 1 year old sits in, colors and yells out words whenever she sees fit.  The first 2 weeks of school got really messy.  Books and papers everywhere, pencils in various places.  Dry erase markers, erasers, glue, etc. I would clean things up at night, then the next night would look like another tornado ran through.  I needed an organized area for her.  When I saw these, I thought how perfect! The ceramic is well made with chalkboard paint on it.  They do provide 4, individually wrapped waxy-like crayons, maybe chalk.  One for each cup.  The lids have an okay suction to them.  I LOVE that they are all in a different color.  The colors are vibrant and look great.  I have pencils in 1, dry erase markers with eraser in another, scissors in the 3rd and glue in the 4th.  They bring a certain something to the "classroom".  If I hadn't needed better organization for the classroom, I would of gladly used these in the kitchen.  The colors chosen for the lids would look great in just about any kitchen and though I would not want a jar to fall off the counter full of sugar, I feel confident that the lid could keep out dust and possible bugs lurking.  Other great uses that I could see would be candy or in the bathroom for cotton balls, q-tips etc... Very versatile!  I received these Ceramic Jars in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

It works! We have deet based bug spray for camping and mainly ticks.  The deet based states on the bottle to only use on your clothes and that it will burn your skin.  Well I can not in good faith put that on my children, so we would only use it while walking through the woods on the bottoms of our pants.  I was more than thrilled to try out an all natural bug spray.  I have to admit, I was skeptical as I have tried "all natural" before and it did not work.  We finally had the chance to try this out the other night at gramma and grampas.  I put it on all 3 kids and myself.  It almost smells like murphy's oil and lemon pledge put together. To me not awful, but I could see how others might think so. Then again, I think our deet based spray stinks, so why wouldn't I at least choose the one that would not burn my kids.  It is thick and you do need to rub it in.  It dries on skin without an oily residue.  It really does work!  While others would complain about getting bit here and there, or I would watch them swatting gnats, we were fine.  I did get the occasional bug in my face, but it didn't stick around long.  I checked my kids when we got home, and no signs of being bitten.  Quick showers, and we could no longer smell the bug spray.  Great Product! My only downside is I think the price could be a little lower, but at least a little does go a long way.  I received this all natural bug spray in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

I read a bunch of other reviews for these that said the cushions fell off easily.  I can not believe that many customers would be wrong or exaggerating, so I am thinking that maybe they re-did the design of the headphones because I have not had that issues at all.  I even messed with the cushions, to try and get them to fall off and I could not.  These are the first pair of kids headphones that my kids can wear comfortably, without having them fall of their heads a hundred times.  The padding is thick and large.  It covers their entire ear.  I actually used them a few times and they do sound pretty good.  We have had these over a month, have used them several times and have had no issues at all.  Great pair of head phones! I forgot to grab a picture of them, so I will tomorrow ( It will be of my 6 year old wearing them :-).  I received these kids headphones in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

We are using this on the back of the front seat of our car and I really like it! The strap to wrap around the seat is detachable and comes unattached, tucked into a pocket.  The straps are adjustable and I had a nice fit around my seat.  The pockets at the top are pretty big and can hold whatever is necessary for the car ride.  The reason I keep it in the car is for the insulated bag.  A lot of our car rides run an hour or more long.  Having this attached to the back of the seat makes it easy for us to store snacks and drinks for the kids, in a place where they can grab them without my help since it is hard for me to continuously reach back there.  I keep it in front of my oldest child so she can handle passing out the stuff for me.  The insulation of the bag is like what you would in those grocery store insulated bags and I will post a picture of what I mean, but it does do the trick and leave are drinks and suck cold until we need them.  We do use ice packs.  The material of the entire thing is somewhat thick and very durable. Great product! I received this 5 in 1 organizer in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

These are pretty nice kick mats.  There is a pattern on them but it blends into the mat so you can only see it when looking from certain directions.  There are 2 pockets near the top, so It is pretty easy for my kids to grab things out of them and they are high enough to where if my kids put their shoes on the mat, the yuck from their shoes doesn't get on the items in the pockets.  They do use a thin, durable material.  We have pretty big front seats (suburban) and the mats just fit the seats.  I was able to place the bottom elastic in the crack of the seat and have it stay, and the tops were just long enough to fit around the headrest.  I am thrilled the bottom elastic can be hidden or else my husband would not allow it in the car.  These are easy to clean and easy to manage and now my kids can no longer turn our tan seats black :-)  I received these kick mats in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

I am a sock fanatic! I especially love new socks.  How they smell and feel (weird I know),  but I can also say I am somewhat of an expert.  You should always wear a nice pair of quality socks.  You feet take the most abuse out of your entire body and deserve to be pampered.  These are really well made.  The fabric feels great on your feet.  They are not big and bulky.  They are stretchy, soft,  and breathable.  They are not however, so stretchy that they lose their form after wearing.  The prints on them are really cute.  I like how you get 2 different prints.  They have tons of different prints to choose from when you order.  The size is great for a teen or an adult.  If you love your socks like I do, You will most definitely love these!!  I received these pairs of socks in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

I have wanted one of these for years and am very pleased to have gotten this one.  You have to watch when you first open the package because they have it super wrapped with the "wings" together.  When I unwrapped it, the thigh master kind of hopped out and went flying.  I suppose that also answer the question about the resistance.  Yes it has quite a bit of resistance.  The "wings" are about 9 1/2 inches long and are fully padded.  I really like using it!  I did a quick search online for different ways to use and found MANY videos.  You can work your belly, thighs, arms, chest and so on.  One of favorite ways to use it is to lay on the couch with my kids while they are watching tv (we have a pretty firm sectional)  It is also like laying on the floor without the added pain of laying on the floor.  I can work my thighs, arms and chest while using their shows to time myself.  It is also the first piece of exercise equipment that I have owned that I can use without my kids getting in my way.  I have been using every day since I got it without any problems.  I received this product in exchange for an honest unbiased opinion.

These are really nice garment bags!!.  I had some not to long ago with a really bad chemical smell, so I was very pleased when I opened these up and did not find that.  There is a clear plastic window, so there is no guessing when you want to find something to wear.  The material is pretty thick and durable, as well as the zipper.  I like that you get 3 garment bags but it would have been nice for them to include 3 shoe bags (instead of just 1), though that is not much of a big deal.  The garment bags should be big enough for whatever outfit you plan to use them for.  Such a great way to keep your clothes clean organized! Great product!  I received these garment bags in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

0:17 Mins This is a decent little camera.  It is not movie theater quality and I have never used a gopro, but considering the price difference I would imagine the quality is better on the gopro.  That being said.  This action cam is a few hundred dollars cheaper and does do the trick!  I will be able to capture my children in all their glory without my videos looking like smears across the screen.  The camera itself is about 3 cm tall and wide.  There is a strong magnet on the bottom for accessories and mounting.  It is very easy to use.  Hold in the button on top to turn it on.  Once it is on, hit the button once for a picture, twice to record.  When done recording, hit the button one more time to stop.  The camera is not waterproof, but IS splash proof and I know you can buy an accessory (a clear box) to put it in if you wanted to use in the water.  It also works pretty well in the house.  It was not sunny out when I took that short video, so you can the quality is not that bad.  The only things I do not like is the fact that without the accessories, there is really no way to secure the camera.  At the very least, you should be able to attach a lanyard and you wouldn't have to worry about losing it somewhere. I also do not like that the videos come in .mov format.  I had to convert the video (converting software was free and easy to use)in order to watch it on my computer.  I could however plug the camera in my TV without problems to watch the video on there.  I received this polaroid action camera at a discount in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

We used these when we went to a local amusement park near our house.  It is a pain to grab toilet paper, set it out, lift my kids up to put on the toilet paper so it does not fall off in the process and all this before my kids pee themselves.  I was more or less desperate for a better solution.  These are really nice.  Since they are thicker, if there was something on the toilet that I did not see, I didn't have to worry about it soaking through the cover.  The "grips on the back kept it in place through the whole ordeal (I still lifted my kids and sat them down just in case).  They covered the entire seat without a problem.  I also like that they fit in a small, thin pack.  I easily kept them in my purse for easy access.  They are a great price for the quality!  My only suggestion is if you decide to buy,  please think of how many people will be using them and for what you are using them for.  We are a family of 5 and only 2 of my kids used them.  It was not enough for the day!! I think this company should sell larger packs (or maybe options to buy more than 1 pack with a discount for the more you buy).  Other than that, I really liked them!  I received these protective covers in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

So so happy I got this light!! Our bathroom is at the top of the steps and because of that, at night I get really scared about my kids going to the bathroom. I really do not like having the hall lights on because that light switch controls 2 ceiling lights for 2 separate hallways and I feel that is to much light on and completely unnecessary. Also when my kids go to the bathroom in the middle of the night, they tend to not turn the light on and go to the bathroom in pitch black.  My son did that the other night ( I just happened to be up).  My SON.. Where is he peeing if he can not see!?!?  This light is perfect for my problem!  I have it where the 2 halls meet each other with the light facing towards the bathroom.  When they come out of the hallway into the other,  the light turns on and they can see their way to the bathroom and to turn on the light. Plus when they leave the bathroom this light will turn on and stay on just long enough for them to turn off the light and walk into their hallway and I no longer have to worry about them not seeing the steps.  It has been working perfectly.  You can turn the light in any direction and it will stay.  The light comes out of the fixture for easy replacement of the batteries.  It does come with a screw, but I am just using the included "3M" tape.  Just make sure you select "auto" instead of "on" or else the light will never turn off.  I Love it!! I received this light in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

This is a pretty nice thermometer. I like that the mouth piece is made from silicone which feels more comfortable in your mouth. It takes your temperature in under a minute. I tested the results with 2 other thermometers in the house and they were accurate. The numbers on the LCD screen are easy to read. I also like that they include a few thermometer covers, but I would of loved it if it included more (In a family of 5 it can become a nuisance to continuously wash the thermometer when multiple people are sick). The case for it is an added bonus to help keep it clean and protect it from it breaking. As far as oral thermometers go, this is definitely one of the better ones! I received this thermometer in exchange for an honest unbiased opinion.

Love this hair towel.  I actually have the smaller one as well, which my daughter uses.  I was very excited to find out that they came out with a larger one for longer hair like mine.  These towels are super soft.  I love that they are not so incredibly thick or huge that they are heavy on top of your head.  They tuck nicely in the back so you can wear it and go about getting dressed and such without it falling off your head.  They also dry quickly so I have no problems hanging them on hooks in the bathroom to not have to wash them after every use.  Plus now that we have the small and large, my 6 year old daughter feels more like a big girl having something that mommy has :-).  She loves it! I received this large microfiber hair towel in exchange for an honest, unbiased opinion.

It's a fun book with a familiar theme of coping with feeling different. The story is silly and has bathroom humor which I'm not a fan of, but many kids around age 8 think bathroom humor is the funniest thing ever.It was funny in a childish manner. Nothing too complex. Good for some fluffy reading.

They're comfortable and work well-enough. I prefer my tongs to have a longer gripping area for better, um, gripping. When in gripping position, the silicone tips touch each other, but where the silicone tips end, there's almost a gap of 1". I wish the tips stayed more straight, instead of curving out so much; therefore, more of the the scalloped parts would touch each other.Speaking of the tips, I couldn't get them off. Granted, I'm not the strongest person in the world, but any stronger, I felt like I'd rip off the silicone tips that may never stay on afterwards. There's a very slight gap where the silicone tips end, especially on the inside side of the tongs. There's a chance that food or liquidy stuff might get in there. Of course this isn't an issue if I can remove the tips, but I cannot.Otherwise, the tongs work well. The locking mechanism works well, and it can be hung.

I've been a Macbook Pro user for over a decade, but getting another MBP as another computer seemed too pricey, so I was happy to receive the Zenbook UX305LA to review because I was looking for a PC laptop.This looks a lot like Macbook Air. It works well, looks great and has good battery life, with a good amount of RAM and hard-drive capacity. However, it falls short in a few areas:- The keyboard is not backlit. I didn't realize how crucial this feature was until I was typing in the dark.- The power button is the same size as the delete button which is located next to the power button. It has a small light, but it's easy to hit "delete" accidentally, especially when the keyboard is not backlit if you're typing in the dark.- (I use a laptop stand, so this isn't an issue.) The laptop's four corners have rubberized feet. Unfortunately, when the laptop is being used on a flat surface like a desk and is open a little beyond 90-degrees, the back/bottom part of the screen-containing lid lifts the back part of the Zenbook, so the rear two rubberized feet don't come in contact with the surface, i.e. only the front two rubberized feet keep it from moving around, which doesn't keep things as stable. This is a design flaw.- Opening the Zenbook takes some thought. There's no indentation to allow a good, easy position to lift up the screen/lid.- The touchpad takes a while to get used to. It's definitely different from Macbooks.This isn't a negative - just an FYI: The Zenbook does NOT have a touchscreen.The price is pretty good and much lower than a comparable Macbook Air. It works fine for today's computing needs, with everything being on cloud. If you plan on buying this, please be sure to familiarize yourself with an unlit keyboard. I didn't realize how annoying that'd be that I'd rather pay a bit more for that feature, even though I rarely type in a dark or semi-dark environment. With a backlit keyboard, this would be a solid 4-star machine, possibly 5 if the price stayed the same.

It's a nice, lightweight, classic polo shirt. It doesn't wrinkle very much, so no ironing needed, unless you're overly fastidious.After washing, the size small when placed on a flat surface measures:- 18" pit-to-pit.- almost 25" from shoulder/collar seam to the bottom (the longest part of the shirt).- 8 1/2" short-sleeve.- a little over 6" for arm opening.It's very comfortable, and the sewn logo of an animal is not too noticeable since it's in the same color. Perfect for golfing and many workplaces.

These are like the black marble composition notebooks we're all familiar with, except they have plastic covers in six different colors. The covers are more durable than the cardboard material, and the colors make it easy to distinguish which notebook is for what.These notebooks are a welcomed improvement to the traditional ones.

This is a great all-in-one printer at a great price. I especially appreciate all the thoughts that must've gone into to make this printer because it's not excessively large for what it offers: flatbed scanning, multiple feeders, lovely results. My last Canon had a paper tray which always stuck out because it couldn't be stowed away. Annoying.The setup took a while - you might need to visit Epson's website to download some updates.This is great for printing colored documents and photos on the go. It prints black-and-white documents too, but I would get a separate laser printer for that due to the higher cost of toners for inkjet printers. I also wouldn't print several gigs of photos stored in my computers and cellphones - I'd use a photo-printing company for such huge volumes.It's a great value for a well-designed printer which produces colorful results.

This is a basic microphone for musicians, comparable to the classic Shure SM58. This is not a condenser mic which picks up every nuance or background noise. A dynamic mic (like this one) can be more useful if you're not in a completely silent studio environment for recording your music.I don't have a high-end brand's dynamic mic like a Neumann to compare this, but this serves the purpose for an all-purpose general mic. It should also be a good performance mic at a club, though my gigging years are long gone.You need an XLR cable to use this. (That's a typical microphone cable.) I don't know why this product is listed under "wireless," as of the time of this review because this is not a wireless mic.Overall, a good, affordable, basic starter microphone for recording and performing. My 5-star rating considers the price because it provides excellent value for what you pay. It's particularly great for starting musicians, but experienced musicians often have extra mics around, and I wouldn't mind having this in my stash - it's always good to have a cheaper, well-working mics around.

These aren't very thick or plush like your bath towels, but they're much better than those flat cotton dish towels without large loops. A possible downside is these may produce more lint.Besides wiping wet mess away, I like to use them in place of potholders in a pinch.Be sure to wash them a couple of times before using, like you should with all towels - remember to clean out the lint trap.

These are less bulkier than pull-ups or bedtime underpants, and they look like regular underwear - imagine an underwear with a space for an oversized maxi pad without a sticky back. They're very snug, perhaps to minimize the movement of the insert which is placed in the gusseted underwear.They look like regular underwear, except they have a gusseted inner section which has waterproofing lamination. The direction says to machine-wash warm without bleach, then tumble-dry low. I'm guessing the waterproofing will wear out if washed in hot water or tumble-dried on high. The direction say to replace "if it's not in good condition or after 30 washes." I suppose every fabric thins out after 30 washes, but the underwear will lose its waterproofing mechanism. If you want to continue using it, you'd have to buy another starter pack.Despite how the underwear looks, there is no hole for the underwear. The design is strictly decorative, but then who'd want that hole when you're trying to seal in urine?These are better for kids who leak, rather than empty the entire bladder. It's just not as bulky, nor does it have the necessary side protection. These are for more discreet protection for young children who may be embarrassed to wear pull-ups or bedtime underpants.

These are less bulkier than pull-ups or bedtime underpants, and they look like regular underwear - imagine an underwear with a space for an oversized maxi pad without a sticky back. This is the refill, so you need to purchase the Tru-Fit Starter Pack which comes with two pairs of underwear. The refills are both boys' and girls' style of underwear.These are better for kids who leak, rather than empty the entire bladder. It's just not as bulky, nor does it have the necessary side protection. These are for more discreet protection for young children who may be embarrassed to wear pull-ups or bedtime underpants.

My review is for Husky size 8. These are sturdy and classic-looking with an adjustable waist, which should be a must for all pants. They wash up nicely, and the denim feels thick, i.e. not flimsy like so many jeans these days.The waist measures 27" at the largest setting, with 5 notches in the elastic band on each side to make the waist smaller, though at the smallest setting, it might look a bit bunched up. The inseam is about 20".My only wish is for these to come with reinforced knees from the inside, but it's okay. I'd still recommend these.

I got the size 12, which is a teeny-tiny bit larger than Merrell Kids Trail Glove series in the same size after learning about Merrell phasing out the kids' "barefoot" series out. The Go Plae website has a printable sizing guide. I actually ordered a 1/2 size up, and it was fine.These seem thoughtfully designed. The wearer of these sneakers has narrow feet, but the tabs that came with the order were fine. Actually, the sneakers felt a bit too tight because of the removable insoles, but the wearer got used to the feeling after wearing only Merrell sneakers for several years.I can't believe I paid so much for a pair of children's sneakers, but I'm grateful my financial situation allows me to pay a premium for comfort, ease of use and style. Given the quality, these might end up costing less than better-priced sneakers in the long run, especially if these can be handed down to younger kids after the wearer grows out of them.

These size 14-husky pants seem sturdy and well-constructed. The fabric feels heavy enough to withstand the abuse.After washing (and please wash only with other dark-colored clothes, unless you want your whites to be tinted with blue-gray), the inseam measures about 27", and the waist is about 30" at the biggest setting. The waist can be narrowed by adjusting the elastic band inside the belt line - there are 5 button holes on the elastic band on each of the side, though stretching to button at the 5th/last hole would make the waist bunch up a bit. Still, I wish all pants, including adults', had that feature. (Btw, these can also fit a petite adult female who's a little over 5' tall - of course I had to have other people try these on.)The look is classic. I love the adjustable waist. The material feels like it can withstand some wear-and-tear. After this phase of hipster jeans, it's nice to get back to the basics.

I have the older version of this laminator (TL-901) which works great, but I didn't like how bulky it was, with some design elements that could have used some thought. This works very well but comes in a nice-looking compact format, mainly because it doesn't have a feeder tray. Also, the power cord can be stored at the bottom.I thought I'd miss the tray, but it works fine, probably because this is a great laminator which is very generous if you make minor errors. The result is clear and bubble-free.It's 14" wide, 3 3/4" deep and 2 3/4" tall. Besides the reliable lamination, I love how easily it can be stored away or carried around. The TL-901C-T is a great improvement on its predecessor.

If you want a compact sleeping pad for car-camping, this is fantastic. It's efficiently designed with excess material trimmed away, so it rolls up to a small size, though not as small as high-end backpacking pads. Some people don't care about size while car-camping, but I still like well-designed products that offer better features at reasonable prices.The pad inflates nicely, then you need to blow it up the rest of the way - be sure to watch for the little raised bumps on the pad to appear to know you've inflated enough for maximum support. Once, I didn't do a good job at manually inflating, but it was still comfortable.In case you don't read the direction, be sure to over-inflate before use to help the pad retain its shape better. For storing, do not keep it rolled up in the small stuff sack which will crease and weaken the foam pad material inside. Instead, keep it unrolled with the valve open. Yeah, yeah, it takes up space that way, but you want to make your investment last.

Sonicare keeps offering new brush head options. These look closest to the "regular" (for now called Simply Clean) with a few bundles of stiffer bristles from Intercare and other brush heads that offer better removal of plaque.I was wondered out clean my teeth would feel because I'm used to the forceful Intercare, ProResults and Diamond Clean lines, but my teeth feel very clean! This could be because I'm using a new brush head, but these feel gentler on the gums.The brush head is about few millimeters longer and wider than the usual Sonicare non-compact sizing you're used to - imagine a bristle-bundle longer and wider. The brush head uses softer plastic and has more "give" than old (now non-adaptive) brush heads. As an excessive brusher, I can probably use less force.One thing which might take a bit of getting used to is the back which isn't flat like other brush heads. These have a small ridge/spine down the middle, so you'll feel with your tongue. Nothing you can't get used to.The result is a combo of Standard/Simply Clean and Sensitive brush heads, with few tougher, longer bristles for better reach. I think these might be my go-to brush heads because I realized how much pressure I applied to my gums while I brushed my teeth. I don't know if the decrease of residual post-brushing sensation with these has to do with the "adaptive" design or the stiffer, plaque-removing bristles are tougher on your gums. This is a nice balance.

If you're tired of the skinny-jean phase and need a bit of leg/thigh room, these look like normal jeans. These don't look baggy and don't rise up excessively high at the waist.You should wash any clothing item you wear, but please remember to wash these with only darker-colored clothes. I sadly forgot, and my white t-shirt is no longer white and looks greyish.

These seem sturdy, and they're easy to care for. I especially love the reinforced knees on the inside. These pants will also work for girls because the girls' equivalent of these pants don't come with knee reinforcement. Due to the differences in clothing sizing standards, these may work better for girls who are thin for their leg lengths.Or, maybe these pants simply come with longer legs. At least the waist can be adjusted for a better fit.

These seem sturdy and well-proportioned. The only reason for not giving 5 stars is because I also have the boys' pair that come with reinforcement at the knees. Why don't girl clothes get extra material at the knees to deter wear-and-tear??? Girls are also capable of ruining the pants with kneeholes.I would find the correct sizing for your child in boys' sizing, then buy the boy pants. The boys' sizing seems longer but smaller around the waist, i.e. size 6 girls have similar waist to size 7 boys but shorter.

This product has one specific function: to hold two plugged/connected cords together. Gone are the days when you'd make a knot or wrap the cord around something to avoid accidental unplugging.It's expensive and has limited use. It's basically a thickish piece of Velcro with two holes cut out. This doesn't secure the connection, i.e. if you yank really, really hard, the cords will disconnect,; however, you'll most likely feel the tension before disconnecting.The wrap's thickness is between 1 3/16" and 1 1/2" and works very well. To store, I wrap my coiled extension cord like a regular tie.If you've been annoyed by losing electric power while gardening or using a circular saw, you'd understand the cleverness of this product and may be willing to pay a premium for that convenience.

There's nothing to dislike about this lotion. It's not too greasy, thick or heavy. I appreciate the lightness. There's no scent. It's capable of moisturizing both kids' and adults' skin.In case you're concerned about the ingredients and can't enlarge the product's picture because you're on an unfriendly mobile device, here they are: water, theobroma cacao (cocoa), seed butter, cetyl alcohol, squalane, decyl oleate, butyrospermum parkii (shea) butter, propanediol, glycerin, persea gratissima (avocado) oil, olea europaea (olive) fruit oil, canola oil, tocopheryl acetate, aloe barbadensis leaf juice, solanim lycopersicum (tomato) seed oil, helianthus annuus (sunflower) seed oil, vaccinium macrocarpon (cranberry) seed oil, nigella sativa (black cumin) see oil, cetearyl alcohol, ceteareth-20, stearic acid, beeswax, carbomer, sodium hydroxide, caprylyl glycol, trisodium ethylenediamine disuccinate, sorbic acid, phenoxyethanol.They sound scary but are not scary. The list uses scientific names for what are basically plant seed oils. The label also says to avoid contact with the eyes and to store at room temperature (59-77 degrees, Fahrenheit).A wonderful, gentle, soothing lotion for all ages.

From the product description, these gloves seem like replacements for tongs. I disagree for the following reasons:- The product is only 10.5" long, measured from the tip of the middle finger. Maybe you can withstand heat better, but there isn't enough coverage to protect your arms when handling items directly on the grill for a feeble person like me.- If I'm handling food items with these on, I'd have to take them off to handle plates and such because I don't want the plates to have food and grill residue. Taking these off is much more inconvenient than putting down  a set of tongs.Those being said, these gloves do a great job at protecting your hands from cooking heat. The fingers have added thickness when compared to the palm and top-of-the-hand areas. The gloves can sufficiently replace oven mitts but won't replace tongs. I'd wear these instead of oven mitts AND use the tongs while grilling. Inside, I use them like how I'd use oven mitts.As for the feel of the product, they're made of silicone and feel like super-thick rubber gloves, except without any lining inside. I felt like my hands might feel slimy, but they felt fine and weren't covered in residue.

This is a really graphic novel, as in very visual. The artwork is superb, but it's too bright and busy for me. I received a review copy with only the first several pages in color while the rest were in black and white, ready to be colored/inked. It was a visual relief to see simpler panels. Sure, there are some graphic novels where colors help readers distinguish the characters, settings and such, but this is so well-drawn that the reader wouldn't get the characters confused due to a lack of color; an 8-year-old had no trouble zipping through this book.Speaking of the 8-year-old, she loved the story and would give it her classic "265 million stars!!!" Some adults might be concerned about the language which uses casual slangs, but it's not anything your child wouldn't have heard or (gasp!) even used when you're not around.My only minor critique is less use of colors everywhere. Some white space would be appreciated. Overall, a beautiful, engaging book.

This towel is about the size of a regular bath towel. The generous size is nice for soaking up liquid quickly. I use a smaller microfiber towel to dry my hair, and now I have one for my body. This is also good for camping or backpacking when I want more space and less weight.One side of the towel has something like a shallow terrycloth-type loops, and the other size is flat. It is very light, much lighter than a regular towel. Held up to light, it shows some spots that are a bit sparse, like a semi-worn-out towel. However, it still absorbs well. I'm not sure how many washings this can take before becoming too thin.The towel has that staticky/prickly feeling, but it doesn't prickle at all - it's quite soft. The package claims it absorbs up to seven times its weight in water. I haven't verified that claim, but it soaks up well, and easily more absorbent than what I expected. The material is 80% polyester and 20% polyamide. The tag says, "machine wash cold with like colors, do not use bleach or fabric softener, do not iron tumble dry low."Definitely wash it before using, which is what you should do with every fabric item you get anyway. This one has a particularly stronger "new fabric" smell.

This is kind of a cool product which has few elements packed into a very portable size. It's the kind of product you'd take if you must minimize the amount of stuff you need to carry or as a backup. It feels sturdier and more rugged than a typical Bluetooth speaker. I don't have a need to listen to music while I bike since I prefer to pay attention to my surroundings, so I wouldn't mount it on my bike. It's more ideal for camping or for your emergency kit.The speaker pairs easily and works well. It's water-RESISTANT, not waterproof, so don't go swimming with it. The flashlight isn't strong but works; if using with a bike, I'd rely on a dedicated light. I love the charger feature. Because this is a speaker, it's much larger than a typical portable charger, but it's always nice to have backup power source when i forget to charge my phone while not at home.Since an online shopper can't see the product, the following is copied from the box which lists additional specs that may or may not be useful to you:- Play Time: 16 hours- Rechargeable lithium-ion battery- USB out with 1.1 A for charging capabilities- Bluetooth profiles: A2DP & AVCRP- Wireless range: 32 feet- Built-in microphone- External controls allow you to adjust volume, change tracks, play/pause & answer calls- IPX 5 dust & water resistantOverall, this is a good-enough speaker with extra features like a power bank and a flashlight. I'll be taking this on the next camping trip but will still take the dedicated headlamps.

This sorter is so much better than another 3-bag sorter with mesh bags I bought on Amazon. The frame feels sturdy enough, and the bags actually stay on the frame.The description says 4 locking wheels, but mine came with only two locking wheels and two non-locking wheels as far as I can tell. Two are enough since I'm much too lazy to lock all 4 at any given time.The bags are thin-but-stiff, sort of canvas-meets-reusable-grocery-bag. The washing direction says to wash in warm water, but do not tumble dry.It's not the most heavy-duty sorter but is good enough for my needs.

It's a very nice, well-made, comfortable gi. Like many others, my biggest issue is with the company logo everywhere. The one on the back is enormous: the black "snakehead" take up about 8" by 8", then two more stripes off to each of the sides. We get it - the brand name is Venum. You can't miss it. Maybe this is a new style for those who prefer the flashier MMA look, but the logos are so over-the-top everywhere, it's too much for a typical martial arts class.

This is a an okay book to supplement algebra lessons. Amazon's "look inside" feature does a great job of showing many of the pages, so you can get a better idea for what this is. Since there's no official standard for what 6th or 8th math level is across the country (no, there isn't at the time of this review), only you can assess the appropriateness of this book's level. To me, this seems too easy for typical 6th to 8th graders.The lessons don't cover enough concepts of middle school-level algebra, and the book doesn't have enough problems for practicing. I'd say it's better to use this book as an intro to algebra or as a companion workbook to a student who may struggle with his/her algebra class.

Despite not feeling as fluffy, these towels dry very well. They feel a little different from cotton towels; I have trouble describing the sensation accurately, but they feel like they snag or cling but don't, almost like something between static and snaggy, though it's not like they scratch up my hands by any means. The towels wipe up dust and liquid nicely. The golfer in the household took one for cleaning golf clubs at the range.I received the dishtowel-size, which is handily sized at 16" x 23". The non-frilly pattern is much appreciated.

I can't say enough positive things about this well-written book, full of heart and well-developed characters. As much as I don't want to lose the beauty of this book, it's inevitable a movie will grow out of this, with at least a sequel and a prequel.The book deals with heavy themes like illness, death and abandonment, but it's all age-appropriate while capturing the complexity and depth of various themes. It's another "265 million stars" book, according to my favorite eight-year-old avid reader.

This review is for the "Sweater Size," which is a small (18" x 12" x 8"). You get two in a package. Each bag is lightweight and feels like a softer version of reusable grocery bags made from recycled material. The label says it fits 1 king-size comforter, but I don't see how that's possible because the bag isn't that big. It can hold sheets and a flat blanket, like a bed in a bag, but that's it. A standard pillow won't fit, unless your pillow can be squashed. It's better for storing winter sweaters and such.The bag itself works. It's soft-structured, so if it's not as full, it'll take up less space, though it's easy to fill up. Only one side has the clear plastic panel. I initially thought these bags won't get much use due to the size, but I've thought of other uses beyond sweaters:- When I pack, I like having separate compartments for different items or people. With an extra-large suitcase, I can put both of these bags inside as long as each bag isn't full. For a carry-on sized suitcase, one of these bags will fit inside with a little bit of room to spare.- I can store things in the car, like emergency kits, extra baby-care items, etc...- It's good for toys, especially plush toys.- Basically, I can use these instead of plastic bins for light items.These bags turned out to be more useful than I thought, but before you purchase, please be mindful of the size. Remember: smaller than a standard pillow.

I'm using this strictly for storage. For that, this is fine, with its large capacity without taking up a lot of space. The black box is nice-looking and fits well with the modern looks of gadgets and gear. It's not the fastest hard drive, but I don't know if that's due to the unit itself, my network or my connected devices. However, since I'm using it for storage, it's not a huge deal, nor is it annoyingly slow for my needs.It's amazing how 5TB can be stored in something so small. The dimensions are 9 1/4" x 4 5/8" x 1 7/8". According to the box, the system requirements are:- Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista.- Mac OS X 10.7 or later.- IE 9.x, Firefox 5.x, Chrome 11.x, Safari 5.1.x or later.I'm too cheap and scared to sign up for a real Cloud service, but as long as my home doesn't get destroyed to smithereens, I should be able to store all my files safely among the hard drives.

If you like lacy decor, you'd love this shower curtain because that's what it is. It's thinner and much more delicate than I expected and doesn't provide opacity. If you want opacity, get a non-transparent shower liner because you'll need a liner anyway for containing water. I expected a thicker, light-filtering shower curtain, not a lace one - the photo is deceptive because this shower is shown with a white liner behind it.

As a non-handy person, I didn't even know that there were pass-through ratchets. No more struggling with wrenches for long screws and bolts! Keep in mind that you still need the space to turn the ratchet, which is almost 8" long.The set includes:- 3/8 ratchet and adapter for standard square drive sockets.- SAE: 3/8, 7/16, 1/2, 9/16, 5/8, 11/16. 3/4, 13/16 and 7/8. (total of nine.)- metric: 10,11,12,13,14,15,17, 18 and 19. (total of nine.)The storage case/system is useless, though I don't think it's supposed to be a case - it's more of a holding system for the product. Use your own container. Also, if the sockets are rolling around in storage, I can foresee the size markings coming off because the size markings aren't engraved, so be sure to check them occasionally so you know what sizes they are. If the company wants to improve this set, I would definitely etch the sizes on the sockets.Overall, a clever system.

This won't drench your target because it doesn't gush out or spray widely like one might expect from a "Super Soaker." However, the water doesn't get used up as quickly as other soakers that drench quickly, which makes sense. It's basically a pump-action sprayer which activates four streams, i.e. the trigger is there for show.Another item for show is the light-up tank with the aid of batteries. I don't know why Nerf invested in this feature because the light doesn't help the sprayer spray better. Besides adding unnecessary weight, I generally don't like water toys with electronic components or battery-using parts. It's gimmicky at best.I like the toy itself but could have lived without the lit tank.

This is a fun book to immerse the reader in a different part of the world: the rain forest. It's appropriate for younger elementary school-aged kids. Russell signs up for an adventure with his friends, except he gets assigned to a different team than his friends. The book highlights teamwork, friendship, problem-solving and environmentalism.Between the chapters, a double-sided page discusses features and creatures of the rain forest, introducing the readers to facts and more detailed info. Each book in the series takes place in a famous nature-driven destination.It's nice to have a series where kids aren't faced with family tragedies, dystopia or scary creatures. Also, a nice way to help develop a sense of respect for our planet.

The story of Alex and Ren solving an on-going Egyptian-based mystery and searching for Alex's mom continues, this time in London. Like the first one, the Death Walker is the scariest element. The plot is full of excitement, twist, scares and action.While not necessary to read the first book, the reader will get much more out by starting with book 1 when Alex was sickly and the Death Walker emerged from New York City. We're looking forward to the next one.If the potential reader gets scared or spooked easily, this book is not for him/her. For those who love a little thrill, read this.

These aren't as thick as a typical canvas tote bag which are heavier. While lighter, these are still thicker and sturdier than those flimsy reusable bags at checkout counters for $1-2 each or given away for free. These aren't very big and are smaller/narrower than a typical grocery paper bag.There's a bit of a "base" created by cleaver stitching, measuring at 11" wide and 4" deep; when you flatten the bag, the width is 15". You can still carry a gallon of milk since the bag's cloth material isn't rigid, but the bottom isn't naturally flat. The side seems are stitched and reinforced for extra strength.The straps are about 19" long and spaced apart 6 1/2" at the innermost. When picking it up, my forearm does not naturally slip through the straps when the bag is full and heavy, so it's a two-handed operation, though with practice, you can pick it up one-handed.I prefer a bag with a bigger/deeper base for groceries, but these are fine for carrying laptops or tablets. I also appreciate that because these aren't as thick, they fold up nicely for compact storage. As long as you know what the limitations are and don't expect huge bags, these should serve nicely for your toting needs.

The best thing about this caddy is its ability to fit the corner of the bathtub and a floor-to-ceiling setup due to its height extendable to up to 9'. It also looks elegant and holds a lot of stuff. I'm surprised by how light this is, given all the components.Things I didn't like:- It take s a while to assemble.- The tension can be stronger or designed better. I feel like I need to adjust it every couple of weeks. If not secured strongly or your house has a tendency to "settle" due to seismology or geography, it might topple over; maybe if the bottom and top parts had larger corner-looking pieces to "catch" the caddy from slipping out, I'd feel more secure.- The shelves only go diagonally. Smaller bottles might need to lean against others, so pack your shelves with forethought.- It's expensive.Really, the "worst" part is the feeling of secure installation. Maybe there's a trick I haven't mastered. However, I can see this being used non-traditionally as a corner fruit basket in the dining area, but I'll a small, somewhat-hefty, end table-like furniture in front of it because I'm paranoid about it tipping out of place.

The book is about Sophie who has to move from Los Angeles to a family farm in northern California in or near Santa Rosa due to family circumstances, then is responsible for running a chicken farm. The story is told through a series of letters written by Sophie to her family members and someone named Agnes who runs a farm supply store during the first summer at the farm. It also has info about raising chickens, something I know nothing about nor care for.The story is cute with a lot of heart. For a book with several letters to deceased relatives, it's not a tragic story. The book also lightly touches on race; Sophie is half-white and half-Mexican-American. Overall, a delightful read about a girl adjusting to a new environment, facing new challenges and family. It's also a good lesson on raising chickens.

Everything about this system is compact. What you need is an advanced-enough smartphone with a 3.5mm headphone jack, Bluetooth and a way to connect to the internet.The initial setup was a bit challenging, and I needed to consult the manual, like for how to insert the battery in the monitor. After the cumbersome setup which I won't bore you with, the reading seemed accurate with not that much blood. The software/app seems to have some neat features, but I don't take regular measurements throughout the day because I don't have full-blown diabetes - I just want the numbers occasionally. If you are someone who likes to tinker with settings, you'd like this or get annoyed that it doesn't work the way you want it to.It worked with my cellphone, running Android 4.4.2, but I couldn't get this to work with my iPad 3, which is still running iOS 6.##.The default BG unit is set to mmol/L, but it can be switched to mg/dL (my preferred unit) under settings.It took a while to get things going. Once everything was configured, I can reliably use this very compact system and quite like it. However, if you're not technologically savvy, you'll hate this monitor.*****************************(Edited on 6/27/2015)After using it some time, I lowered it from 4 stars to 3 stars. Some issues:- My phone sometimes wouldn't recognize the device, but once I rebooted, the app worked.- Once you open a pack of strips and scan it, the countdown toward expiration date (90 days) begins. This won't matter so much to diabetics who must monitor frequently, but I always end up with leftover strips that can't be used. Technically, they're expired, but c'mon. I understand the strips have chemicals and enzymes that degrade over time, but only 90 days? Okay, fine, if these strips are more easily affected by the environments, but you're screwed from day 91. Even with new registration, I couldn't use those "expired" strips. It's so wasteful. It's like the food industry throwing away perfectly edible farmed food because the harvest was misshapen or not "of size." If these strips do expire quickly upon opening mere 90 days later, it makes me weary about how resilient these strips are in warmer or colder temperatures.The expiration issue really makes this product a 2-star item, but then most diabetics who'd use this would go through those strips within 90 days, so I gave 3 stars. Don't get this if you monitor occasionally.

This is the third book in the "Princess Academy" series. I didn't read the previous two and was turned off by the series' title, but after a recommendation by a precocious teenaged niece, I decided to forego by judging a book by its cover. I'm glad I did because the book is well-written and highlights the strengths of Miri, the protagonist.I was able to follow this book without reading the previous two, but I'm sure you'd get more out of this if you've read the other two. While still stuck in a world where females are second-rate humans when compared to men, female characters are assertive, strong and thoughtful, with real responsibilities. There are deaths, but not written in a descriptively gory manner. Another "mature" material is the feeling of having crushes and such.What I didn't realize that Miri has the power to "quarry-speak" and communicate via linder/rocks, like other people from her area, so there's a "magic" element to this book. If you read the other two, this is probably old news to you, but I didn't expect the book to contain supernature.Overall, an entertaining book for middle schoolers.

If you're expecting a history lesson about Ancient Rome, this isn't the book for you. This is a fantasy novel set in Ancient Rome. I don't want to get all religious with with this book review, but I think it's safe to say that people of today don't believe that Roman Gods were real, but it was real to them, including to Julius Caesar who believed to be a descendent of Venus. The author ran with that idea and created a magnificent portrayal of Rome:its riches, the violence, revenge, betrayal, power, family. This is like "The Gladiator" with magic and Roman Gods.The story is about Nicolas Calvo who is introduced as a slave working in the mines. He is... oh, forget it. As I try to write a bit about the characters and a general synopsis, I keep deleting because the story is full of twists. The only two certainties are that Nicolas Calvo wants to save Rome, and he loves his sister. It's so exciting, and I feel petty trying to analyze it because it's that good. Okay, it's not the most philosophical book in the world, but really, depths of philosophy and "art" are overrated. This is a book. A very entertaining one. If you like bombastic, entertaining gladiator stories, Roman myths, magical objects and apocalyptic tales, read this book. I can smell a movie series developed from this. If I had the power to secure rights to movies, I'd snatch up this story.Warning: It's violent. The violence isn't described in an extended gory manner, but you can feel the deaths and suffering.The book ends on a "to be continued" note. I can't wait to read the rest.

I didn't expect a book featuring a magical pencil to be this riveting. Maybe that's because Ava, our 12-year-old protagonist, clearly has anxiety-ridden, and all the dramatic life events don't help her anxiety. The magical pencil can't tell EVERYthing. It initially does help Ava gain some confidence, but sometimes knowing the answer creates more questions.The book's writing is engaging and captures the feel of almost adolescence. One of the things the pencil might be useful is what so many girls worry about: if boys like her. So, there's a slight bit of "mature" theme. The book also deals with life's other big questions, but not so deep that they get lost to a young reader.Overall, a fun read yet full of anxiety - there's a lot of that, but who wouldn't worry about life in her environment? Yes, the pencil helps, but it's about a young girl growing up, problem-solving and gaining confidence.

This is a tough book to read on an emotional level because the protagonist (Mark) is a kid with cancer, and no one wants a kid to have cancer. He decides to fulfill pretty much a suicide mission by running away to climb Mr. Rainier without telling his parents while tasking his best friend (Jessie) to keep that secret from everyone else.[SPOILER ALERT]The book is a description of Mark's experience and reflections. They're heartbreaking but also highlights the strengths of human spirit. Each chapter is written from Mark's perspective in first-person perspective, with each chapter followed by "half" chapters that Jessie experiences and told from a third-person perspective. By the last few words of the book [BIG SPOILER], this "memoir" of Mark is written by Jessie after Mark told her about all his experiences and opinions. Mark does live long enough to reunite with everyone, but the reader doesn't know if Mark lives much longer or beats cancer because Jessie's mission is to write down his story.I like the coverage of this ordeal from both Mark's and Jessie's sides because they provide a broader coverage of Mark's near-death experience. The book is well-written and tugs at your emotions. Overall, a wonderful, life-affirming book despite the awfulness that comes with cancer.

I was concerned the book's length of almost 600 pages, but wow... what a wonderful book. It's a story which begins with abandonment and magic, then delves into the lives of children from three different experiences: Nazi Germany, the Great Depression and WW2 from a US perspective. Somehow, these three experiences are held together by a special harmonica, owned by musically inclined childen. Each section is riveting while building toward our protagonists facing life-challenging situations, then ends on cliffhangers.[SPOILER-ISH ALERT]Thankfully, everything ends up okay, and you find that the protagonists all end up together as performers at a concert in NYC. I loved how each story deftly captured the historical elements of the 1930s and 1940s while woven by an enchanting theme.There are more mature materials, like prejudice and abandonment, but they were handled appropriately and understandable by a 7-year-old reader who absolutely loved the book.The task of outlining and organizing this book must've been quite monumental - it's so well-done. The writing is descriptive and clear.  If you have a reader who enjoys historical fictions sprinkled magic and adventures, this book should be on the wishlist.

It's not a terrible game, but its title is misleading. I expected this to be more like "Dance Dance Revolution" or "Just Dance," but it's not. Not even close. The movements mostly involve choosing the answer with your hands, such as picking out an alphabet letter which isn't displayed correctly or selecting the word which rhymes, or following the movement direction told by the game, like "twist" and "spin."I suppose this can be considered a form of kinetic learning of a sort, but that's it. Except some freestyle dance-anyway-you-want segment, there isn't much dancing or dance moves to follow. Kids capable of recognizing letters and words are typically capable of following dance moves, but the dance moves were woefully missing.There were a couple of pluses. You can set up different profiles for different ages, so the level of activity within the same gameplay when played in multiple player mode is tailored to each player's age. Another is a feature which lets the child view himself/herself on the TV screen, which was delightful to the player.As long as you know that this is more of a "pick the answer with your body" instead of a true dancing game, it's okay - think of it like a tablet app for preschoolers, except the player maneuvers with his or her body.Also, in case anyone's wondering, you do NOT need another remote controller to play in multi-player mode.

This has a dark story, with many deaths, including the protagonist's parents. So, in a way, a typical story for children! (C'mon, you must recognize how almost all Disney characters lose their parent(s).) Except, because this is a graphic novel, you see the deaths being depicted as drawings, though not in a bloody, gory manner.The story is about Herk (the amphibian Nnewt) who has feeble legs and has to leave his hometown after an invasion by the reptilian Lizzarks. His dad was a magician, and it appears that Herk may have inherited some magical skills. What completely threw me off was from page 80-85 (from the review copy), there's a scene which resembles heaven, i.e. life after death. Sure, many books feature characters that speak from the dead, but this one was really heavy-handed, with Orion portraying the role of a deity. The afterlives of Herk's parents and still-egg siblings meet, feel at peace as if everything's fine after death, then get "carried to the bosom of the hunter" - six pages are devoted to this sequence. SIX. Also, Orion is mentioned earlier when Herk's mom tells the departing dad, "Orion be with you." And, Orion reappears a couple of more times.That being said, there's a quick lesson in the book about being kind when the amphibian Herk meets a reptilian Turt. This is a world where amphibians and reptiles are enemies, but Turt decides to go against a reptilian ethos and lets the distraught Herk go. Do what's right, even if it's against a set of arbitrary rules of your community.The book has a "to be continued" ending. It might've been easier to read as a regular book for the younger kids, but the dark themes combined with images are a bit jarring, so the material might be better suited for older kids. And, this might be just me, but I get annoyed when I see nouns used with deliberately incorrect spelling - calling the newts "Nnewts" doesn't add to the story or character development. Also, (while this had no effect on my rating), this comprehensively challenged reader had some trouble keeping the characters straight (as in tracking them) and would've appreciated a glossary - I hope the retail version of the book includes one.

First, a quick review from a 7-year-old who read the book in two days and absolutely loved it: "I can only give 5 stars? I'd give 265 million stars!!!"
