The Neato Botvac D75 is really impressive. From box to first use was a snap. The manual is multi-lingual and basically only has 4 pages with lots of graphics to cover the basics and get your Neato moving. It comes with a comb for cleaning the airways, magnetic tape to use for setting a boundary marker, and a spare filter.I really liked how thoroughly the unit cleans, even on our thickest carpet. It also glides easily over cork. The boundary marker did its job well and is low profile so having it out on a continuous basis is fine. The fact I can schedule an automatic cleaning is a huge plus for our household.The Neato can handle complex maneuvering like going around the feet of furniture,  exercise equipment,  awkward corners without getting stuck or excessive bumping. It can also easily handle going over any cords without issue. The Neato actually goes under whatever furniture it can, which is more thorough than we would normally do on any regular basis.It easily returns to ‘home base’. The only exception was when the unit got stuck, it returned to the spot it got stuck vs. home since it was in a different room and not within the line of sight of the base.The dirt bin is adequate. I recommend checking the bin for sure after using the Neato in an area for the first time. That initial pass can result in a lot of stuff being sucked up.A couple of considerations:1) The unit is louder than I would have expected, but it is a vacuum after all. If it runs while we are watching TV, we have to bump up the volume slightly. The sound can be a bit distracting so keep that in mind when you program the schedule2) The Neato is prone to get stuck if there is a barrier less than an inch high as it tries to go over it and then get trapped. In our situation, we have a chair with a round base that it can get over, but then gets stuck when trying to back up.Overall, the Neato D75 is science fiction made manifest! My wife was skeptical of vacuuming robots and is now longing for a model that can tackle stairs!

The Stanley Classic Vacuum Bottle is iconic with THE essential design to keep liquids hot or cold.The claim that it keeps hot liquids warm for 24 hours is actually under-rated. We boiled some water and then used our grill thermometer probe to take a number of readings. The initial boiling temp was 200 degrees F. Ten hours later it was 166 degrees. A full 24 hours later, the temperature was still an impressive 146 degrees F.  I did not test out the cooling features, since frankly, keeping a liquid cold for that long seems a bit pointless. Most of the time I go camping or see myself using a thermos like this, the question is not how to cool something, but how to keep it hot.Some additional specifics:* The entire thermos is made out of metal, with exception of the stopper, the black rim around the cup, and the handle.* The metal-looking label of 'Stanley' is a cheap sticker. This is a slight turn off, and I do not understand why they did not make it out of a cheap metal so it would look cool and will last the life of the thermos.* The weight is too heavy for backpacking, but for car camping or wherever weight isn't a major concern, it is perfect. You can heat up liquids in the evening or morning and have hot coffee ready for the next day.* The product is made in ChinaOverall a good product. Because of the sticker label, I’m deducting one star.

Vitasound PAE-200, TV Hearing Helper-Charcoal GrayThe Vitasound PAE-200 is basically a wireless sound extender that is rechargeable. The primary use for me was to listen to my TV while working out 15 feet away and not have to turn up the volume so loud that it disrupted the entire household. For this purpose it worked remarkably well since I'm usually alone when working out.The good* The sound transfer is crisp and clear, even with the noise of a treadmill.* There is a 4-stage volume control built in. It works together with the sound volume of the receiver if you use the headphone output.* No need for a line of sight, it is wireless like your home phone.* No interference with our WiFi network.* The range extends far enough to cover most of my house. This was a surprise, since I went from our basement to the kitchen ~50 feet, and still had a good connection. This was likely due to the fact that the kitchen is above the work area so only 20-30 feet away from the unit.* Any headphone connectors fit. I even tried my cellphone headphones which have a three prong headphone jack for some smartphone controls and they even worked fine. I think you likely could use a Bluetooth dongle as well if you want wireless headphones.* The connector box is very lightweight and contains re-chargeable batteries.The bad* This unit does not allow you to listen to sound normally through the speaker system AND simultaneously through the hearing helper. So if you have two people watching TV, both will need a unit. It’s all or nothing.* There are basically three options to connect this hearing helper. Through the TV directly, through the back of your receiver (if you have the right plugs), or through the headphone jack in the front of the receiver. However, the PAE-200 only come with an RCA stereo jack, so I had to buy two additional pieces to make this work:  o A stereo headphone adapter plug to stick into the headphone output of the receiver  o A 3.5mm stereo male to dual RCA female adaptor to use the RCA connectors* The unit does not come with other options like optic (no cable) or coax.Overall, this unit delivers good sound and is convenient to use. However, I am removing two stars because of the connectivity/set-up difficulties. Ideally, some additional cable options and connector pieces would come with the unit. Even if I chose to use the stereo RCA jacks, I would have to take down my large TV from the wall and completely bypass my surround sound system while requiring everyone else watching the program to listen through the unit too – not really practical.

The shoe laces come as a pair. Each side contains a light switch and a plastic wire you lace through your shoes.You have to stick this plastic wire into the light switch part, which would not be a problem, except there is a little tube in the switch the wire has to go through. Somehow this was not 100% aligned when I tried to stick the wire in.The result was that one side never worked since the tube turn sideways. I did not ask for a new pair since I needed them for the festival and had not opened the package until that time.This little piece of plastic should really be fastened better inside the switch.

The tips are very soft plastic, and the handles feel great. My toddler just loves playing with them as much as trying to eat with them. Since she still bites often her utensils the plastic has to also be resistant to scratches and these are holding up very well after 3-4 months of abuse.The fork part is very dull so she can spear anything with it, but it does give her the feeling of having a fork.

I have several sets of over the ear headphones: noise canceling Bose QC15, Shure SRH145 headphones as well as Sennheiser PXC 250s noise cancelling.First of all, these are not noise cancelling, nor very collapsible for easy transportation on a plane unlike the other three. They do however fold flat (the ear pieces), so you can put them in your backpack if needed and quickly grab them out to put on your head. The cord does indeed not tangle as easily as round cords.They are very stylish with the polish metal on the ear pieces. The set I got has a green accent and wire that is flat. I do like the flat wire, it somehow feels more high tech, is easier to work with, and I think they might hold up better as well.The sound is fantastic for the price. When I play some EDM the bass comes out very well, at the same time, playing an acoustic piece sounds good  as well.  It is much better than the Bose or Sennheiser which excel in mid to high range, but not much in the low range. So if you play a lot of pop music, EDM, rock or watch moves, these will be a better fit then the others I have.Fit is very comfortable on my ears as well as head. Some of the above mentioned headphones like the Sennheiser or Shure, I only can have on my ears for 3 hours before they start hurting. This pair I can have on my ears for hours more. I wish they would come with noise cancelling.Unlike some cheaper brands, these also do not tend to adjust “automatically” the head size when removing them. Once set, they will stay in place. I have some pairs, specifically the Shure and Sennheizer, that whenever I put them on I have to re-adjust.The cord comes with a speaker to connect to your cell. It has a single button to pause or continue a song, pick up the phone and disconnect. I tried it with a Samsung Galaxy 4 and it worked great. The person I called found the sound quality to be good. Not that it matters, but she sounded great too in the headphones.Finally, the manufacturing seems to be very solid. Time will tell, but all the material and connections feel securely put in place.So the biggest knocks on this set are:- No noise cancelling- No volume controlOverall, definitely a pair to get if you do not want to spend too much and you want headphones that have a good bass sound.

I have been very happy with other Holmes products, so I looked forward to trying this product.This unit comes fully assembled including the initial HEPA filter. There are four pieces of tape (2 on each side) that easily come off. Simply plug in the unit, and you are set to go! It is fairly lightweight and definitely meant for table or countertop-type surfaces where it can lay flat. In the rooms (at or smaller than the recommended 10x11 max), the unit seemed to work great after a very slight (and not offensive) initial odor when first operating.The manual is very concise and straight-forward. There is a sticker included where you can sign-up for automated email reminders for filter changes. A nice touch for busy families. A quick search on the web for the replacement filter type ‘HAPF30 A’ has the brand name replacements at about $12/filter in a 2-pack or off-brand filters around $6-10/filter.There are 3 speed settings. To me, the lowest speed setting IS quiet enough to have on an office desk and not worry about the background noise being picked up by my headset during conference calls. For the brief period of time I used the ionizing feature, I did not notice a significant difference.

The PNY Elite Performance 64GB SD card works like a charm. I used it in my Canon S100, DSLR D60 and G7X. None of these camera felt like they slowed down in rapid shooting mode in comparison to the Extreme versions of some other brands. Downloading on the computer went very fast and without a glitch. Windows 7 installed the driver quickly.The only comment I have, which is not related to this product, is the size of the card. This card is really for the video enthusiast, and likely the 4K kind. The battery of each of the camera's mentioned is empty between 300-500 pictures. Let's say a picture is on average ~4-8MB, that makes at best 1-2GB in picture a battery. Video (HD) 1080p (60 frames/Sec) will still require several battery changes. According to their own calculation, I will require 50-75 battery changes for pictures.One alternative use for this card I was thinking about is to use it as a cheap backup. I have been using portable hard drives, but the solid state may be of use for some people. Just if using it as a backup, I would get two for redundancy. Per MB tough, the SD card is still vastly more expensive then a portable 1.5 TB hard drive.

At some point in life most people want to throw an ax, knife or ninja star, and these SOG Specialty Knives & Tools TH1001-CP Throwing Tomahawks fit that craving. I don’t know if there are leagues or sport events where you can throw these things competitively, but this is my experience as an eager amateur:About the items:1) The package comes with three axes (not 2 as the description says), and a single sleeve that holds them all.2) The single sleeve has a top section to hold the head and three Velcro straps going down a spine the top one is the smallest strap and the last one is the biggest. At first I tried to loop all three axes through the three straps, but it seems that the first Velcro strap is meant for ax 1, the second for ax 1 and 2 and the third one for Axe 1, 2 and 3. This provides extra safety when removing the axes, since they won’t all just come out, each one requires special attention.3) The blades of the axes are very sharp but were much smaller than expected. I know they say 2 inches, but 2 inches is really small. Maybe they can be considered more like a “mini” Tomahawk.4) Balance is great, and the quality of the steel and handle is superb. It feels great holding them and playing with them.5) There were no instructions or recommendations that came along in the package, with the exception to wear goggles.These are NOT a toy, but very sharp pieces of metal that can easily wound someone.After examining the Tomahawks, my wife, friend and I tried them out on different materials.1) The Tomahawks are very light to throw, so you can keep throwing them for a very long time before feeling fatigued.2) They spin great when throwing and are heavy enough to make a good impact. Ok, very subjective, but they are really super fun to throw and seemed to stay well on track.3) The braided grip is nice to hold and prevents any slippage.4) For target materials, I used a plywood board, a tree trunk, a rotten tree trunk and a large wooden box. From a distance roughly 40 feet away:  a. The plywood board broke in two after a few impacts, but the ax never “stuck” to it  b. The ax bounced off the tree trunk.  c. The rotten tree trunk had one ax get stuck in it, but the second impact made it explode with little ants flying everywhere who had made their home in it.  d. The large carton boxes worked great, although I throw one ax straight through it5) Recovering the axes after throwing was a bit difficult in lower light or in vegetation, since they are black. A bright yellow or orange stripe might have been better. I might do this myself with some duct tape.Bottom line, they are great fun, and we had a good time throwing them. Even my wife who was at first reluctant “to throw these dangerous things” got into the spirit. What is important though is finding a good target to throw them into. I think one of those plastic arrow targets might be perfect. Carton boxes or Styrofoam  are too light and wood is too dense to get the ax into it. Perhaps that will come with practice, but even just cleaving wood with it was near impossible. Because of the lack of instructions and the difficulty to find them (all black), I am removing one star of an otherwise fantastic grown-up toy.

The Klymit Inertia pad is in essence a very thin air mattress. Where it starts deviating from a regular pad is that it has hole / pockets everywhere throughout its structure. These pockets allow your sleeping bag to compress less since it fills naturally up the holes and your body hovers over those sleeping bag pockets. Now in theory that sounds all good, but there are a few concerns I have with this mattress. Currently I own two other air pads, a Thermarest Basecamp and a Thermarest NeoAir.A bit of a technical comparison:- Thickness: the Basecamp is 2 inch thick, the NeoAir 3, and the Intertia 1.75 on the main body parts, but the pillow is more like 2-3 inches.- Width: both Thermarest pads are 1.5 inch narrower, but the 1.5 inch does not really give you much more since the Klymite is slightly curved upwards on the sides- Length: They all are 72 inches, but the main difference is that the Inertia has a billow build in at the end.- The Basecamp is 41 Oz, very heavy to log around, the NeoAir 24 Oz, the Inertia 12.5 and by far the lightest. This surprised me, since I thought beating the NeoAir would have been very difficult.- Insulation rating, the Basecamp has a 5 R-Rating, the NeoAir a 2.2 rating, and the Intertia is not rated. It claims that it is as warm as the sleeping bag you use it with. This creates some interesting questions on how to use it.- Material: The blue top of the Intertia is rip stop fabric and the bottom is some strong gray nylon. The seams are very well constructed so I think my only concern would be a leak from a puncture. It is also very easy to clean which I had to do after I dropped by accident a bit of fruit on it.Comfort/use- Inflating: The Inertia has two separate inflatable compartments, the main body and the pillow. The pillow takes 2 good blows as it is a bit ticker, while the main body takes 4 good longue full’s of air, so it really inflates fast. The basecamp is a self inflatable kind, but I always tend to have to blow some extra air in. The NeoAir takes a lot of air to fully fill and I sometimes have to rest half way. What is also very well designed is the end cap. The Inertia allows you to temporary push it down to hold air in, and then twist it to lock it. That is a very nice touch. One point of interest, the sides kind of curl up, the picture shows it straight, but the real blown up pad has the sides curved where you would have your knees and/or lower back. This makes it a slightly easier to put it in your sleeping bag, but I am not sure how functional it is.- The pillow fully blown up was not as comfortable as with a little bit of air out of it. The reason is that there is actually 4 parts to the pillow which cradles your head. The lower part, for me at least, fully inflated caused some neck cramping. That said, I finally do not need to have a bunch of clothing stuffed in a bag to have a makeshift pillow and this is maybe one of the best features.- Sleep: I tried both sleeping on my back and sideways. Some people were stating that sleeping sideways was out of the question, and I don’t really have that same experience, perhaps because I like a hard mattress. The pillow adjusts perfectly, and my hip fit also great into one of the pockets to have a comfortable rest. Note: I did not fully inflate the pillow- Sound when moving: A lot of these air mattresses can make a lot of noise. The Inertia is actually fairly noiseless in comparison to the NeoAir which crinkles like a paper bag every time you just move. The Basecamp is the best for this as it makes no noise at all.- Packing:  Sometimes it is a serious effort to pack one of these pads after it has been setup. The Inertia took me a minute, it deflates very quickly and easily rolls up. After I used the pad, the re-packaged pad is slightly larger than a can of pop.- Putting your sleeping pad in the sleeping bag is a very unique idea, but it makes your sleeping bag rest on the ground, or the fixed foam pad in winter.  Without the weather turning to freezing again, I simply cannot rate this for insulation. The system is just too unique. For sleeping in the summer I use the pad as an outside barrier, it at least means you do not have the entire sleeping bag touch the ground. The pad is comfortable, but a sleeping bag is softer and can be washed. I just do not like the idea of sticking it inside my sleeping bag and not being able to eventually throw it in wash machine.Overall, I like the pad, but I am not sure how well it will do in winter. For summer and moderate temperature camping I give this a 5 star, but eventually I might reduce it depending on my winter camping experience.

I have two Keurig type brewers and a regular 12-cup coffee maker. I like the idea of a personal cup-at-a-time coffee brewer, but the Keurig pods are pricey and really, a 10-ounce cup of coffee is pretty small. If you want to brew something for the road, you're waiting around through two pod cycles.This Hamilton Beach brews up to 14 ounces, and can be set to a regular or bold brew. I like my coffee strong so I fill up the scoop and set it to bold. Makes a perfect hot mug every time. Any of the flavors you find in the k-cups can be found in bags. I find that 14 ounces is the perfect amount for a travel mug to allow enough room for creamer. Has a built in stand that's easy to switch between a coffee cup or a travel mug. Real stainless front and sides makes clean-up easy. A little catch tray at the bottom ensures no coffee ends up on your counter. And the water tank has a wide opening so you're not dribbling half the water down the side of the machine while pouring water. There's a scoop with a screen bottom as well as a secondary screen, that ensures you don't end up with grounds in your cup. No extra filters needed. Use it to brew hot water for tea or other hot drinks. Small countertop footprint - which works really well in my small kitchen. The working parts all slide out for super easy cleaning. After one week of daily use, I'm a happy customer. Will update if anything changes.

Pretty bulletproof case. But it is HEAVY. Like other reviewers I thought something was packed inside the box with the case but no, it just weighs a ton. It's the only thing that keeps me from giving it five stars.
We've been using these for years. They last a long time! I stick them in a net bag and wash with the towels. They don't scratch my nonstick pans but are abrasive enough to remove most stuck on food.

We have hard floors, with rugs. This vacuum does a super job of cleaning both. For something so light weight, I can't believe the amount of dirt, dust, and animal fur this thing picks up! Plenty of attachments to get everything from corners to cobwebs. I bought the detail kit as well, which is great for my car and electronic equipment.I have arthritis in my hands and  was a little concerned about the weight - it's very easy to use. Even cleaning cobwebs from ceilings (which we seem to have a lot of this year) is easy. We got ours in a beautiful green.I used to have a Dyson which was three times the price of the shark. When my home burned someone stole a lot of the things we managed to save that we had put in the back yard, including the expensive vacuum. They did me a favor because I was never really happy with the other brand and decided to buy the Shark. So glad I did!
Well made, good quality fabric, fits perfectly, priced right!
Well made, good quality fabric, fits perfectly, priced right!

As a deodorant, this works fine most days. For the first few weeks, I was lovin' the stuff. But then my armpits started itching. Then they were burning. There must be an ingredient that irritates my skin because now my pits are red, raw and chafed looking. Went back to the old standby, Dove deodorant two days ago. The itching is almost gone and my skin is healing. So, while I want to find something that's more natural without the aluminum, this stuff isn't going to fit the bill.

My daughter has been using Alba acne products and swears by them. She noticed some fine lines around her eyes so she purchased their eye gel. She immediately complained about burning and the area around her eyes became red, raw and very irritated after just 2 uses. Thinking it might just be her sensitive skin, I tried it. The skin under my eyes felt on fire after about 10 seconds. My sister and mom both reported same reaction. There is something in this stuff that is irritating. I cannot recommend this.
Well made. Sturdy. Only con is that it's a steel tube so it's heavier than most pick up grabbers. That also means it can pick up heavier things.
Works as promised! Keep in mind this is a deodorant - not an antiperspirant. You will sweat, which is healthy. But you won't stink. Not sticky, nice, natural scent. We'll be buying this again!
My daughter swears by this stuff for her ethnic hair. Says it makes her hair soft and manageable without being greasy.
My daughter swears by this stuff for her ethnic hair. She says it gets her hair and scalp really clean.

Purchased this set after exhaustive research. Went to a bunch of stores to price luggage. These individual pieces were available from a major retailer for about $250 together. Checked other online vendors. Amazon's price was significantly lower at about $114. Looked at a bunch of other styles and brands of luggage. This set comes with a 10-year warranty. The spinner wheels are amazing and look like they will hold up well. Handles all seem sturdy, with no problems extending and retracting. Soft side handles are well sewn. Zippers all close and open easily with no catching. I'll be testing this out on a 6 hour flight across country where I'll have to change planes.  If I encounter any problems, I'll post a follow-up.One caveat - the color in the picture looks like lavendar. It's actually a deep plum color, which is fine. I just wanted something that would stand out when my bags come thru the gate. And the darker color won't show dirt as much.Some reviewers reported strong chemical smells. Yes, it's brand new luggage, so yes it has a strong "new car" smell. If you spritz it with Febreze and air out, the smell goes away.

Purchased size 10WW. They are a bit narrower than I expected. Unfortunately, the metal decorative button on one of the shoes popped off when I tried them on. The button on the other shoe is loose. The metal rivets aren't secure. I will be returning them.

I sometimes give a ride to a friend who is a person of size and she struggled to buckle the seatbelt. I purchased this inexpensive extender so that she could buckle up without embarrassment. It fits my Toyota RAV4 just fine. When not in use, I toss it in the glove box. Arrived quickly.

Love this bed! With an 850 pound capacity, it is very sturdy and well made. Massage feature is basically just vibrator motors, kind of like the "magic fingers" beds that used to be in motels. It's nice if you're someone who needs to be "patted" to sleep, like a baby. Shuts off automatically after about 20 minutes. The adjustable motor is very quiet. Head and foot are completely adjustable so you can make it as comfortable as you need. I have a 10-inch Lucid memory foam mattress, which is very firm, that I bought on Amazon 3 years ago for under $300. Same price today, and it works really well with this adjustable base.Warnings: It comes flat in a huge box. When the bed arrived, there was a fist size hole in the box and there were only two straps and some tape holding it together. At first I was concerned because there was no styrofoam or packing material to absorb bumps during shipment. But once we laid the bed down I realized that it really didn't need extra packing material. The bed is HEAVY. You definitely need two strong people for this project.Assembly: The manual doesn't tell you in the beginning that you need to insert 9-volt back-up batteries into the motor box. Those instructions are on the last page - AFTER you've flipped the base over and then have to crawl around on the floor to reach the box. But assembly is simple. Attach the legs, cut away a few strips of zip tie that hold the power cord, insert the 9-volt batteries, and then the bed is ready to flip right side up. Here's where it gets tricky. You need two people to dead lift the unwieldy, 125 pound base and flip it over. You cannot "lean" it over on its side, because the pressure on the legs could bend or snap the metal bolts. It was a challenge for my daughter and me but we managed. Anyway, once it's right-side up you just need to attach the corner brackets that hold the mattress on. I don't think they tell you that the bed also comes with the headboard attachment kit, which was a nice surprise.Have slept blissfully for a 3 nights. I bought it because I have moderate sleep apnea and sometimes woke up with headaches. The wedge type pillows weren't much help because I would slide off during the night. With this adjustable bed, I am able to lift the head up so that my sleep is uninterrupted and I wake up feeling like I actually got a good night's rest - either on my back or on my side. No more headaches. I love being able to elevate my legs while I watch TV or read - it really helps with edema. I used an income tax return to purchase this bed. Best thing I've done for myself in years!

I have several sets of Corelle, the newest being True Blue. Very pretty. Goes well in my Swedish theme kitchen. Very durable. I don't have a dishwasher so the light weight is much easier to wash than heavy stoneware. Takes up less space in the cupboard. I've been a Corelle fan for 30 years. Pick your favorite pattern, then watch for sales because prices seem to go up and down.

Dress is lovely. I bought this for my daughter, who is a big girl, using the vendor's size guide. It fits perfectly. The print is much more vibrant and pretty than the picture. Daughter wears it with a cami underneath, which works perfectly as the neckline and back are in a deep V shape and she doesn't want to show so much cleavage. Fabric is a good quality spandex blend. Doesn't snag easily. I ordered the "tall" and it fits her 5'9" height perfectly. You will want to wear a slip with this as the light fabric is just sheer enough that your panties show through.

Works as expected. I use it daily in the shower. One warning - be sure to pull your hair back BEFORE using this. This morning, a stray lock of my hair got wound up in the brush. It was just a matter of popping the brush off and unwinding my hair. Also, note that when it says "electronic" they mean battery operated. It can not be adapted to AC.

Great moisturizer for the eyes and the dry skin areas of your face. For my over 50 skin, it works great. For my under 30 daughter though, it caused her oily skin to break out in the "t-zone" oily areas. She continues to use it on the dry areas under her eyes. Nothing works miracles on wrinkles, but this helps to keep my face moisturized and protected against the elements.
Works as expected. Easy to change date. Easy to re-ink. Arrived quickly.

I've had a previous version of this wallet for over five years, with a white background. Besides the fact that it's kinda dirty, it still looks new. No cracking or unraveling. The zippers work as new. So, when I decided it was time to get a new wallet, and then I found this one, it was a no brainer. I love the bright colors. The teal green background is even nicer than shown and the pink stitching is more of a rose pink. Plenty of room for all your cards and miscellaneous stuff.

Beautiful color illustrations for every step. If you are a visual learner, this is the book for you. Easy to follow along. The only thing that could have made it better is if it was spiral bound. I have to use metal clips to hold the book open so that my hands are free to crochet. Lots of great projects for beginners to advanced. Well thought out.

My daughter and I made the commitment to lose weight in 2015. Problem is I have very arthritic knees that make it impossible to do many athletic activities. I needed to start walking - slowly. I don't have a lot of space for a huge piece of equipment.  Did a lot of research and found this treadmill. It's a WALKING treadmill. The treadmill folds up, the table folds down, so when you're not using it the footprint isn't too big (FOLDED DIMENSIONS: 38”L x 36”W x 60”H).Does it work?  YES!  We pulled it out of the box and had it assembled in under an hour. No adjustments were needed. It's VERY quiet. I put my tablet on the table and watch Netflix or Prime movies while walking. I find myself on the treadmill much more because I can use my laptop and get some work done while I walk. The table is very steady - no shaking while the treadmill is moving. We've been using it a few weeks now and there have been no issues or problems. Able to go from 0.4 to 4 MPH and up to a 15% incline. We're both about 5'8" and the treadmill is fine for our stride length (20”W x 40”L). Heart rate monitor and buttons on the handlebars as well as the display for setting speed, Very happy with this purchase.  One caveat - if you're looking for something that will allow you to RUN, this is not the machine you need. Maximum speed is 4 MPH, which is perfect for someone like me who wants to do computer work or read while I walk off the pounds.
It's OK. We're pretty new vegetarians, and if this is the best that's out there, we may have to allow some dairy. Tried using it with pasta for mac & cheese. Tasted fine.
My favorite quilt batting. I've made quilts with this stuff that have been washed a hundred times and the batting has held up beautifully. Doesn't shrink. Maintains a soft drape.
Fits and works as expected. Comes with the metal ring, but don't forget to buy a chain or something to hook it to the faucet!
Five stars because it's delicious. But at $9 for 2.5 ounces, we won't be buying it very often. WAY overpriced. Time to pull out the food dehydrator and make our own.

Gentle, unscented soap with a soft, creamy lather. Great for sensitive skin. Rinses off with no residue. After years of dry, itchy skin, I went on a hunt for a soap that cleans but won't irritate. This stuff works. The bars are small and it costs a little more than commercial brand soaps, but one bar will last 2-3 weeks with daily use.

My three dogs love all the chicken and duck flavors that Merrick makes, but they don't like this beef. It's like gray mush - not very appetizing at all.  My two cats will eat it though, so it's not a total loss.
This game is fun for anyone of any age.

Item as described/pictured, very well made, solid pieces, does not look cheapy. I am using mine to store coffee/tea supplies on my counter top beside Bunn MCU Single Cup machine (Keurig type brewer). Very happy with my purchase, may end up buying a few more sets to organize with in the kitchen.
Very well made Tripod!  Love that it's affordable!  I use it with my Nikon 3300 and it works perfectly!
Item as described/pictured, fast 2 day Prime shipping! What's not to love!?
Item as described/pictured, fast 2 day Prime shipping! What's not to love!?

The pictures in this book are so cool.  Bought for my 12 yr old daughter to color with Sharpies.  She LOVES these.  The pictures are one sided and good quality paper, however if you're going to color with markers or sharpies, I'd recommend putting a thick piece of paper in between the sheets to avoid bleeding through.
Love these!  Gentle, yet very effective.  We keep a stock pile of these in our house.

12 yr old daughter loves this wrap.  She says it's comfy and her hair doesn't get tangled in the goggles strap.  Was a little tricky to get on the goggles but once they were on there no worries of it shifting or moving.

Perfect fit for my 12 yr old daugher.  She loves these goggles and wears them several times a week to the beach.  I like that they're well made goggles but not too expensive that I'll be upset if they get lost on accident.

Bought for my 12 yr old daughter.  She loves these.  Personally I think they're a little on the thin side and bend easily and they're really small.  But they do look really cute on her and she gets lots of compliments from her friends.

Well made, color true to description/picture.  Very warm & quick to dry once they get wet from playing in the snow.  They do run a little on the large side.  My daughter wears a 14/16 in her Columbia gear but these were a little big on her.  They actually were a little  long on me and I wear a womans small in gloves.

Very cute set!  Full size comes with 2 pillow shams and the quilt.  It is very well made and has withstood several washing/drying cycles with out any fading or fraying.  My tween daughter loves this set & it goes perfectly with her updated big girl room!

This decal is just as described and super cute!  It was rolled up in a tube wrapped in plastic so I did have to lay it out on a table and put some heavy books on it for a few days to get it to lay flat.  However it went on the wall easily & flawlessly and looks like it's painted on!

Amazon is amazing!  I passed my older (had it for over 2 years) Kindle 6" E Ink down to my daughter.  One day the when she went to turn it on the bottom half of the screen went blank.  I called Amazon to see if it could be fixed and they told me unfortunately it couldn't be.  They offered me a Certified Refurbished Kindle (with 12 month warranty) at a discounted price plus sent me a prepaid label via email to send in my old broken Kindle for a credit.  I received the "new" refurbished kindle in less than 24 hours after ordering and it looked BRAND NEW!  I couldn't be more happy with Amazon's service and the kindle I received.
This movie is great for all ages!  What more can you say...once you watch it, you're hooked and singing along!
Bought this cover for my husbands new dual grill.  It fits his gas/charcoal CharGriller Duo model #5050 perfect with a little wiggle room.
My daughter loves dinosaurs so this movie was perfect for her.  It was really a cute movie but the voice over on the dinosaurs was kind of cheesy.  My daughter didn't seem to mind though.

These Flip Flops are really cute and comfy and great price.  However the size 6 (big kid) was wayyyyyy to huge for my daughter!  It was more like a womans size 8.  Amazon was great and I was able to send them back with free returns and they credited my account immediately.

I have been feeding my cat this brand for a few years and Amazon has the best price & FREE 2 day Prime shipping!  I'm happy to get the same food I've been buying from big box pet food stores without having to drive 20 miles and paying more!Also my cat loves this food!  She is a 13 year old outside cat with food allergies & she does really well on this food.

These sporks are perfect for school lunches!  I frequently pack my daughter fresh cut fruit and yogurt in her lunch and these lil handy sporks are great for her!  She likes that she doesn't have to take throw away forks and spoons anymore because they end up getting broken while she's toting her lunch box around all day.  These sporks are tough & wash up great in the dishwasher!  When I first ordered them I was afraid they may be too small for her (she is 11) but they're perfect compact size.  I'd say they could be used from toddler thru adults.  I also like that the fork part is rounded so she doesn't end up stabbing herself with anything sharp.

This lil Furbling is super cute and about the size of a tennis ball.  It does interact with the larger Furby Boom by putting them face to face and pressing the top of it's head. It is really cute how excited the big Furby gets when it interacts with it's baby.  However the interaction is short lived and repetitive.  I was a little disappointed that the eyes were holograms and the limited phrases it says.  The fun wore off in a few days and now both Furbys are "sleeping" on a shelf.  My daughter is 11 and she plays with them from time to time and uses the Furby Boom app to get more out of these lil critters.  I believe I overpaid for a glorified "happy meal toy".

This cute little Chimpanzee is so soft & just the right size at about 10 inches tall give or take a little.  My daughter was delighted to find this lil guy in her Easter Basket this year!  She loves collecting Webkinz and entering their codes online at WebkinzWorld so she can play with them in her virtual "zoo".

I purchased this ink on 5/28 and paid the extra fee for 1 day shipping as I needed the ink like yesterday.  It arrived as promised on 5/29. It was packaged in a bubble wrap mailer and inside the cartridges were individually sealed in plastic and those were inside another plastic bag. I installed the cartridges in my printer in just a few minutes after unpacking/opening packaging.  After the printer recognised the cartridges and went through the alignment process, I was ready to print!  I printed out several small pictures (for a project my daughter is working on) onto regular printer paper and the colors were vibrant, crisp & clear and the ink dried quickly without any smudging.  I can not testify as to how many prints I will get out of these cartridges yet but I am satisfied with the quality.  I can not tell any difference in these remanufactured Dell 31 cartridges compared to the Genuine (expensive) ones you buy from the big box stores.  I will be buying again when I need them.  Can't beat the price and FREE prime shipping!  Thank you Amazon & YoYoInk!****EDITED REVIEW*****I purchased this ink on 2/1/15 as I was very impressed with the quality of my last purchase and needed ink again. I don't know what they did to change the quality but this time the ink cartridges were NOT the same high quality I raved about in my original review.  Immediately when I opened these cartridges (Black & Colors) they leaked all over my hands and stained them, even splattered onto my shirt and ruined it.  I wasn't happy about it, but I got a paper towel and cleaned off the cartridges and installed them anyhow, as I was out of ink completely and needed to print something.  The 1st print was smeared and streaky and since then then the next few things I printed the colors are printing just fine, however the black is not black at all, sometimes it prints out like it's low on ink or prints NOTHING at all in black.  I have ran the cleaning system on my printer etc, and still nothing is changing the black print quality.  I HIGHLY DOUBT I will be purchasing this ink again.

My 25 y/o Amazon likes these very much but they're kinda huge and more like a treat for him.  He likes holding his food and picking at it so these work well for that. But he only eats half of it then when he can't hold onto it and eat it he throws it in the bottom of his cage. It seems like an expensive waste.  I've started crushing up some to put in his food bowl (along with his primary food) and leaving a few whole ones for him to pick up. These say Medium size but the size is comparable to a gum drop.

My picky 25 y/o Amazon loves these.  I was so surprised how much he loved these.  He's usually picky and with throw down any new treats/food but, not these - he devours them in no time.  My only complaint is they smell kinda strong like thankgiving stuffing to me and are very crumbly thus making a mess...however the bird doesn't mind and these are for him not me.
Great artists, great songs.  Seem to be perfect for upcoming movie.  I'm very excited to see where these songs are placed in the movie.

This is by far the BEST dog toy I have ever invested in.  My 125 lb Rottweiler/Mastiff mix LOVES to play soccer and I was having to buy a soccer ball for him every few weeks because he would deflate it and then shred it to pieces.  This ball has been great for him...he loves this ball even more than soccer balls.  The grooves on it make it so easy for him to catch/fetch & the best part is it's heavy duty foam and will not deflate.  The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because the 1st one I bought only lasted about 4 months of heavy use before the thread/seams started coming apart.  Eventually it broke down and the canvas covering came off exposing the foam and had to be thrown out.  We are now on ball #2 and when this one gets torn up we will get another.  These last so much longer than any other ball I have bought for my rough player.

These are by far my FAVORITE face product.  I only use Desert Essence face wash and these cleansing pads.  They smell pretty strong and sting a bit at first but that disappears very quickly.  They leave your face feeling so fresh and clean.  I have used many TV products, drug store products and other natural products to manage my breakouts/combo skin with no luck.  These clear up any breakouts fast for me & they DO NOT dry my face out, actually my face feels so soft after I use these. The pads also feel a little textured which exfoliates a little.

I have feed my 2 dogs TOTW Roasted Lamb for many years.  I have a large breed Rott/Mastiff mix and a Jack Russell.  They like this food & I like that I can order it from Amazon and have it shipped to my door in 2 days with Prime.  It sure beats driving to the pet store and lugging a 30 lbs bag of food from the store to car to house.

The costume is really cute.  However I feel it runs a little small.  I ordered Large 12/14 size for my 10 y/o size 12 girl.  The top was to short and the skirts elastic waist to tight. She wore a shirt under the top and tucked it into the skirt so it wasn't to big of a deal & I stretched the elastic as much as possible to loosen it up a tad.. My only other complaint is the skirt is glittery and gets glitter EVERYWHERE!  But my daughter LOVED it and she looked really cute so overall it was still a good buy.

OMG! It's so fun to play! I like Star Trek, and I'm hopeless at video games. So I'm really lucky to stumble across this mostly intuitive game! It's not perfect, it's not gee whiz latest CGI mega resolution or anything. But it's fun, it's great the enemy is easy to vanquish, and I love it! I downloaded 7 games the same time I uploaded this one, and the only other one I've opened is Candy Crush. I've just been shooting photon torpedoes at everything, and using the death ray as often as I can get away with it!@ HAHA!SHould you play this? Sure, it's free! But if you can use all ten of your finger and do 20 button combos, you probably won't like it.But for me, it's awesome!

This is the 4th kindle I've owned and for the first time I've actually not liked it.The Good:=======- price- Kindle- all the e books, audio books, and, finally more appsThe not so good:===========- the software makes it fiddly to make your way around. Instead of the "carosell" from before where you could flick through books and apps you most recently used, it looks more like a complicated android set up and you have to click on several tabs before you can see your kindle's library, or uploaded apps. Sure, you can get used to it, but before you could simply see it all the moment you "unsleep" your kindle. Messy- the bottom side corners are all rounded, but the upper surface facing you corners are all sharp right angles. This means if you try to rest the kindle with the top part higher than the bottom, like the top is raised up 2cm , and the bottom is on the tbale, it just slides until flat. Means viewing angle is a pain withough a special cover.- holding the kindle lying down can be troublesome- Gravity works against you when you lie down and you hold the kindle up, and the rounded edges give no grip.Ok, the kindle works, and it's great value, and you can get used to all the minuses above. But I find it less user friendly than the previous kindle ?pure ebook reader), kindle fire 7 inch, and kindle fire 6 inch tablet's I've owned.Thanks for reading!

I bought the yellow/orange belt and it looks great. It came with belt, USB cable and there's a clear plastic cap over the on/off switch, which also has the inlet for recharging the battery. It has 3 modes- x2 blinking speeds and constantly on.Overall it works fine, the light can be seen clearly at night, although it's not quite as bright as I thought given some of the reviews I've read. It's np 300 lumen flashlight.I wear it for night cycling and it works well.I'm considering getting another one. Later I hope to cycle tour and there will be many tunnels where I hope to go, so this flashing belt is perfect for being seen.

A solid and smooth functioning pair of pedals. Very easy to understand. A button says push, and with one hand you can push and fold the pedal. I only put it on, before taking it off because I chose a pair of quick release pedals instead, but these are good quality. Only qualm is they feel heavy compared to normal pedals. Otherwise they work well.

I actually use this torch as my bicycle light. I'm a light junkie for bikes (I figure more lights means cars are less likely to hit you, right?) I had two front torches which aren't bad (You can read previous reviews on them). But this diving torch caught my eye due to low price and run time of 120 hours, which is far better than the 5-10 hours new gen USB rechargeable lights currently have. I liked the results of this diving torch so much I bought two more in case the price went up.The reasons I like this torch are:- bright yellow body- easy to catch people's eye in daylight. Easy to see and not forget if I put it somewhere.- long run time. I'll be using up the included AA batteries first, but then will use my rechargeable AA batteries, and they have more juice, so run time shold be pretty awesome with them.- there is a wide field of view. Because the flash head is larger then most cree type torches/flashlights, and because the LED "bulb" is not as far back from the front glass as many torches, the light can be seen from a wider angle and is almost as bright from the side as from front.Please note that you can't turn the on/off switch too far, or it might not work. About 60 degrees from the off position is fine. There are no markings for this.Thanks for reading!

I'm sorry but I have to give 1 star for the pole. The reason is the part of the pole which includes the handle and the h 4 or 5 holes for adjusting the length of the pole didn't work- the silver steel ball which is supposed to pop in to lock it iin position was always in the pushed down position, so you could pull the rest of the pole out and it was essentially in 2 pieces- the handle with holes, and the rest of the pole. I live overseas so it's not worth my returning the pole, so I wasted the money. The rybber handle seems fine, the elastic cord which pulls all the pole sections also seemed to work well, pulling them all together. So it's a real shame mine was literally useless. It's Zero stars really, but 1 is the lowest.

I gave it 4 stars because it wasn't that bad. But I felt it was a little contrived at the end. The governments really seemed very inflexible- they must kill the hero...sure, the reasoning is there, but...and then, having the telepath as the cause?The ending left me unsatisfied. Hope deserved better than that, and surely there must have been some room for compromise.

Looks like Nuttall's starting another space sci-fi military series. It's quite good. Good details, plot, and well paced.But it'd be nice if he could round off the Empire series. He's got a few series' out there with similar themes. Feel like I'm out dangling a bit.
Was hoping there wopuld be some improvement in the style of writing, but it's more of the same. I know i can ignore Power written novels now. He's just churning them out.

A solid effort from Nuttall. Not his best, but certainly not his worst. NIce to see a series completed. I'm guessing he wants to concentrate more on the other series which is similar, but more popular.

Brandon Sanderson is one of the best authors I've ever read. He's very versatile, being able to write both books for both adults and teens, and he does a truly spectacular job fleshing out the world of each novel, of giving each character depth, of being able to write dialogue as if he is thinking from that person's point of view, regardless of which sex, and even human of not human. Each world has something different about it, something unique which gives it it's spark, gives it the magic. I can honestly say that I have never been disappointed by any of his books. And this one is no exception. WIth Sanderson's books, it's not whether or not it's good or bad, it's simply the degree of how good it is. Was it good, or was it excellent.The only issue I have with Mr Sanderson is that he takes some time to publish each novel, so as some reviewers have suggested, you might want to reread previous books in the series, to refresh your memory. I read hundreds of kindle books and this is one disadvantage of kindle books.- those indie kindle authors are in a race to publish as often as possible as possible to remain fresh in reader's minds, (Chris Nuttall is the leader I think-  a new book every 3 to 6 weeks for the last few years- no joke)Hope you enjoy the book as much as I did! Have a great day and thanks for reading!

A good solid series of 6 books. Good pace, good storylines, consistent characterization. However, hasn't the White hero saving the Asian woman who is beautiful and a martial artist a stereotype which has been done to death?

I have to admit I felt this was just an average Atlantis episode. There were some nice touches, like Weir returning to Atlantis, Finding Aiden Ford and bringing him back to his family on Earth. But mostly there was nothing really special.Having said that, the authors did remain true to the characters, and as I read the dialogue, I could hear each actor's voice, exactly as it was on tv.
A pretty good teen super hero novel. Bit too arguementative for my liking, but basically quite solid and I'll be looking for the next installment.

A 4.5 star novel I'm rounding up to 5, just because I like this author.I'm glad he decided to write another book about Dante and Blays. I wasn't happy with how the last trilogy ended, and I'm glad that with the use of a time jump, they have become friends again and we can read more of their adventures.You can start from this book, if you wish, but it's better to start from the beginning.

An attractively designed, high quality simple backpack which is light and easily transportable. I bought it because of price to try it, and discovered I like a few more pockets for organisation, so this pack doesn't suit me and I will sell it. But make no mistake, this is a top notch pack, despite it's incredible light weight of 175 grams. Eg, the shoulder straps look like cheap mesh plastic at first glance. But pull it. It's tough and doesn't strech, right? Similarly, none of the stitching gives, and the fabric  is , well, tough.If this type of design suits you, then I'd recommend this pack. If it had 1 or 2 more pockets, I'd keep mine.

Osprey is a popular brand name that many people love. But I'm not one of them. I think they look great, and are built like a tank, but they rarely fit me well, and other lesser well known brands are better IMHO.For me, I compare the Gregory Miwok 24 with the Talon 22. While they take similar volumes, I find the Talon is weak in the smaller pockets- didn't anyone notice the rough plastic sticking into the smaller pocket, which will scratch your mobile phone? And the other smaller pocket is a hassle to reach, inside the main compartment. The little mesh pocket(s- depends on version) can't put anything there besides a rolled up paper map. If it were twice the width, I bet everyone would place their mobile phone and compact camera there. Sure, you can use the waist pockets, but this is a waste. And of course, the Osprey sin of compression straps across the side bottle pockets.In contrast, the Miwok 24 has a huge front pocket, huge side pockets, both front and side are expaandable, and the top has easy access to the smaller pocket, which can take quite a few things. The Miwok also has a dedicated hydration bladder clip on one shoulder strap, and a dedicated sunglasses holder for the arm of a pair of sunglasses on the other shoulder strap.I know, I know, I sound like a fanboy of the Gregory brand. I'm not. I just think The Talon 22 is overrated. I think it's really 3.5 stars, but rounding it up to 4 so as not to offend too many people here.

This is a very light hydration pack. It's about 215 grams, and seems very well made. I've only gone cycling once and for a 3 hour walk once, but so far it seems well made, has plenty of straps for adjustments, and I can fit in the things I like, like a bladder, my kindle, wallet, mobile phone etc. There are quite a few reflective bits on it too, which is good, and you can stuff quite a bit with the back cinching cords.There's some oddly designed features though. There is an individual zippered pocket for the water bladder, which is good, but my 3 L/100 oz Geigerrig bladder is just a tad too long to fit in there. Similarly, the water bottle pocket on the right shoulder strap is too small for anything larger than , I'm guessing, a 300ml bottle. There is a left and right side mesh pockets, and oone is smaller than the other. I haven't seen this before, and I'm going to guess someone thought that some items are smaller so they'd rattle around less in a smaller pocket.The side straps around the ribcage have an excellent locking system which easy to use, and excellent. So it's strange that for the sternum straps (x2), they use a complicated system needing two hands. Cost? Weight?Thankfully, my leather wallet fits in snugly in the top horizontally zippered pocket, which also has a key fob. The main compartment is accessed by a side zipper and seems quite decent for the volume of the pack.I'm due to pick up a second hand Camelbak Octane xct tomorrow and will compare the two, as well with my Camelbak Ultra LR and Gregory Miwok 24. Yeah, I'm a bit of a gear junkie.Sorry I can't offer an opinion on it's use in a long distance run. Hope some others review it for that.EDIT Sept 28th 2015===============I've used this for a couple of day hikes and several times cycling. I've noticed:- the light weight is amazing.- the front right shoulder strap pocket is where I put my mobile phone or waterproof compact camera.- the left shoulder strap narrow stretchy pockets are where I put some credit card sized cards, like the ones for tapping on ticket gates at public transport.- the side mesh pockets are quite useful, and one of them has a lockable drawstring- I tighten it when I needed to bring along lots of small bike lights which I wanted to attach at night time, but didn't need during the day.- really fits a 3L water bladder. I thought the hose attachment might poke into my back, but I never felt it.- the side straps have a great locking system. easy to use without needing to look.- the front pocket string- there is even a fob/latch at the end- quite useful and thoughtful.- the main compartment zipper has become stuck 85% near the top. Needed to zip it up and down several times to get it to zip closed completely. Happened 3 times now. Hoping won't happen again.......This pack isn't nearly as attractive as the camelbak's, but although not perfect, it is functional, light, seems solid and I will keep using it.

I generally like the author's work. But I'm afraid this one isn't up to par. The whole plot is very repetitive. Start with individual's mundane job, then introduce multi galaxy wide threat which sweeps up main character into becoming a leader who saves said multi galaxies from biological threat which is backed by AI threat using highly advanced sodium technology. This in itself isn't that much of a problem. But this novel felt very bland, with no real suspense. It read more like the author's own plot summary reminder sheet, than a proper book, especially in the last third.And am I the only one who is thinking that the Duke is going to return? The series should really end here, but it feels like it's being forced to extend the series.

Of all the Star Trek series' out there in written form, I feel New Frontier is the best (Department of Temporal Investigations is my second favourite, so perhaps I'm quite non mainstream from many/most ST fans). It's lively, isn't afraid to be humourous and quirky, yet it will also take the drama to a new level as well.This second book in the new series, which is kind of a "Return of New Frontier" series, is more like it. I felt the one before was a bit bland, but this one ups the pace, introduces some new characters and complicates the plot a bit more. Am awaiting third volume eagerlySide note-I'd prefer to read all these 4 books as a 1-2 thicker volumes, rather than x4 150-250 page volumes, but I'm guessing there's more money this way and you can string the readers along further. Cynical view, I know, but why couldn't these be combined?

Like most reviewers, I like the Hank series. The author does a good job reinventing the city each book, keeping it fresh, but somehow I was a bit disappointed. It didn't quite have the crazziness of the first 2 books.Having said that, I'm eagerly awaiting the next one!

Disclaimer- I'm a man, not a woman. I'm broad and well built. I don't know what features on this pack are woman specific. But I do know I like it. The pack that is, not the woman specific features.I've had a few packs of similar size and type- Frames and air space -Osprey Stratos 36 original and newer versions, Osprey Exos 34. No frame - , Karrimor Trim 35, and a cheap backpack called Camel Mountain. I find the Crea Light 40 to be the best of the lot for me because: - it's quite light for it's size-approx 1.05kg. The Stratos 36 is about 200-300grams heavier, and the Trim 35 is only 250grams lighter. I think one way they reduced weight was by using thinner fabris. You can tell it's thinner, but it's still tough- just try to pull/stretch it0 you can't. - Side and front pockets are stretch mesh. That means you can fill up the main compartment and even if it bulges out,it won't stop you being able to stuff things into those pockets. If they were non stretch, then they'd be restricted to a thin space. The Stratos doesn't have a front pocket, although the top lid has two pockets, on on top of the other. - The shoulder strap height has 3 height levels to choose from. While it would have been great to be able to do fine adjustments along any length, like Berghaus and Vaude packs, this is much much better than no adjustment at all. Means if you buy online without trying first, you have some leeway for error. - there is a zipper along the side of a side pocket so you can get stuff out from the main compartment without digging everything out. - The top lid has an outer and inner pocket. - there is only 1 waist pocket (I don't know why expensive packs from brand names only put one waist pocket, instead of two) but it is very spacious, and I would be able to fit x2 compact cameras in there. - it has an air space for keeping yuir back cool. - well built. - Useful double pullstring levels so you can pack a bit extra in it. - There's two elastic top loops and two lower ones for stowing your poles. Quite standard, not as useful as the easier access method Osprey uses.Some niggly things: - the shoulder straps seem a bit narrow and could do with a bit more padding. - the two straps which clasp with the female parts on the top lid are attached far low on the pack, so when unclipped, they dangle down far and you reach further to grab them. - The grey "iron/smoke" is quite drab, but I guess it's inoffensive. But since I got it new at 60% off, I can't really complain. - The stitching for the words "Crea Light 40" looks a little cheap.Overall I like the pack. It works well, feels good, although extra padding might make a difference if I were to do overnight hiking. Speaking of overnight hiking, there are no exterior straps for a sleeping bag, but there are little loops on the top of the lid, so maybe you could use some string or elastics to tie one onto the pack.Or you could tighten it with the side compression straps. But point is- no specific sleeping bag straps or compartment.I hope more ladies write reviews soon so mine won't stand out so much!Thank for reading!EDIT Sept 28th 2015===============I've really only used this as cabin luggage and moving from city to city a few times, not for real hiking. So far I've noticed:- the side zipper for access to main compartment is of limited use. It's not really large enough, and it's only one side- bad luck if you didn't pay attention to pack certain items closer to the zipper.- on the other hand, you can put smaller items into the main compartment via the zipper without undoing the top lid and opening the drawstring.- the top lid is actually a separate item and is attached to the main backpack by x3 straps. I don't think you can totally disconnect the lid from the backpack, but the straps can be adjusted in length. This is good for when you overpack the main backpack and things jut out the top. By lengthening the straps, the lid remains level and on top and can still cover the whole top.It matters because it looks neater, it doesn't leave the drawstring sphincter area exposed, the lid remains level so the top pocket is level. If It weren't level, then it would be angled back and the pocket lid zipper would be down/bottom, so things might fall out when you unzip it.- sometimes there is a squeak from the frame/back mesh.- the left waist pocket is really quite big- a;; mesh pockets are stretchy and can hold lots.- I don't think it's a true 40L. the inside capacity seems to be less than the Osprey stratos 36.- on the top of the lid there are x4 short loops. If you need to strap on something like a sleeping bag- you can do that.- on the bottom x2 loops, on half of it is thicker. I don't know why. It looks very deliberate so it must have a function.- I put a 3L water bladder inside as I was going to carry the full laden pack for a whole day- fits well, but takes up quite a bit of space in the main compartment.I still like the pack, but as with everything, I'm learning to live with it.

As a piece of military sci fi literature, this short novel is quite good. Although I find it quite pricey to pay per short story, you really do get an intangible benefit from Scalzi's superior story telling. I've read 4 parts so far. All are well written, although part 3 is a bit weak in action and story development.Fans of Scalzi, those who have already read prior Old Man books by Scalzi, will all enjoy this short story, and the continued development of the Old Man universe.This volume is solid Scalzi, but as a previous reviewer said, the ending seems a little rushed.

As a piece of military sci fi literature, this short novel is quite good. Although I find it quite pricey to pay per short story, you really do get an intangible benefit from Scalzi's superior story telling. I've read 4 parts so far. All are well written, although part 3 is a bit weak in action and story development.Fans of Scalzi, those who have already read prior Old Man books by Scalzi, will all enjoy this short story, and the continued development of the Old Man universe.Volume #3 is probably the weakest of the 4 chapters/short stories out so far at this date. There's not much action or intensity.

As a piece of military sci fi literature, this short novel is quite good. Although I find it quite pricey to pay per short story, you really do get an intangible benefit from Scalzi's superior story telling. I've read 4 parts so far. All are well written, although part 3 is a bit weak in action and story development.Fans of Scalzi, those who have already read prior Old Man books by Scalzi, will all enjoy this short story, and the continued development of the Old Man universe.Volume #2 is from the point of view from The Conclave. To say anymore will involve spoilers. The ending is a surprise though.

As a piece of military sci fi literature, this short novel is quite good. Although I find it quite pricey to pay per short story, you really do get an intangible benefit from Scalzi's superior story telling. I've read 4 parts so far. All are well written, although part 3 is a bit weak in action and story development.Fans of Scalzi, those who have already read prior Old Man books by Scalzi, will all enjoy this short story, and the continued development of the Old Man universe.Oh, and this volume #1 is a real hum dinger. The usual excellent character development, storyline surprises, pacing and smooth reading, but with a twist. To say anymore requires spoilers.

Good book, nice way to mix up mythologies.But........Takes too long in between books though. McHugh is lucky to have started writing a few years ago. He managed to miss the deluge of kindle authors who produce novels monthly and sell at 99c a copy.

A fun enjoyable read. However, I have always found Hearne's books to be too short, and the time taken to complete each new novel, too long. He's lucky he established himself as a "proper" author in the years before Kindle came out, and now hundreds of wannabe authors are churning out new books every month, either for free, at just $0.99 a copy.

Thraxas is back, and this time he's been given responsibility for doing something which should be beyond him, but he's not the number one chariot at finding things and people for nothing! Hopefully they can recapture their favourite city soon and Thraxas can be back at his favourite tavern!In an ideal world, Martin Scott would churn out a Thraxas book of high quality every month (That's what Christopher Nuttall, kindle author, has been doing for 3 years so far). Sadly, it looks like once a year is more likely.

My overall feeling was that this third installment was average. I don't know if it's because I'm used to an avalange of novels being produced by Kindle authors these days, but it's been a while between Books 2 and 3, and it took a while to remember what had been going on, and I never recaptured the same interest in Book 3 that I remembered feeling in Book 2.Not quite sure whether this is the final book in the series or not, but if another one pops out, I might wait for some reviews first.

Smoothly flowing and fantastical. As a previous reviewer wrote, I too was worried when I found out there were lots of gays in the book, but thankfully it did not devolve into a gay erotic novel, and it stayed mostly focused on the plot. If it's still free, grab it. If the gay parts bother you, just skip over them, like I did. The rest of the book is quite fun.
Humourous and smoothly flowing, but too much gay love for a straight guy like me. Won't be reading the 3rd one with Marrk

Like his previous series' , the plot continues to evolve, and the people you thought were the bad guys give way to even worse bad guys. In a way, life in the Arnault universe seems to be going in circles. All 3 series start with a single person who does their job in their own neck of the woods. Trouble follows them and somehow they become embroiled in something bigger, and by halfway through the series, they become leaders of lots of people. They then discover sodium tech and Autobot tech- either invented, or find left over, and they end up with incredibly advanced stuuf and battle AI's.If this is what will happen in Omega series, then it's almost like we can stop reading now- we know how it's going to end.But I admit- I'm still going to read on to find out!

Disclaimer: my version of this bag is 1.0. Version 2.0 is the current one you see here on amazon. The hiking shop attendant informed me the only difference between version 1.0 and 2.0 were the two shoulder strap pockets added on 2.0, which are not present on 1.0. I would have liked to have bought the one with pockets, but the 1.0 I bought was 40% cheaper and didn't justify paying extra for them. Those shoulder strap pockets were not available seperately.I was looking for a light and smaller frameless backpack to compliment my Karrimor 35 Trim, which is great when full, but has too much empty space when not, and lacks enough pockets. So I was window shopping around various hiking shops, seeing what was available, and hoping to see any bags with a steep discount.Initial impressions:=============When I saw the Hyper 22 hanging on the shelf, I spent about 15 minutes testing it out- adjusting the shoulder and waist straps, putting stuff inside so there'd be some weight, putting my camera and wallets in the waist pockets, and so forth. I was impressed with the quality of stitching and fabrics, the weight was light- only about 500 grams, the waist pockets had loads of space- camera easily goes in- not tight at all, shoulder straps were long- the wider padded part doesn't end in my armpit (I'm broad build 173cm), and the shoulder straps are a bit wider for comfort.The design is a tube, but instead of drawstring to close with a flap lid, it's a 270 degree(approx) zippered lid, with a zippered pocket on the top, and another zippered pocket on the inside. I thought that was pretty cool.There are also three stretchy mesh outer pockets- two on the side and one on the front.The puzzling part was the thin string which goes from one side pocket, across the front, and to the other side pocket. The staff showed me how to use it- it has several functions- compression strap, wrapping around things you want to hold like clothing on outside of bag, and anything else. Honestly, it looks like it will rip if it gets wet, but anyone with experience in higher end gear knows that thin material doesn't mean weak material. (I hope). There are a couple of plastic hooks which allow you to wrap the string around.There's also two loops at the bottom for poles etc.Essentially it was comfortable, pockets were spacious, light, well made (if a little quirky).Real World Use:===========A week after I got the Hyper 22, I found the Gregory Miwok 24 on special and bought it (65% off- awesome!!!) and I realised that the way the front and side pockets of the Hyper 22 were sized, the side pockets were slightly larger than normal, and thus the front pocket was narrower. For me, that means my 7 inch Kindle Fire is an extremely tight fit in the front pocket, and you might only fit one windbreaker in it. On the other hand, you will be able to fit 1L bottles into the side pockets easily. IN comparison, the Miwok 24 front pocket is designed to easily enclose a bicycle helmet.The Miwok 24 became my go to daypack and the Hyper 22 sat alone in my bag box.So one day I thought I'd give it a chance and I took it on an easy 2 hour day hike/cycling combo. I found that the pack is designed for, and suits very well, marathon and distance hikers and runners. Light, comfortable, can stuff a fair bit in.But for me, it's not quite so good as I find the design of the Gregory Miwok 24 more to my liking- more spacious pockets on top and front for my electronic gadgets - tablet/mobile/spare battery. It's a purely individual opinion. If I only brought hydration bladder, food, spare clothing, wallet, then the Hyper 22 would be fine. But for me, the Miwok is just so much more flexible- front pocket can fit so much, side pockets can fit 1.5L bottles, and completely enclose my 7 inch kindle fire, top pocket eats my wallet and passport and mobile when pack used as cabin bag.The Hyper 22 is a good, attractive, durable looking pack with many good features. If you want something like this, it's certainly worth a look. But I find my Miwok 24 that much more spacious, and far more versatile. (I wish more people were writing reviews for this, because I feel guilty writing the maiden review for this pack, and I've only used it for a single hike. and I want a pack to do perform in several ways, not just purely in one)

Once again Stephan follows a tried and true formula. Space sci-fi spanning galaxies, initially focuses one our hero in his little world, doing his job. From here, things get bigger, crazier, and his, and hence our, world view expands almost exponentially, and there are plot twists, as the enemy we thought was the enemy, is not who we think it is. As I write this review, Stephen has written 5 volumes in this series, which I have all read.This one is free. Download it quick, and be sucked into the Stephen Arrsenault universe for a fun and wold ride!

They say you shouldn't judge a book by it's cover, but that's what I did with AMP 1. I only downloaded it because it was free, and did not read it for months, until I ran out of other books to read. So then I got started into AMP, and I liked it enough to try buying book 2, and after book 2, I simply bought the rest in the series. The series starts with the hero down on his luck focusing on his own little world, as we all do in real life, except his revolves around his small spaceship. From there, it gets bigger and bigger until by the end of the series, he is the leader of the Human race, has travelled across many galaxies, and throws off evil tyrants.Download the book.The plot twists and turns as you progress through the series. Not truly epic like Neal Asher or Iain Banks (Seems the English authors are better at wordsmithing epics) but it's a good series.

They say you shouldn't judge a book by it's cover, but that's what I did with AMP 1. I only downloaded it because it was free, and did not read it for months, until I ran out of other books to read. So then I got started into AMP, and I liked it enough to try buying book 2, and after book 2, I simply bought the rest in the series. The series starts with the hero down on his luck focusing on his own little world, as we all do in real life, except his revolves around his small spaceship. From there, it gets bigger and bigger until by the end of the series, he is the leader of the Human race, has travelled across many galaxies, and throws off evil tyrants.Download the book. A bit short but otherwise fine. It was good to have a satisfying ending.But don't worry, Stephen is halfway through his next series, so there's more to read from him!
