I highly enjoyed this story, the sweeping landscape and the characters and look forward to more of Pratima’s adventures in this well-crafted realm.

As a child every time I got sick my mom would inevitably mash up some raw garlic and chase me around trying to force me to eat it. I’m not sure which was worse, actually eating it or the breath and burping that would last for hours… But as horrible as it was it really seemed to give my immune system a great boost. As an adult I am so glad there are options like these supplements that give you the same health benefits of garlic, but without the horrific side effects! No more flower wilting breath, just improved health. These are some of the best supplements I have purchased, hands down.

I really like hot short story compilations as I can usually finish at least one whole story before my stop on the train ride home from work. And what’s more fun than reading an erotic story while surrounded by strangers who are oblivious to your enjoyment? These stories did not disappoint as they jumped right into the exploit and descriptively brought the action to life. Told from a unique perspective, the 4 stories in this book were fun to read and get lost in / worked up over. No sexy detail is left out. Please tell me there’s a book 3 coming out soon?

I have a different Lampat lamp at home and bought this one for my husband to use in his office. So far he says it has really helped him have less eye strain and he really likes the USB port at the back to charge his cell phone. Not only is it functional it is aesthetically pleasing as well, which was part of the reason I wanted this one for his office. He said that his colleagues have commented on it and have asked for the brand and where he purchased it. Didn’t realize how much attention a lamp could get! Needless to say, this has more than paid for itself as it’s helped my husband be more productive at work and gain positive attention from his colleagues.

I love this lamp, use it every day in my home office. It can be hard to focus on work with all the distractions at home but I swear this lamp has helped me. Having decent lighting when I am working on a project makes it easier to focus and see the small details. Also, my eyes don’t get tired as quickly as I am straining less so I am more productive. I like that it is touch sensitive as I don’t have to break my concentration when I want to dim or brighten the light, just tap the base. Having a USB port is a great plus as I can charge my phone while at my desk without taking up an outlet or needing a long charging cord.

The author has spun a yarn that is part fact, part fiction, and all fascinating. If you like the early Tom Clancy works, you will LOVE this story. So lock the doors, settle down in a comfy chair, let the dog out, and silence the cell phone.

I’ve been dabbling in graphic design for a few years and have been teaching myself with every resource I can get my hands on. This book is exactly what I needed as it has taken my limited knowledge of color applications to a more professional level. For years I have played around with hues, saturation etc. on pictures and while I liked the final results I didn’t really understand what I was doing. I had never heard of hue similarity and found the information and examples in this section extremely useful. Sometimes I don’t like the way something I’ve worked hard on comes out and I’ve been stumped on how to convey what I want the picture to say. Now I know more about color symbolism it will be easier to get the results that I’m looking for. I learned a lot from this book that will definitely help me achieve better results with my graphic design and I know I’ll be coming back to it for reference in the future.

I knew I was going to enjoy this book when by the 4th page I actually laughed out loud from the conversation between Derek and his father, very relatable. But things quickly became serious and soon the adventure really began to unfold.I really enjoyed this story and think for a debut this author has brought a good quality novel to the table. Each character has an in-depth history which really brings them to life by adding depth and realism to the story. The action was great and just descriptive enough to make it easy to visualize without getting too wordy. I really felt for both Derek and Chandra and the many other characters that make up this detailed fantasy world. I really hope this author publishes more books and would love to read a sequel to this book.

I first heard of Selenium after my mom started taking supplements due to her hyperthyroid. As I have some thyroid issues myself I decided to give these a try. So far I’ve noticed an increase of energy and mental clarity. It’s not been super dramatic but it is noticeable. If the health benefits of taking this supplement are half as good as they claim then I will definitely continue taking these. I’ve had no side effects but as with any supplement I always look into any negatives before I begin taking them. Apparently you can overdose on Selenium but if you follow the directions and take one of these a day you will be well below the limit.

This has got to be one of the sweetest eroticas I have read. Two teens who have grown up as legal siblings are both so attracted to the other yet terrified to make the first move. It’s hard enough to get out of the friend zone, how the heck do you do that with a step sibling? I really enjoyed the game of cat and mouse Nathan and Lily both play and the suspense building up was palpable. This was a hot, cute and taboo story all in one.

I love buying box sets (especially erotic romance) to pass the time on my train commute. Nothing like getting all worked up on the way home after a long day! Makes me even more excited to see my husband – and I don’t think he minds one bit. I found each story in this collection interesting with good story-lines and well-developed characters. If I had to pick a favorite it would probably be the “When Naughty Becomes So Nice” trilogy. I love a strong woman who’s not afraid to get what she wants. I could definitely relate to Andie’s predicament of trying to decide whether to be naughty or nice and enjoyed the hot scenes. Really glad I bought this set, now I’m off to go see what else this author has written.

I was looking for a great supplement with Phytoceramides and I decided on this one as it has the other Vitamins contained within each capsule. I have taken vitamin E for months and have noticed it has really helped my skin and hair so I was very happy to see this included. Now that I’ve switched to this supplement (from just vitamin E) I have noticed my skin feels even better and I swear my wrinkles seem smoother. My hair also feels thicker and smoother and I haven’t changed my shampoo. I’ve told many friends about this and I’m quite excited to see my results after a few months of taking this.

I’ve become a big fan of Stewart and was quite excited to begin a new series by her. I liked how seriously Katie takes her job and watching her try so hard to keep things professional when her body desperately wanted to devour the hot musicians she is working with was delightfully excruciating. As you can imagine the release after so much build-up is super sexy and very entertaining. This is another very well written story with plenty of sexy scenes and interesting and unique characters and definitely a stimulating start to another great series.

I'm rather excited to write this review.  It's so nice to get something that really lives up to its name.  I have some Thayers open now and the bottle is still pretty full.  Normally would have finished the Thayers before opening the Dickinsons, but when I received this after reading all the great reviews, I just had to try it.  So, I washed my face, sat down at my makeup table, splashed some toner on some cotton balls and began to wipe my face.  My initial thought was hmm my face feels clean and refreshed, then my pores caught my attention --- My pores literally looked like they were diminishing with each swipe.  I'm 50 and I have great skin but my only issue is my pores.  They're not huge and probably not as bad as I think, but because they're noticeable to me I'm always searching for that next product that will actually shrink them.  This toner deserves a thumbs up, I'm very loyal to a great product and this has just been added to my great product list!  I highly recommend.
Well, constructed, they look great and hold my thick curly hair.  I wear these quite a bit!  I definitely recommend!

it is very comfortable that's for sure.  But the way the straps are constructed with the velcro if you don't place the straps perfectly, they tend to slide and the velcro scratches the heck out of the back of your ankle.  I think my right sandal the strap with the velcro piece attached to it was shorter, so I really felt the scratching on the back of my right ankle. I wore these during the summer commuting to work, as I take the subway, and the straps are my only complaint.  My feet felt great walking in these.

for sore muscles, back aches, etc.  I purchased it because for a while there my boyfriend was complaining about his back aching.  I rubbed him down and presto, he said his back felt better.  My mother swears by this stuff and I must say my boyfriend was happy with the results as well. I use the emu oil and really like it so I figured this would be a winner too and it is.  I definitely recommend.

It's unscented (I prefer the coconut scent of organic, virgin coconut oil I usually purchase) but in terms of consistency it feels the same going on your skin.  I guess if you don't like the coconut scent but want to use coconut oil this would be a great alternative.  What I did like about this one is when melted, you can add it to your lotions without it altering the scent and it gives your lotion more umph, moisture that is.  So I definitely recommend, I was quite satisfied.

but it truly is a staple in my house.  I love coconut oil on my skin and I'm never without it!  It's great for your hair as well. I've gotten my whole family using coconut oil now, and they're pleased with it too.  If you haven't tried it before you won't be disappointed. It absorbs well, great for your skin, smells wonderful and will make you soft as a baby's bottom.  I use a lot of different oils, grapeseed, rose seed hip oil, olive oil, castor oil, and I'd say my top two are the grapeseed and coconut.

and he loves it.  The only cup he'll drink from now!  It's well made, a good size and I like that it doesn't "sweat" no matter what beverage you put in it.  I do wash it by hand (which is easy, it cleans up very easy!) didn't want to risk putting it in the dishwasher but he is quite happy with his own personal Redskins tumbler!

I bought the black the first time, and thought I'd buy another before they sell out, so I purchased it in cobalt blue.  I absolutely loved wearing it during the summer.  I'm 5'5 so I'm able to wear this as a dress, it hits me above the knee.  The fabric is comfortable and it looks great on and another plus for me was that it was true to size.  No guess work, having to read reviews to see if I should order a size up or down-- it fit perfectly.  I definitely, definitely recommend this!

the vanilla and lavender.  My boyfriend and I moved into an apartment together and I cleansed it with white sage and decided to also try the dragons blood incense. The cones for this particular incense are larger that than the vanilla/lavender cones I purchased previously.  I wasn't quite sure if I would like the smell, but it's not bad --it's rather calming and soothing.  To me, it smells like a mixture of frankincense and myrrh.  I would definitely recommend.

I went into this movie with mixed feelings because remakes aren't usually as good as the first movie.  Like Last House on the Left, I thought the first movie was better than the remake.  But happy to say, this this time I was wrong.  It didn't stray too far from the original movie.I read reviews on the movie before I saw it and yes, it's graphic but I did think the punishment fit the crime.  Perhaps more rapists would reconsider if they knew this was coming. . call me weird but I actually liked the way she got them back, quite inventive.  Even showing up at the sheriff's house, I would have done that too. It didn't stray too.  All in all, I'd recommend.  I thought it was pretty good!

I've only used it a couple of times, but it works well, and heats evenly. Having it all tuck together for storage is nice, although it would be even better if the lid clipped onto the body somehow so it would all stay together.

My desk is kinda dark, especially when my old eyes need more light to read some small print. This light is an inexpensive and bright answer to that need. I also use it as a work light for small jobs around the house. It holds a charge for maybe a couple weeks, so I do have to remember to plug it in once in a while to make sure it's ready when I need it (not sure if it is good to leave such things plugged into the wall all the time).

I bought two of these to do full image backups of my home computers (using Macrium Reflect). I keep them at a friend's house, and just get them one at a time, leap-frog style, when it's time for monthly backups, then take it back there when I'm done. (Daily document/etc. backups are done with CrashPlan.) Anyway, these drives are rugged, so I don't feel like I have to baby it when transporting it. While the clipped on cable seemed a bit clunky at purchase, I now see it as a good thing, to have the cable attached so easily to the device it supports.

I'm using this to lock my desktop computer to my desk (and that same lock tab, built into my computer, also prevents the case from being opened without the key). I know the small lock and cable won't stand up to strong bolt cutters or other tools, but I just need to slow down the robbers until my GuardBot gets there.

A good quality cymbal, it pairs well with this stand: http://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B0002E5266/ref=wms_ohs_product?ie=UTF8&psc=1  The cleaning supplies and extra pads are a nice touch. Ours sees very light use, so I can't speak to how durable it is, but many drummers go through a lot of cymbals anyway, as they do take a beating.
I am pleased with the high quality and stability of this item, it works great for my son's drum set.

Update: the stand came off completely today, and even after 6 months of use the phone is still hard to get out of the holster. Reducing my rating to 3 stars.I like holster cases, because my phones tend to take a lot of abuse and I like to keep them clean.I carry this in the side pocket of my backpack, or clipped inside my front pants pocket (where it hangs from the pocket edge, not way down at the bottom of my pocket smacking against my leg). I really like the fold out stand, which is handy for watching/reading stuff, and makes the phone especially easy to hold onto when I use it as an e-reader (for ebooks from the local library system). Two minor things: 1) the fold out stand is now loosening up enough that sometimes it folds out when I don't want it to (it used to click positively into stowed mode, now not so much), and 2) it fits in the case firmly, such that even after all this time it's difficult to get out. But it's still the best one of these I've tried, and I've tried a few. It's nice that the USB port is accessible while in the holster for charging.

This is a fun instrument. It's played basically like whistling (where your mouth and tongue change the pitch) except the air you blow out of your noise makes the base whistling noise. I got one for my favorite elementary music teacher, and now she wants to get them for all of her students.
This works well for my iPad, giving it some protection and serving as a stand, without adding to much weight or width. It stays closed while in my backpack.

I wanted to like this, but the pressure gauge was way off, and different every time I took a reading. It's a good design, and I liked the light and all the tools, but the main thing I needed was a pressure gauge I could rely on.
I bought this for a coworker's retirement, and I'm glad I did. It has a good heft, and seems like a classy addition to a garden. It has a threaded thingy on the bottom for mounting.

In an effort to avoid going to the front door three times a day to talk to salespeople, I purchased these. I cut the outer stripes off to lessen the sticker's garishness (in an effort to mollify the wife, who was not a fan of such signs). They were easy to apply, and have good adhesive, and seem like they'll stand the test of time. Here's hoping for longer uninterrupted naps.
These cables feel good and work fine, and the snagproof things over the tabs aren't too stiff (some of them make it difficult to remove the cable from the device). Will buy again.

I purchased these for my HP Photosmart C309a, and so far all is well. Printouts look good and there have been no problems.Notes:There are plastic plugs with long handles on these, and it is possible that, when you open them, ink will spill. So open them carefully, with the plugs pointing up, and over some paper towels or something that you won't mind getting some color on (also, I had splotches of black and blue on my hands for a week, although for some reason the black wore off much more quickly).It always risky using refilled/remanufactured cartridges, but it sure can save money, Like I said, so far so good, but be aware that the cartridges have a sticker on each one that says: "Made In China. Please Note: These cartridges were professionally refurbished in an ISO 9002 certified factory; however because they are previously used cartridges some printer models may not show an accurate ink level. These cartridges have been completely filled to meet both volume and weight standards for ink that are equivalent to the originals in order to provide you with full print life." My printer seems to be able to judge them correctly so far: the new ones are all full, and my photo black (which I did not replace) is almost gone.I'll post an update in a few months after some time and printing.

For the most part this is a good chair, and I'm glad to own it (I do not have an easy time finding comfortable folding chairs).Things I've noted:* I'm of average height, and my feet/ankles are all over that metal bar at the bottom when I recline.* The tab things that hold the recliner in position, one on each side under the armrests, don't always hold; and they rotate on the bar they're on as well, so sometimes they feel like one is broken or that they are uneven with each other (can be fixed by lossdening and repositioning them)* it's admirably light, so even though it's big, it's an easy carry* I'm within the stated weight limit, but when sitting on it I can feel the  crossbar that's under the seat (but not too bad, although I haven't given it the "family camping in it for multiple hours" test yet)* it is a learned skill to be able to recline these things: as others have mentioned, you have to push the bottom bar with your feet to recline (which is a design issue that I'm sure has something to do with the first bullet point)* the mesh seems like it would help keep one nice and cool in warmer weather

I like the fact that it's a glass jar (for reheating the honey of it starts to crystallize), but I can't get it to stop leaking. I've tried turning the gasket both ways, and I still get honey leaking from the lid (not just at the spout). And I've been careful to not over-tighten it. I'd like to say I followed the instructions, but it didn't come with any; it would have been nice to know which way the gasket goes, and get some coaching about starting and stopping the pouring while the device is tilted. So now I have a honey dispenser that usually has a small dish stuck to the bottom of it.

I bought these on the strength of the reviews, but they are nowhere near as good-sounding as the ones I've compared them against: JBuds Hi-Fi Noise-Reducing Ear Buds (Black) The JBuds sound much better (much better lows, cleaner highs) and are about the same price. Tested on two different devices: my computer, and my Sansa Clip MP3 player. I wish there was a place where I could just try dozens and dozens of ear buds to see which works best for me, but I guess I'd only do that if I was the first one to do it, if you know what I'm saying about ear wax.

I bought these in 2007, and they're still working great (but I don't use them very often, and I don't jog with them or anything). I like their sound better than the few other ear buds or vertical-in-ear headphones I've tried. They provide good low end, which is a must for me. I use them with my Sansa Clip MP3 player.

This product seems well designed, and the manual is comprehensive. The flashlight is bright, and all functions seem to work well. As with all such devices, it's a good idea to read and understand the manual in order to maximize the life of the battery and the device itself.I am confused, though: in section 4.3 it sounds like the device is not for *directly* charging cell phones, as it says: "disconnect the smartphone or PDA first from the USB charging port before cranking (the crank charges the internal battery and by design, the smart device must be disconnected first to prevent the phone from power cycling and reduce the load on the crank". Also in section 5.5 it states "it is not intended for recharging fully a discharged cell phone battery... a fully charged Adventurer will only partially charge a cell phone or mp3/mp4 device. After the battery stops charging the device, begin cranking... to continue charging the cell phone." I think that could all use some clarification in the manual, and maybe have someone else not familiar with the device proofread it for clarity (as some of it could be rewritten to better serve the purpose). Also, at least one other person here has said they've charged their phone with the solar panel: is that advised? From reading about the crank and how it needs to be used correctly, I'd rather *not* use it if the solar option works as well (and I understand it could take longer).I should also say that I've spent the time writing this review and questions because of how great customer support is in responding to reviews. In this way, we can not only find good products and avoid bad ones, but also work with the manufacturer to actually improve products and documentation.

This is a good mouse, no problems with it so far. The nano transceivers are good, as they can be left in the USB port even during transport, as they don't stick out far enough to cause problems. Will buy again.
I'm busy helping people avoid Windows 8, and this laptop helps. It is fast and good-looking and has had no problems so far.

This case is too big to be lifted with one hand. Why is it so wide? So it can accommodate the sleeves, which for no good reason have binder holes on one side. 5 binder holes, each punched *almost* all the way through, so that you get to spend the time removing them on purpose so that they don't fall out all over everything by accident. The front and back pockets also have a piece of plastic that must be removed. Multiply that by 75 (and because of the pockets, you'll be doing 150 of those pieces, for a grand total of 525 things to be removed) and see if you still feel good about the product. And don't forget to install the hinge pins, during which you'll feel like something is going to break for sure. Also, the lid only stays closed (for lifting) if you lock it with the tiny plastic key, then you can lose the key, because I think you could open that lock by just looking at it with a raised eyebrow. On the plus side, the sleeves are of good quality (once you complete the manufacturing process as above), and the provided dividers work well, and can be moved as often as you'd like. But overall, not worth it.

The spring clip for the top is pretty strong, and holds my GPS in place. There is easy room to run the power cord. The on-off button on the top of the GPS is right up against the clamp, but that's due to the size of the GPS. I was initially worried because the bottom of the holder isn't quite flat (like it's been stuffed with too much beanbag filler), but it's never moved once when in use. I was kinda hoping the the inside of it was big enough to store the GPS when I wasn't using it, but no such luck. I really like how slick it looks, and that it provides some measure of sun protection.

Great drumset, really a lot of fun. The picture (like many other product pictures) isn't really indicative of actual use, because everything plugs into something else so there's cables all over. But Alesis also sends some black wire ties to help keep things in place, so there's that. Also note: unless you are playing at very low levels, it's not recommended to use any old amplifier with this: you need one built for electronic drums, or a keyboard amp, or you'll thrash in to death (presumably because of the frequency range and dynamic range of the drum kit's output). Also note: it's not completely quiet: even in a room with the door shut the kit can be heard else where (especially the kick drum). But as they say, that's just physics. I still happily give this 5 stars.

I carefully read all the instructions and tips, and did everything accordingly. When I first used it, I could barely cook an egg in it, because it was so slippery that I couldn't get a spatula under it; then within a few weeks of daily use it got less slippery, and kept getting progressively worse. I tried a scrubbing pad, and even a fine scouring powder, nothing made much of a difference. And has anyone noticed how much lids are for frying pans? So now I'm back to using Teflon, with a nice fitted glass lid. T-fal D9133364 Signature Hard Anodized Nonstick 10-Inch Skillet with Glass Lid Cookware, Gray

These have worked well, I just bought my second bucket of them. Be warned: when they say to keep them dry, they mean it. If you leave the container open, or reach in there with wet hands, the moisture will start to break them down (as they are designed to do). We had one let go of the blue stuff, and it made kind of a mess; I took them out of the container and wiped them off with paper towels, then put them back in with a paper towel between each layer. Also, at least from what I see right now, it is worth it to look at various size options: the 90-count is almost twice as much as the 85-count, and the 85 is eligible for Amazon Prime.

This lock has an intense acrid/plasticy smell, very strong, and although I am admittedly sensitive to such things, other people were shocked by how bad it smelled. I left it outside for a few days, and wiped it down with a wet wipe... no change: it's still stinky enough to knock out a buffalo at 10 paces. Touching it left the smell on my hands, and it persisted through hand washing. Even the package in the trash stank so bad I had to take it outside.Would the smell have gotten better after it off-gassed its chemicals for a few weeks/months/years? We'll never know.

I happily give this item 5 stars for doing what it is supposed to do, and doing it well. I had no trouble using this with my Windows 7 laptop and my Cisco 7960 VOIP phone (no phone amp needed). But be aware of these things:-- the binaural phone headset I tried with it (Plantronics HW261N Binaural Headset) is either not built to provide stereo sound, or the ZoomSwitch doesn't support it. This is no problem for phone calls, but I was, at the time of purchase, in a sucky cubicle environment (and anyone who claims they're good for "collaboration" needs to just admit they're for "packing more worker drones into less space") and wishing to use my headset to listen to music or waterfalls, so I could do less unintentional "collaborating" while I was trying to get things done; and not having true stereo sound was a deal-breaker for me. I'm not sure if a different headset, or using one of these (ZoomSwitch ZMS15-PIGTAIL Soundcard Headset Cable Adapter - DJ9930) and a true stereo PC headset would help, but I suspect that phone systems, and the phone/headset side of the ZoomSwitch, are just not designed to handle stereo signals.-- the ZoomSwitch is a USB device that will show up as a second sound system to your computer, which adds complexity and possible confusion until you get things set up correctly; but does allow you to do something cool, if your phone software supports it: I can have the ring sound and regular system sounds come through the computer speakers, so I don't need to wear the headset all the time, only when actually on a call.

The one I received is similar to what is pictured here, but mine didn't have the logo thingy on the front, and was decidedly more square on the top, and the stitching is a slightly different pattern. It just seems big and bulky, so I have't used it much. But the phone fits in it well.

This brush is sturdily constructed, and previous ones like it have lasted a long time without the handle breaking (like plastic ones do) or the scrubber thing coming undone (and who knew that those things are made of 20 feet of mesh?). The string at the end of the handle did come unknotted, but I tied it again and gave it a couple of extra knots, all seems well. I recommend shaking the excess water out of this after use, and hanging it to dry.

Pros:-- feels great: because, like a beanbag, it conforms to the shape of your head and shoulders-- the buckwheat hulls do mean a cooler sleep (in my case, not a completely cool sleep, but at least the pillow allows some of the heat to escape away, not hold it all against me to form a bowl of noggin sweat soup).-- the cover feels strong, and the zipper tough enough to hold everything in (pillow case recommended)Cons:-- this pillow is not very pretty. Because it's half-filled with loose buckwheat hulls, it doesn't retain any shape like a regular pillow.-- it's a bugger to work with, in terms of trying to get it into a pillow case or even just move it around: it's heavy, and gravity does what it does best.-- it's loud when you move it around or punch it into shapeBut those things are okay, and I'm still giving it a 5-star review, because it's just the physics of the thing, and I'd read enough about these pillows to expect all of that.Protips: if you let it hang and get all the hulls in one end, then fold the empty case underneath, it's firmer and better-looking, but for me at least it's then uncomfortably high; also, this would be wicked cool in a pillow fight, if there were no rules and you had no sense of fairness.
Designed and assembled well, glad to have this, and will buy again next year. Double-ring spiral binding is a good idea for items like this.

This fan pushes a *lot* of air in a very narrow stream, and is fairly quiet about it.* The yellow part pivots at least 180 degrees, as I have rotated mine back so that the air exit is right above the floor (as I'm using it as a cold air return booster fan for our belabored central AC system, which has far more output vent area than cold air return area).* The cord is very thick, about 6 feet long, with a grounded 3-prong plug; that's good, especially since the fan has two grounded outlets right on it, which have a circuit breaker; they are labeled max 10 amps each.* The fan has three speeds, and is truly three speeds: I refuse to buy fans that count "off" as one of the speeds.* The box says the fan has 100 blades, and it's a squirrel cage fan (sucks air in through the sides, forces it out through the front, just like a blow dryer.* The case is made of heavy plastic and feels solid.* The fan sounds like white noise, there is no vibration or phasing.

I paid less than 3 clams for these, and they work well enough for phone calls. I'm using a Blackberry Torch 9850, and the button by the mic does indeed mute the mic, and if help down, ends the call.The bass (low end) sound reproduction is not good, I don't think I'd want to listen to music with these. Also, the asymmetrical cable length is irritating, with the left cord very short, and the right one way longer: I think this is so you can put your phone in your left shirt pocket? I dunno, it feels weird. The headphones come with only one size of cushion (1 set on already, and a spare set), and I think if the cushions were bigger there'd be better sound due to canal blockage. I much prefer the other ones I bought: PureGear PureBeats Premium In-Ear 3.5mm Headset With Mic (Bulk Packaging)

This bottle tries to trick us by claiming "100% Gel": it is definitely not 100% aloe vera (it has a bunch of other chemicals in it, some of which you may not want to put on your skin or in your body). That's like saying a beverage is "100% liquid": it's true, but it's not nearly as important as the ingredients, and it appears to be an intentionally misleading label. It is also not "Pure" because it has "no color added". Sorry, Fruit of the Earth, I refuse to do business with a company that does this with their packaging.

These look good on my son's '98 Crown Vic. When they arrived the box was so thin I thought we'd somehow only ordered one, but there were four of them in there: they don't use the tabs and metal rings I've seen with other wheel covers, but instead just have a series of metal clips along the edge that hook over the lip of the rim. Two of these clips wouldn't work on the car until we gently pried them outward with a screwdriver, then they snapped on (and it felt like the plastic cover was nearing the point of breaking, because it's kinda thin). Time will tell if they stay on; they seem solid enough now. Here's the kicker, and the reason I only gave it three stars: the box they came says "Wheel Skins are designed to stay on the vehicle's wheels and are not designed for frequent removal. To remove Wheel Skins, remove the wheel from the vehicle to access the Wheel Skin's retaining tabs and proceed with care." I don't even understand that, because to remove the wheel you'd have to remove the lug nuts, which are behind the wheel cover; and there are no tabs, just clips. So I worry that these are single use wheel covers, especially if one tried to remove them in winter, when the plastic would be cold and brittle. I'll post an update in a few weeks or months.UPDATE: after 5 months of use, I can say that they've held on pretty well, except 1) lost one while driving (probably too fast) in a couple inches of water after a flood; and 2) after getting the tires rotated, the tire store (that's all they do is tires) didn't put one on good enough and it fell off and got driven over and it broke. Given all the issues above, I think I'd take them off and put them on myself when work needed to be done; or, more likely, I'd just not buy these. I note that the image for these says "factory grade": yeah, no they're not.

These sound great, very good sound clarity and low end. It's interesting how the bass gets way better when I look upward, must be the ear canal tightening. Anyway, these come with three sizes of cushion, and after switching to the large ones, the fit (and bass response) is much better. I'm a big fan of the flat cable, which seems tougher, and definitely doesn't tangle as easy. I use these on my work laptop (a Lenovo T510), since I've had my work life downgraded to a cubicle, and they work well, although I have yet to use the mic much (I did test it to make sure it worked, and it did).
I needed a little bit longer of a cable for my printer (a Canon printer/scanner/copier), and this one worked perfectly, at a price soooo much better than buying in a local store.

These were just too big for me to use comfortably. In their default state they have no cushioning and are large, and trying to install the included foam covers was very frustrating, and the resulting amount of stretch means the foam is very thin and doesn't seem to add a thing to the comfort level.

The mirror arrived, in original packaging and nicely packed by Amazon, but as others have pointed out, the mirror is all scraped and scratched in the middle, probably due to moving around during shipping. This make it an unusable 1-star item in my opinion. I suffered for too many years with scratched glasses to ever willingly look into something with that kind of damage. :-) It's too bad, too, because otherwise it's a great mirror: black offset frame that rotates around the backing plate so change the view, and the backing plate has a nice piece of adhesive on it.I just tried to clean it with a cotton ball and some rubbing alcohol (I thought maybe the mess on the lens was some sticky stuff from the manufacturing process), and not only didn't it clear up the problem, but the *cotton ball* left scratches on the lens, which I assume is plastic. I bought this to use as a cubicle "don't sneak up on me" system, and I can't imagine how this would ever survive the rigors of outdoor use on a vehicle.

Enjoyable read. Bushkin offers true insight into the life of one of America's entertainment icons of the 60s and 70s and the entertainment business itself. His revealing tales of dealing with these people is eye-opening and puts things in perspective. His stories of off-set Carson are humorous, frightening and give you an idea of just how crazy his time with Carson were. It is entertainment history at its best.

It is not too common that a small production company makes a wonderful film with a nice story line, cast and nicely done overall. The Legend of Longwood is a wonderful dramatic story that will be enjoyed by most who sees it.The main genre of this film is drama with a sense of adventure and fantasy thrown in. Also, they include from time to time a bit of comedy making the story enjoyable, yet thrilling.The story begins when a young girl named Mickey (Lucy Morton) is torn away from New York where she lives with her family because they have to move to Ireland on almost the opposite side of the world. She arrives sad and depressed. To add to the problems of leaving New York, she leaves behind the memory of her passed away horse which is the only connection she has to her dad.  (If you want to find out more about he dad, you have got to watch the film!) She and her family settle in and she soon learns about a legend and starts a massive and dramatic adventure along with a discovery which leads to a very unexpected ending.This film is a wonderful production with nicely executed shots and story plot. You never expect what happens so it is just a thrilling thing to watch. The director, Lisa Mulcahy, really excels at creating a compelling story with everything in perfect position. The only con I have is that the acting with some of the younger talent is a bit dull at times. Also, they move through conversations so fast that I missed important parts of the story, making me wondering what happened later.My favorite scene is when a elderly lady tells Mickey the story of the, 'Mysterious Black Knight' which is a 300-year-old legend. It is shown through animated pictures and narration and becomes a very, if not the most, important part of the story.This film really has nothing too mature for kids, so I recommend it for ages 9 to 18. I also give it 4 out of 5 stars because, although it is very nicely done in terms of directing, story and camera shots, it lacks somewhat in terms of acting skills and feels rushed at times.Reviewed by KIDS FIRST! Film Critic, Gerry O. For more reviews by youth, go to kidsfirst dot org.

Very interesting story about the Jews from Turkey who were persecuted in Paris during the Nazi occupation and how the Turkish officials were able to bend the rules to help those from their homeland as well as others. Compelling story line.
Pretty good. Not quality turquoise but works for inexpensive bracelets.
pretty good. Good price. They sometimes get caught in my printer.
excellent. Natural materials, love it.
perfect. works great. all natural materials. What's not to like.

Maya the Bee Movie is a cute and funny movie! It’s about a young little bee named Maya who is very curious and eager to learn about the beehive. As Maya explores the beehive without permission, she asks a bunch of questions. Maya quickly learns that she is completely different from the other bees. She repeatedly finds herself in trouble by Buzzlena, the queen’s assistant. As a result, Maya gets banned from the hive. Her friend Willie does not want Maya to be alone, so he leaves the hive and follows her. As Maya and Willie are out in the meadows, they learn that hornets and the other bugs and insects are not as bad as they have been told. While Maya has been banned from the beehive because of her curiosity, Buzzleana devises a plan to harm the Queen so that she can take control of the bees and the hive.There are several different messages in this movie. The one that stands out the most to me is, “dare to be different.” In this movie, the bees have to follow specific rules, specific directions and they must do as they are told. Maya is different and she is told that she does not belong in the beehive. She works hard to find her place among the bees. She learns that she is an important bee in the kingdom and that her voice is important.My favorite part is when Willie is mad at Maya and decides to fly back to the beehive. Willie is scared of everything. But, when a frog sticks out his tongue to try to capture Willie for dinner, Willie hits the frog’s tongue and flies away without looking back. That’s pretty impressive for a fearful bee.My favorite character is Willie. Willie is a very loyal and a true friend. He supports Maya and helps her when she’s down and he’s not afraid to tell her when she’s not right. Willie is also very funny.Maya and the Bee Movie is a wonderful movie! It has great messages for kids! I recommend this movie for boys and girls ages 5 to 10. I give this movie 3 out of 5 shinning stars!Reviewed by Kayla P. KIDS FIRST! Film Critic. For more youth reviews go to kidsfirst dot org.There are several different messages in this movie. The one that stands out the most to me is, “dare to be different.” In this movie, the bees have to follow specific rules, specific directions and they must do as they are told. Maya is different and she is told that she does not belong in the beehive. She works hard to find her place among the bees. She learns that she is an important bee in the kingdom and that her voice is important.My favorite part is when Willie is mad at Maya and decides to fly back to the beehive. Willie is scared of everything. But, when a frog sticks out his tongue to try to capture Willie for dinner, Willie hits the frog’s tongue and flies away without looking back. That’s pretty impressive for a fearful bee.My favorite character is Willie. Willie is a very loyal and a true friend. He supports Maya and helps her when she’s down and he’s not afraid to tell her when she’s not right. Willie is also very funny.Maya and the Bee Movie is a wonderful movie! It has great messages for kids! I recommend this movie for boys and girls ages 5 to 10. I give this movie 3 out of 5 shinning stars!Reviewed by Adam C., KIDS FIRST! Film Critic. Who knew that being so square could be so cool! Big Block Singsong is a terrific musical, visual DVD romp. Creators Warren Brown and Adam Goddard have hit the creative mother load here - what seems so simple is so deceiving in its well-designed construction - the 'simple' individual block characters sing a two-minute nicely produced song that covers subjects from noses and hair to emotions of sadness and happiness, so you see the sky's the limit, or not. Two of my favorite pieces are 'Octopus' who is so proud of his eight legs and 'Moose' who touts the joys of visiting the park. If I was a betting man I'd bet you couldn't watch just one, could you, I bet not.This might be the best invention since the Wheel! Simplicity and cleverness of design mixed with catchy songs and melodies. Great to look at and fun to hear. I'm 65 and mesmerized ... the colors and movement will entrance toddlers while adults will get the in-jokes. Each two-minute animated song is a complete story and true to its mission of making what might be a mundane single word into a revelation that being so square could be so cool. I love that some of the lyrics are above the head of the little ones. It doesn't matter because the visual and audio support each other so wellThe songs are positive and supportive and applaud individualism and uniqueness. I bet this DVD will get worn out from repeat viewings!The DVD cover shows the diversity of each character, an animated block that is colorful, very fun-looking and inviting. The technical features are all sound but the joy is letting each of the 24 segments play through. Cool!The kids really liked this program. They watched it with interest and they were excited for each next song to begin. They laughed and jumped around during the song about hair. We watched it in two sessions because it was a little long for them to watch in one session. They lost interest halfway through but came back excited about it again later. They loved the different colors of the blocks and were interacting and discussing the songs with each other."It's big music!" "My favorite part was the hair person that had hair all over her eyebrows." "We liked everything." "We liked that it said, oh yeah!" They really liked the format of short, fun songs, laughed hysterically at the hair song. The baby had his eyes open really big. They also liked the space song. Thought it was really cool. "We learned about colors, fruit and flamingos. The owl looked so mean." They were loud and enthusiastic about each new song. The baby cooed at the fruit song. Very enjoyable for all, ages 4 months to 5 years.

The 50th Anniversary Edition of Rodgers and Hammerstein’s The Sound of Music is a must-have for every family.  This 5-disc DVD set includes the movie in HD and standard definition, a new 60 minute documentary called The Sound of a City: Julie Andrews Returns to Salzburg and lots of other special features.The Sound of Music is the best family film of all time because it brings  everyone together with its great, true-life story of the Von Trapp family.  The songs by Rodgers and Hammerstein are all wonderful and unforgettable.  Each song is a masterpiece. Some might think Frozen is an amazing movie musical, but Rodger and Hammerstein’s The Sound of Music is a million times better!  The quality of the song writing just cannot be compared with anything else.The Sound of Music stars Julie Andrews as Maria, a young Austrian woman who is training to be a nun at a monastery.  Christopher Plummer stars as Captain Von Trapp, a wealthy Austrian naval captain who hires Maria as governess to his seven children.  It was directed by Robert Wise.  It won five Academy Awards including Best Picture.The documentary, The Sound of a City: Julie Andrews Returns to Salzburg, which is included in this 50th anniversary DVD edition, is informative and revealing.  We go behind-the-scenes to visit the original locations in the film: the monastery, the Cathedral, the Von Trapp estate (which is really a classical music school) and a 100-year-old marionette theater which was the inspiration for the puppet scene in the film.  It is wonderful to see Julie Andrews so excited about coming back and visiting the film's locations after 50 years.For those who love the songs, the 50th Anniversary DVD Edition also includes the original soundtrack from the film. And there are lots of other bonus material, such as Music Machine Sing-Along;  Audio Commentaries with Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer, and Director Robert Wise; A City of Song—Virtual Map of Filming Locations in Salzburg, Austria; Vintage Rodgers and Hammerstein and The Sound of Music programs; and more.The Sound of Music is appropriate for all ages.  The documentary, The Sound of a City: Julie Andrews Returns to Salzburg is appropriate for those ages 10 to 18. I rate this new DVD set 5 out of 5 stars.Reviewed by Clayton P, KIDS FIRST! Film Critic. For more reviews by youth, go to kidsfirst dot org.

This is a fantastic collection of My Little Pony episodes. My Little Pony: Keys of Friendship is a collection of the best episodes from My little Pony including a sing along. And, if you are as big of a fan as I am - you will be very entertained by this collection.This collection has more than just favorite characters - there are a lot of family matters, some good lessons, a lot of comedy and some pretty thrilling moments as well as great and catchy music.The episodes show, as usual, the pony friends learning about friendship. However, Twilight, who recently became an alicorn (unicorn and Pegasus) doesn't feel like she is doing enough of her job as a princess. However, she will become more important than ever when an ancient beast comes back from his prison to rain chaos in Equestria! (The country where ponies live.)I thought this was a very smart choice of episodes since the DVD contains about half of the full season. These episodes really are exciting and, even though some people may not know it, pretty funny and really show some good lessons. For example, in one episode about family, ponies argue a lot but at the end they are still just a family.My favorite episode is when one of them learns that she is a cousin of another friend. When they realize there may be an error, they go on a road trip to find out the truth. On the way there, the family argues and feels bad that they may look like a dysfunctional family. At the end, they see that even though they argue, they are still a great family. I like it because so many families in real life feel are like that and we all need to understand that it happens with everyone - nobody is perfect.There is nothing parents should worry about and even infants will like the bright colors of the show and its wonderful sounds. I give this DVD an age rating of 1 to 18. I also give it 5 out of 5 stars.Reviewed by Gerry O, KIDS FIRST! Film Critic.

What an exciting and thrilling blockbuster! I was worried about this film. This was the 8th add on to the Planet of the Apes series, second to the reboots. So this Is a sequel and an eighth movie. I expected that it would feel a bit stretching, but it isn't. In fact, Dawn of The Planet of The Apes' main purpose Is to show another side of these super apes and to set up the story for the next film in the franchise.This isn't just about fighting; in fact, fighting scenes, even though they are epic, take very little part of the film. There is romance within humans and apes families, sometimes, the apes can act funny. Dawn of The Planet of The Apes is thrilling and kept me at the edge of my seat the entire time! Also it has a story line no one expects!The original Planet of the Apes book is about humans that went to a planet ruled by apes. When they come back to Earth, the same thing happened to our planet. The reboots, (Dawn of The Planet of The Apes and Rise of the Planet of the Apes) are pretty much prequels. So, Caesar leaves civilization with his ape friends while the human race almost goes extinct due to a deadly virus. The remaining humans struggle for power. Will they be able to find a new source of power or will it be up to the apes and their leader to decide the humans' fate?For me, this is a fantastic addition to the series. They don't try too hard to make it too action-packed and cool looking. The apes look extremely realistic and I really like that. They include some scenes from Rise of the Planet of the Apes which helps to pull it all together nicely. The action and fighting even has some stuff from the original 1963 Planet of the Apes book! The director made it a perfect length and, in fact, this is the first time I've seen what I would call a "trailer" movie (a movie that looks like an hour-long trailer for the next one in the series) that is entertaining and includes a surprise ending.My favorite scene is when we see a small group of humans working on the power station. When they wake up, the youngest is sitting with an ape that acts as a teacher to young apes and is very loyal to Caesar. The kid gives him a book and reads along with him. It shows how well they actually understand each other and how alike humans and apes are. It shows friendship and how two creatures of different species can be friends.This film has some violence and intensity so I recommend it for ages 11 to 18. I also give it 5 out of 5 stars for fantastic graphics, a well planned story, excellent cinematography and stupendous acting.Reviewed by Gerry O, KIDS FIRST! Film Critic. For more youth reviews, go to kidsfirst dot org.
good deal, works great.
Love this, saved $2500/ year on my phone bill by installing this and ditching my 2nd line through the phone company.
Perfect for my needs, just a bit on the big side.
perfect for my needs

It’s been years since the Decepticons and the Autobots battled for the fate of the humans in Chicago and human defenses against alien forces are at an all-time high. A government branch of humans is targeting all Transformers, Autobots and Decepticons alike, with the help of a menacing assassin. While all of this is going on, Cade Yeager, a struggling inventor from Texas tries to make enough means to keep his property and put his daughter Tessa through college.  While looking for parts to help his inventions, he stumbles upon a broken down, rusted truck and decides to fix it up. To his surprise, the truck turns out to the mighty Optimus Prime. Cade fixes him and decides to help him defeat the forces coming for Earth yet, again once he realizes what the government is doing to Transformers. Now, the fate of the entire human race lies in the hands of Optimus and this family of humans and, without them, we might just face extinction.This film is entertaining and visually very well done. Director Michael Bay uses the first IMAX Digital 3D camera, making the images more immersive and stunning than anything that’s been seen on the big screen so far. It’s very intense to be sitting in the IMAX Theater seeing these 50 ft. robots captured in such a realistic way. If you’ve seen any of the previous films from this franchise you know that they are nothing short of action packed. The cinematography and CGI is able to show the intense battle scenes and large scale attacks in a breathtaking, edge-of-your-seat way. One thing that I don’t like about the visuals is the inconsistency of the Transformers from film to film. The main characters look the same but some of the Autobots that are introduced in this film are designed completely different than in any of the previous films. Their faces are constructed to have features that look extremely humanesque and it is strange to see them next to Optimus and BumbleBee who still have the classic Transformer look. Another inconsistency is that, in the last film, every time a Transformer was hit they would spill a blood-like-liquid, but in this film, if they are injured, the liquid that comes from the wounds is bright green.It is very strange to see a Transformer film without Shia Labeouf but, I am quite impressed with Mark Wahlberg and the way he tackles this role. I think he’s a fantastic actor and really grounds the film. I’m also a fan of Nicola Peltz and think she is decent in this film. However, I am really sick of the way girls are portrayed in this franchise. Every single leading lady looks like a Victoria’s Secret model, is completely helpless about 75% of the movie, can never figure out how to help them self and has to be told to run before they do. Near the end, they have one moment of courage and that’s pretty much all. It’s a formula that is completely predictable in all of the Transformer films, but alas, it’s what sells.Like I said before, this film is entertaining and it enjoyable. It kept me engaged, concerned for the characters, shocked and, I’ll admit, I did almost cry near the end. However this film is peppered with extremely cliché and honestly annoying lines and interactions. From the very beginning, Tessa is introduced as a stereotypical film version of a teenage girl. She rolls up with her friends screaming and giggling about how excited they are to party and be crazy. The whole interaction is cheesy and unnecessary and sets her up to look like a bimbo. After that, her boyfriend, who looks suspiciously similar to the Hemsworth brothers, comes to save the day and the rude, inappropriate and just plain stupid things he says to Tessa’s father drove me insane. There are several lines in the film that prompted me to say to myself, “Really? Was that really necessary?” The last irritating thing is the fact that they really drove the whole “American Way” and patriotism to the ground. In every seen at Cade’s ranch there are at least two American flags shown and it is constantly mentioned that they’re just good ole’ Texas folk, protecting America with cries of: “Don’t mess with our country!” “Think of your country!” “Fight for your country!” Previous films were less centered on our nation and more about the human race as a whole.Despite my qualms regarding this movie, it is entertaining and the visuals are extremely well done. I give it 4 out of 5 stars and recommend this film for ages 13 to 18 due to the violence and language. However, if you have seen the previous films and are under 13, then this film should be suitable for you. If you're a fan of Transformers, action or just want to experience the first film to ever use the million dollar IMAX Digital 3D camera, be sure to check out Transformer: Age of Extinction in theaters now.Reviewed by Raven D, KIDS FIRST! Film Critic. For more youth reviews, go to kidsfirst dot org.

How to Train Your Dragon 2 is an awesome animation! It is adventurous, funny, and suspenseful. The producer (Bonnie Arnold) does a great job keeping everyone on the edge of their seats throughout the whole film.How to Train Your Dragon 2 is an incredible sequel to the first movie.  It is a 3D animation about a boy named Hiccup (Jay Baruchel) and his dragon, Toothless (Randy Thom), who are trying to stop a bad Viking named Drago (Djimon Hounsou) from capturing all the dragons and making an army out of them. Hiccup and his friends must work together in a battle to protect the peace.This movie has you feeling many different emotions throughout the film.  It is suspenseful, funny and even a little bit sad.  The amount of thrilling scenes in this film is incredible.  I kept wondering if Hiccup and his friends were going to get caught when they went on all their adventures.  How to Train Your Dragon 2 is also very funny.  All the characters and the dragons have a good sense of humor.  The characters scripts are hilarious and the dragons have very comical body language.  The animation in this film is also amazing. The 3D animators do a great job with the special effects.  The dragons look like they are popping out right in front of you! My favorite part of the movie is when the two alpha dragons fight with each other.  I like it because the special effects make it look like it is happening right in front of me.  Like I could reach out and touch them!How to Train Your Dragon 2 has a great message.  It shares with us that you have to believe in yourself if you want to accomplish big goals or dreams.  This message is used a couple times with a couple different characters throughout the film.I give this movie 5 out of 5 stars because it is suspenseful and funny.  Kids and adults will love it, especially those who love fantasies with dragons and Vikings.  I recommend How to Train Your Dragon 2 for children ages 8 and up. This is a movie the whole family can enjoy.Reviewed by Jeremy B., KIDS FIRST! Film Critic. For more reviews go to kidsfirst dot org.

Never have I seen a movie so heart wrenching as this one. The Fault In Our Stars is an exceptional movie that will have you crying, laughing and anxious all at the same time. It is based on the amazing novel written by John Green. In this movie, Shailene Woodley plays Hazel Grace, a girl diagnosed with stage four lung cancer. Ansel Elgort plays Gus Waters who is diagnosed with cancer as well. They fell in love with each other the way we fall asleep, slowly and then all at once. Their journey goes from meeting their favorite author in Amsterdam to rushing to the hospital for immediate chemotherapy.  This movie shows the hardships of being in love and fighting for your life in such a beautiful but realistic manner. I absolutely love this film.There are so many great aspects about this movie that it’s hard to highlight a few. However, one of my favorite things is the whole plot and its meaning. It creatively captures a teenager’s perspective of love but also of dealing with cancer. It reaches out to a younger audience but still allows an older audience to enjoy it.  John Green knows how to grab the audience's attention by intertwining the two most heart-wrenching aspects of life - love and death. Another thing I really love about the movie is how well it depicts the book it is based on. I read the book a few months ago and I loved how the director put in just enough of the details to keep its authenticity. I didn’t feel like there was anything missing. Overall, this movie is extremely great and I want everyone to enjoy it as I did.My favorite character is Hazel Grace Lancaster. Hazel is witty and smart but also strong and understands things. She teaches Gus a lot about books and how not to be afraid of oblivion. Hazel knows she’s going to die but she accepts that and she wants her parents to accept that too. I think a lot of teens going through love or even pain can relate to Hazel Grace.My favorite scene is when Hazel, Gus and Isaac go to Isaac’s ex-girlfriend’s house. Isaac’s ex-girlfriend, Monica, dumped Isaac because he was going to have eye surgery which would leave him blind. Right before the surgery, Monica dumped Isaac and never even asked if he was okay. Hazel, Gus and Isaac want revenge so they go to egg her house. This part is so funny because Isaac is blind and he can’t see where he’s throwing the eggs. This struck me as so funny because he’s throwing the eggs in the bushes and at the trees but Hazel and Gus try to keep his spirit up by giving him encouragement. It is just a funny scene.I recommend this movie for ages 12 to 18 because it is a lot to comprehend and some of the information about death may be too much for young children. I am 14 and have never cried so much in two hours. This is an amazing movie and I give it 5 out of 5 stars. This is a great movie for teens to go out and watch with friends. It comes out this weekend so make sure you get to watch this movie, you won’t regret it!Reviewed by Jailene A., KIDS FIRST! Film Critic. For more film reviews, go to kidsfirst dot org.

The movie Sophia Grace & Rosie’s Royal Adventure reminds me of a Cinderella fairy tale.  There are two bratty sisters and a very innocent one named Abigail.  It is similar to the Cinderella story because Abigail has two girls looking out for her as if they are her fairy godmothers. This movie is definitely an exciting royal adventure.The story begins when Sophia Grace and Rosie are sent on a special assignment to meet the princesses of Switzelvania to see which one will be crowned Queen.  However, they loose their guardian and become mistaken as the King’s great grand nieces.  They end up having to teach the King’s daughter, Princess Abigail, the ways of being a real princess.  In the process, they get thrown into a dungeon because the bratty princesses (Abigail’s sisters) don’t want her to become Queen.  However, at least they have their secret weapon.  To find out what that is, you will have to watch the movie.  In the end, everyone gets what they deserve!My favorite part is when the security guard tells the guardian, Phyllis Bunt (Amy Louise Wilson) that she can get out of jail if she reveals her true identity.  She gives a made up name of Dynasty Composition knowing no one believes her real identity anyway.  However, the security guard lies and won't let her out.  Phyllis then jumps the security guard, ties her up and duck tapes her mouth.  I didn’t see that coming!  It is hysterical.All the characters are great, especially Princess Cordilla (Emma Pierson) one of the princesses who makes fun of Abigail.  She has a funny voice and isn’t very smart and plays the part well. The main idea of this movie is that if you believe in yourself, you can make anything happen.I recommend this movie for kids ages 5 through 12.  Specifically, girls will enjoy this movie, as every girl wants to imagine herself as a princess at some point. Therefore, I rate this movie a four out of five “dazzling” stars!  Sophia Grace & Rosie’s Royal Adventure is available now on DVD.Reviewed by Haley P. KIDS FIRST! Film Critic.  For more reviews go to kidsfirst dot org.

SlugTerra: Ghoul From Beyond is an entertaining, action-packed animated film. This movie brings a new face to the slug. Instead of being creepy crawlers, they are warriors that can save the world. This makes the movie even more humorous to watch because these cute creatures are nothing like the slugs we find on earth.Eli and the “Shane Gang” has defeated the evil Doctor Black from corrupting all of the slugs in SlugTerra but evil still runs rampant in the 99 caverns. For a short time Eli and the gang are able to stop the villains from doing any real damage, but nothing can prepare them for what they encounter: a Slug that can do something no one in SlugTerra has ever seen or heard. The gang must find a way to help win the battle against a great evil. Eli on the other hand must engage in a very different type of duel to save the slugs, his friends and himself.This movie is perfect for the SlugTerra fan. There is more action and humor than ever before. I love how each slug has a unique power that helps them in combat. For example, Hoverbug has the power to fly, while Frost Crawler can protect itself by forming a sheet of ice around itself. Some slugs have “safe” powers like Boon Doc who can heal both humans and slugs. Other slugs can be harmful like Tazerling who zaps his opponents. My favorite character is a slug named Burpy because even though he is small he is a huge help in the battle.Sam Vincent does a great job driving the story as his character Eli Shane. Lee Tockar adds amazing humor to the movie as his character, Pronto aka “Pronto the Magnificent.” The message of this movie of this movie is "don’t lose hope, always keep trying."There are many things that come to mind when I think of this movie. The eye-popping animation is one of them. When the slugs are launched into the air, it looks as if they are coming right at you!SlugTerra is best for boys ages 8 to 11 and I give it four out of five dazzling stars. SlugTerra: Ghoul from Beyond is available online and comes to stores June 10th so to check it out.Reviewed by Simone S., KIDS FIRST! Film Critic. For more film reviews go to kidsfirst dot org.

X-traordinarily perfect! I’ve been waiting for this movie for a while and what a payoff.The future, as we know it, is a wasteland for mutants: hunted and eliminated by the Sentinels. To stop this from ever happening, Logan/Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) is sent into the past to prevent this dark outcome.I adore the X-Men series and to see it again is beyond fantastic. Bringing back the original iconic actors such as Sir Patrick Stewart (Professor X) and Sir Ian McKellen (Magneto) makes me overjoyed! Even the younger versions of them - Micheal Fassbender and James McAvory are their own 3-dimensional characters because they’re not trying to be replicas of their older selves. Their interaction and relationships are strong and, just as in “X-Men First Class,” I love seeing Eric and Xavier just talking. These two started as friends and the film shows that perfectly. They have different pathways and ways to fix events but they never give up on each other.The action and special effects in this film are grand. Showing different mutant powers is what made X-Men unique to begin with. It’s not entirely combat action, like “Avengers,” it’s more letting their powers do the work. Magneto slowly lifts an entire baseball stadium, which allows us to marvel at how powerful mutants can be.The story is astounding! This film has to pick-up from the previous films and tie-up loose ends. Not only do they succeed but, they also remember little details. Example: the young Wolverine doesn’t have metal claws. They’re bone because he doesn’t get the metal ones until sometime in the future. Specifics like that add to how incredible this film is.It can also confuse people who haven’t seen the other films. There are inside jokes and character connections that could be lost.My favorite character is Quicksilver (Evan Peters), a mutant who has incredible speed.This is by far the best representation of a comic-book character. Evan shows the mischievous and cocky side of Silver that is always a kick to watch.My favorite scene is Quicksilver’s super speed sequence. This is when the team breaks Eric/Magneto out of a Pentagon prison and the group is cornered by security. Quicksilver, without a care in the world, pranks the guards by poking the bullets in mid-air, pulling their guns out of their hands and more. This is such an incredible ride that it just needs to be experienced.The message of this film is, “Choices you make in the present, affect your future.” The whole reason for this story is that one careless act has changed the world forever. We need to think through the choices we make to have a bright future.I give this 5 out of 5 stars and recommend it to 13- to 18 year-olds. This film shows dark images and language that is not intended for younger audiences.Reviewed by Keefer C. B., KIDS FIRST! Film Critic. For more film reviews, go to kidsfirst dot org.

Maleficent is a remake of the Disney classic "Sleeping Beauty." I assumed that I knew what it was going to be about but, it turned out to be a totally unpredictable and amazing movie. Maleficent is about a betrayed fairy (Angelina Jolie) that curses the king's infant daughter Aurora as revenge. She soon discovers that when Aurora grows up, she is the only one who can restore the peace and happiness that everyone needs to get them out of the depression caused by revenge and war. This movie takes "Sleeping Beauty" and turns it into a completely different movie.By far, this is the best Disney movie I've seen and one of the best movies I’ve seen in a while. Everything is just right. For example, the music sets the right mood in every scene. It is strong and loud when it needs to be and quite and shy at other times and, at certain points, it is playful and happy. It really pulls the whole movie together. Along with the jaw-dropping music, this movie has amazing actors starting with Angelina Jolie and Elle Fanning (Auora). They fit each role perfectly almost as if they were born for these roles.This movie is very interesting to watch because it isn’t entirely based on "Sleeping Beauty" so you get to see a completely different side of Maleficent before she becomes the villain that she is known as. Throughout the movie I found myself wanting the movie to go quicker to see what would happen next but not wanting it to end anytime soon. I think that the director Robert Stromberg and the writers Linda Woolverton and Charles Perrault really outdo themselves with this movie because I cannot stop obsessing about how great it is.I give this movie 5 out of 5 perfect stars and recommend it for ages 9 to 18. To be honest, this movie is a movie that you should be sure not to miss because IT IS THAT GOOD!Reviewed by Samantha A., KIDS FIRST! Film Critic. For more reviews go to kidsfirst dot org.

I was pleasantly surprised by this original and great story. Son of Batman is a great, action-packed animation many people will enjoy.This film has a lot of elements to admire - thrilling Batman-class fighting that kept me excited and at the edge of my seat. There is also some romance between Batman and his 'special person' which is short, but nice and I thought it fit well.The story starts when a training camp is destroyed. A young boy escapes with his mom and flees to Batman who, as it turns out, is the boy's father. For his safety, Batman takes the child and, as Batman, tries to protect and train him. Batman teaches his kid to take criminals alive but, a new mystery arises - one that will have a significant impact on the story line. We join Batman, Robin, and Batman's son as they face off deadly people while Batman makes sure his kid doesn't hurt himself. It's a fun and action adventure that all Batman fans will appreciate!Overall, I think this movie had some ups and downs. The animation is rather interesting but, I thought it was a bit too much at times. It is gory at times, yet plastic and 2D like most superhero animations. I believe that the animators could have cut down a bit on the violence and mature content. Also, the animation of the faces looks a bit fake to me. The directing is interesting. I thought that the angles were good and fit the storyline quite well. The voice-overs are excellent.  For example, Jason O Marra who is the voice of Batman, doesn't show much emotion and talks in a quiet and dark whisper - perfect for the character. The plot is original and surprising, which I am fond of. For the most part, Son of Batman turns out to be a very unexpected and surprising adventure.My favorite scene is the first scene iwhen the academy is destroyed. Even though this is a sad moment, it sets the tone for the entire movie. I love scenes that may not seem important but have a big impact on the rest of the film.This movie has lots of adult lines and a lot of gory scenes, so I recommend for ages 11 to18. I also give it 4 out of 5 stars because of some hiccups with the animation.

This movie is about Shaggy and Scooby winning a trip to WWE city to see WrestleMania.  The gang runs into trouble when Scooby is accused of stealing the WWE championship belt. Some of their new friends must prove Scooby’s innocence before it’s too late and the mysterious Ghost bear ruins the main event.  Daphne (Grey DeLisle) is my favorite character because she is in love with John Cena and it reminds of me of myself when I have a big crush on a celebrity.  I love when she confesses to Fred that she gave John her phone number, cellular number, email address and home address.  That is pretty funny and cute and - Fred gets jealous. Scooby (Frank Welker) is my second favorite character because I love his voice and he is a better fighter than Shaggy because his moves are so swift and smooth.I enjoyed the wrestling scenes in this movie, especially when Scooby is dreaming of being in a video game and he is up against a slice of a pizza, two delicious hotdogs and a huge cup of soda. My favorite scene is Scooby playing the bonus level of the video game by doing Sin Cara’s victory dance because Scooby has some nice dance moves.  I is really cool to see WWE city animated because you get to experience what it is like to be a wrestler and what it is like to see a fight in the stadium. The upbeat music allows the audience to feel the excitement of the opponents. My least favorite part is the beginning because it takes forever to get to the plot and I is confusing for the first 30 minutes of the film.The moral of the film is to not allow one’s anger to turn into revenge.  It’s okay to be angry. It is not okay to act on the anger and make bad decisions.  Parents should be aware that there are fighting scenes and a Ghost bear before allowing small children to view this movie.  I recommend this movie for ages nine year to 18 years. I give this movie 3 out of 5 stars.

Poppy Cat Birthday Treasure and Other Adventures is an exciting, funny, and adventurous series of animated films for preschoolers. They are based on the best-selling books by Lara Jones. They have a lot of bright colors and friendly characters throughout the film which will keep kids entertained for a long time.This DVD is a collection of seven animated films. In the main episode, Poppy Cat is celebrating her birthday. She receives a lot of presents from her friends including a treasure map. Poppy and her friends journey to the Mystery Jungle to find the treasure.Each episode on this DVD takes you on a different adventure and they all are really cute. The characters are friendly and treat each other nicely, which is good for preschoolers to see.  Each episode only lasts for eleven minutes so it is a good length for young children whose attention span is pretty short. The episodes are full of bright colors that are very appealing and I think young children will really like. The music is very pleasant too. My favorite episode is “Marshmallow Mines” because one of my favorite characters, Rocket Cat, is in it. Rocket Cat is brave and thankful throughout the episode, which I really appreciate and I know parents will too. Another great thing about this DVD is that it made my imagination fly. I immediately wanted to create boots that had magnets in them so that I could walk on walls, just like Rocket Cat.What I like best about Poppy Cat Birthday Treasure and Other Adventures is that each episode teaches an important lesson about friendship and teamwork. At the end of each segment, Poppy Cat’s owner explains the message and gives examples.I give this DVD 5 out of 5 stars because it is educational, adventurous and funny. I recommend it for kids ages 2 to 5, especially for kids who like animals, music and bright colors.  I think young kids will really enjoy the friendly and silly characters.Reviewed by Jeremy B, KIDS FIRST! Film Critic
perfect and cheap. why  pay more when you can get it for this price? Will order again. When this runs out.

I'm so glad that amazon carries this because it is perfect for our outdoor teak furniture. Makes it look new again and protects the wood. The furniture was an investment so I like to take care of it. I put this stuff on about 3 or 4 times throughout the summer.
I just got these last week and like them. They are a bit big but I washed them and that helped.

This is a breathtaking masterpiece of art that allows your mind and heart to soar like the wind .The story is loosely based on the real life story of Jiro Horikoshi (Joseph Gordon- Levitt). He dreams of flying but, because he's nearsighted, decides to be a Japanese airplane designer. We observe his life from child to adulthood as he makes his dream plane and, in the process, falls in love with Naoko (Emily Blunt). Will Jiro create the beautiful plane or realize that the beauty he's seeking is right in front of him all along?The film is a work of art. Hayao Miyazaki (Director and Writer) creates unique color palettes and designs. Since the movie takes place in the sky, the animators go above and beyond to hand draw backgrounds and movements for the planes. We witness them majestically soaring through the skies and you feel as if you're with them. The voice acting is well done. I think they portrayed the characters and their relationships exceptionally well. Much of the film focuses on the romance between Naoko and Jiro. Their connection is both loving and tragic. The film was first released in Japan, so American voice-overs are dubbed over the animation and yes, it can be distracting. They confront actual events that happened in Japan, such as the Kanto earth-quake of 1923 and Japan entering the war. I love the truth in this film.
