Not only will it securely hold a child from close to infancy through toddlerhood (is that a word?), it does so very comfortably.  Sitting on shoulders with two straps, stirrups for the child's feet, even legs that can be opened to provide a secure base to set the child down.The carrier is well padded, with heavy plastic adjustments which look pretty solid.  There are a number of handles to hold it, with and without a child in it and a lot of storage, particularly on the bottom of the carrier.  It is not a toy...this is a serious piece of equipment and it feels like it could survive years of use and abuse. There are many straps, each of which require some adjustment to fit the child.  Fortunately, the carrier comes with a very useful thumb drive with videos to show how it works.  It isn't hard to adjust at all and the makers have thought of everything. There's even a canopy that can be erected above the child's head to keep sun (or light rain) off.The only drawback is that the carrier is bulky and, though light for what it does (I saw 10 pounds online), its a solid weight.  It takes up a large footprint and is probably too large for daily use (unless you were really opposed to using a stroller).  I believe you could go for long hikes and walks, backpacking with this carrier and it would be admirably suitable, but those are likely to be its only uses.  If you are considering this as a way to get on the roads with the youngster, this is an excellent product.  If you are looking for a simple way to take trips to the mall or shopping, this is likely overkill.I like the product, I recommend it for hiking and long walks, but it will probably be too much for many other uses.

I ordered the watch from Amazon as a gift for my wife.  It doesn't look fantastic in the pictures but the watch really is lovely and she opened it when I was in another room.  I heard the exclamation ("Oh!  So pretty!") and ran in.  Sure enough, she loved it.  The face and diamonds set each other off very nicely, the band is a lovely colored leather and all in all its a great bargain for the price.The real test of a watch happens over time...whether it stands up over time to the punishment that watches get everyday day in and day out is the true testament.  But as far as I can tell, the watch seems rugged enough for everyday use and pretty enough for even dressed up events.All in all, very satisfied with purchase.  Will update in 6 months to see how its holding up!

In reviewing food for my dog, I have a couple of criteria: ingredients used, appreciation by my dog, price and overall presentation of the product.The food is made by Hill’s, which has been making dog food since 1939.  That’s a long time…their other brands include Science Diet, Ideal Balance (of which this is a product), Prescription Diet and Hill’s Healthy Advantage. They are committed to honest advertising and, I believe, in making a product that is healthy for pets.The ingredients to this particular dog food are a lot.  Roast beef is only the start of the list of premium items in the dog food: there is also Buckwheat, Peas (green and yellow), flaxseed and canola oil (for the dog’s fur coat), parsley and rosemary. There is approximately 391 kcal/cup of the food, and it is comprised of 23.2% protein, 14% fat, 52.6% carbs and 4.8% fiber.  I’ve copied and pasted the actual ingredient list at the bottom of this review if you want it.  The dog food is a little bit expensive and the package I got was gone in a couple of days (a little small but my dog kept wolfing it down)My dog loved this food.  I couldn’t keep his bowl full.  He particularly liked the meat chunks which he dug out first, but then he would finish the bowl off entirely. Ordinarily, if my dog likes a food this much, he’s going to have a bothered stomach not long after…but that did not happen here.  He was very happy with the meal.Last, not least, the dog food is kibble based but does not have a distinctive odor, which I appreciate.  Many dog foods, particularly with premium ingredients, really smell bad.  This one does not.The only drawback that I see is in price…the product is a good one, healthy and appreciated for my mutt.  But the price a is a little bit much and I will likely buy more, but may mix it with a cheaper brand to spread that cost over a longer period.Ingredients: Beef, Yellow Peas, Cracked Pearled Barley, Whole Grain Oats, Pea Protein, Chicken Liver Flavor, Chicken Fat, Egg Product, Chicken Meal, Buckwheat, Oatmeal, Powdered Cellulose, Dried Beet Pulp, Malted Barley, Brown Rice, Parsley, Canola Oil, Calcium Carbonate, Flaxseed, Choline Chloride, Green Peas, Carrots, vitamins (Vitamin E Supplement, L-Ascorbyl-2-Polyphosphate (source of vitamin C), Niacin Supplement, Thiamine Mononitrate, Vitamin A Supplement, Calcium Pantothenate, Biotin, Vitamin B12 Supplement, Pyridoxine Hydrochloride, Riboflavin Supplement, Folic Acid, Vitamin D3 Supplement), Iodized Salt, Cranberries, Potassium Chloride, Taurine, Mixed Tocopherols for freshness, minerals (Zinc Oxide, Ferrous Sulfate, Manganese Sulfate, Copper Sulfate, Calcium Iodate), Apples, Broccoli, Zucchini, Citric Acid for freshness, Beta-Carotene, Rosemary Extract.

Hot Wheels continues to innovate.  Since its founding in 1968 by Mattel, they have gone beyond the scope of simple 1:64 scale care replicas (it was apparently meant to be a competitor to Matchbox) to encompass tracks, collector editions/models and conventions for model collectors.  I'm not one of those people.  I had Hot Wheels when I was a kid, loved them dearly and have given them to my son for years. Now, it was time for my grandson!This new track system throws a curve at it.  Using a combination of a hot water and a cold water tank, the car literally changes color (dark to light green and back again!) as it moves through its track. Further, it can be set up to trigger a second car as the first car moves through its paces on the ramp (this one doesn't change color, but it’s still a pretty slick trick to add to the toy.)  The toy can also be added to a broader track and used as an expansion set.Construction was pretty simple, even if the directions looked complex. Simply use the letters in the directions and the whole toy will go together in about 2 mins.The problem is you have to keep refilling the ‘tanks’ which drip and reheating the hot tank (not that hot…) and cooling the cool tank.  In the interim, bring a towel, its going to get wet everywhere!  Having done this in a bathtub made it simpler, but that’s about the only place that the toy makes a lot of sense. The second time my grandson asked to play with it, the only answer was to wait until bath time. Come bath time, we kind of forgot about it.Don’t get me wrong, Hot Wheels are a lot of fun (even for a guy with grandkids) and they keep pushing the envelope for people who like them. This one is fun but messy and while my grandson liked it, I’m not sure how many plays he’ll get out of it.Recommend: If you are a collector, its pretty slick. If you are a kid, it will be fun at least the first time you play with it.  If you are an adult buying for a child, it’s a bit of work.  Its up to you to decide if its worth that bit of work.

So, Greenies has a blueberry flavored treat for dogs, and given my predilection for having my dog try new things, it sounded good.  In the case of this chew, the advertising points out that the treat is, in addition to delicious, safe, easily digestible packed with extra vitamins and minerals and (not surprising considering its shaped like a toothbrush) its supposedly good for dental hygiene..My dog is about 30 pounds and even if the vet says he's chunky, I know how much muscle is in that body.  He takes me for walks.  When he chews things (more often than I'd like) he chews them apart in seconds.  He can spend a whole 5 mins reducing a largish nylabone to nothing. He also went through these treats in about 30 seconds...but he loved them and came looking for more.The bag I got had about a dozen treats in them.  He's eaten two of them and really likes them.  As a human, I can say that the smell is pretty strong. From six inches away, you can smell the blueberry pretty easily.  Any closer and the odor is overpowering.  Having said that, dog's breathe afterward definitely was more pleasant than usual.All in all, a worth treat to try...I may buy more once I'm satisfied the product won't do anything to his stomach.

Tonight I had a delicious meal, using McCormick's Sicilian Chicken skillet sauce.  It was a simple dish, prepared quickly...simply cook the chicken, brown the vegetables, add the sauce. The result was delicious with a wholehearted flavor that's Sicilian to its heart. All in all, it was 10 mins of cooking and three of us ate well.  The flavors, basil and garlic, popped nicely and there's a little heat to the flavor.  In short, its everything I love in cooking and its made simpler than I usually can make it.  As you can tell from the pictures, I had it with some thick garlic bread and ravioli.A winner...one that's earned its way back into my cabinet. If you are considering, I recommend highly.  You won't be disappointed.  Unless you started out that way, in which case, you'll be full and maybe not so disappointed.So you're aware, the sauce contains 30 calories (count 'em!), none of which are from fat.  That's good.  There's also 400 gm of salt, not so good. The ingredients are crushed and diced tomato, vinegar, garlic, corn starch, salt, spices (paprika and basil), olive oil and some acids.

My DII rug finally arrived after two weeks of waiting.  The rug itself is the size of a doormat (a little smaller than I expected) and is lush, comfortable under bare feet and pretty. I was originally thinking of this for my foyer but moved it to my bathroom where its been put through the wringer.  Wet, dry, the rug remains secure to the floor, colors haven't run and it remains a comfortable addition to my décor.I saw other reviews in which people pointed out that there were sharps in the material but I did not experience this problem at all. All in all, happy with my rug.  If you are seeking a rug for a hallway, foyer or bathroom, this is a solid one.  But the size is actually doormat, so keep that in mind when purchasing.

Gaming is becoming an immersive technology, one which will involve a lot more than hand eye coordination.  It makes sense that, with the advent of games on handhelds, cellular phones and tablet computers, games on dedicated gaming machines and personal computers would have to evolve...they simply can't compete easily.  Further, those machines had the memory, hardware and throughput capabilities to allow for gaming to expand.When I speak of expansion, I'm pointing to more than simply graphics upgrades.Sounds, music, touch response and the ability to change settings to suit taste have made games on dedicated systems, like the Playstation, so much more than they used to be.  No one is going to confuse Madden 2014 with the actual experience of trotting out onto a football field in your pads and cleats...but games weren't ever meant to be that.  Computer games are their own animal...and the experience has been improving for years.  Madden may not have anything to do with football as played on a field, but its a lot of fun all by itself.Today, I reviewed the sound upgrades that have been coming about to extend that level of expansion to PlayStation in the form of the Turtle Beach Headset.  You do not have to use these headphones for PS alone.  They can function as simple headphones on their own, but the sound levels (and ability to speak into the microphone) do a nice job of extending the experience of a PS game to another level. They also work well in plugging into a cellular phone.The plug is worth talking about..in PS' case, it plugs into the handset.  I'd love it if it was Wifi/Blue tooth compatible, but that would mean batteries, charging and (possibly) reduced capabilities.  As it is, its very good and does a great job of letting you hear and communicate.  It could be a little longer (approx. 36").Pros:- Good sound- The response is solid enough that I don't need it to be wireless.  Its worth using the wire.- Comfortable for relatively short periods- The inline amplifier works well, is intuitive.- My son can still hear me when I call him and he is gaming with this headset on. (BIG plus!)Cons- While comfortable for short periods, I watch a movie with them on and, honestly, I was squirming a bit near the end. Part of it was sizing, part was warmth-retention.  I have a large head, your own experience may be better.- A little weighty, a little bulky.  Not  a big deal...just a little bit. You will not mistake these for earbuds.- The cord is a little short...this is the only real reason I took one star off.  It hasn't been a problem, I can extend it using an extension cord but should I have to?- The sound when you are wearing them is very good, but it leaks out.  People in the room will hear what you are listening to.All in, very serviceable headset, with really solid sound and performance.  If you are considering a headset for gaming (PS), a cell phone or ipod, this is an excellent choice.

Today I got a massive grin out of my 5 year old grandson.  I gave him Fisher-Price's Transforming Bat- Bot and he played with it for a solid 8 hours today.Don't be surprised...this is Batman (not necessarily apparent from the name)climbing into a transforming tank.  Its remote controlled and the 'Bot' is basically a tank that can stand up.  It also fires (very light pressure) disks at targets, usually falling short of whatever the child will aim at, but still a lot of fun (the amazing thing about the dancing bear isn't how well it dances).  Sound effects, voices, lights and, of course, Batman, make this a toy that kinds (probably boys mostly) will love.  I know my grandson wouldn't go to dinner without Batman.  My son, who is 13, was playing with both grandson and BatBot and now he wants to watch the batman movies.The product came fully setup and ready to roll.  I had to put some batteries into the remote but not the Bot. Its sturdy enough to handle the abuse my grandson is inflicting on it without a problem...Mine also came with the Joker Laff Factory (doing the name from memory).  I'm not sure if that's standard or not, so I will review that separately...All in, very much a win!

I obtained these reeds for my son, who plays clarinet.  He prefers 3 strength reeds (although I didn't know that when I ordered them).  He put the reed on, and it played beautifully.  The sounds was crisp, solid and right on tone.  My son also commented that these are the best reeds he's ever played on and he's thrill with the box.In looking at the reeds, they are well done.  Consistently good, there is nothing to complain about and only to commend.  The good news is that he loves the reeds.  The bad news is that with better reeds, he will likely accept nothing but the good reeds (expensive) again.If you are a clarinet player (or responsible for some who is), these are exceptional reeds!

Review; Belkin Car Charge MountToday I installed my new Belkin Cellphone mount in my car.  The devide (Belkin Car Charge and Navigation Mount for Iphone)plugs into your car lighter (remember when they were actually used to light cigarettes?) and hold your cellphone in place where it can (theoretically) be safely view while driving.The notion of a mounted cellphone seems like a pain when considered but for people that do not have GPS or need to have handsfree access to a cellphone while driving, this is a pretty solid performer. The neck of the device is long enough that your lighter distance in the car shouldn't matter much.  That neck is also stiff enough that it is not going to flop over on turns (or at all).The clamp mechanism is solid, but removing the phone takes two hands (so does putting the phone on).  When it is in place, it can be adjusted to need and is clearly and easily sighted from the driver's side.  It will work well.  Likewise, the plug has a retaining ring on its exterior to hold it tightly within the plug.As a charger, it is also good.  The charging plug is on a flexible bar so you can easily bend the plug forward to mate with the phone.  The charger works immediately and without the annoying warning that the plug is not Microsoft approved (and may not work).All in all, a very good product, one I plan to use daily!
I'm not a small guy.  I order in my size but it is way too big to wear

Today I had a chance to put the Epson Workforce WF-7620 All in One through its pacs.  Its an admirable piece of engineering, delivering excellent performance, crisp images, fast copying.  Scanning was a little slow, but I did have it set on 1200 DPI (dots per inch) to see what it can really do.First, it prints quickly, with crisp clean lines, solid gradients and strong colors.  Its possible that the colors may fade as ink is used (its new ink in the cartiridges) but the cartridges are standard and easily replacedThe scanner is responsive...but you need to use Epson Scan to bring the scanned images over to your computer.  I tried to make the printer recognize the computer but couldn't find my way through it to the right place in the menu functions on the printer screen.  It doesn't matter, Epson Scan does what its supposed to...and the image was pretty and with a little sweetening using Picasa, it was actually improved over the original.I did not check the fax...though I have no doubt that it functions fine. I just don't have use for a fax!When I unboxed the printer, I was pretty amazed at the size of it.  This is not a home unit, though most homes would be fine using it.  The box is large (aren't they all?) but the printer is really large!  I had to look inside, the box was like a Tardis, the printer felt bigger than the box it came in!  Setup was pretty simple, though my mother started using it and had to call Epson.  MJuch like their product, they were responsive, helpful and a pleasure.All in all, very good printer.  This will work well, will not cost a fortune to either maintain or replace ink and I expect it to be the household workhorse for years to come.  High recommend!

This is the third Philips Sonicare toothbrush that I've gotten.  I bought one for myself, loved it, bought another for my wife.  She also loves it. Its been around 5 years since I switched and cannot ever foresee going back to a manual one.  In fact, during the few travelling trips where I've either forgotten or left my Philips behind and had to buy a manual toothbrush, I hated the experience.This toothbrush was for my son, and its almost the same one that I have and use every day (you can probably find my earlier review around Amazon somewhere).  All in, its terrific.  About the only negative is that this toothbrush goes on for 2 mins, then shuts off.  My version of it pauses every 30 seconds to signal you to switch quandrants (upper left, upper right, lower left, lower right).  But that's a minor quibble...the toothbrush works very well.Worth noting is that the heads on these should be switched out every couple of months.  I've discovered that a number of drugstores carry 'generic' heads for them that are much cheaper and work just as well.Last, not least, my cat likes the toothbrush too or at least the taste of the toothpaste on the body of the brush...I'm thankful that the head is covered by a clear plastic cover or I'd be swapping spit with my feline!If you care considering, this is a strong recommend.

The following review is based upon my observations and those of the female who will be using this.This organizer is designed for cosmetics, to organize and group them.  Its sturdy (a heavy plastic), has two drawers as well as 'containers' on top to hold eyelines, lipsticks and other cosmetic applicators and appliances.  The design of the top of the unit allows for items to sit comfortably, even as I move the organizer around but I would not stack items on it.All in, it is likely not big enough to handle everything a person may own...but it will hold all of your most common items (if you have more common items than you can fit in this organizer, you should redefine what you mean by common items).  The drawers have a little give to them, but that is not a bad thing.  There may be contracting or swelling as temperature changes happen and the little bit of slop in the drawers will probably help a lot more than they will ever hurt.My only concern is whether the organizer, which is translucent, will collect powders and cosmetic gunk over time.  There's no way to tell that now, but the design of the unit should give sufficient access to its surfaces and corners to make it relatively easy to clean.All in, a win!

Today, I got my new iPhone case from Case Logix.  Its attractive, appears to be well constructed and fits snug and secure to the back of my iPhone.  The profile of the cast is slim and tight to the phone, not adding any substantial bulk to it.The back appears to be made of a textured cloth. This is attractive and a nice touch.  I'm hopeful that it will not give me the problems that come with cloth for items such as this, where the cloth catches, pulls out, stains.  I will update my review should this occur.  As of today (06-30-2011) it is a five star review but that may change depending on mileage...some of these cases have a tendency to look great on a shelf or a phone after a couple of days but do not wear well.  Stay tuned on this.Case Logix, in case you are not familiar is a Boulder, CO based company that started with audiocassette cases and have now grown to provide cases for many different items, mostly portable technology based products and support.  You can find their website at caselogic.com

I'm in love with the comfort of Skechers GoWalk shoes, but I frequently get comments on how odd-looking/ugly they are and I wanted a pair that looked a bit nicer for pairing with shorts, cutoffs, and skirts for the summer. I was pleasantly surprised with these shoes - they were even comfier than my GoWalks, which I didn't think was possible! They stay comfortable even when I have to spend a few hours on my feet at a time. Plus, unlike my GoWalks, I get compliments on how cute they are all the time!Please note that these shoes run large. I wear a size 8 in all my other shoes (Skechers included), but I saw several reviews advising that customers order a 1/2 size down. I ordered a 7.5 and they fit exactly the same as my size 8 GoWalks. Glad I read the reviews first! As for width, my feet are slightly wider than average, and they fit perfectly in that regard.I noticed the foam inserts in these shoes aren't sewn in like on the GoWalks... does anyone know if the inserts are replaceable once the memory foam wears out?

Our cats were running low on their generic stuff, and I happened to see this at the pet store and bought it. My cat Ringo, an older cat, woke me up in the middle of the night running around the house. I got up and he had pulled out all sorts of toys from his toy box that he hadn't played with in years, and was eagerly rolling around and playing with them all. I asked my husband what had gotten into him and he said he'd given him some of that "zoom stuff" a few minutes prior. We've never gotten a reaction like this with catnip, not even with the organic stuff we sometimes get from the Farmer's Market - Ringo was more active and playful than we'd seen him in awhile!This morning, he managed to find the Zoom bag and was licking the outside of the plastic, trying to get at the nip inside. We'll definitely be getting him this brand from now on. He loves this stuff! Usually he'll lick up catnip and lounge around rubbing his face on things, but this stuff gives him a ton of playful, happy energy.

I've never felt compelled to review tampons before, but then again, I've never had a preferred tampon brand until now, and these Tampax Radiant tampons are just too awesome for me not to rave about.I grabbed a huge box of these at random two periods ago because they were on sale, but they are now my absolute favorite. I don't like using tampons without applicators. I've used tampons with cardboard applicators in the past, and I just can't get them to work well - the tube-shaped design is not only painful to insert, but the lower "plunger" half doesn't always slide into the rest of the tubing smoothly, ending up stuck and unusable unless I take the tampon out from the applicator and insert it by hand, therefore defeating the purpose of an applicator. Yeah, not my idea of a good time.These tampon applicators have a smooth, thin shape that inserts and depresses easily. My favorite part is the packaging - the seals are a sticker, making them both easy to open and resealable, so you can insert your used applicator inside and seal it up before you throw it away. Less grossness to impose on public restroom custodians! And as someone who was a custodian throughout high school to save up for college, I know how gross dumping those sanitary napkin cans in public restrooms can be.The packaging is also very silent, so you don't sound like you're ripping open a bag of potato chips in the bathroom stall. I figured this might be a good feature for some people. Personally, it doesn't bother me unless I'm in a unisex restroom. If I'm in a women's restroom, no one in there is going to give a crap (ha!) about being able to hear you open a tampon wrapper.

I bought one of these ACcase covers in brown. It was lightweight, thin, and a very lovely color, but the one I received was poorly constructed; the front cover was wobbly (wriggled up and down when closed, despite the magnets) and, when closed, left a slight gap on the top and bottom through which I could see the light from the Voyage - meaning it wasn't being put to sleep. Auto wake also only worked 2 times out of 10 tries. I mainly wanted a case for the auto sleep/wake function, so this wasn't something I could overlook. I sent it back (thankfully Amazon returns are painless) and replaced it with an OMOTON case in black. They didn't have the same deep brown color that I liked so much about the ACcase, but the Kindle Voyage snapped into the OMOTION case perfectly, construction feels sturdier than the ACcase, and the auto sleep/wake function works perfectly.

When I first used the vacuum, it was to pick up pine needles and very small pebbles off the floor mats of my car. It seemed to work quite well and I was pleased with my purchase, but when it came time to pick up dirt and dust, I realized what the other reviewers were complaining about. The exhaust is pointed directly at the user's face, so all the air being sucked in is blown back at you. Not a big deal when it's just air. However, dirt and dust pass straight through the filter and out through the exhaust - right into your face/eyes. What doesn't hit you in the face ends up being blown around the car.I can't recommend this product.

I do like these headphones. I'm a side sleeper, and they're 100% correct when they say these are the most comfortable headphones ever.However, these do not block out ambient noise in the slightest. I purchased these because my husband snores and it keeps me awake. You can hear everything that goes on around you with these on, even with music cranked up fairly loudly (which completely negates its purpose as a sleep aid). The bands are also pretty large. I have a big head, and even though my head size said I should get a large, I got a medium, which still doesn't fit super snugly and can easily slide around.The earbuds will not stay positioned over my ears unless I pull the band down over my eyes, so I won't be able to use these while running/walking, just sleeping.There is no "sound leakage" to disturb other sleepers if you keep the volume on low/medium.

I had an older soft chest that looked just like this for groceries in the back of my car that I gave to my sister, so I bought this one to replace it. It's a great size and will fit in the back of most hatchbacks (my car is a subcompact and this fits in the back with plenty of room to spare). Each square can hold two gallons of milk or a few shopping bags. I use mine for groceries since I live in a hilly area and groceries tend to roll around in the back of my car; one messy milk accident was enough for me to vow to never just set bags in the back of my car again! The front pockets I use to hold small tools or maps I want to keep in my car.Please be aware that this is intended for HOLDING groceries or storing car tools/accessories - if you are using it to store items heavier than a gallon of milk, do NOT use the chest to CARRY items around or the bottom will rip. I know the handles are a bit deceiving in that area. If you are just carrying around paper towels or other lightweight items, you will be fine.I am removing one star because this is the only soft storage chest I've ever owned that did not come with rigid square pieces on either side of the middle insert that fold down to cover the bottom of the chest upon opening (to keep the chest from collapsing in on itself when empty). Not only does this mean that the chest is always in a state of half-collapse when not filled, it also means you can't carry items around in it (as I stated above) as I could with my older soft chest.

I dislike plain sparkling water and flavored waters, so I was very surprised at how much I enjoyed Sparkling Ice. I decided to give it a try because I was incredibly thirsty while shopping at Winco one day and these were only $0.89 a bottle, so I thought I'd give them a shot. I liked it, and my husband bought me a variety pack at Costco a few days later and I fell in love, especially with the Strawberry Watermelon (another surprise, since I don't like watermelon-flavored things). I've gone around town and managed to try several flavors (since most stores carry only a few), and while not all of them "wowed" me, I haven't had one yet that I've disliked. The lemonade flavors are particularly good!Make sure you are getting a good price if you decide/need to purchase online. The most I've ever seen these sold for in stores is $1 a bottle (WalMart), so any 12-packs being sold for more than $12 is a poor price. If you can't find these in stores, go to Talking Rain's website - they have a search function to help consumers find distributors of specific products.

I bought the Pore Clearing version and was super excited to finally try some legit BB cream. The product provides decent coverage and hid my red spots, and a little goes a long way, so a tube should last you quite a while. Doesn't look dry or overly matte. Nice semi-dewy finish without being shiny or greasy.However, the product is too dark for me. I usually wear Ivory in most makeup brands and this made my face too dark. A few reviews claimed it would adjust to my skintone after a few minutes but after an entire day my face was still the same dark color. I would recommend it if your skintone is lightish-medium or you are at least 1-2 shades darker than Ivory in your normal foundation. I will hang on to the bottle until summer and see if the color suits me more after my skin tans a little.It also rubs off easily - even hours after applying and setting with powder, a ton of this came off on my phone screen while talking. Gross.

Does very well moisturizing dry skin exacerbated by winter air. I was impressed by how quickly it worked when I had been using other lotions that still hadn't done the trick after several weeks of repeated use. Originally I purchased this after hearing from a dermatologist that it would help treat my Acanthosis Nigricans (I have PCOS and AN is one of the symptoms) as well as small red bumps on my arms. While Amlactin hasn't helped get rid of either of the affected areas after two months of use, it has at least slightly approved its appearance now that the skin stays so much more hydrated than before (both conditions look much worse with dry skin).I only have two complaints about the product: if your skin is quite sensitive, the product can sting on contact and there is a burning sensation afterward for 10 - 15 minutes. Also, the lotion bleaches fabric. Wash your hands with soap afterward or you will bleach anything you touch, and make sure to let your skin dry a few moments before putting on clothing. I learned this the hard way... ruined a brand new hand towel and shirt.

These racerback style bras are more supportive than Fruit of the Loom's typical pullover sports bras. They seem to be a tad tighter than the pullovers, but they are still comfortable. I wouldn't recommend them for running, but if you are walking, doing yoga, or just lounging, they are great. Breathable, so your "girls" don't get sweaty. I highly recommend them if you need to wear a bra to bed (fellow busty girls, you know what I'm talking about *fist bump*).

I bought this item from my local hardware store yesterday morning after coming into work and realizing that some of the techs had left the warehouse door open the previous afternoon. As a result, my office was swarming with flies - a coworker and I counted, and there were over thirty swirling around. They were landing on me, walking across my computer screen as I worked... it was creepy and disgusting. I got my boss to cough up a few dollars for me to go to the store and buy something to get rid of them. This item was literally the only thing they had in the store to trap flies (which was cool with me, since I really didn't want to resort to fly tape). I followed the instructions and placed it behind the fax machine (so no one walking by my office would have to look at it).When I came into work this morning, I only saw four flies buzzing around my office. I took a peek inside the trap - YECH! It's FULL of dead flies! Looks like it was worth the money, which is great, because my boss had griped about handing over seven bucks.I've read a few other reviews here mentioning the smell, but I guess mine hasn't been out long enough to smell yet, plus I only plan on having it out long enough to catch the few remaining flies before dumping it out, cleaning it, and storing it in the cleaning closet to fight another day.

I have dry eyes that often feel gritty, itch, and water, and my doctor recommended Systane Ultra Lubricant Eye Drops High Performance  Preservative-Free Vials, 0.4mL 24-count. My local Walgreens was out of Systane, so my husband picked up Visine Totality instead, since the box made the two sound comparable.I put one drop in each eye, and my eyes immediately began to burn. I thought maybe my eyes just needed a moment to adjust, so I tried lying down with my eyes closed, but within a minute the pain intensity had increased so much that my eyelids literally could not open of their own accord. I had to hold them open with my fingers while my husband poured cool water into them. As soon as I had the drops rinsed out, the burning stopped, but I had an immense sensitivity to light for the next 12 hours.Cannot recommend this product.

I bought one of those cichlid stones at my local pet store (that way I was able to pick through them and choose a nicely-shaped one with a good-sized entryway) as a pick-me-up for my betta, Feron. It was an instant hit! He loves swimming inside and sleeping in it.Make sure to turn it when it's underwater so that the entire thing fills with water, or there will be a large pocket of air inside. You want your fish to have as much room to play/sleep inside as possible.

I have a 2.5 gallon tank housing a single betta, which was frequently overrun with algae (the filter would be coated within days) despite weekly water changes and only keeping the light on for a few hours each day. The gravel I had inside would trap in food/waste, which made the tank smell horribly. Because of this, my water changes were often 50 - 100%, which was stressing my betta. He started chewing on his own tail and wasn't as active - he refused to even chase my finger around (a game we've played since I first adopted him).I picked up three bags of this Activ Betta sand on a whim while browsing my local pet store to find him a new toy to perk him up. My tank is 2.5 gallons, and with three bags, I get an inch of even coverage. For three days, the water was slightly cloudy from the sand not fully settling, but after that, the water was crystal clear. It's been a full week, and the tank looks remarkable clean - my filter is still white (before it would turn green within a week, black if I left it in for a second week), there is no algae growing on the tank anywhere, and my betta is once again happy and active. He even blew a huge bubble nest last night, which he only does when he's very happy and relaxed (I know that sounds weird, but I've had him for a couple of years, so I know his quirks).The sand makes it very easy to clean, since now I can see any food he misses and retrieve it with a turkey baster, and it looks lovely. Feron (my betta) likes it, too; sometimes he'll swoop down and rub himself in it, then sleep on it, which he never did with the gravel (he would sleep on top of soft plants instead) so it's obviously quite soft.

My little betta "office assistant" Feron LOVES this food. I recently ran out of Bio Gold and they were temporarily out of stock at my local pet store, so I grabbed a bottle of this Aqueon pellets since I've used items from their brand in the past for "fish stuff" and liked them. My betta absolutely loves this stuff; he prefers his noms in pellet form. After initial hesitation as to the change in flavor, he was on these little pellets like white on rice.The only problem is that, before, he could take his sweet time picking at the three or four pellets I'd feed him daily. However, these pellets sink within two to three seconds of hitting the water. I have to feed them to him one at a time, and sometimes he still isn't fast enough to catch a pellet before it sinks. He'll chase it downward, but doesn't always catch them. I had to order a turkey baster so I can retrieve the sunken pellets. Until that arrives in the mail, I've borrowed a little mustachioed cory catfish from my boss's tank to supervise pellet cleanup duties (he likes these pellets too, although he has to wait for them to soften for a few minutes before he can eat them).

I don't normally purchase shoes if they're over twenty dollars. Let's face it, when it comes to fashion, I'm on a cheap side. But I've recently begun majorly amping up how much I walk each day, and I've noticed that my feet hurt after only a short twenty-minute walk while wearing any of my other active shoes. I also have issues with insoles shifting around after a few weeks and having to glue them back in place, and the fix never lasts long.I've never had Skechers before; in fact, I used to roll my eyes at the brand name ever since those shape-up shoes came out while I was in high school and were revealed to be completely ineffective a few years later. However, after reading literally hundreds of great reviews for this particular shoes, I decided that they were at least worth a shot. Honestly, I suspected that some of the reviews were probably exaggerating just how comfortable these shoes were, but the moment I slipped them on, I realized I was wrong - my feet were in heaven.Twenty to thirty minute daily walks are a breeze now, as I experience no pain in my feet whatsoever. I went for a six mile hike on a trail through our local mountains and, even after over two hours of walking, the ache in my feet wasn't a fraction as bad as I would usually experience in other shoes. The insoles also stay perfectly fixed - I believe they are sewn in place. Because of this, I don't have to worry about washing the shoes, because I know the insole won't come out! I just throw the shoes in when I'm doing a load of towels and then air-dry them on the front porch, and they look as good as new. I've never had shoes come out of the wash looking so good before!I have semi-wide feet, and the front of these shoes are quite roomy, and accommodate me perfectly without actually having to opt for the wide version. The only cons I have regarding these shoes are that 1) I've had people tell me they're ugly and look like aqua-socks. Personally, I don't care what people think of my clothing, but if you're the type of person who puts stock in what others think of your appearance, you may want to take this into consideration. 2) The nubs on the bottom are wearing out pretty quickly. For 40-60+ dollars, I'd expect shoes to last a long time, so this aspect has been disappointing. I'm fairly certain I'm going to have to replace them every few months.I ended up buying two pairs of these shoes - one for everyday wear, and one indoor pair that I use on my treadmill. I just wish all the colors were the same price instead of varying so drastically.

I typically experience some pain my palms and fingers while crocheting or knitting, and these seemed like the perfect item to aid that. I measured across my knuckles and was a perfect measurement for size Medium.When I got the gloves, they did fit very nicely in the wrist and palm area, but the finger holes came right up to the tips of my fingers! I have pretty average sized hands - my fingers aren't THAT short! As you can imagine, the fingers being so long made it impossible for craft work, plus it made it very hard for my fingers to move at all - after testing out the gloves for less than ten minutes while knitting, my fingers were cramping awfully and my pinkie fingers had both fallen asleep. The gloves ended up putting my hands in far more pain than I was experiencing beforehand.I do see a lot of positive reviews for this product, so I would say that if you've got long and slender fingers, you might find these gloves useful. If you've got more average mitts like I do and need support, perhaps find a different set of crafter's gloves that are fingerless.

I wasn't surprised by its tiny size since I took out a ruler after reading the product description, and this cauldron should work fine for burning loose incense. However, I'm not sure the one I got was new. The handle and cauldron (both inside and outside!) were covered in brown smears, and were very, VERY sticky - almost as if someone had used the cauldron for burning resin and then returned it. I have a photo of some of the brown goop inside the cauldron (the only bit I remembered to take a photo of before cleaning). The welding is sloppy, and on one side, the triple moon symbol is crooked. Still, it should work for my purposes. I've posted customer images for those who may be curious.

Our house is very small - one bedroom with a shared office. We needed all the space we could manage, so I traded in my writing desk for this floating one. While quite time consuming to put together, it looks absolutely gorgeous once installed, and has saved us quite a bit of space; we installed inside the office closet, where it fits comfortably with about 5" clearance on either side. I've always wanted a "closet desk", and the floating feature gives me plenty of leg room, as well as area to store filing cabinets and other storage bins if need be.There is a hidden shelf on the bottom in the back that faces the wall - this is where I've hidden my huge surge protector, so only a few of my many cords are visible. There's a small hole in the center bottom so that I can turn the surge protector off if the power goes out (you have to lie on your back on the floor to access it, so it's completely hidden from normal view). The upper shelf is larger than I thought - I was able to fit my Aqueon 17771 Mini Bow 2-1/2 Desktop Aquarium without it sticking out at all - my betta likes watching me work, and seems to be much happier somewhere where he can see me most of the working day!Because I was unable to find the dimensions of the middle cutout area for a computer on any sites, I was unsure my 27" iMac would fit. It ended up being a perfect fit - see my customer photo. The inner section of this area measures 27" wide and 20 1/2" tall, so if you want to be able to tuck your computer into it for more desk space, make sure it fits within these dimensions. If a 27" iMac fits, I'm pretty sure most desktops should do fine.

This is quite lovely. It's very elegant, not too big and not flashy but large enough so that the light can shine off of it. There's a nice weight to it and feels wonderful around my wrist.I like this, because I can wear either gold or silver with jewelery with it.The clasp is easy to close on my own. And it was also simple and easy to take off on my own. But, it's so much nicer (and romantic!) when these items are put on by a loved one.This came beautifully boxed. An inner black box inside of another black box. The boxes have the soft feel of the ThinkPad notebooks, that soft silky, matte kind of feeling.This would be wonderful gift. Perfect for a special lady to wear. For the price, I'm quite impressed. It looks much more expensive than the price here on Amazon.

I'm loving this Blu phone.  It's light but feels very good and sturdy in my hands.  It has a good feel to it.The buttons are easy to use - volume and power are on the right side of the phone.  Power plug is on the bottom of the phone.I'm moving from a Moto G phone and this Blu phone is lighter, thinner and has a larger screen.  The screen is nice and crisply bright. I love the larger screen without having to deal with a heavier phone.  I can easily slip this in my pocket.While setting this up, the hardest part was removing the battery cover and inserting the sim card.  I had to get my reading glasses out to figure out how to do those.  The battery cover has a slot on the bottom right hand corner which is where you can start to pry apart the battery cover from the phone.  To insert the sim, there is a small, thin metal bar which needs to be lifted loose before inserting the sim.  Yeah, sounds simple now, but while trying to figure it out, I was going a little batty.In regards to the sim cards - this is a dual sim card phone, so you can insert and use 2 sims cards at the same time.  Convenient for people who travel to other countries frequently or who may need to have 2 sim cards regularly (maybe one for work and one for personal use?).While setting up the phone, I logged in to my Google account and magically my contacts appeared and apps started to get installed.  I *think* I liked this...  Yes, it was very convenient.  But, I wasn't aware this would happen.  I probably should have been more aware as everything seems to be saved and tracked and backed up somewhere.  I guess I just need to be careful with my Google account and ID, knowing how much of my data is connected to it!The phone comes with a bunch of goodies: a headset, a USB charger and cable, a screen protector and a protective case.  These items are not super fancy, but they work well and it's great to have everything you need as soon as you have the phone.Oh, one additional item - the phone it has a notification light.  It will blink red when a text message or a voice mail arrives.  Nice feature.The battery seems to last me for well over a day.  I'm in the habit of plugging in at night, but let it go for a couple days and I still had a charge.

This drill is solid and very well made, more a contractor grade drill versus a home user or occasional user.  But, the home user will certainly welcome and love the features, too.  A puny, under powered drill just makes the job harder and makes everything take longer, whether a small, quick job or a longer weekend project.  After using this on several projects, over several days, we've come to understand this is the Cadillac of Drills.This cordless drill has AMAZING power and torque.One example of use - we used a larger drill bit and this drill made it a breeze to drill into older wood and pressure treated wood.  It was like putting a knife through soft butter.  There was no locking up of the drill and we could finish the job quickly.  This drill completely blew away any other cordless drill we've used.  Honestly, it made our hearts beat fast with excitement.  We've struggled and suffered with drilling into hard wood before, on so many projects, and this drill completely made that problem a thing of the past.This comes with two batteries, which is great as you will always have enough juice to get a job done.  The batteries have LED lights to show how much battery life is left, which is nice so you know how many bars you have before you need charging.  The batteries came with about 2 bars of charge and charged really quickly when we charged them up.  The charger has a cooling fan of some kind, maybe so it doesn't over heat during the quick charge feature?  Pretty neat.This drill has an easy to use quick release chuck and we love the ratcheting chuck.  It was easy to change drill bits and remove them when finished.The drill is weighted well so it stands up on the battery fine, no tipping over on itself.The batteries and charger are on the larger side compared to a lot of other drills we have.  The battery also makes the drill a bit on the heavy side.  On my bathroom scale, it weighs 5.4 pounds.  If you need the excellent power, quality and longer battery life, as well as faster charging, this is the drill for you.  If you prefer a lighter drill, this might be too heavy for you.Oh, one more thing - this comes in a really nice solid material carry case.  Most drills either don't come with any case or come with a soft bag.  This hard carry case makes it easy to store and transport the drill without risk of any injury to it.

Yum.  Good tasting rice and it's easy and quick to cook up.  This goes nicely with so many dishes - roasted chicken, meatloaf, spicy sauteed vegetables...While growing up, my mom made us rice mixed with a flavorful, slow cooked spaghetti sauce.  With 5 kids to feed, this was an economical and delicious meal.  And we really enjoyed it, especially in the winter. It was hearty and flavorful.  Using this rice in my mom's recipe worked out perfectly.

This is a nice apron which looks good and fits both men and women well.  It also fits a variety of sizes and heights.The material is strong but not too heavy.  I like the fun chalkboard design.It's been washed and I didn't notice any degradation of the fabric or color.  Good apron!

These are really lovely and fun!  They are so easy to use, they already come pre-folded so, just take them out and unfold them and done!  These look wonderful and make the table settings look very festive.  They come in many different colors, so there's a color to match whatever celebration we are having.

These are great stakes for use in the garden or for fun outside (or I guess, even inside?) projects.We've purchased stakes at our local hardware/garden store before and they were not as well made or as good looking as these.  They were also not boxed up.  They were loose and difficult to carry and get home.  It's wonderful we can get these types of items delivered right to our door and in a strong and secure box, which these can also be stored in.We're using these in the garden and they were easy to put into the soil.  I also got a couple working double duty helping me hold up some Halloween decorations.  Good stakes

This is an interesting product.  It smells and tastes very 'green' and natural, with some undertones of sweetness, I suppose from the banana and butternut squash.  The ingredients are very simple - 6 of them - and they are all listed as organic.It mixes well with no lumps and is nice on its own or it also tastes nice mixed into yogurt and oatmeal.

This is a tasty protein shake, nice and chocolaty.  It's very light and easy to carry because it's just powder inside.  You need to add liquid to it and then shake it up.  There's a mesh inside to help ensure it's mixed well.  It works pretty good.  I still get a couple very small lumps, but not a problem.20 grams of protein helps keep me full until I'm ready for my next meal.

We like this TV.  The picture quality is good.  DVD movies look bright, sharp and clean.The TV was very simple and easy to set up.  It did take 2 of us to safely get it out of the box and then stand it up on the TV stand.  Not because it was heavy, because really, it's very light.  It's just too large for one person to carry around on their own.I like where the plugs are located in the back.  They're easy to get to with plenty of room for fingers.  We quickly attached our DVD player, cable box and Wii.The sound from this TV is not that great, but we've got some external speakers attached to it.Our older TV was a 32 inch and while this one is a 42 inch TV, it doesn't take up that much more space.  This TV is mostly all screen without a lot of dead profile space around it.The remote which this TV comes with, is almost 10 inches long.  But, it's easy to use and feels good in the hand.  Comes with batteries...Overall, a good TV for a good price.

These are fine working pot holders.  I really like the non-slip side, makes gripping things a bit easier and I feel I can hold on to things better.These work well to remove hot items from the oven and also for use as a trivet to lay hot dishes on.

Both our dogs eagerly eat this.  I was a bit worried they wouldn't go for the salmon but I shouldn't have been concerned.  They love this food.  Our little one can easily chew threw these, even with her bad teeth (shes a rescue doggy).There IS a scent of fish when this is served out of the bag and also as they eat it.  It's not super strong but it IS noticeable.  I've decided this is not the food for me to feed them first thing in the AM as my own tummy doesn't like the smell at that time of the day.Dogs seems to be doing well on this food.  No problems with digestion.

We grill at least once or twice a week.  We've gotten used to our grill and after grilling for a few years, our grilling skills are adequate. Still, having a grilling probe thermometer that also can tell you the temperature of the grill is a big plus. We usually do rely on the temperature gauge on the grill and we think it works well but we've heard they can be off.We tend to grill steaks and burgers and sausage mostly, and this type of device isn't the most beneficial for those items but for large items, this really comes in handy and works well.  It being wireless and being able to have the sensor inside the home is a great advantage. We compared the temperature this gave us to a different probe thermometer they both matched up closely so this seems to be pretty accurate.These are black in color and both come with handy stands. Batteries are needed for both devices, which come with the units.I wish these came with a storage bag to hold these in when not in use. It seems these types of things never come with a bag and you need to toss them in a drawer for storage. A tougher material for the units or rubberized case would be helpful for long term durability.Careful around flame... I killed a previous grill probe because flame flashed up and hit the probe.  The instructions give this warning, too.  I'm not sure how we're supposed to keep flame away 100% of the time, though.  I mean, we're cooking over an open flame, so...  ?It says it can monitor meat and grill temperature up to 300 feet. I was inside the house probably around 50 feet away and through a wall and it worked fine.It does have a setting to store different  meat, grill, and timer settings. There is also a nighttime back-light for grilling after dark.

I have used these reusable filters before and this one works very well and fits perfectly in my K cup machine. I admit I switch sometimes between packaged k cups and my own ground coffee. Having the option to enjoy your own ground coffee and also being able to brew one cup at a time for convenience is great. There really is a difference between your own ground coffee. Yes it requires a little more effort in having to grind, and then clean this filter but worth it if you like coffee. At the office it is a little more work so I often rely on the prepacked ones. I had another reusable filter in the past that just did not fit right and actually leaked. I am not sure why. I tried a few different things to make it work and it never did work just right. No issues with this unit.One of the other great things about these is you can regulate the amount of coffee. If its one of those mornings and I need a strong cup.. more coffee. If its a little later in the day on a Sunday and I want coffee but not as strong I use less. Rinsing easily under water and ready for next use.I would recommend as in the long run less money that always using packaged k cups.  We received this for free for evaluation.  But, I would not hesitate to buy another because it really works and the cost is nice.

We drink wine often and now and then we do not finish the bottle. As a wine drinker I can say that these really do help keep wine a little longer then just replacing the cork. They do work and take the air out of the wine. Next to investing in a more expensive wine preserver system these are great for the home user. Simply put one of the two rubber "corks" in the wine bottle and put the pump on top. Depending on how much wine is left and after a few pumps your done. When you are ready the next day or two to enjoy more wine you remove the rubber stopper and after a brief wisk of air escaping you are ready. I believe I read somewhere that when you hear a slight difference in the air pumping out sound you know you have pumped enough. Well you will notice for yourself. It also looks nice and goes really well with our stainless steel wine opener. There are other versions  that can be a few dollars less in all plastic but I think for look and durability it is  worth the extra few dollars. I would recommend.  We received this nifty wine saver for free for evaluation.

We have a mostly outdoor cat and he's had a problem with hairballs.  When talking with the neighbors or walking outside, I've seen his little hairballs on the sidewalk, in the street, on driveways.  Yuck.  And when I see them, I do my best to clean them up.We haven't had good luck with hairball products before.  We've tried treats and adding different things to his food.  Didn't work, or he didn't like it and wouldn't eat it.This Nutro hairball control food is working well and the best part - he loves to eat it!  I've still found a hairball here and there, but they are happening less and less now.

This is so much fun.  This is great because it's obvious what each food is - egg, pizza, bread, cupcakes.  Very colorful and attractive toy.  Well, it's more than just a toy, actually.  As fun as it is to play with, it's also educational and counting, sharing and more.  And it's all well made, with the usual quality we've come to love from LeapFrog.

Yes... this works.  This covers the natural scent of ... well ... poop.  We're finding that we don't have to use more than one or two sprays, though.  Any more than that, and the scent of the Poo-Pourri is very strong and noticeable, many, many feet away from the bathroom.  No poop scent, though.  So, that's good.  But, then, having a poop scent billowing down the hall was never our problem.  So, be mindful about how much Poo-Pourri you use.It's easy to use, just spray in the toilet, into the water, before pooping.  Somehow, it traps the poop odor with nary a noxious scent escaping.Good to travel with, easy to stick in a purse to use when out and about.

This is a beautiful workhorse of a printer.  It was wonderfully easy to set up.  Actually, the hardest part was removing the blue tape which was holding all the movable pieces stable and safe during transport.The quick start guide was easy to follow.  The ink bags are a breeze to install and there is no mess at all.  There are two paper trays, so different size/stock paper can be loaded for use.It’s a pretty large printer.  The box said it takes 2 people to remove it from the box and that is correct (at least in my case).  There was no way I could remove it from the box on my own, but it was pretty light with 2 people carrying it.Getting it on my wireless network went pretty smoothly.  Installing the software on my Android cell, iPhone, iPad, Android tablet and computer was also a pleasant experience.  No problems, with the computer and the iPad being the faster/smoother installs.  Being able to printing from all these is fun.  My sister and brother came over and they were able to print from their cells phones within minutes.The printer is a good printer and we’re getting good , clean, crisp prints from the printer, just what you would expect from an Epson printer.  Oh, and it’s fast.  I also love the large LCD touch screen.  The features seem to be endless on this printer  -- duplexing, ethernet connectivity, scan, copy, fax...Now, while this is a wonderful printer and it prints fantastically and is easy to set up, I’m not so sure how well it would hold up in a very busy work environment.  It’s not the speed of the printer.  That is actually quite amazing and it prints extremely fast.  It’s also not a worry about using up ink too quickly.  This printer comes with enough ink for thousands of black and thousands of color prints.  No…. my concern is for the physical body of the printer.  It’s plastic.  Yes, it’s very nice plastic.  And it does seem to be well made.  But, I don’t think the drawers, buttons, levers and paper tray are made for any type of abuse.  I’ve seen people at work being very mean to the printers, taking out their frustration on them, or just using too much force to close drawers or lids.  And while the printers at work are ugly beasts and they don’t print as nice as this Epson, the plastic is harder, tougher and built for the abuse that the poor printers get.Anyway, that’s really my only negative on this printer.  It’s an expensive printer, over a grand, and I can’t see it lasting for many years in a very busy office environment, without something cracking or snapping here and there.  I think, though, it’s perfect for a very small business or more intimate office.  It's all the printer you'll ever need and should last a long time if not abused.

Yum... This makes a delicious bloody mary.  Not into booze?  No problem - this is tasty on its own.  It's tangy, a little spicy, a little salty... a perfect drink.  It's so refreshing.These smallish cans are the right size for one drink.Don't know why they have to put High Fructose Corn Syrup in.  That's irritating.  Other than that, this is a go-to mixer for sure.
Easy to install, very clean looking.  Wish it came in a brushed finish.

Best of these towels I have used.  I buy a number of large towels like these and cut them into strips to use with my young tennis students.  This is the best that I have had.  Really soaks up a lot of water and retains it.  Cooling effect is perfect and lasts.
Works great, fairly quick charge.  Using with my Panasonic ZS50.
Too small for my Olympus OM-D.  Not sure what small DLSR they had in mind, but it is 1/2" too small for my Oly with the standard 12-50mm lens.  Before buying check your measurements closely.
Much better than the other sequel to the main stream Crimson Worlds.
Looking forward to the next novel in the series.

Like armor for the Nexus 6.  A little heavy, but really well made.  I will use it when I travel, not when I am at home.If you are looking for real protection, I think this is all you need.  Well made, covers all the sensitive spots, and has a cover for when you want to carry it in bad places.Remember, the Nexus 6 is water-resistant and has Gorilla 3 glass so you really only need what this case provides.Why 4stars?  It needs a little more grip.

Difficult installation compared to Schlage Keypad Deadbolt.  Very hard to line up screws through door, rubber gaskets kept twisting.  Took 30 minutes to do something that should have taken 10.Programming is strange to say the least.  Managed to put in a Master Pin, but following their instructions can't add other User Pins.  We have to use Master Pin to open door.  Had to do reset to "Factory" twice and their diagram on how to do it was flawed, says to "push reset button" and there isn't one . . . you have to use a paperclip to push the button inside a small hole.  I think I reset it, but still won't let me use anything other than the Master Pin after I reentered it and started over.I finally figured out their programming instructions . . . after being in the computer software industry for 35 years I count myself as an experienced user, but this one was stumping me.  There is supposedly a setting that makes the door auto-relock which I finally got to work. It is a great feature, BUT the only setting is 30 seconds.  We would like it to be more like 1 or 2 minutes so you could take the garbage out or run to the car for something.On the pro side it is an attractive unit and I like the emergency battery feature and the Auto Lock feature.Couldn't test the ZWave network feature as I don't have the controller required.  If I look into it in the future I will update the review.

Pros• Decent size and weight (actually feels like a solid watch)• Face and chronographs are easy to read (numbers)• Sleek colorway with nice polished chrome accents (noticeable on the wrist)• The buttons on the side of the bezel are non-intrusive (could be worn on either wrist)• Fairly easy to understand, straight forward instructions (nice manual included)• Ample amount of removable links for sizing (could fit varying wrist sizes)• Invicta always have good packaging (sturdy box with soft felt liner)Cons• The color of the band and bezel seem like a cheap coating (chip easily if banged up)• The watch clasp seems cheap, compared the rest of the watch (MSRP $1000)• Curious why there is a date window and date chronograph (seems repetitive)• Ample amount of removable links for smaller wrists, leaves you with one link on each side (could offer more removable links or wider links)• TritNite Night Glow doesn't last that long (even with prolonged sunlight exposure)• Comprehensive manual isn't model specific (general instructions for wide range of models)

Note that there are no verified purchase reviews. The other two must be shills. As I am a Vine reviewer, this really disgusts me. I would like my reviews to be trusted so I work very hard to make them accurate and truthful.

Excellent small footprint printer/scanner/copier.  As other reviewers have noted, this is not a high quality photo printer, but it is a good quality all-around printer.  For just a few $$ more you can buy the Epson Expression Premium XP-620 which has five color tanks and does produce higher quality photo prints.  You do get what you pay for.Construction quality is acceptable to good for this price range, you really have to move up another $50 or more to get better construction but do you really need that in a personal or small business printer/scanner/copier?As a printer, the B&W quality is excellentAs a scanner, really does a good job and the software does work over the wireless to my PC.  I just scanned two documents for my wife to .pdf files and they were perfect.As a copier, it is medium quality.  Once again, good enough for business use.All in all excellent value printer/scanner/copier.

Really bright!!  Covers a 6-8' circle with light.  It's cool white, but for a walk light who cares.  Very light construction, be very careful putting it together.  Before you start, open the battery cover and make sure they are seated properly. Turn the switch by the batteries to "on".  Then you can assemble the 6 pieces and go stick it someplace where you need good light at night.  Note that the batteries are a problem area, I needed to reseat them after a couple of days -- thought the light had failed, the batteries had just fallen out of contact.  Put a piece of foam inside the battery lid to keep that from happening again.The chrome is a little cheap looking and had the battery problem, so one star off.  It does deliver lots of light and seems to last about 8+ hours which is perfect for most uses.

Really perks up the kitchen.  Now it supports Pandora so we can hear all of our favorite music.  We use our tablets to control it in the morning so when step into the kitchen we already have nice music playing. They keep adding features with software updates.  Well worth the price as it keeps growing in capability. My wife wants it in stainless to match our new appliances . . . that's how much she likes it!
Used it to wrap trees welcoming my wife home from the earthquake in Nepal.  Waterproof, easy to work with, good price.  She appreciated the thought.
Great price for replacement nets. Quality is good enough.
Gave up on series.  Too expensive and the writing has fallen off with every book since about #6.  Very disappointed as Weber was one of my favorite authors.  Must need money.
Easy, very easy to install and manage.  I have units that have been running for 6 months without needing any restarts or reboots.  Speed is as advertised, and coverage is good.

My wife was in the earthquake in Nepal, ended up in a hospital in Lhasa, Tibet.  She says that this pillow is the only thing that saved her from permanent neck and back damage from the hospital bed/pillow.  Conditions were/are terrible, hospital is like something from the 1930's, bed is like WWII cot.  Pillow allowed her to sleep.
Way too wordy, puffed up a lot to make a full book.
Seemed to work, but developed nose bleed so had to stop using it.

I have always liked Lexol for my leather seats and jackets.  This brings convenience to using Lexol Leather Care products.  Whats nice is that you can use one pad several times, don't throw it away after one use.

We usually like OXO products, but this one gives no real improvement over a regular scrubber like the Scotch-Brite Heavy Duty Scrub Sponge 426 which is what we use.  In fact, it is harder to use on the curved part of pans and doesn't do the job on any irregular shaped object like a grabber.The cost for the replacement sponges is not clear as they are not on the system yet, but judging from their other products that require replacement it will be at least 3 times more expensive.

This is a very useful product for the BBQ season.  Since it is winter, we have tested in our ovens and it works perfectly.  The Bluetooth range seems to be about 35 feet indoors, may be a little more outdoors.  Linked up fine with my Moto Maxx and with my Nexus 7.Software complaint: while it does a great job of showing the temperature, it also offers a timer which would be great if they both displayed on the one screen.  They should be integrated instead of acting like stand-alone apps.  You start the temperature tracking, and then when you go to the timer to set it for basting or whatever, it hides so you don't know how much time you have left.  All you would need is a little countdown window in the same screen as the temps.Note that cleanup was easy and the winder makes it easy to store properly.

My wife is very handy and does a lot of projects that require a level, so I asked her to help with the review on this product.  Following are her comments:"Love the look.  Love the construction.  Love the carrying case.  It is relatively light weight so that you can easily manipulate it with one hand if you are drawing a level or plumb line on a wall.  The hand grab areas are user friendly.  The buttons are all user friendly and the laser button is at the end so that it can’t be accidentally confused with anything else.  As a level, this product is superb.  Besides the easy-to-read LED display for the distance from level , there is an angled line drawing which tells you that it is out of level.  When the lines meet, level has been reached.  There are also 2 arrows which tell you which way you need to go to reach your goal.  Where it goes beyond an ordinary bubble level is in its ability to give you exact angles of any degree if you require them.  And in my estimation, it is quite accurate.As far as the laser part of it, I feel that there are many products on the market that are perhaps easier to use and that are more effective.  This can be used by the occasional handyman for DIY projects, but in order to use it to full capacity, you will need a tripod and even then, I’m not sure this is the best or easiest to use product for a laser-type job. "Note that I couldn't get it back from her.  It is now part of her kit. She also felt it was a little expensive for the everyday handyman, so recommended subtracting one star for that.

After I had thought I had done my research I bought this to replace an aging Denon AVR-988 unit. Wanted more HDMI ports.  Big mistake was not asking the Yamaha support group on Facebook a lot of questions before I bought it.  First, there is no way to support both speakers and a set of wireless headphones at the same time.  There is no monitor out function at all.  I am very hard of hearing and like to watch TV or listen to music with the family using my Sennheiser RS 130 Wireless Surround Sound Headphones.  I can do that with the Denon, but not the Yamaha . . . guess their engineers haven't heard of the ADA requirements.Second, the zone 2 only works with NON-HDMI sources.  If you want to listen to the game in one room while watching it in another as we can do with the Denon, there is no way.  You cannot pipe audio from your DVD player because the input is via HDMI, you cannot send music from your cable or Uverse connection if they are connected via HDMI.Note that there are "Monitor Out" jacks on the back, but they only work for non-HDMI sources.I have a feeling that a lot of the so-called "Zone 2" and "Zone 3" on all of the Yamaha AVR have the same problem as well as some of the other manufacturers, but none of them are forthcoming in their advertising or brochures.  You have to download their manual and search to page xxx to find out what you want doesn't work.  One item that does work through these zones apparently is anything coming in from the network.  But then you would have to have a PC that is remotely controllable to take advantage of this.  I do have a Alienware Alpha that will be hooked up to my future AVR, but it attaches via HDMI.If you are thinking of buying a Yamaha and want to use it for anything beyond a basic 7.1 setup, go to their facebook page and ask questions.  I give them 4 stars for answering support questions there, but the product only gets one star.Since I waited too long to return this unit, I will be selling it cheap.  Haven't opened it yet, luckily I was reading the manual and started having questions before I tore apart my audio/video closet.

Wow, works perfectly in our shower!  We completely redid our master bath and put this in the shower.  Contrary to what some reviewers have said, it really only turns on from the motion sensor when we get into the shower.  The glass door seems to be enough to block it's view.  Ran a 4" pipe up through the roof to make sure there was no back pressure.  Sound is extremely low, can barely hear the air movement when you are in the shower with the water turned off.  Nothing fogs in the bathroom, ceiling outside of the shower stays dry.  Only complain is that it is moving so much air that you feel the cooling breeze  as soon as you turn off the shower . . . not sure that is a valid complaint :) . Note that we did not wire this through a switch as it has an on/off switch in the unit when you pull the faceplate down . . . we wanted something that was always on.Well made, moves a lot of air, auto features work perfectly, almost silent.

Bought this for a clumsy house guest that keeps wanting to take her morning coffee to the bathroom with her.  Next time she visits we will be prepared. No more spots on the rugs to clean up.Weight is good, nice sized handle, seems sturdy.

Would have given it 5 stars except for the bogus marketing claims of "600Mbit/sec" speed which this device does not, in fact can not deliver for basic technical reasons. It does deliver decent speeds in my tests, at or above most of the little plug in adapters that I have used.  It seems very stable, haven't had to reboot it once and had it on a high use device overnight that was downloading updates to a new system.It is not as tiny like a few of the N adapters I have used, but it does deliver both AC and N capabilities.  I would recommend using a short USB cable extension if you are using it on a mobile device as it sticks out about an inch and would be easy to crunch.  I tried it on both a Win 7 desktop and a 8.1 portable, not problems.  I did check the TP-Link website to make sure I had the latest drivers.Capable product at a good price point.

Had to send it back.  Sized it to my wrist, wore it one day and when I took it off at night it had condensation in the crystal which means that moisture had gotten into the case at some point.  Since it hadn't been in water, it must have gotten into it in shipping. The watch is rated to 100m, so it's waterproofing had obliviously failed.Never had this problem with a Seiko before.  In fact I ordered a different model to replace this one.

Perfect!  I used them with a 8-port switch next to my home patch panel and the colors allowed me to know exactly which port was supporting what device.  They are quality made, with good boots, all of them worked fine.
I have several pair of Silicone Gloves.  These are my favorites.  Very flexible, and you can put them in the dishwasher.
What can you say about a reasonably priced quality product?  Buy it.

The PlayStation 4 and Xbox One might be the gamers systems to many people, but PCs have more games, cheaper games, and can usually make those games look way prettier. Still, PCs can be a pain in the ass to use, particularly plugged into a TV. You can't just pop in a disc, pick up a controller and start playing. The Alienware Alpha claims to be the best of both worlds: a PC game console.  If you price out the components and try to make one like this yourself you will end up spending more and getting something that will not be "wife friendly".  This box is very WF!!!First, if you want to fully use this console and all of its power get a keyboard/mouse or keyboard/trackpad.  It takes a long time to set it up to get started and in several places you start wanting a keyboard.  It took me way over an hour to get through all the setup, update loading, question answering, etc.. When you get to the games side, there some of the older games that require either mouse clicks or keyboard input.  Since you can get a nice wireless Logitech keyboard/trackpad for less than $30 on Amason, it's really not that big of a deal and it expands what you can do with this little box.It really is a little box, far smaller than my XBox, and it draws lots less power.  Unfortunately, part of that is because there is no DVD drive.  But most games you'll want to play download from the net anyway.  That does point up one problem that my daughter picked up: it has a very slow drive.  Some of the really big games need to keep loading from the drive and sometimes she thought the system had quit.  Luckily you can easily upgrade the all of the components yourself.  I would get the cheapest model and add your own memory and maybe upgrade to a SSD or very fast hard drive.  Other than the drive, everything else is screaming fast on this box.  I think all you need is the i3 cpu as the custom GPU just blows away the XBox.  You can play almost everything at full 1080p with decent frame rates.  For sound, you are either going to need USB Headphones or a receiver/TV that can handle the optical audio out.
