Georgie is a lost teenager; living in a home where both of her parents ignore her and their definition of love is buying her whatever she needs. This sends Georgie spiraling down a very destructive path but it puts her in the crosshairs of her favorite rock star, Sloane. Sloane lives the life of a rock star to the fullest (wow the number of woman that are in contact with his penis) then he bumps into Georgie and sees a kindred spirit, she reminds him of himself at 16 when his life began to spiral out of control down a destructive road. Neither Georgie or Sloane have a great support system behind them, the parents on both sides are crazy, self-absorbed and self-centered. Sloane finds himself in a new position, he wants to help Georgie, get her back on a good path and away from the drugs that are leading her down a road she may not return from.  As much as Georgie and Sloane shouldn't be together because she is under age, these two souls connect, but can they find a road to happiness together? Or will the world conspire to keep them apart?

Gut wrenching, life affirming, faith building, downright emotional roller coaster. Hollis is struggling to find her life again after a tragic accident leaves her scarred from a fire. Her friends at school are no longer her friends; they sadly don't know how to accept that this is her. She heads off to college after spending that year of school at home; this is a bold move for her. Through her fear she finds acceptance in an amazing young man, Risher. He truly sees Hollis, the amazing person inside, not the outside/scars that she feels everyone is judging her by. Hollis is also embraced by her roommate, Abigail, but Abigail has a bigger challenge ahead of her. This is story is about learning to love and accept yourself for who you are no matter what others say. It's also about embracing and finding friends in unexpected places. I felt each and every emotion for Hollis and Abigail along the way. Truly a beautiful journey that will open your heart in new ways.

Lex has amazing resiliency and determination having pulled her mother and herself out of the ashes after her father's suicide. She is at the crossroads again as her company is on the verge of falling apart without the fabric needed from Garasoli in Italy. She heads to Italy to confront Masimo and demand her fabric. What starts out as a mission to save her company, becomes a journey involving her heart. Masi is blown away by the confident, strong woman that arrives at his estate unannounced, demanding her fabric. He is drawn into Lex's vortex and finds he doesn't want to step away yet he has avoided commitment for years. Will Lex be the one woman to capture Masi's heart? Can Lex open her heart and save her company? Another exciting, fun and sexy installment on the Manhattanite crew. Avery Aster has given me this great unique family that bands together to protect its own as they struggle with daily living while delivering all the romance, drama and sexiness to keep me turning every page.

Gut wrenching, heartwarming, angst filled roller coaster ride … Lucas and Alex will suck you into their world and not let you go. Alex is best friends with Dylan, Jacob, Austin and Lucas but Lucas has a special bond with her. From day one these two connected on a whole different level – it's that two peas in a pod idea. As they grow up together everything is idyllic until hormones happen. We get to experience all the highs and lows as they navigate moving from childhood to adulthood, one of the biggest challenges is their two year age difference and the fact that everyone feels like Lucas isn't right for Alex. Do you listen to all your friends and family and abandon the purest love you may ever know? Of course, with growing up comes choices and Lucas made some doozies that made me want to punch him. Can Alex forgive his teenage hormonal behavior? Alex struggles to find her own identity away from the best friends she's ever had, will she find her way back? Grab this book and experience every crazy emotion, you won't regret it.

Leila and Jacob have had a rocky road to a marriage that is finally clicking on all cylinders then the unthinkable happens … an old nemesis resurfaces, Rachel Laraby, ready to rain whatever chaos she can muster down upon them. It's exciting to continue spending time with Leila and Jacob to experience life after the happily ever after, what happens when the real world interferes? Daily life?

Tristan Knight finds himself with a family, a very rich one (the Stonehaven's), while his mom is working as their maid. He even has a little sister Emily who takes up residence in his heart. Emily loves her "adopted" brother Tristan but she also has a crush on him. Then this world is snatched from Tristan but 4 years later he ends up back with the Stonehaven's. This time Emily is all grown up and her infatuation with Tristan remains. Can Tristan keep his distance or will history repeat itself? I'm in love with Tristan, his resilience, compassion and willingness to do anything for those he loves. Emily falls into his protective orbit but can he keep that boundary as he starts to see her as the amazing young woman that she truly is. My heart bled a few times during this journey, will these two star crossed lovers find a way back to each other? Is the pain caused by Tristan's desertion too much to forgive? All of the crazy twists and turns had me captivated from beginning to end.

Totally caught me by surprise. Nicole Blanchard delivers a phenomenal romance with layers of complexity and dimension to keep you guessing. Ben and Jack are best friends and when Jack's family adopts a teenage daughter, Olivia, well, this ends up being just as significant for Ben as it is for Jack. Of course, Ben tries to stay away from his best friends sister, especially after he enlists in the Marines but on a break between tours, well, let's just say Miss Olivia knocks Ben's socks off! Olivia has always been drawn to Ben so when she finally gets him to see her as the grown woman that she is, she jumps at the opportunity. Of course, life isn't ever easy as Ben deals with the challenges of war while Olivia deals with a surprise left by Ben. (I don't want to give away any of the amazing twists.) We get to enjoy two incredibly strong and stubborn individuals that ultimately have to decide if love is worth fighting for through all of life's challenges. An all-consuming, sexy and romantic read.

Highland Wolf Pact: Sibyl is being forced to marry a Scottish Lord for England but this isn't the destiny she dreamed for herself. She gets an opportunity to escape and is thrust into the arms of Raife who is not just a man, but also a wolf, known as a wulver. Can Sibyl accept what she has seen? Can she deny her feelings for Raife? This is a very different story for Selena Kitt to write but she grabbed from the first page and kept me wondering how the legend of the wulver would intersect with Sibyl's life. The connection between Sibyl and Raife builds slowly as they both fight their attraction because of duty and responsibilities but when they finally give in, you get a fabulous romance that makes you want to find your own wulver.Compromising Positions: Selena Kitt keeps us entranced as we continue to explore the world of the wulvers and how they co-exist with the Scottish. Kirstin is the healer in the group so she sets out for the MacFalons castle to tend to the wounded but along the way she crosses paths with Donal, the new leader of Clan MacFalon. What Kirstin doesn't expect is to be drawn to Donal as her one true mate. Donal is similarly shocked by his connection to Kirstin. Will they give in to what they truly desire? Will forces around them keep them apart? There are several great twists and turns while we enjoy Kirstin and Donal's journey. I love the mix of romance with the legend of the wulvers tied into the British/Scottish history that adds a level of suspense to the story.Blood Reign: Love the Highland Wolf Pact series. Selena Kitt takes us away again to a different time and place, crafting a wonderfully sexy romance that keeps you guessing. This is Griff's story, he is the sone of Raife and Sibyl, he's struggling with his strength and power, knowing that one day he will rule the clan following in his father's footsteps but he's feeling that pull now. He is also the red wulver which launches him on a quest to find out if a prophecy about him is true. Bridget has been training her whole life to be guardian and priestess, a job routed in tradition and full of tradition and honor. When she must confront Griff as he wishes to enter the sacred chambers, she never dreams that she has found her soulmate. As the two work to unravel the mystery of the red wulver, a nemesis of Griff's families past returns. Is anyone safe? Who is the true red wulver? So many great twists and turns that kept me guessing and wanting to know more.

Lost in Us: Love the connection James and Serena make, they are kindred spirits, both dealing with loss and guilt, can they heal each other? Believe they are worthy of love? James has built an empire for himself and a lonely existence by only allowing himself one night stands with no attachments. Then he crosses paths with Serena, a woman that pushes his buttons and wants him to be a better man. Serena has been living in her bubble following her sister's death. She works at all costs to control her life to keep herself safe. When her boyfriend of 6 years breaks up with her, she is sent down a new path. Meeting James wakens her up but her fear remains. Will she be able to push through the fear and grab onto something wonderful? Can James convince himself that he is worthy of Serena's love?Found in Us: Another great romance from Layla Hagen. Love the sparks that Jessica and Parker create and fight, makes for a fun ride. Jessica has never felt worthy, everyone seems to fix all of her problems and continues to tell her she won't amount to anything. Well, she is going to prove them wrong. As she graduated from Stanford she got found a job in London at a museum and ventured out on her own away from her family and friends. Parker appears to be the perfect gentleman and when he meets Jessica, well, he finds it hard to stay away from her but he tries. When Jessica ends up in London where he lives and works, it's even harder to keep his distance, he is drawn to how she lights up a room and no matter what bad things happen, she always finds the positive. Parker is hiding a past that makes him believe he is unworthy. Can Jessica push past Parker's barriers? Will Jessica be able to believe she is good enough for Parker?Caught in Us: So much fun and sexiness! This is Dani's story, if you are a fan of the Lost series then you met her in James story, Dani is his sister. In this story we go back before James and Parker stories to when Dani is still in high school and a new boy moves to town, Damon. Damon is angry at the world but Dani is having it so she puts him in his place, just what Damon needed. Who knew these two would be friends and kindred spirits but their fathers aren't happy about it. Sadly, Dani and Damon spend a chunk of time apart, when they end up at the same college, well, will the same sparks fly? Has Damon really changed his ways? Will Dani be willing to open her heart again? I loved Dani and Damon's journey which has the added benefit of giving you some other insights into James and Parker along the way since the timeline is a bit different. Layla Hagen delivers another fun, sexy ride to escape into.

I haven't had the chance to read every book yet but so far, everything I have read is amazing. What a great collection of stories to escape with.Second Chance by Liliana Rhodes: Fabulously sexy second chance romance. Tara and Mason met and fell in love on his families' ranch. She was working her way up to manage the ranch and training of the horses when Mason returned home and his father gave him her promotion. Tara never expected to fall in love with Mason but Mason had dreams beyond the ranch so when he leaves and never comes back, well, Tara is forced to move on. As Tara is now settled in Cedar Cove, she never expects to cross paths with Mason in her new job. Mason is shocked to see Tara in the horse barn which dredges up so many questions. Can these two overcome the hurt feelings and misunderstandings of their 15 year separation?His Need, Her Desire by Malia Mallory: Tabitha gets stood up by her friend on their Hawaiian vacation but she never realizes this might be a blessing in disguise. Marcus is a driven business man but is intrigued by this woman he saw in the restaurant, he gets a pleasant surprise when he ends up rescuing her. When these two meet, the sparks fly and Marcus opens up Tabitha's world in a HUGE way. Love the passion and erotic journey that they embark on.

Avery Aster continues to blow my mind with no-holds barred, snappy, witty dialog that has me laughing out loud every time I step into the world of the Manhattanites. This time we focus on Blake, the gay best friend that has seemed to settle for what he's got in life. He has always been this amazing, supportive friend to Lex, Taddy and Vive. When he met Diego, well, he thought he found true love but that ended up not being the case. As he works to restore his confidence, Vive and Thor push him out of his comfort zone and directly into Miguel's path. Blake has had a crush on Miguel for years, truly should have had the courage to pursue him instead of taking the easier path with Diego. Miguel loves Blake but has always been afraid to follow his heart; will this latest challenge be enough to get him to open up to Blake allowing love in for both of them? Will Blake have the courage to be open for a love a second time? All the while we get more drama from Lex, Taddy and Vive as we approach Lex's wedding. Jump in for a fantastic ride with the Manhattanites!

The Blue Moon House continues to astound and arouse giving you all the fabulous hot, sexy, erotic tales about vampires that you could possibly desire. We step into Terrence's journey as he found his way to Sophia, Nicholas and Lynn. This is a pivotal point in everyone's story as they face the loss of their home in London, where will they go? Can they rebuild? Terrence becomes a rescuer of sorts but in reality I feel they rescued each other and ultimately set themselves on the path to what became Blue Moon House.

Hot, sexy, erotic – everything I've come to expect from Angelica Dawson's amazing talent. The Slave takes us back to Blue Moon House to learn how Will became a 'member'. Will is a slave and grew up in a world where men dominated woman in a harmful way. As he works at Blue Moon House he has to unlearn some of those behaviors to truly appreciate his own skills, passions and desires.

Daniela's life gets crazier as a stalker becomes more aggressive, she's not sure who to trust or where to turn. She loves Cooper but his appearance in her life coincides with all of these strange occurrences. Cooper is excited to have Daniela back in his life but she is hesitant and he doesn't understand why. As the case he is working on heats up, will their relationship do the same? Daniela and Cooper provide a fabulously sexy second chance romance that blends a suspenseful storyline to keep you engaged, needing to turn the page.

Daniela had her heart crushed when the love of her life chose professional baseball over her. She hasn't seen or heard from Cooper in 4 years which makes it totally shocking to run into him after one of the fashion shows she has worked. Cooper is just as surprised to see Daniela at the hotel and is a bit startled by her chilly reception. I love that Emily Jane Trent always gives us the dual POV. Cooper has missed Daniela as much as she missed him. The challenge is will she forgive him for leaving and give him another chance. Cooper is working as a PI following a man so an element of intrigue is established since it seems the man he is following has some interest in Daniela. Very curious what will happen in part 2.

I haven't read the entire box set but I have had time to devour a few of the stories and based on these you couldn't go wrong grabbing this box set.Unshakable by J.C. Valentine: A fabulous return to Jami and Ally but the focus is really on Don as he faces how he feels after losing his wife and how his life will move forward next. He has to face some challenges but hopefully this will allow him to open up and embrace the family he has with Jami, Ally and baby. I truly want Don to be the amazing Grandpa I know he can and will be to their children.Perfectly Equipped by Lacey Silks: Fabulously fun and sexy start to a new series. What would you do if your best friend planned your first vacation in years and you ended up at a nudist resort? Oh the possibilities! April finds herself in just this situation and then the hottest guy at the resort takes an interest in her. Love how Lacey Silks has started this new series with a bang!

Brenda Novak never disappoints and always delivers an amazing romance that is layered with complexity which keeps you reading. Maisey has just endured a mother's worst nightmare followed by a wife's greatest fear. To try and heal her broken soul, she decides to  return to her hometown to help her brother Keith, though dreads crossing paths with her mother, Josephine (oh my, wasn't prepared this tough as nails woman). When Rafe crosses her path, something inside her re-awakens, maybe she can heal from all the tragedy. Rafe is a single dad doing an amazing job raising Laney who faces the daily challenge of being blind. Their bond is wonderfully sweet and Laney pretty much will melt your heart. Rafe and Maisey met as teenagers when they were both making reckless decisions, will they be able to move past their first encounter? Can Maisey open her heart again? Blend into this a family mystery that Maisey is determined to solve no matter what her mother says and you have the perfect mix for an afternoon escape.

Oh Robert, will you ever learn! This was a fun and sexy jump back into Kasie and Robert's world that shows Robert struggles to change his controlling ways. I love that Kasie stands up to him and they ultimately work to better their relationship. Kyra Davis also gave us a great lead in to the next book … never saw this coming, WOW!

Owen and Chelsea are put to the test as Chelsea takes an internship 4 hours away from Owen for the summer. Can this new love sustain the long distance? I loved spending more time with Owen and Chelsea to see how much they have both grown. Being in love is a challenge as you balance the other pressures in your life – Chelsea is pursuing her dream while Owen is pushing towards a football career. Will they find a way to balance the two? Come along for their crazy, sexy, fun ride.

We meet Amelia as she starts her dream job at the British Museum. Just as she feels everything in her life is on track well, we all know, that's when life throws you a curve ball. As she faces the end of her long-term relationship, things heat up with Will, a co-worker, even though relationships are forbidden in the workplace. Will is a challenge for Amelia, he runs hot and cold but he also was hooking up with the queen b*tch, Katrina, at the museum. Now that Will has moved on to Amelia, well let's say Katrina is going to make life interesting for Amelia as she fights to get back what she had. Just as Amelia feels like she's got her feet under her, well, new secrets are revealed and Will drops a bomb which leads us to our cliff hanger. On the whole this is an enjoyable story, it does get a bit confusing because we get a variety of viewpoints but once you get used to that it works and adds to the drama – we know what Katrina is really thinking, not just Amelia and Will. I appreciated the complexities interwoven throughout the story along with learning about what it's like to work at a museum behind the scenes. The story does need some editing just to clean up the rough edges but you can still appreciate the intricacies to the characters and their relationships.

Sigh! Red Phoenix has done it to me again. Just when I think the Brie series can't get any better, well, it does. What an amazing journey that both Brie and Sir took to get to their happily ever after. All the moments were spot on taking me on that emotional roller coaster of life for both of them. I don't want to reveal any of the secrets, just know that if you are a fan of the Brie series, this is where you knew and wanted the journey to go.

This is the true test for both Penny and Xander as they face their fears brought on by their parents expectations. We ended with Penny's sister, Victoria, dropping Xander's ex-girlfriend in their lap at her wedding reception – I'm glad she's not my sister – how will Penny and Xander cope? I don't want to give away how this part of their story goes but I can tell you that I love Penny and Xander – their connection is honest, natural, sexy and fun. We get all of Penny's gutsiness even as she battles her insecurities while Xander shows his softer side. They both have to face the hurts inflicted in the past and find a way to move forward. Will they realize that they are stronger together?

What a wonderfully fun, sexy and romantic collection to dive into. Each one is a short story that steps into the world of psychics, all in very unique ways. I am impressed with the variety that is included and the amazing creativity of the authors. I have to admit that I was invested in each of the stories and loved how much hope was instilled through each journey. Get ready to experience a psychic that interacts with deceased animals, matchmakers with unusual techniques, people that see visions in water and people that are too "hot" to touch while others heal with light. It all makes for a wonderful escape.

Compared to our other more elaborate Nerf guns, this one is a simple single-shooter with a holster that clips to the child's pants.  It fires one Nerf bullet and carries two underneath the barrel.  The Holster carries four more (the gray section in the Amazon photo).  The cocking mechanism is not too difficult for a 5 and 8 year old to use.  The best thing about this simple Nerf Gun?  It has the most power and zip of any of our Nerf Gun collection.  The bullet flies the straightest line of any we've tried during target practice in the yard.  I think the more elaborate guns lose some of their zip as they get more complicated mechanisms.  This is one hits what you aim at.  When the neighborhood kids come over and we have Nerf wars in the yard, our Strike Blaster become the most demanded Nerf Gun.  And the price?  Amazon's is easily $6 to $10 cheaper, in frustration-free packaging, than brick and mortar stores in my area.  I've just ordered another.

I have fond memories of Hydrox as a kid with my father and now with children of my own, I began searching for Hydrox to share with them.  I couldn't understand where Hydrox had gone.  I've never truly liked the taste of Oreos, so I left the chocolate cookie world behind... but had recently discovered the Keebler Simply Made version, which I think are far better than Oreos.  Then last week, like a bolt from the sky, Amazon put a recommendation in my field of view and it was Hydrox.  I was blown away.  Where had they gone?  Why did Amazon have them?  I began to research and now I understand that through a series of company buyouts, it was slashed.  Now thanks to Leaf and Amazon, I ordered my first real Hydrox in years... in decades.  No high fructose corn syrup.  Just real chocolate flavor.  That wholesome cocoa smell that hits your nose when you first open that bag?  Wow.  It's like I am eight years old again. Thanks Amazon!
Great patch for my cap.  Very detailed considering that is two colors and its size.  I'd definitely purchase another!

Be advised, this robe looks good, but it is very thin, almost veil-like.  It works and is Made in the USA, but if you want a real solid robe for your child's Jedi costume, look for the thicker variety.  With that all said, it is well made and appears durable.  The sewing is tight and has no loose strings that needed trimming.  The thinness of the material was a tiny surprise.  Yet, my child doesn't care one bit and thought it was a real Jedi robe in her imagination.

I was very excited when this arrived as well built as it is.  Truth be told, I expected something far less, but it would satisfy this coming Halloween needs.  Yet what came out of the packaging, while 100% polyester, is very well sewed and durable.  My only concern is the thin velcro strip that holds the boots on under the child's shoes, after a night of walking that is sure to give way.  I imagine it will be an easy enough fix though.I was pleasantly surprised to see the label and it is stamped, "Made in the USA".  I wish the packaging really pointed that out, but it says nothing about it being constructed here.  I found it while trying to see how to clean this product (by the way, hand wash cold, only.  No iron.  Air dry.)Thank you, Rubies!  Far better than some of the stuff I can find locally in the chain stores!

We bought this funny little sharpener for my daughter, as she is always surrounded by pencils, color pencils, and crayons.  It sharpens all her drawing utensils without issue and even includes an eraser for the pencil markings.  She loves it for the wacky its look and it fits her personality.  For such a simple sharpener, but it really got us parent points with her!

Benny is a lot of fun.  As soon as he was entered into our game, we received the directions to his spaceship (Spaceship!).  I think Lego needs to include these directions in the box, but that's another review.  His spaceship in its first form is a flying toy and a first for my family.  Kids had a lot of fun flying Benny and his spaceship in the Lego Movie level.  The spaceship fires red lasers and was an instant hit.  When another Lego Movie character leaps into the spaceship (Wild Style, from the starter kit), she as well provides her version of "spaceship... Spaceship... SPACESHIP!" while flying.  Just a nice touch.Benny is a brawler and laser shooter.  He talks to himself a bunch and the voice sounds like the one from the movie.  His spaceship is top notch.  Waiting for the other two variations to unlock (by collecting gold bricks within the game).  Have spent in-game earnings to also include "mines" with his spaceship, though we have yet to discover what these mines in fact do.

Been looking forward for this on my Amazon Firestick for quite some time now and it's here.  I linked my Disney Movies account and all my previously purchased Disney movies were instantly linked.  Unfortunately, unlike Amazon Prime or Netflix apps, there is a whole lot of buffering that keeps occuring, which shows up as a pause in the movie and a spinning circle in the center of the screen.  It makes watching a movie, not entirely impossible, but very frustrating.  We counted 12 buffer moments in the first 15 minutes of Mary Poppins.I think some work needs to be done to the app to bring it on par with Amazon Prime or Netflix (as examples).  Disney, over to you!  Please fix the buffering issues!

This is an amazing popcorn maker.  It's is lightweight, collapsible and doesn't appear like it should do anything with popcorn.  For my first two trials, I used a 1/2 cup and about one tablespoon of coconut oil right on top.  My 1000 watt microwave gets to 3 minutes and leaves a few old maids, but in general that's a good time.  It could probably go another 10 to 20 seconds.  The popcorn was light and very crispy.On subsequent pops, I lowered it to a 1/4 cup just for myself and omitted the oil.  I would do the 3 minutes again, though for a 1/4 cup that's the far edge of almost burning.  I give it a little spray of olive oil from my wife's baking cabinet and sprinkle with salt.  Perfect.So far there is nothing to hate or dislike with this simply designed popcorn maker.  By the way, use pot holders when pulling it out.  The sides are quite warm coming straight out of the microwave.

These guys are great and the whole family enjoys their shows.  I purchased the Maine episode as it is my favorite.  Watching Diggers made me crack out my own metal detector  and begin tracking the two kids throughout the yard.  They love it.

This is a very sturdy goblet for wine drinking (or any other beverage of your choice).  After breaking two wine glasses in my rental home on the hard tile floor of the kitchen, I was desperate for something... less wimpy.  You probably wouldn't want to entertain guests with your fancy Tervis wine goblets, but for general wine consumption after a long day, this Tervis does the trick!  It holds quite a bit of liquid as well.  I believe it holds 16 ounces.As for the Tervis guarantee, I can attest to cracking a general drinking cup made by Tervis and without a single question from them, they replaced the entire cup within two weeks time (mostly my mailing to them and their mailing back).  Tervis is a lifetime warranty and they stand by it.  Made in the USA!

We adore this lamp.  It has a beautiful, glowing orange color thanks to the dimmable bulb inside the salt block (accessed via the base and easily removed for exchange).  The best way I can describe it is "warm".  It brings a warm feel to a room, not by physical heat, but by it's color, as it sits glowing in a darkened room.We use it for just about any occasion and any lighting situtation, but alone in the dark, it being the sole source of light, is really an amazing sight.  Our young children come and go in the night, so this dimmable salt lamp has also become our new night light.  It is on the heavy side, but still transportable and my wife takes it to every room she's spending time in.  It does not simply stay in one spot in our home.I can not speak to it clearing the or purifying the air.  It may be doing that, but I can attest to how it makes you feel as a piece of nature brought into the home and then lit.  It is a very nice conversation piece and simply is a gorgeous addition to our living spaces.

The fleece was a great color (purple), but the weight of the material was very light, almost an inner layer instead of an outer.  My wife found that the jacket fit much smaller than both the fit guide and the label stated.  After much thought, we decided to return for a refund and try a different approach to her new jacket.  Great color, OK weight.  The sizing seems to run small.

On my Kindle Fire, this product seems to work and notified me of a clean Kindle.  I was happy with that, but the 90% complete "querying server" process takes 01:05 minutes every single time I use it.  Just over a minute seemed OK to me, but when I moved the app to my Android phone via the Amazon store cloud, that same process took 10:48 minutes.  Yes, almost eleven minutes to complete the "querying server" process on two runs.  I wasn't about to do it again.  I had enough.  That was absurd.Secondly, to see if paying for service might be a bottleneck remover for the "querying" process, any attempt to check out the "Advanced Protection" features by clicking "Get it now" brought me nowhere on both phone and Kindle.  It simply closed the window and I was left looking at settings.I think Bitdefender has promise and it seems to have a very small footprint, but on both my Kindle Fire and S4 phone, the application appears very hobbled.  I believe this needs more work.

For starters, this bed arrived one full day earlier than planned.  That was a great surprise and we appreciated it.  Upon receipt of the bed, my wife and I scratched our heads at how such a small Amazon box could hold a 40"x35" dog bed.  When opened, we saw that it was tightly shrink wrapped and folded over many times.I thought that there was no way for an extra large dog bed to come from this tightly bundled object in front of me.  We followed the included instructions and soon had it unwrapped and let it begin expanding.  Within an hour, just as instructed, the bed had expanded about 90% of the way.  (Overnight it fully expanded.)  The interior memory foam is flecked with blue and has a very cooling feel to it.  It is very dense and in no way cheaply manufactured.My weimaraner is 11.5 years old, 95 pounds, and loves his old beat up bed that we were trying to replace.  My problem was that he would only lie on the beat-up bed, if there was no couch space available.  I also know at his age, memory foam is far better for him.  So I am trying to kill two birds here: get him off the couch and give him on some nice memory foam for his aches.He launched himself at the new bed and began rooting at it.  So far, no issues.  He plopped himself in the middle of it and lay there for awhile as we watched him... but soon he made his way to the couch.  So admittedly, we have to give him time and get him adjusted to the new bed.  He seems very willing and to me, it's far more comfortable than his last bed!

This is the greatest popcorn in our hot air popper.  The first time I popped a batch, I was surprised at how our usual 1/2 cup of kernels, as popped, filled our popcorn bowl to a much greater extent.  Every pop was perfect and we always have very few old maids.  This purchase was a "refill" for us as we had finished our last Bob's order.  We are repeat purchasers and love it.

I bought this charger for our recent Christmas trip home.  What can I say?  It worked perfectly well for my Samsung S4 and my wife's iPhone 5s, both plugged in together at the same time.  Phones stayed charged and kept us happy.  As compared to others we have owned over the years, this car charger has a much smaller footprint and doesn't stick out of the socket very far.Thanks Accu-Charge!!

I have always used White Vinegar in my Keurigs, but decided to try this citric acid based cleaner to see if I was perhaps missing something.  You get three uses per bottle, so already that is a great bargain over the Keurig branded cleaner, which I found needed the entire bottle added to work.  As for citric acid over standard white vinegar, I can say I feel it cleaned better.  I clean every two months, as recommended in the manual of my K75, and with my first CleanCup cleaning, the machine sounded less "congested" afterwards.  It seems to run quieter during its pumping process.  I also received a much more solid stream of coffee coming out of the KCup into my mug.I still have two more uses of CleanCup, but so far think the citric acid accomplished more than white vinegar.

I bought these socks to wear within a new pair of Danner boots I received prior going into snow country this Christmas.  I must say I am impressed in their quality, their warmth, and being made in the USA.  I can already tell I will own these woolen socks for many years to come.What I found important, after warmth, was that they actually stay up on your calf as you continue to wear them.  There is nothing worse than your thick socks falling down and bunching into your boots, requiring you to take off your perfectly fitted mittens to pull up your socks.  You almost never quite get the mitten on again as perfectly as when you first went out into the snow!Great sock.  Very warm.  Very thick.  Made in the USA.  Perfect!
Strange game that is very addicting.  My children love it (4 and 7).

My children loved Planes.  In enjoyed the Navy parts but in general, I felt Planes was substantially lacking some depth.  I just didn't care about the characters and I rolled my eyes at the attempts to pull a laugh out of the kids using bathroom humor.  Planes Fire and Rescue though, now this is a different picture all together.The kids once again loved the characters and the flying, but I felt myself getting hooked on the story and character development.  It became a classic for us during the summer and once released on Blu Ray, I had to buy it.  It makes me wonder, to complete the trilogy, if the third movie is going to be even better?  The do seem to be tracking that way.

This is really a fantastic product and made in North Carolina.  The fabric reminds me of a thick cotton duck.  It holds an amazing amount of wood and I was impressed with its size right out of the box.  This only my second week of usage since purchasing on Amazon, but so far things are holding up quite well.  We'll see with time, of course, but I have a feeling I'll have this carrier for a long time.

If your commute is exactly the way this app thinks you should go, then you might get some use from it.  If your commute route can vary depending on traffic conditions, like mine, suddenly this app is pointless.

I enjoy this brand and this scent.  I was confused by some of the reviews as they mention sweating.  Having switched to deodorant only and no longer using anti-perspirant 7 years ago, sweating is par for the course and natural as well.  Why did I switch?  I discovered that I had a tumor that developed under my left armpit.  It was benign and the doctor recommended I stop using anti-perspirant after explaining how the aluminum worked.  After some time of not using anti-perspirant, the tumor went away.  That was enough for me.I picked up Every Man Jack sometime ago at a local grocery and continue to use this brand.  The scent is not overpowering and my wife likes the smell.  I do not have to reapply throughout the course of the day.  I also travel extensively for my job and never had any issues with soft or melting deodorant.  It goes with me everywhere I travel in my dop kit.I think people confuse deodorant for anti-perspirant and wonder why they feel sweat.

This toy was a little tough to put together using the included screws as not all the holes entirely lined up.  After a few tries, it began to go smoother and soon the M4 was built and I must say it has survived quite a bit of play with a 4 year old boy.  The tracks come off occasionally, but are easily reattached.  I was worried about the machine gun that is detailed on top of the turret, but it also has continued to survive.On the underside you can tell where batteries were supposed to go at one point when the model must have been sold as a moving tank.  That compartment is sealed and inaccessible.For a snap together model, this tank surprisingly makes for a great toy.  I recommend.

My family loves WoT on our XBox 360, so I thought purchasing this would be a nice change from being glued to the television.  We have thoroughly enjoyed the multitude of cards and the drawings/paintings on each card are really top notch.  Even now the kids continually pull the box off the shelf and go through the cards for fun.We did find ourselves confused on the game rules and I have been searching for a better explanation online.  Our first confusion came during the reading of the rules and after following the instructions on how to set up the table, we were left perplexed as to what we were supposed to do for the first play of the game.  We hadn't even started playing and already we were scratching our heads.Still researching and want to learn to play.  I give 4 stars for the potential and the cards being really great looking.

Upon receiving this purchase to replace my last Staples branded shredder, I was instantly amazed at its weight and size.  Though accomplishing 4 more sheets of shredding power, this shredder is half the weight of my previous micro-cut shredder.  The footprint is far smaller as well.  Very pleasantly surprised by both aspects.  Add in the fact that it is also half the decibels, suddenly its a real winner in my open floor plan house.I ran into some slow-down when grinding through junk mail.  Though technically only 3 sheets of junk mail, I guess when folded three times, like a normal envelope fold, plus two sides of envelope, the page count is suddenly upwards to 10-12 sheets.  Add a sheet or two and you compound the issue.  Compared to my Staples micro-cut shredder, the junk mail always had to be opened to shred.  This Amazon shredder at least gives it a good grind and gets through it slowly.  I have my letter opener handy and slice through the paper to feed the beast.To date, I am very impressed with this Amazon branded shredder.  It's so much smaller, lighter, and quieter than the previous one I owned.

We love this product.  This is our 3rd purchase of the same Cal-Mag.  When taken in the evening, it puts me in such a relaxed state, far better than any chamomile tea.  Not being a scientist or dietician, I have no idea why Calcium and Magnesium does this.  It was recommended by my Chiropractor after several visits for neck tightness which was casusing headaches.  I believe he uses a different brand, but we liked this brand for the 2 to 1.  My wife has issues with too much magnesium, so we had to avoid that.  She can sip this daily and has no problems.The bottle claims it has a delightful lemon flavor, but we beg to differ.  It has no lemon taste, but does have a citrus tartness to the hot water.  I add a squirt of lemon juice.  I have even added apple juice and I suddenly have a weak hot apple cider to sip.  But lemon?  No, not really.  We have to add to it to get something more that tart hot water.

My father has the Garrett branded digging tool and I bought this one to try something different, as his feels a little cheap.  This Lesche tool blew me away with its quality.  It just feels heavier and more rugged.  When I showed my father at our next detecting session, he showed me how he had bent the tip of his Garrett already on a root and clearly the Lesche would not suffer the same fate.  It is far better constructed and a thicker metal material.  Great digger!

Believing one of the previous reviews, I was hoping this armband would hold my S4 in its Otterbox Commuter case.  It does, but not without some snipping of the armband material and a bit of wrestling.  So, does it fit while still within its case?  Yes.  It takes me a good minute of positioning, squeezing, pushing and tugging to get it fully seated into the armband.  My dog hates this timeframe as he stands by the door.Outside of that, it works fine enough.  Sometimes the clear material on the face of the armband that allows you to access the touch screen of the phone, doesn't work 100% and I have to pause my jog to really get a good press of the buttons.  The band fits my upper arm in the larger of the two slots.  When on my arm, it is on for the duration of the run and does not slip down.  The interior of the case is always devoid of sweat, which is impressive to me.If the Commuter case was a little easier to slip off and on, I'd probably spend that time doing that instead and neatly slide the naked phone into the armband.

I had never considered having a bird app.  We have our books, but I thought an app would be perfect for the kids and us.Unfortunately, we have found that it runs very slow on our Kindle Fire HD.  It also crashes often with a very innocent, "Birds must close."  Sometimes we will have the entire list of birds to peruse, as we chose to download the 900mb offline file, and other times we will not.  It just simply is not there.  Often a crash follows this behavior.I feel this app was designed for another platform and poorly ported to Kindle.

This syrup is a very flavorful syrup which leads me to wonder if it is Extra Dark, but it might lean towards Dark.  Perfect for my family as we practically sip real maple syrup with straw.  Never any flavored corn syrups in this house.  We tend to purchase only Maine syrups, but gave this a try and love it.  Highly recommend.
Good look and information is tight and readily available.  Unlike the TWC app, this doesn't try to be hip and social media like.  Just the weather, please.  WeatherBug fits the bill.  Love it.

We got these to compliment a pair we purchased for my children so we could attend a Monster Jam event.  My wife and I found these to be a very comfortable fit and we wore them almost all of 2 hours .  I have a big 7 1/2" noggin, so use that for your own comparisons.  This price beat any others we looked for and we were very happy with the results of our shopping around.

If not careful, these ears can scrape children's faces.  The black section in the photo is actually two layers, the first, closest to the head is soft cushion.  The second section of the black is an sharp edged piece of hard plastic.  On their first wearing, my daughter removed her Neikos and instead of pulling them out and away from her head, she grabbed one side and pulled forward.  This left the other ear still on her head and that sharp edged black section, scraped forward all the way across her cheek.Some tears were had at the event, but we instructed her how to better pull these Neikos off her head.If adults try to wear these, they are very tight squeeze.  We were at a Monster Jam show and if I had to wear these the entire performance, I would have had a headache.  For children, these are a perfect fit (6 and 3).

I had read the descriptions here of finely chopped tea in this Yorkshire Gold Tea, but was really surprised to see how fine it was.  One reviewer said it was like coffee and I have to agree.  I do not have a strainer fine enough to trap all the tea and end up with extra on the bottom of the cup.  That is my only reason for the deduction of 1-star for my review.  I find the tea to be flavorful and milk compliments it nicely.  I do not sugar up and simply like tea and a bit of milk.  At work I will even drink it black.  It tastes good and is aromatic when the bag is opened.  I just need to get a finer strainer than I currently use!!

When it arrived it was much smaller than I was expecting.  It is only a 1-liter kettle, but in my mind that was going to be much larger.  Nonetheless, it is a perfect size for the cabinet and the cord is removable, stored within the kettle.  It is marked as holding 6 cups, but when I make my tea, my mug is about 3 cups, so unsure what exactly a "cup" size is!  I use about half the boiled water.The kettle is very fast and boiled the liter worth of water in approximately 3 minutes.  I say 'approximately', because I did not time it, but rather it was the time for me to get out my mug, get the tea, fill the strainer, get out the milk, etc.  By the time it was all done, the automatic shut-off on the kettle was going off and the boiling stopped.I do not know what its longevity will be like, but at this Amazon price, whatever use I get out of it, will be more than paid for.  I'll just get another at that time!

Upon breaking the seal and taking my first whiff, the smell of this Special Reserve was very spicy, but the smell of the alcohol was quite strong.  I had my doubts at first.  I do not often mail order after shave and never one that I have not tried in the past.I went to the bathroom, had an afternoon shave, and applied Special Reserve.  Immediately scents of cedar, leather, and spice filled the bathroom.  I was amazed.  It smelled nothing like it did in the bottle.  This is a must-apply to get the real scent.Then for the real test, I got myself dressed and was going to go out to see my wife.  She wasn't downstairs, so I waited.  When I heard at the top of the stairs, she declared that it smelled "very manly" in the house.  I laughed.  She expanded her comment as she came down the stairs.  She said it smelled like I had been outside, maybe working with wood and maybe a little woodsmoke.  She then got close and said it smelled different nearer me.  She could smell the leather undertones and the spice, perhaps musk.  I asked if she liked it and she did.  It was different than any other I have worn in the past.The initial punch of smell lasted about 30 minutes and as the evening wore on, I noted I could still smell the spice/musk, but the cedar was almost gone.  For me it was perfect.  It is not cologne, but rather after shave.  Cologne should last you all day.  After Shave is a nice scent but doesn't linger.  I like this Clubman Special Reserve very much.

It does not appear to be a simple project when you release it from its storage bag, but in reality, it only takes but a few moments of time to install.  With this current cold, cold weather I decided to "store" the fireplace for a few days and this draftstopper does a fine job of blocking the flue on our newer model fireplace.  Your hands will get sooty when installing this properly in a used fireplace.  So always be prepared to wash up.Unfortunately the draftstopper made me realize that my cold drafts were more than just the flue.  My fireplace was very drafty around the edges as well.  I never knew that and the Battic Door product is helping me draft-proof my fire box in total.Thank you, Battic Door Energy!

I had previously ordered this play set for my daughter's growing Infinity collection, but we saved it for Christmas.  She immediately wanted to play it that Christmas Day and as we set into playing, at first she was in awe that it in was Radiator Springs.  She had a good laugh at all the tractors and other characters from the movie(s).  There was a lot of pointing at the screen in our first sessions.  When Finn McMissile was introduced, her glee couldn't be contained.For the first day or so of playing, she was happy enough that it was simply Cars.  But I noted that after those initial gaming periods, she began requesting older playsets, like The Incredibles.  I wondered what was wrong.She explained and I will translate the 6 year old's explanation: being that you control cars, there is a lot racing to be done.  Whether an actual side by side race, or one where you chase down an errant vehicle, and she does not understand racing.  She is not very good at racing and loses every race that the game throws at her.  Her frustration begins to build until reaches the point where she'd rather play another playset or Toy Box mode.As the adult I have raced with her and tried to let her win, but unfortunately, the opponents (like Chick Hicks) aren't so nice.  Every race comes off as a do-or-die, must-win situation and each racer is very competitive and will use the sideways bash move to get you out of the way.  I have tried to beat the race and even I found myself growing frustrated at the opponents.  I wish there was a way to "dial down" the race aggressiveness.I think she is a little young for this title, which surprised me based on the characters and theme set.  She is enjoying the time spent around Radiator Springs, but each new 'quest' brings on a new race and she wants no more of that.

This is the product Keurig should have developed to make the Vue a stronger system.  Standard K-Cups are everywhere these days and almost every box store has their own variations of K-Cups as well.  But Vue?  Not so much.  We fell in love with the features of the Vue, but after 1.5 years of ownership, we find the lack of Vue cups to be frustrating.My wife introduced this K2V Cup to me prior to Christmas and try as we might, could not get one until now.  It really works well.  The K2V Cup is really two products in one: the standard KCup adapter and a brew-your-own adapter.  The brew-your-own fits inside the standard KCup adapter.  The adapter has a pointed needle at the bottom to make the hole in the standard KCup plastic bottom.  The brew-your-own adapter is hollowed out on its bottom to fit over the needle.On the first usage, I wasn't sure how the standard KCup would fit the adapter.  With the brew-your-own adapter out, I slid my first KCup in and knowing I had to puncture with that bottom needle, I simply pressed down until it seated itself in the adapter.  There was a very satisfying 'pop' as it punctured and the KCup is nice and snug.  I had no fear of it separating from the adapter.The adapter with KCup fits the Vue system perfectly with no hang ups.  I adjusted for my 10oz "thicker" cup of joe and let the Vue do what it does.  Voila.  It works and without any mess.  The used KCup is removed by just grabbing its top and lifting out.Thank you EZ Cups/Perfect Pod folks.  You have definitely breathed life into our 1.5 year old Vue system.January 21, 2014 Edit:  I wanted to delve into K Cups themselves.  We have found in our daily usage of the K2V Cup and our various K Cups, there is a definite difference between the foils tops on the different brand K Cups.  A little background first - when you insert a K Cup into the K2C Cup, there is a needle at the bottom to penetrate the bottom of the K Cup (this produces a nice popping sound).  This also seats the K Cup into the K2V and makes it snug.  When you close your Vue door, the needle in the hatch penetrates the foil lid of the K Cup.  When you remove the used K Cup, you find the two holes.  The foil lid has a nice, neat needle hole as well as the bottom.What we have discovered to date is that Green Mountain branded K Cups have no issue.  So far we have utilized Breakfast Blend, Lake and Lodge, Sumatran, Newman's Own, Our Blend, and Vermont Country Blend.  The Starbucks branded K Cups also have no issue.  So far we have used House and Sumatran.The Caribou branded K Cups DO appear to have an issue.  So far we have only used one box of Daybreak Blend.  The foil lid appears thinner or a different material.  When you extract the Caribou K Cup, the foil top is completely crushed inward.  Instead of a neat hole, the foil lid has a large, dime sized hole.  This exposes the fine grounds of coffee and we have experienced some grounds in our coffee and machine.  I clean these out with a couple small empty runs of water.February 8, 2014 Edit:  I have since experimented with Eight O'Clock Columbian variety.  I also have no problems with this brand in terms of the puncture on the lid being too large.

He asked for a "roller" for Christmas (we have a large number of road projects in the vicinity of our neighborhood and he sees them all the time).  I was glad Amazon carried this Bruder toy and it was a big hit at Christmas for a 3 year old.  As the adult, I was very impressed with the workmanship and detail in a child's toy.  As the child, he loves gripping it and rolling over anything in his path.  Overall size is smaller than other Bruder machines, but watching real rollers interact with bulldozers, the scale is correct.  Rollers are smaller than other machines on the road project.

The only flaw I can find in the product is that the removable plastic cover (the right side of the product in the photo, with the hinge), too easily comes off while sharpening.  I find myself gripping the sharpener with my left hand, but far enough over to also grip the removable cover just beyond the "wall".  I see no safety issue with this as the axe blade is within the wheels and below finger level.Outside of that strange grip I have to do, the axe blade itself comes out with a sharpened edge after a few swipes.  Perfect for quickly honing the hatchet before making kindling wood from my cords of cut firewood.

I was hoping for a RevWar calendar that included small daily details about events that occurred on any given day during a particular month.  What you receive instead is a calendar with a large RevWar picture on the top half and then the month on the second half, but directly next to the month grid is a number of paragraphs of history pertaining to the month in question.  For example, April 2014 has a description of Paul Revere's ride, but the actual day of the 19th on the calendar grid is a blank.I think this calendar could have been so much more.  It works though and is beautiful hanging on my wall.

We knew the blower was not included, but just wanted to make sure future readers knew that.  This mattress worked like a charm during this previous Christmas house traffic and the guests we had.  I did not sleep on the mattress, but can report that those who did couldn't say enough about it.  We wanted the two twins to separate them, but ended up not needing to.  We then used it as a single, very tall twin and the people who slept on it loved it.

Bread knives are always so expensive.  Yet we stumbled on this and got it thinking we'd only be getting what we paid for.  I am happy to report this knife is fantastic on my wife's daily homemade wheat loaf and her english muffins.  We are shocked at how well this knife works and for so little money.

My inlaws needed something to scoop their ice cubes, but to date had been using broken plastic cups.  The cold of the freezer would always eventually break the plastic and they'd have to get something different.  They had never seen this product before and wondered where this had been all their lives.  They report it by far exceeds their previous broken cups and should last them quite some time!  Great gift!

I gave this book to my history loving father for Christmas and I swear Christmas ended for him right then and there.  He retreated to the arm chair and with coffee in hand began reading.  I think he read for the remainder of the day too.  He was so impressed with the title, he wanted to know when future editions would be released?  Good question!

I was really surprised by Merrick.  My dog is typically hard to please, but he took to this brand in Lamb quite easily.  I love finally being able to have a dog food kibble that I can get through Amazon and no longer have to make my way to the pet store and ultimately pay too much.  We did have a laugh though because the big bumpersticker on the back of the bag is how the food is locally procured, yet the lamb is listed as coming from New Zealand?  Nonetheless, it is a quality product and my 10 year old Weim loves it.

The pictures are large and will be beautiful when filled in.  But in the meantime, we were very surprised at how small the coloring portions were.  My daughter is doing her best and she does typically color very well, but this is a challenge.  Her concentration gets tapped out while working on the pictures and she doesn't color as long as she typically does.  So I give it 4 stars for the end product, but for a 6 year old (the minimum age listed) it will be a long haul as she works on it.

Ms. Peikoff has written a savvy, interesting and engaging suspense thriller, in the vein of Robin Cook.  Its a fun read, and will make you think - not a lot, but enough to set this above other books in its genre.

This is the classic collection of Emerson's essays that was used as a text in my college classes.  It is a great resource, and I'm glad its finally found its way into an electronic format where a new generation of young thinkers can read and enjoy it.
This gave me everything I needed to adjust my watchbands.  Finally: I don't have to spend ten bucks every time I need a band replaced or adjusted. Its easy to use and includes all the right tools.

This is a terrific and simple to use set of exercise resistance bands.  They are color coded according to strength (yellow is the lightest at 2-4 pounds, red the heaviest at 25-20 pounds).  Basically, if you haven't used these before, they are flexible bands with carabiners at the ends to which you can attach handles.  They are fun to exercise with, and the set comes with a booklet describing a simple workout routine.  Also included is a simple cloth anchor to use for connecting the bands in a doorway.  I like the fact that I can exercise anywhere in relative privacy, and with minimal space requirements.My favorite feature is portability. I travel often, and the whole set fits in a small and compact bag, which is easy to pop into a backpack or a suitcase when traveling, so my "gym" can go everywhere with me.

I bought one of these mics just to use as an emergency backup, but as it turns out it has remarkably good sound, and I'm using it in my regular rig now!  It has a really tight cardioid pattern, which makes it a great mic in noisy settings! I rarely get any feedback from it.  It compares very favorably to my Shure SM58, which it is designed to look like as well as to my older Shure Beta Green mics.  My one caution is that the cable it ships with is an XLR to 1/4 jack, so if you want the best fidelity, buy a proper XLR to XLR cable with it.Overall, this is one terrific mic at an unbelievable price!
Tom Knox has done it again!  Here is another exciting, world spanning adventure, spiced up with some surprising historical and archeological backdrops.
These are my favorite guitar strings. They have a clear and bright tone, and stay in tune better than any other brands I've used.  I replace the high "e" string with a meatier gauge though.

This digital alarm clock has a large, easy to read from any distance display and keeps excellent time.  There is a battery backup to keep it running even if there is a power failure. It is not glamorous, but it is enormously functional.

This is a gorgeous and informative volume. In addition to having beautifully rendered reproductions of manuscript pages, this book offers a comprehensive account of the history of illuminated manuscripts, and offers a clear picture of the industry behind their creation. It dispels the notion of the lone mad monk laboring away in a monastery and replaces the romance with a practical description of how they were made.  Fascinating to read and lovely to look at, this book deserves a spot on your top shelf!

Once charged (see note!), the phone works very nicely.Using the android setup app that opened automatically on startup, I easily added my account and contact info, setup the security features and made my first phone calls.The physical appointments of this phone are nice - it has a big (5 inch) attractive, colorful and easy to read screen. Netflix movies look great!A metal strip surrounds the screen, adding a nice touch of elegance. The plastic back has a leatherette texture which feels nice in the hand.Internet connectivity is good.  At home, the Dash found both of my wifi networks and easily connected. Once online, my browsing experience is smooth and effortless.  The powerful processor in this device is really evident when browsing, streaming video or listening to music. No buffering or interruptions.With bluetooth on I easily found and connected to several different headsets.Phone calls are efficient and clear, although I wish I could boost the volume a bit higher. Its a bit quiet.The sim card I used is a T-Mobile that I've had for about ten years - and the phone had no problem setting it up.I'm new to the Android OS, but found it easy to use and efficient.Note: This was not a difficult setup, but it was not a quick start either, as the battery was not anywhere close to being charged when it arrived. You need to fully charge before using this phone. Plugging in is simple - and there are indicator lights on the phone - a red one while charging that changes to green when charging is finished.Be patient: Using the included charger, mine took over 4 hours, after some false starts (there were a few warnings from the phone that my "battery is too cold - please unplug from the charger". For my second charge-up, I used the charger from my Lumia Windows phone - it charged the phone much more quickly. I've been topping up with a dc charger in my car and it works fine.Although this phone multitasks very nicely, be aware that the battery life is much better when you remember to turn off apps when you are done! I've noticed that apps open on shutdown reopen at startup! The Dash M. has a "recent apps" button right on the home screen, so its not hard to turn off apps when you're done. If you have a lot open there is a "clear all" option to close them all at once, a good idea when you are shutting down.Overall, I'm impressed with this phone. It is simple to use, has a deep feature set, a clear screen and good, if quiet sound.

My elder daughter has thick, wavy hair that is prone to frizziness.  She thought this product did a good job of helping to tame the frizz while making her hair look sleek and shiny.  Yet it isn't overly heavy or greasy like some oil products she's used in the past.  Overall, seems to live up to the claims.

This folio planner/appointment book has a fairly stiff cover.  The paper is of good quality and is easy to write on without much ink bleeding (if you use a felt tip pen).  It is well made and durable, and it should survive a student's routine well.

My teenage daughter has thick wavy hair.  She often complains about how unmanageable it is.  She was excited to try this product.  Overall, it was successful.  It gave her hair a more finished look and tamped down the frizz she sometimes experiences.  On the other hand, it left her hair a bit crusty and crunchy, not soft.

My wife and daughters started shaving with conditioner instead of shaving gel not long ago.  This foam-free shaving cream provides a similar experience.  The product creates good lubrication for the blade and leaves my face feeling soft and calm, not irritated.  I don't know exactly what the "Dead Sea minerals" are doing, but they certainly don't seem to be hurting anything.  The cream washes off easily when you're done shaving.  The fragrance is subtle.  Overall, a nice shaving cream.

This little robotic vacuum actually does a pretty good job on our carpeted and hardwood floors.  After charging, we set it to its default pattern.  It cruises around, changing direction and pursuing various directional strategies when it bumps something or runs into the included "invisible wall," which we used to keep it from running over an electric cord.The capacity is pretty small.  It filled up within a few minutes when we first ran it.  It isn't a full substitute for a regular floor vac, but it will certainly let you go longer between thorough floor vacuumings.  The little side brushes are effective at pulling small bits of debris into the path of the rotor brush's suction.It effectively returned itself to its charging base when it ran low.My only complaints are that it's a bit noisier than I'd hoped--sounds a bit like a kid's toy running around--and that the dirt cup fills a bit faster than I'd hoped it would.  (That's a mixed complaint.  It actually reveals that the vacuum is a bit too effective at picking up dirt and pet hair.)Overall, this is a pretty good robotic vacuum and is worth checking out if you're in the market.

Our thirteen-year old wanted to see what the SATs would be like.  The Kaplan practice tests offer numerous questions designed in the vein of the SAT, allowing test takers to learn the relevant kinds of analysis and test strategies.  Our daughter found this challenging but liked seeing what SAT tests would be like.  Kaplan is a pretty well-regarded name in test preparation, and this book is consistent with their reputation.

These are lightweight packing cubes.  They are a very light ripstop nylon and can hold your sundry socks, undergarments, and lighter clothing, making it possible to fit more in a larger suitcase or travel bag.  I wasn't knocked out by the quality -- the zippers are pretty average, and they don't feel like they would stand up to a lot of abuse.  I used them recently for a weekend trip, and they were fine for my underwear and dress socks.  In all, a decent value, even if not quite as robust as I would have hoped.

I have used this to give my wife foot massages.  It absorbs well, has a pleasant fragrance, and leaves her feet feeling soft, including the skin by her heels, which can get dry.  Whether the minerals have benefits above and beyond other creams isn't apparent, but they certainly don't seem to be hurting anything.

Our five cats usually eat Iams or Science Diet.  They seemed to like this food -- none of them turned up a nose at it.  We didn't observe any uptick in the number of hairballs they had, etc., and they did not appear to have any digestive problems with this food.  If your vet clears it, it's a decent dry food.
My elder daughter has thick wavy/curly hair.  This Dove creme helps to soften her hair and gives it a substantial shine.  She finds her hair to be more manageable when she uses the creme.

This watch is a pretty good value.  The fit and finish are excellent, and it is an accurate timepiece.  The stainless case and bracelet are polished to a brilliant shine.  The watch has a classic appearance and can be adjusted to fit wrists of different diameters.The crystal is slightly rounded and contributes to the elegance of the piece.  Overall, this is a nice watch for the price.

I have had a few OtterBox cases over the years.  They typically are well designed and nicely finished.  This Symmetry series case for the S6 is no exception.  It isn't as bulky as the Defender series cases, but it still protects the phone from minor drops and bumps.  The cutouts all line up properly, and the switches function without difficulty.  In all, it's a pretty good case if you're looking for something effective but don't want to carry a humongously chunky case on your phone.

This grooming kit comes in a nice, supple leather case.  However, it seems quite overpriced for what it is.  You get 1) a metal file and nail cleaner; 2) a manual nose and ear hair trimmer; and 3) a cleverly designed set of clippers with a retractable lever.  After using the set, I think the clippers are the only element that reflects typical Henckels standards and quality.The file is fine for what it is, but it's nothing special.  It's a stainless steel nail file with a decent finish.The real downfall of this kit is the rotary trimmer.  It is a manually operated trimmer (i.e., you have to hold the mid-barrel piece and spin the cutting shaft assembly by hand).  And it does not cut hair so much as it pulls it out.  It was an unpleasant experience to use it on nose hairs as some of them are growing from highly sensitive areas.  In the past, I have used a Panasonic battery-powered trimmer and never had a similar problem; the Panasonic cut the hairs with a rapidly spinning blade.  This trimmer, on the other hand, is difficult to operate because you cannot hold it perfectly still while also spinning the cutting shaft assembly with your other hand.  Sure, it isn't going to cut your flesh, and it feels substantial.  But unfortunately it appears to have been designed for masochists.  There is a small brush inside the base of the trimmer to help wipe away the follicles the trimmer pulls out with the hairs.  This device appears to be the principal reason the kit costs so much, and it ruins the value of the kit.The nail clipper is fine and sharp.  You operate it by pulling the lever to extend it from the body of the trimmer and then, once it pops up, by pushing it forward to put it into position to generate leverage.  The clippers are sharp and work well on fingernails.  But they alone are not worth the price of admission for this kit.If I were to receive this as a gift, I would suspect that the giver was trying to punish me for some (imagined) slight.  Better than being sealed behind a brick wall perhaps, but only just.Not recommended.
My wife tried this cream.  It is light, not greasy, and does help reduce morning puffiness.

My elder daughter loves seaweed snacks, and these are one of her favorites.  The brown rice gives the snack a crispy crunch that isn't present in basic nori seaweed snacks.  She loves the texture and the flavor.  Recommended.

My wife loves foot massages, and this foot lotion is a great addition to a foot massage.  The lotion softens her feet and leaves them feeling supple.  She says her feet feel more comfortable after I use this during a massage.  Whether the fact that there are minerals from the Dead Sea in the lotion makes a difference to its performance isn't clear, but isn't it pretty to think so?  It's a hint at something exotic for something that, at bottom, isn't that sexy or romantic for most people (foot lotion).

This is one heavy cast iron dual-burner griddle/grilling griddle.  The iron includes the Gorham foundry marks on the handles.It supposedly comes pre-seasoned.  However, we followed the instructions and seasoned it by coating it lightly with oil and baking it for an hour at a moderately low temperature.  With cast iron, you don't use harsh soaps to clean it.  You want to build up a "patina" to keep the product well seasoned.  Cleaning it is a little difficult, however, simply because it is such a heavy item.As for performance, it's great.  The smooth side works great for tortillas, and the grill side is deep enough that the meats you cook develop decent marks and don't just sit in their own juices.Overall, this is a great piece of cookware.  Just keep in mind that it's quite heavy and difficult to maneuver when you're cleaning.

My wife and daughters are enjoying this electronic manicure tool.  It's like an electric toothbrush for nails.The motor causes the head to oscillate quickly.  The three interchangeable heads allow you to shape/file nails quickly, to smooth the tops of the nails, and to buff/polish the tops of the nails.The only step that you really need to be careful with is the second one, as it can be damaging to your nails/nail beds to reduce their thickness too much.The heads are shaped well and my ladies are all able to get at the full surface of their nails.It's not too loud either.Overall, it's a helpful tool if you want to try something other than the old emery boards and buff boards.  As I said, it's like the electric toothbrush of nail care.
Our daughter loves these socks, which are soft yet do not slip on tile or hardwood flooring.  They have stood up well so far to laundering.  Its' a good sock for shoeless activities.

I was bowled over by these headphones.  They have tremendous build quality for a portable set, and the sound they produce from unamplified  sources is full and detailed.  My only complaint is that I wish they had a longer cord.
Cooks rice perfectly and includes detailed instructions.  As good as our Zojirushi.  Cooking bowl is easy to clean.

This travel alarm clock is a very basic clock with a few neat features.  First, it can run from power from a USB port on a computer or a USB charger through a micro USB input on the side of the clock.  A cable is included.  When it is powered from a USB port, it constantly projects the time on the ceiling through a lens on the top right side of the clock.  Also, when running from USB power, it is possible to charge a 1.0A device from an output port on the side of the clock (same side as the input).  This output will not work if only using two AAA batteries.My only real complaint is that the LCD is difficult to view from certain angles and looks almost blank.  Also, the image accompanying this product does not accurately depict the screen, which is a standard silver screen with dark numbers.Overall, it's a decent, functional alarm clock.  It does not have the radio feature that some La Crosse clocks have, so it's up to you to set the time.  The AAA batteries (not included) are supposed to last about a year.

With the ET-4500, Epson took one of its multifunction small office printer/scanner/fax machines and added a massive amount of ink capacity.I have Epson and Canon multifunction machines that are quite similar to this.  The cost of operating those machines per page is much higher than this one.  For about the same price, I can print a few hundred black text pages on my Canon or several thousands on this Epson.  It's refreshing that Epson isn't gouging for ink refills.The overall quality of the product is high.  It feels well put together, and the interface makes sense, although the instructions help in the early going.  The software works decently well, too.In all, this could be a small office beast.  It's nice not to have to fret about printing color pages given the much lower cost per page to operate this machine.

The bag is decently well made with substantial zippers.  For the heat retention, the insulation is a bit bulky.  The bag packs down reasonably well, but not nearly as well as many goose down bags made for hiking trips.  It's a little heavy, too.  But it works.  It is a mummy-type bag but is not too tight.  The toe box is reasonable.

My daughter loves R/C helicopters and small drones.  This one is tiny but has the benefit of a light "cage" that prevents the blades from bumping into things.The controller is responsive, but the drone is a little wild in flight.  She cannot get it to hover.  It lurches around.  Thank goodness for the integrated "cage" to protect it and the walls.She has better luck flying it outside where the somewhat exaggerated movements don't cause collisions with walls.In all, not a bad starter drone for kids, but be prepared for something that is a little hard to control.

This locker shelf fits our daughter's school locker and provides some extra space for books and binders.  The construction is sturdy and consists of a heavy gauge wire frame with a metal shelving surface that adds some structural rigidity.  We have not tried stacking it as we only have one unit.The finish in teal blue is decent without any glaring flaws.If you have a standard 12" locker and need some extra space to organize notebooks/binders/books, this is a good solution.
These caramels are soft but don't stick badly to their wrappers.  The flavor is wonderful, and the texture is creamy and smooth.  Great  treats.

We occasionally have birds hit our windows in the back of our home.  These films are easy to apply and are supposed to help birds realize the presence of glass.  They're not bad looking.  Recommended.If only people had invented these sooner, the terrible events portrayed in the famous Alfred Hitchcock film may never have transpired.

Brain cells . . . dying.  Derivative slapdash.  Better production in original Star Trek series.Cue Statue of Liberty.  You blew it all up!I was just waiting for Kevin Sorbo to announce that the food supplements they ate while in space ARE PEOPLE.

This planner is well made and laid out.  Our middle schooler loves it as an alternative to a smartphone phone calendar.  The front pocket isn't really all that useful for her, but your mileage may vary.

It's a bit expensive, but this notebook is worth it.The cover is the durable Five Star plastic cover that withstands all kinds of locker and backpack abuse.  This model has a cover over the spiral binding to keep things from getting stuck in it.  That's a nice touch.The paper is of decent quality and doesn't bleed from most pens' ink.Overall, it looks good and holds up well -- we've had several notebooks from Mead's Five Star line over the years and have never been disappointed.

We have used Preen off and on for several years -- more recently we've been using corn gluten meal, which has similar effects but is all natural.  The product works as advertised.  Once we have beds of flowers planted and established, we have used Preen to help minimize the appearance of weeds.  It works by keeping weed seeds from successfully germinating into viable plants.Overall, it's a fine product.  We do not use it around our vegetable garden, though, because why risk it?  Corn gluten meal has similar effects and dries out germinated weed seeds before they can grow.  The biggest difference is that corn gluten meal needs to be reapplied more frequently.

We have a daughter who is curious about the way things work and who loves learning about things.  This bug vacuum and critter barn set was right up her alley.The bug vacuum is a pistol-shaped device powered by two (included) AA batteries.  Pulling the trigger yields a low intensity vacuum.  (The company includes a tiny foam butterfly so you can see how it works.)  It isn't overwhelming, but it's enough to pull in small insects that aren't latching onto a surface.
