Our daughter used it to collect several crickets, fireflies, and even a bumblebee.The "barrel" of the vacuum contains a valve that the child can open or close to trap the insect within.  Once trapped, it's easy to transfer the insect to the critter barn for brief observation before freeing it.The whole set is pretty neat because kids don't have to touch the insects.  That minimizes the chance that the insect will be mangled or harmed.  And for some people, it probably provides comfort that those same fingers that are holding PB&J sandwiches haven't been all over some bugs moments before.In all, I'd highly recommend this set for kids who are interested in learning more about the insects in their yards.  It seems decently well made, and it is well thought out.

In the past, I have used heat guns from Craftsman and Milwaukee, mainly to strip layers of paint from woodwork.This Makita gets the job done, yet it is more compact than other heat guns I have used.  It is comfortable to hold.  There are a number of available attachments to concentrate the heat output for specific types of jobs.  With the adjustable heat, the gun is quite versatile.  I used it successfully to soften and remove paint.

These are no-frills silicone baking mats.  They have a simple design.  But they perform like champs.  My wife and I used them on cookie sheets while baking oatmeal and chocolate chip cookies.  The cookies released simply, and clean up was a breeze.  We're looking forward to trying them with other baking projects.

My daughter has some DIY synthesizer, drum machine, and delay effects boxes that use 1/4" connectors.  But she has a single amp.  This kit let her craft custom length cables to hook the components together in the way she wanted.Crafting the custom cables isn't hard.  This kit comes with a tool to cut and prepare the cable.  From there, it's just a matter of attaching the jacks to the cable.  It didn't take long at all to do that.  The jacks are of decent quality.We've had good luck with the Planet Waves line of products from everything from cables to guitar picks.  This kit is consistent with the quality we've come to expect.  It's a handy way to get short cables of the lengths you actually need.

This bargain shredder from AmazonBasics gets the job done if you don't have high volumes of documents to shred.  My wife is obsessive about eradicating our personal information from anything we throw in the trash.  This micro-crosscut shredder does the job.  Feed a receipt or other document in, and it pulverizes it into little rectangles.  It's quick enough for small jobs, and it isn't terribly loud.It's pretty compact, too, so it's not difficult to store when not in use.  It seems pretty well made and is a good deal at the current price.

This case provides a bit of protection, but the interchangeable bumpers look plasticy.  That is a shame given that Samsung finally decided not to have a plastic frame around the S6.  Overall, the case does not interfere with buttons, ports, or camera, and it will provide some protection against minor bumps and scratches.  But it just isn't quite as nice as the phone.

This is the second BLU smartphone I've had a chance to try.  I'm still impressed.  For a c-note, you can get an unlocked phone with Android Lollipop, a decent screen, a decent camera, and capabilities that match many competing brands that would cost you hundreds of dollars more.  Sure, this phone doesn't have a top-of-the-line processor or massive amounts of internal RAM or storage, but the storage is expandable through microSD cards.  And the RAM is not a problem unless you are someone who actually needs to be performing several tasks at once, and that isn't most of us.  For basic smartphone use, this phone is more than adequate.The build quality is fine.  It is plasticy, but for the price it's a much nicer phone than you might expect.  The included transparent cover helps to protect the plastic body against minor bumps and scratches.The phone has pretty good battery life, too.  It has a 3000 mAh battery that will keep you going all day, even if you're surfing the web over WiFi or watching a video.Call quality is fine.Lollipop is fairly smooth on this phone.  There are times when an app is a bit slow to launch, but I don't think that's unique to this phone: my Galaxy Note 3 has similar stutters and hiccups in Lollipop.Overall, this is a tremendous bargain smartphone.  If you're content not to have the absolute top-of-the-line phone and want to save yourself hundreds of dollars, check out BLU's offerings.

This Spanish moss worked well as a cover for an orchid pot.  But there is much more you could do with it.  Your imagination is the limit.The product was in good shape -- it wasn't broken down.  And there is enough here to provide decorative coverage for a few medium pots.

This portable automatic sharpener is working well out of the box.  It quickly sharpens standard wood pencils to a pinpoint and automatically stops when the pencil is sharp.  The motor seems plenty strong with fresh batteries.  Overall, it feels well made.  Time will tell how well it holds up, but, on first impression, this sharpener is pretty good.  If it has any issues down the road, I will update this review.

I hadn't used polystyrene balls before.  They're great.  These have a slight surface texture that make it easy to put spin on, and they bounce really well.  There are no seams -- each ball appears to be one piece.  They sound pretty similar in play.  Even some rough play didn't result in any cracked/split balls.

The flavor of this concentrated liquid tea mix is good; however, this 2.4 oz bottle doesn't go very far.  I find I have to add more than a quick squeeze to get real tea flavor in a beverage, especially when the water is cold.  This seems like a pretty expensive proposition at Amazon's current prices when compared with the powdered mix.

I have listened to music through headphones for decades, starting with a pair of AKG K240DFs back in the 1980s.  My preference is for a neutral sounding headphone with a slightly forward/detailed presentation.  That is not something easy to come by in sealed circumaural headphones in this price range, but Audio-Technica has managed it here.In terms of appearance, the headphones are well finished.  The gun metal/brown pleather look may not appeal to everyone, especially as AT has included some funky anodized-look red accents.  But to each his own.As for fit, they're circumaural (around the ear), not supraaural (on the ear).  The memory foam covered with pleather makes for comfortable pads that give decent noise attenuation.  You don't hear a lot of what's going on around you, and those around you do not hear what you're listening to.  I used these on my commute on mass transit rail, and they did a good job damping the sound of the El train.  However, they're a bit tight.  I wear a 7 3/4 hat, though, so my head is a bit bigger than average.The cord is detachable, which is nice.  However, because of its comparatively stiff jacketing and the way it attaches to the left earcup, it transmits a lot of "microphonic" cord noise to the left earcup.  In other words, when the cord moves and brushes or bumps against something, you'll certainly notice it -- sort of like a stethoscope.As for overall sound, I evaluated using three sources: my Galaxy phone, a HRT MicroStreamer (DAC and headphone amp), and a HeadRoom Desktop headphone amp with Class A upgrades.  Although a portable device can easily drive these, I found that the sound really benefitted from amplification, smoothing the treble response, which verged on grainy and harsh when driven from the Galaxy, and tightening and controlling the bass.  If you can afford a portable headphone amplifier, it will serve you well with these headphones.  These do have some emphasis in the bass.  Other than that, they're relatively neutral in the mids and treble.  They have excellent detail retrieval -- I could hear well into the music listening to FLAC files via the MicroStreamer and Desktop amps.These do not suffer from common sealed headphone problems such as recessed mids or an overly closed soundstage.  They're nowhere near as good as my Shure 1440s or AKG 701s (both of which are open designs) for a sense of air around the performance, but they're better than my Beyerdynamic 770s.  As an aside, imaging isn't really a headphone highlight area anyway unless you're listening to recordings made using a binaural setup.  Most stereo recordings are not engineered to image and soundstage well on headphones as opposed to speakers.  This has to do with the fact that, listening with headphones to stereo recordings that aren't made using a binaural setup, your right ear doesn't hear any musical information from the left channel and vice versa, although listening with speakers both of your ears do hear sound from both channels.)The overall sonic presentation is slightly forward and detailed, not smooth and relaxed (a la certain Sennheiser models).Overall, these are a solid set of sealed headphones that can be used at home or with portable devices.  They have an elegant, classic appearance and feel well made.My only substantive complaint is the cord microphonics, which are distracting when using the headphones in a portable fashion.

This haircutting kit has everything you need to do male grooming at home.  The clippers and included combs allow controlled length.  The included shears can clean up bangs, etc.  Best of all, it comes with a case that keeps everything organized when you're not using it.This is a corded kit with steel clipping knives.  They are sharp and cut without pulling the hair.  The motor feels capable and does not bog down in thick hair -- mine is quite thick.With a bit of training, you can save on trips to the barber with this set.  It's a pretty good deal.

I have used this Smooth & Silky version of Head & Shoulders shampoo for about a week and don't notice much difference from the original Head & Shoulders formula.  It lathers and rinses well, has a similar scent, and helps tamp down dandruff.  It leaves my hair feeling about the same as the original formula does.  (I have used Head & Shoulders off and on for years.)  My hair tends to be on the thick, straw-like side.  This does leave it feeling soft.

Our eight-year old daughter loves this toy.  She gets it swinging from her ankle and hops for minutes at a time.  The analog counter on the device works perfectly well.  I don't really see the need to upgrade to the optional digital counter as it seems like something that would render the toy more fragile (and more expensive).The toy does not require batteries unless you get the optional digital counter.

This "sherpa" fleece throw blanket is pretty well made.  One side features a simulated soft sheep wool, and the other is a satiny Union Jack.  It is warm.  I will update this review once I know how it stands up to washing.

This portable umbrella is pretty standard.  It is vented to reduce the chance that a gust of wind will turn it inside out.  It feels well made.  It's easy to hold with its rubber handle.  The auto opening mechanism works well.  Time will tell how it holds up.

We have five cats ranging in age from one to seven.  The veterinarian suggested that they get a bit of wet food from time to time to supplement their dry food diet.  They love these "Soft Loaf" portions.  The food releases pretty well from the container, resulting in a "loaf" on the bowl.  The texture is soft/pate, so the cats can lick it more than bite it, which is how cats prefer to feed on meats.  They inhale these.  The containers are recyclable, so you don't feel too badly about the waste packaging.

Neil Grimmett's The Hoard is a dark, scary, rough and tumble thrill ride that will have you turning pages for hours on end. This is definitely a "you can't put it down" book, and I way overspent my reading budget and lost a lot of sleep reading the book.The story takes place in England, in the Royal Ordnance Factory at Bridgewater. It is based on the actual event in June of 1951 when an explosion killed 6 workers. The blast was never explained. Neil Grimmett in The Hoard postulates what caused the explosion. We are taken through it in the first chapter of the book. Now fast forward 30 years to when Byron, the son of one of the victims as been clandestinely advised that the explosion was no accident and monstrous evil has been and still is taking place at the ROF. That the letter was sent by a seeming madman only complicates things.US readers will want to be aware that the book is written in UK English. I had no difficulty in understanding the "working class" dialect present in most of the book. Do keep in mind though, that I have worked for the British Diplomatic Corps for 4.5 years, and I am rather used to it.  I don't think that the few differences or slang words used will present a problem to the vast majority of readers from other countries.Mr. Grimmett does such a stunning job of intimately describing his characters and settings that this book will chill you to the bone and leave you gasping for more. You can tell when a character is influencing the main character Byron because he tells us what he is thinking and feeling in reaction to the character. Because the story is based on actual events, that feeling of believability and realism permeates the entire book. His portrayal of characters like Gunner, Daphne and Bates are so cinematic that I had no difficulty in picturing them easily. That is part of what brought the eerie and sometimes terrifying parts of the book to life for me. Much of the action takes place at night as well. So wandering around an old munitions factory still in use where extremely dangerous explosives abound and evil men are killing people that get in their way - you may need to sleep with the lights on for a while. I know I did.As the story progresses and the discoveries unfold and relationships evolve, we are pulled deeper into this dark and ugly story of what really happened.Mr. Grimmett delivers the technical expertise and wallop of Tom Clancy in his descriptive writing ability. He gets to an extreme level of detail with his characters, language and dialog;His story telling ability in The Hoard is phenomenal.The book comes to a logical and appropriate conclusion after an unbelievable roller-coaster ride and another near catastrophic explosion at the ROF Bridgewater facility.Just a warning to parents out there - This is an "R" rated book for language, violence and sexual situations. I would not advise under 17 year olds read it.In summary I would not hesitate to recommend this book to any adult reader out there that likes a good solid yarn skillfully executed. Thrill seekers, this will SO be your cup of tea. If you are looking for a gripping, edge of your seat can't put it down read, try The Hoard.NB a copy of this book was provided to me gratis in exchange for my honest review, which I have rendered herein.

The paranormal is not a genre I usually read. However, at the author’s request, I read a description of The Unearthed. I then read a short sample, and of course by then I was hooked, so I readily agreed to be scared to death reading it.Now, I had just moved into a new apartment at about this time, and I can tell you, I got so scared reading this book, that I had to go to sleep with the lights on for a while. And as a world traveler that frequently goes to a different country on business every other week, it’s not like I have a faint constitution or anything. This book was so well written that it really scared me reading it.In fact, I WAY overspent my reading budget, I lost sleep, and I just couldn’t put it down until I had finished it. And what an ending! A few reviewers have fussed about the ending, but to my reading, it makes perfect sense in the context of the story.Let’s just take a step back here: Evan Rowan is an understated, comparatively little known writer. That’s a mistake, and I am certain that we will see him climbing to the “A” list in paranormal writing soon. He is an undisputed master at descriptive story telling. He has a narrative strength that is really impressive when it comes to painting a very detailed, gritty picture of someone and what they think and feel and what motivates them. His character studies and alliterative skills paint a story picture that is believable, realistic, and very, very scary! It is very clear and obvious that he is a professional writer with a lot of experience. No grammar and syntax errors. No stage props showing through. It is seamlessly and professionally executed at a very high level. And I am ever so grateful for the lack of technical and typographical errors. Very few if any at all.I have seen some reviewers complain that Mr. Rowan inserted himself into the story. Well, I disagree. Clearly they are not students of cinema, as Mr. Rowan obviously took a page out of Mr. Hitchcock’s book of putting himself in his own movies in a very ingénue, vignette role.  If it’s good enough for Alfred Hitchcock, it is good enough for Evan Rowan, and I, for one, loved it.The way Mr. Rowan gives you his bleak descriptions and sub-plots within plots, it was almost for me like watching Liam Neeson in Taken(x) right there in the pages. His writing is outstanding.As to the story line, it starts off almost like a Ghost Hunters episode: A suburban unremarkable house wherein lives a mom, dad, and Billy, 13 year old boy. Blood drips into the basement. Billy is talking to an “invisible friend” that no one can see or hear. But weird stuff is happening in the house. Oh, and by the way, there were 3 murders in the house just a few years ago. The mom, the dad, the teenage son all killed…Enter the Ghost Hunters, Tim McCloskey and good for nothing little brother Eddie. Who have their own skeletons in the closet, so to speak.  Tim, the big brother, responsible for n’er do well Eddie… But why is that? Turns out we’re in for a surprise. Who was REALLY responsible for the death of their parents?As you read, the action gets more and more taut, the suspense builds, it gets ever more creepier and scarier, until a very surprising ending that you won’t see coming…. But boy, are you going to suck it down like a Hoover run amok!I honestly think that in addition to Evan Rowan’s descriptive ability to paint believable cinematic images out of his words, his depth of character study and his no-frills, no-nonsense, let’s not just be polite and tell it like it is here style make this book incredibly believable and credible, and just continue to grab you, buckle you in, and take you on this wild, nightmare ride until you reach the end… and you may be sleeping with the lights on too for a while. I know I was.If you like paranormal, if you like thrillers… or as I discovered even if you don’t think you do, I can recommend this book. The characterization, narrative, dialogue and horror are all pure gold. The unexpected twists and turns will leave you gasping... and reaching for the light switch.  Eddie and Tim (and Jackie, Talia, Billy, Eamon, Michelle, Moira and everyone else for that matter, even our puckish lottery winner) will make you want to know more about them. They will make you want to find out what happens next… which is just what I’m about to do, as I embark on the next book. But I have to wait until I’m on vacation, I cannot afford to lose that much sleep and go to work and function!So to sum up, Evan Rowan is a fantastic writer, I loved the book, and I can’t wait to read more of this spine-tingling, creepy, taut supernatural story in his next book.I would recommend that if you are considering the purchase of this book, read a sample. Does it speak to you? Does it reach out and grab you? Then grab it.Respectfully submittedDr. Geoff

*I received a copy of this book in exchange for my honest review, for which I am honored to oblige*Joshua Elliott James has a clear passion to be a writer. He can tell a good story.  While this book is classified as a novel or novella, at 36 pages I would classify it as a short story.  Given Mr. James’s gorgeous and eye catching cover art, I would say that his stories might actually work best as graphic novels.The story line resembles that of an Indiana Jones adventure, and with a female heroine as glamorous as Arcadia Jones, it has potential for being a really fun and exciting adventure story. But due to its length and its striking lack of detail where it is really needed, it struck me more as the Reader’s Digest condensed version of the Indiana Jones adventure. The story felt rushed. Even though the action was explosive and non-stop, it should not have felt as though the writing is rushed.I was very excited about this book; just the cover art alone is enough to stir the blood.  It is written in a present tense first person stream of consciousness style that when done right is unstoppable. But unfortunately, there is just not enough there. For example, Arcadia is considering where thieves might try to sell Da Vinci’s stolen books. She wonders about New York, but discards it because “it is her turf”. WHY does she consider it her turf? Who does she know that makes it unlikely? What does she know? There is so much there that is not said, it cries out (to me) to be detailed.I actually DID like the story for the non-stop action and adventure. There were a lot of issues that mitigated against that enjoyment.The paragraph about the Trevi Fountain in Rome is another great example. For people who live there, I understand, it is backdrop. But for everyone else, they really want to hear about the Trevi. The throngs of people, the sound of water, the ancient patina, the hordes of tourists and people trying to throw coins in and get photographs!  Many people dream of going there someday, or have been only once, and why not give them something they would recognize and relate to! Make it come alive! Not just a casual mention in the context of clothes shopping! Come On, a Harvard Archaeologist and Museum Curator can’t care less about the Trevi Fountain because she needs those red shoes for the Tango competition? Really? Really?As to the technical aspects of the book, there are issues.  This book is in serious need of editing and proofing, and Mr. James may want to consider finding himself a good proof reader for future revisions and future books.  Examples of grammar, syntax, tense and language errors abound.  Here are a few examples:“But Arcadia does not budge in.”“Murder happens again before she recovers the books and takes the first flight out which is to Australia and then to Spain where she is chased first by killers and then by the police who is accusing her having shot a police man.”“It’s a good job I love a challenge, but first I need to check the alleyway before I leave Rome.”In addition to the language and grammar problems there is an abundance of misuse of single quotes in this book and I am not really sure why.The story line has its challenges.  It was crying out to me for details, more details please! Cities like New York, Rome, London and Geneva – God they are oozing with character from hundreds of years! Please, a little detail! What’s nearby? What are the people dressed like, acting like? What are the smells in the air? Is it raining? What are people like in Rome when it’s pouring and you can’t get a taxi?  You get the idea.Now, as to the travel: My last tour of duty was with the British Diplomatic Corps. I was there for about 5 years. My remit called for travel to a different country every 2 weeks. So I know travel. Sometimes I was hopping from country to country for 3 weeks back to back, every few days a different city. Let me tell you – It is not as easy as Mr. James makes it sound!  Also, one MUST wonder, where is the money coming from that pays for all this?  The museum she curates? She does not have unlimited funds!  Someone has to stop and do the accounting and budgeting at some point!  And do you have any idea how TIRING that amount of travel in a short amount of time is? And the jet lag from going across 13 time zones and back?Unfortunately my sister is a Harvard trained Anthropologist and Archaeologist. She has had her own series of adventures going back many years, including the discovery of more than one lost language.  I understand that this book is a work of fiction, and should be treated as such. I have heard in great and intimate detail about some of these adventures – it actually made the book harder to believe.  I do understand that this is an action and adventure story, but some of what Arcadia does seems incredibly out of character for who she is purported to be.I am a published author myself. I write in a very different style and in different genres. Some people really like my writing and it moves them; some hate it, and think it garbage. Presumably there are lots in between.  So I find it very difficult to judge this book. This style of writing may be very desirable and enjoyable for many people.I would recommend that if you are considering the purchase of this book, in e-form or paper, read a sampling. Does it speak to you? Does it reach out and grab you? Then grab it.Respectfully submitted

*I received a copy of this book in exchange for my honest review, for which I am honored to oblige*Debra George has written a book of poems from A to Z - there is one for every letter of the alphabet - and one for many moods and emotions.I found that I could relate to some of these poems more than others.  In general though, they are written from the heart, with a deep desire and longing to help you get through your day as a mortal human on this planet, and as for that I think that they do a fair job.Debra has chosen a free form rhyming meter to express herself.  In some poems, the rhyming is forced and the meter is awkward. Still, as others have pointed out, I do not believe that she set out to be Housman or Whitman or Longfellow, just give us a bit of human understanding and relating to when we go through strong emotions.  It would be nice to see difficult emotions  in other than a rhyming meter.As to the technical aspects, other reviewers have spoken to the numbering issue.  Otherwise there were few errors, typographical or otherwise, for which I am truly grateful in this day and age of that lack of perfection for the printed word. The errors that I encountered were in tense (present instead of past) and where an extra word was left in that should have been removed in a line.I did like some of the poems such as Crazy, Anger and Zealous more than others.  I found I could relate to some more than others.  The one that I could actually relate to the most was Heartbroken.I also found that the underlying message from these poems is one of hopefulness and striving. There is a clear spirituality that comes through that I can appreciate. Yet it is not preachy nor is it telling us how we should be or act or feel; it acknowledges what we feel and gives us some companionship on the way.I am a published poet and author myself. I write in a very different style and in different genres. Some people really like my poetry and it moves them; some hate it, and think it garbage. Presumably there are lots in between.  So I find it very difficult to judge this book.  Were I to offer advice to Ms. George, I would strongly encourage her to keep writing. I would encourage her to get as much exposure and feedback as she could for her work. I would encourage her to join writer's groups and go to workshops. If that's what she wants to do. She may be content with right where she is.As others have said, I think I would recommend that if you are considering the purchase of this book, in e-form or paper, read a sampling. Does it speak to you? Does it reach out and grab you? Then grab it.Respectfully submitted,Geoff Parker, Ph.D.

I loved this second Old Guy book.  It was a little different from the first book in how the narrative ran, and the plat. But the characters and characterizations were excellent.  The enjoyment was very high for me.  Timothy writes so different from how David Weber writes, or how Keith Laumer wrote; yet it is every bit as enjoyable, gripping, and entertaining for me. I really like the concept of the human race having essentially evolved laterally into Bolo type autonomous cyber tanks. What a concept. In treating these machines as humans, and personifying everything about them, Timothy has successfully, in my opinion, managed to create and maintain a high level of interest, a high level of engagement, and a very imaginative plot line and story. Vampires and cyber tanks, who would have thought it. I will certainly be buying the next book, and plan to keep on until Mr. Gawne gets tired of writing them.

This is the second time I have used a Garcinia Cambogia product.  I was actually still using my last provider's brand when I had the opportunity to review this product.  I was getting EXCELLENT results from the other product, which I was so excited about, I reviewed as well.  You can imagine my surprise when I started getting even BETTER results with Nutrapure.The idea behind Garcinia Cambogia is to suppress appetite, suppress cravings, such as sugar cravings, burn fat, and promote lean muscle mass growth.  Sounds like a miracle cure.  IT ACTUALLY DOES THESE THINGS!  IT WORKS!I was previously on a medically managed diet. It was costing me a fortune. It worked for 2 years, and I lost over 40 lbs on it. But I hit a plateau, at the same time I hit stress from job change.I decided to strike out on my own, and began my own herbal diet.The first thing I noticed about Nutrapure's Garcinia Cambogia is that the capsules are a bit bigger than what I was taking before. The other thing I noticed is that if I took one in the morning, I did not get hungry all day. I did not feel like eating at all. None. Zilch. Nada. In fact, I had to MAKE myself eat something during the day.I took another one about 30 minutes before dinner, and my portion sized dropped to about 1/3 of what I had been eating. And I felt F-U-L-L!!! I don't mean satisfied. I don't mean comfortable. I mean I felt stuffed like I simply could not eat another bite.I thought it was a fluke, but it has been going like that since I started testing the product. I have lost 4 lbs. in just over a week. I did not change anything else.  Do keep in mind, I am taking dandelion root for a diuretic, and saffron extract as well. The only thing I changed to test the Nutrapure was swapping out this Garcinia Cambogia for the other brand.This one may be a little pricier than others, but I can guarantee you this is the one I am going with. In actuality, a 90 day supply works out to about the same as the other brand.And this product works.I would advise that it is a good idea to consult a qualified dietician or medical professional before embarking on any program that changes your supplement intake. Particularly be mindful of other factors that can effect your health and metabolism.Everyone is different, but for me, this has been a fabulous find, and I'm sticking with it.

This is a really good simple slot machine game. While there are in app purchases, you can enjoy the game just fine without buying. Excellent music and graphics. Good simple options. A ton of variety and new machines every day. Really fun tournaments. 1 Up is really good.

Wow, Wow, wow-wee, did I love this book. Hoo-Ra! Tim, ya done good!  I am a die-hard Keith Laumer Bolo fan. Which I guess makes me a David Weber fan, but not as much as I loved Keith's books. I INHALED Chronicles of Old Guy like a Hoover run Amok. In fact, I blew away my reading budget, and was over-drawn in that dept. and sleep-deprived for several days. And I didn't care. I loved it that much.Your irreverent, down to earth, stream of consciousness writing style, and natural flow as if a human is narrating just blew me away. And I'm a very hard man to impress. Forget the "sans peur et sans raproche", we're going straight to the "kill because that's what I do" approach. I loved the characterizations of the other tanks, the names cracked me up. I loved Mondocat. I loved the vampires, the library, Double-Wide. You named a mountain-sized killing machine that can pretty well raze a planet Double-Wide. I don't know, maybe it's a Massachusetts/MIT thing.I was born and raised in Newton, though now that I'm tired and old I've lived all over the world. But I sure recognized that style. I don't know if anyone compared you to Asimov recently, but there are aspects of Isaac's irreverence from the old gang that definitely shown through.So, not 24 hours after finishing the Chronicles, I've already bought SBC and the Library of Doom, and if you keep writing them I'll keep buying them! Your books so totally resonate with me that I am just an out of control giddy fan. Not the staid, laid back erudite professional I usually portray.Thank you so much for feeding my addiction, I really do appreciate it.  And at some point I'll catch up on the sleep. I'm really trying to throttle back on the reading a bit too, just to savor them and make them last a bit longer, but fortunately I can always re-read them.Please do not run out of ideas, get bored, or move on to something else. Just keep writing what you're writing. You're like the ultimate kluged up train-wreck of Doug Adams, Heinlein, Asimov, Laumer, Weber; like someone took their psyches and threw them in the blender on puree for a few minutes. And I am so freaking hooked on the results!Thank you!  Please keep writing them!

I have bought Omega Soul's Garcinia Cambogia twice now, and I will buy it again.  I was on a "medically managed" diet that was costing me about $160.00 a month, but after a while it just wasn't working. I decided to try herbal on my own. After all, I am going to have to sustain and maintain once I reach my goal weight.I was a bit leery about trying this, but the reviews looked good.  I'm very glad I tried it.  I have had no detectable side effects, and I have lost weight and inches.I am working out in a 50 minute regimen once a day, which includes either treadmill or swimming or stationary bike. I try to eat healthy and in much smaller portions.  After about 2 months, I am down 10 lbs. and 2 inches around the abdomen.  So I am making progress. I use the Garcinia exactly as directed.  I am also taking dandelion root, and saffron extract for an appetite suppressant, and I am really pleased with the results.This is a time of great stress for me. I am a stress eater.  So if I can do this under some of my greatest stress, I'm pretty sure it will keep on working.  I know that everyone has a different metabolism and a different set of health factors.  For me, this product is working and working well, and assuming it is a good fit for your condition, I highly recommend it.

Fantastic game from the Trese Brothers!  Corey and Andrew absolutely rock.  They are incredibly talented, and incredibly dedicated! They CONSTANTLY support and CONSTANTLY release updates, upgrades, and more for their games.  You never run out of variety in this universe. I'm in my 8th decade (73 years old) and have recently returned to riding horses again, after not having ridden or doing very much athletically for the past 30+ years.  I ride once/ twice per week, an hour each time plus doing the chores of mucking out the stall and grooming the large 15.3 hand tall horse,  I always take this 1/2 hr before I begin my barn activities, and take another dose 10 minutes before my ride, and take another dose immediately after my ride.  It works wonders.  Before, I would get off the horse feeling kind of achy and knowing I would be stiff the next day.  I swear by homeopathic treatments like this.  It still surprises me that the old timey scientists out there still resist homeopathic treatment.  Don't they know understand physics?  Everything is energy including them....and all medicines are energetic forces that coax (or forcibly slam) the body systems into curative patterns.  Homeopathy is gentle and effective without lasting oftentimes harmful/negative side effects.

Not just for competition horses.  Every horse, no matter what size or breed, and anyone handling horses (barn managers, owners, instructors, students, riders, grooms) would benefit greatly from the kind of care and maintenance described here.  The text is laid out in block and numbered paragraphs, supported by sharply focused, close up professional quality photos.  Easy detailed explanations that anyone can read and understand, from ages 8 through 100.  The spiral binding allows you to lay the book opened flat on any handy surface for easy reference while you're performing the various grooming techniques. Shows the correct and incorrect ways of doing things in photos as well.  The authors know what they're talking about, having taken care of horses owned and ridden by some of the most demanding owners in the world.  EXCELLENT gift for that horse lover friend of yours.  Christmas is coming soon and you need not wait to until then to gift it.

BEST STRONGEST GOOD GRIP QUALITY SUSPENDERS.....I purchased a black pair just to see what they were like.  Was so pleased with them, I purchased the hot pink set (they come in several other colors).  I use them with my riding breeches.  The back is helpful to my instructor since it sits dead center of my spine and waist lines so she can tell from a distance whether I am sitting straight and balanced in the saddle.  I also wear a constrasting color belt (bright red) so my riding instructor can also see from a distance whether I am sitting square and balanced on the horse.  Best of all.....these suspenders are strong and a comfortable width.....the aren't narrow and do not cut into my shoulders when they stretch.  I just wish these were sold in bright yellow and bright orange.  Other suspenders of this quality sell for much more money.  These are great quality for the price.

I've returned to riding after over 30 years.  I never had riding lessons.  I feel sorry for the horses I used to sponsor and ride because I knew nothing about a balanced seat, soft hands on reins, etc.  It was only because of the generous and kind nature of the horses I rode that I fell only once while riding miles of trails, alone, in the Golden Gate National Recreation Area (SF Bay area, Marin County coastline).I take this booklet with me to my riding lessons  (three thus far).  I gave a copy to my riding instructor who has incorporated it into my lessons. My confidence has increased because my balance has improved greatly, using Jan Dawson's clear, logical instructions.  My biggest "aha" moment was when I could stand up and sit and stand up and sit without my lower legs moving and without having to use my reins or my arms to balance.I would strongly urge every rider and riding instructor to get this book.  It lays out in easy to follow steps what I think is an achievable, solid, correct foundation to gain the "classical independent seat" I keep reading about in all the other books on "how to ride horses".  Yes, you do have to put the time in on the saddle to master these exercises.  However, if you follow the instructions correctly and in the order they are given, you will eventually get the proper, comfortable, rhythmic  feel of a well-balanced independent seat.Buy this booklet....it doesn't cost much.  The rewards will be priceless.  You will be riding correctly with a light and balanced seat, resulting in our horse being grateful that you aren't pulling on his mouth and thumping painfully on his back.
It's addictive in the most wonderful way.

Even experienced, long time riders can benefit from these books to fine tune their riding skills and to discover whether they have developed "bad" postural habits and how to change those habits and change their muscle memory to ride better.  These workbooks (see my review of Volume 2) should be in every instructor's and riders self-help riding library because the author explains in simple language, the how to and why of proper position....and also the why of postures that make you an uncomfortable and unbalance load for your horse (which results in the horse's tension and pain and possible injury).  Small books....worth every penny.

Sized to put into your tote bag to take with you to the barn for your lessons.  Easy to understand, with instructions on what to do, why you should do it, and graphic silhouette drawings to further explain the correct way to hold your body and the effect it has on your ability to maintain your balance in the saddle while maintaining the classic, deep seat of good horsemanship.  I have both volumes....Workbook 1 and Workbook 2.  I keep referring to both to remind myself and have been improving my chances to eventually achieve the balanced independent seat that takes a lifetime to achieve.  Practice, practice, practice with time in the saddle.  These workbooks will help you avoid making mistakes that become bad habits and give you clear explanations of why.

Did a lot of research on what materials should be used as a saddle pad to keep the horse comfortable and to prevent skin issues.  The best and most highly recommended are the pads made of natural fibers.  Which is why I chose these (I purchased two) which are all natural cotton and easy to put in the wash to keep clean.  The horse appreciates cotton in our warm-hot summer climate (north-west California, Marin County & Sonomal County).  These may cost just a little bit more, but you'll have a much healthier and happier horse under you.

Will be using this every day in my morning tea to keep my immune system protected.  I highly recommend this product and plan to purchase more products from this company.  Organic, wholesome, fresh and pure.  What more could you ask for in a high quality product?  I will also share my Chaga Mushrooms with my pets....making a tea and adding it to their meals.  You can learn more about using medicinal mushrooms  and proper dosages for your pets on Dogs Naturally Magazine, as well as other sites about dogs and dog health using plant based, non-synthetic ingredients.  Am so glad I found this product on Amazon..com
Excellent product.  Keeps my devices charged.  Would recommend it to others with confidence.  Quality at a good price.

My ophthalmologist-eye surgeon said I had signs of cataracts and that my floaters would increase.  After daily use of these drops plus the Native Remedies Homeopathic Formula, "Cataract Clear", my night vision has improved measurably.  I can see a lot better while driving at night. I can see the stars better and the moon even looks a lot brighter. I'm definitely going to order more once I'm on my last bottle.  Seeing more clearly, without that awful haze of floaters has much improved my confidence in being able to drive safely at night.

Enjoyed the story.  I am a very very short person....technically not a midget because I'm over 4'8" tall and a tad under 4'10", and I'm not a dwarf (my body is normally proportioned....so I identified with the tiny woman's role.  I'm Asian (Filipino), so I was in sympathy with the cultural quirks at play in the plot.  I'm so glad there are movies being made of American Asians in America. It's about time. Enjoyed Margaret Cho as the shaman.  Hope to see her in more movies.

This was recommended to me by a professional photographer.  She said I'd enjoy it because it is laid out simply, in easily digestible and understandable chunks and would guide me from one step to another in learning how to take video....that doesn't suck.  She was right on.I just got my first ever camcorder.....CANON VIXIS HF R40...and of course, I went ahead and started videoing everything....before I read this book.Yes. my first attempts with my brand new HD camcorder really did......suck.  They were boring, jiggly, jarring, blurred, dizzying.  Eye torture.So I read this book.  I think the most valuable rule is the "3 second" rule.  Press start...run for no more than three seconds....stop.  Start again....run a max 3 seconds....stop.  Repeat.Why the "3 second rule"?  Because....People nowadays have an attention span of.....3 seconds before they start fidgeting and wanting to see something else.There are a lot more rules, of course.  However....if there is only one thing you can remember....always use the "3 second" rule.  And maybe your videos won't suck.  And you won't create video torture...for yourself or others.And when you finally start taking videos that don't suck, take your camcorder to your local animal shelter and make videos of adoptable animals to post on youtube so these animals won't be killed because there's no space left in the animal shelter.  Do something good with your new knowledge....you'll be a hero...to the animals and to animal lovers everywhere.

You only need a little bit and it makes anything taste better....even fresh fruits, like water melon and cantaloupe and papaya.Delicious.  And healthful because of the ingredients: Sea salt, Celery, Leek, Cress, Onion, Chives, Parsley, Lovage, GArlic, BAsil, Marjoram, Rosemary, Thyme, Kelp.  NO MSG,  NO Gluten, Lactose, Milk protein.  No additives or preservatives.  What more do you want in a great tasting salt?

Wide mouth at top (which unscrews) allows me to put in the slices or organic Meyer lemon which I regularly put in my drinking water.Glass also allows me to mix my water + Bragg Organic Raw Apple Cider Vinegar + Organic Black Strap Raw Molasses energy drink without worrying whether the acidity from the vinegar may react to the container. Easy sliding latch on bottle lid that secures the  lid so liquid does not leak.  Easy to sip/drink from when lid is open; use your mouth or a straw.  Easy to hang onto with your finger or you can attach it to your waist belt with the handle on the handle on the lid.  Bright color of lid.....neon Saturn green...keeps it noticeable; I can easily identify which bottle is mine.  No funny taste of metal or plastic.  I just wish it came in a larger capacity size.My acupuncturist (whom I see regularly every other week to keep "in tune" and healthy says, "no icy cold, no hot and spicy".  So I always drink my water at "room temp" without ice; ice is a shock to your digestive system....especially when you are hot and sweaty on a hot day.  The "no hot and spicy " advice refers to the rule to avoiding a cuisine that is meant for a humid, hot tropical climate.  I live in a dry California climate; therefore, I try to limit my foods that are suitable to a dry climate. (no hot and spicy)...I eat locally grown, eat stuff grown in season, eat preferably organically grown, and consume everything in moderation.

Lightweight so can be worn comfortably in all seasons....I wear a woman's size 8-10 blouse, so this is large enough to toss over a heavy winter coat/jacket/sweater.  Huge advantage is that it is very highly reflective.  My dogs have reflective coats and reflective leashes.  Now drivers will be able to see that those dogs and their leashes are connected to a....human being in its own highly reflective top.  You'd have to be totally blind to not see us.  And if you don't see us, and run into us, you'll be in very deep doo doo with the lawyers.

For those worried about radiation from Japan...the nuclear plant where the accident occurred is northeast of Tokyo.  Look at a map.  The Yaeyama Island group (where this Chlorella is grown, harvested and processed), is located a good distance Southeast of the main Japanese archipelago where the nuclear accident happened.  The Pacific Ocean north of the Equator travels clockwise.  If you start from Alaska, the Pacific Ocean current from Alaska travels south, past California and Mexico, then heads west (towards Southeast Asia) along the Equator.  When this Northern Hemisphere Pacific Ocean current reaches Southeast Asia, the current turns northward traveling  past the Yaeyama Islands then continues north past the main islands of Japan (where the nuclear accident occurred).  Any remaining traces of ocean borne radiation from the nuclear accident that occurred north of Tokyo is carried past China, past Russia, and then travels northeast along the Aleutian Islands and back to Alaska.JARROW Yaeyama Chlorella is my second go-to source.  My first choice,( available only in pill form), is BODYBIO Chlorella which is sourced from Germany, using a completely enclosed system (never exposed to the atmosphere and using distilled water).I mix JARROW Yaeyama Chlorella Powder in my STRAUSS DIARY Organic Yogurt smoothies.  I mix it in my BOLTHOUSE FARMS Organic Carrot Juice.  I sprinkle it on my BOB'S RED MILL Organic Oats.  You can mix it into your scrambled eggs (Dr. Seuss' green eggs!).  I also mix it into my dogs' daily meals,In addition to this chlorella, I add NOW Foods Organic Barley Grass powder (grown on certified organic farm in USA), NUTIVA Organic Chia seed and NUTREX Hawaiian Spirulina (grown in Kona, on the Big Island of Hawaii....which tastes far better than the Now Foods organic spirulina which is sourced from India).All this green goodness in our diets (humans and dogs) turns your poop green, with the benefit that your poop doesn't stink as much (so you don't have to light a match every time you go potty).A healthy, regularly functioning digestive system is essential to your overall health.For serious health conscious people, I highly recommend SEVEN-X PLAN FOR DIGESTIVE HEALTH, by Anil Minocha, MD (2014 edition, paperback, 452 pages,  ISBN 9780991503117,  It's a holisitc approach to keeping your gut healthy, using both Western and Alternative medical knowledge. It's available from Amazon.com....look inside at the table of contents.  You'll be amazed at how much influence your digestive system has on your physical and psychological health and your appearance.

I have been purchasing Moringa products for years directly from MORINGA FOR LIFE through their website.Moringa For Life is a small, family owned cottage industry business.  Their hand processed and hand crafted products are made from plants they grow from seed at their family farm in Southern California.  They adhere to holistic farming methods: their plants are grown w/o use of pesticides or harsh chemical fertilizers. I have been very impressed with the purity of their Moringa leaf powder, which has a lovely rich green color, has a fresh smell and tastes good.I mix the powder in scrambled eggs, add it to soups & smoothies, sprinkle it on my morning cereal, mix it with my favorite berry jam to spread on toast, etc.  I use every bit of the precious powder, right down to the very bottom of the package.  I have never tasted, seen or felt grit, sand, or other impurities.  I also use their Moringa For Life oil, which is also a fresh green color with the same fresh smell. I mix it with coconut oil, macadamia nut oil, kukui nut oil, and hemp oil for a rich facial and body moisturizer (your skin is your largest organ).Other merchants obtain their Moringa from farms in Africa, India, Southeast Asia, etc.  There are inherent problems in this arrangement, the most important one being the difficulties of consistent quality control in these countries.  Even though a company purports to test its products for purity, it would be prohibitively expensive to test ALL the Moringa that is used to make their products.My health is my most important and precious asset.  I am willing to spend the extra money for a product I trust, from a seller I trust.

I should have known better.from the date of publication that this would not add to my library of horse training and horse care.  Author is not a bad person; she just reflects the majority thinking of the time when she wrote this book.  Although there are still many (too many) adherents to the aversive training methods and approach discussed in the book, there is a rapidly growing population of horse people who want to train their horses in ways that will not harm the horse physically or mentally, based on recent scientific studies and research.  I would start with the book EQUITATION SCIENCE by Paul D. McGreevy and Andrew McLean. There are many books on horse training and riding that avoid punishment and force.  There are also websites devoted to positive, non-punitive, non-aversive and forceful methods.  I would also recommend THE ULTIMATE HORSE TRAINING AND BEHAVIOR BOOK, by Linda Tellington-Jones.  Also books and DVDs by German veterinarian, Gerd Heuschmann.  And Alois Podhajsky.  Websites:  www.Happy-Horse-Training,  Also www.ThinkLikeA Horse.

This goes on my face under my moisturizer to make my skin look softer, smoother, healthier..  I use it for every little nick, cut, scratch on my body.  I use it on my pets. I have a tube in my bathroom, in my car, and in my purse.  It's pretty amazing. And it doesn't sting and blends into your skin quickly.

TTouch for all my animals....easy to learn and easy to  apply, with fast  amazing results.I have all of Linda Telling-Jone's books.  I got all of them when I gambled and took a two day TTouch workshop-clinic at the Marin Humane Society in Novato, CA with my dog who was (a) reactive to other dogs (he was attacked twice in a dog park), (b) had extreme separation anxiety issues (he'd been dumped on the side of an abandoned road where I found him), (c) had symptoms of vaccinosis (having been over vaccinated too many times which adversely affected his health).TTouch Horse Trainer and dog trainer Kathy Cascade (who is based in Oklahoma) conducted this workshop-Clinic. After the first day of this two day workshop-clinic, my entire approach to training my animals changed dramatically. When I and my dog returned for the second day's session, the other participants in the workshop kept asking me, "Is that another dog?  What happened to the dog you had yesterday?  I thought you had a different dog yesterday."  Yes. the improvements were that profound.HORSES.......T-Touch method brought about such palpable positive results in my dog's bahavior so rapidly that I was convinced I should learn more so I could apply TTouch training to the horses I ride.This book does what it's supposed to do.  Increase your bond with your horse in a gentle manner that benefits both you and your horse physiologically (you both have an increase in the pleasure hormones that put you both in a mental framework very conducive to learning new things).The TTouches prepare both you and your horse for the learning experience of training...TTouch quickly helps your horse to learn to trust you....establish the relationship bond that is vital for training.With the combination of using the various TTouches and following the step by step training exercises illustrated by the numerous photographs, you are able to communicate to your horse in a  clear, progressive, non-punitive, calm and gentle manner how to teach your horse so he understands exactly what it is you are asking him to do.  You also are given the whys...the reasons for the way these training exercises are carried out and why and how they affect your horse.This book will help you build a relationship with a horse so he will learn to trust you, come to you voluntarily (often without you having to ask) and be willing and eager to be taught  the lessons you want him to learn.Very highly recommended for every horse trainer's reference library.

What a difference between this movie documentary and the Japanese movie, "Quill: The Life of A Guide Dog".  The Japanese movie treated the dogs as mere commodities.  This movie, "Through A Dog's Eyes"  emphasizes the dogs, their lives, their personalities, the traits they must have to become a valuable and compassionate companion animal.  The Japanese should learn from this movie.

The most truthful part of this movie was the part about how the Italian mother could not bear to see her grown son (who is the detective sent by the wayward wife's husband to hunt her down) go to a nearby city for a few days to do his job.  The rest is a nice distraction from reality.

This is a very bad video to show your children.  They will have the horribly wrong idea that zebras are just like ponies to be ridden.  I wonder....how many zebras were harmed while making this movie?  Oh yeah...there's always that blurb in movies that use animals that says "no animals were harmed".  Well....if you read the news, you'll know that isn't true.  The movie industry "owns" the agency that is supposed to oversee the humane treatment of animals in movies.  Bottom line....movie industry pays these trainers and suppliers of animals.  Guess what?  Movie industry is in this to make money....not to do anything to further the humane treatment of what are essentially circus performance animals. If you have any decency about humane treatment and understanding of zebras and horses, don't show this to your children.

I was shocked that the family who got Quill was allowed to keep him outside in the rain and weather.  I thought Guide Dogs were so valuable that the Guide Dogs For The Blind organizations would require, as a condition of receiving one of these exceptionally sensitive and highly trained animals, that the dog be kept indoors with the family.  This video gives the impression that a Guide Dog is merely a commodity, like a tool for a blind human, except it is a living thing.  I expected a more humane treatment of this subject. The man who received Quill should have stuck with finding his way with his stick, as he preferred to do.  I hated him....I don't care what was wrong with him or that he suffered from illnesses that eventually killed him.  He should never have been given a Guide Dog.

Teaches you an easy to master way to teach your horse without using punishment.  No whipping, no punching, no hard jerks on the mouth or face, no pinching the ears, etc.  This method gains your horse's trust and cooperation.  Best of all, it results in a horse who enjoys doing what you ask and who looks forward to your training sessions.  It's all positive....for your horse and for you.

I was without this chlorella for awhile (I ran out during the last six months of 2013). I placed my most recent order for another jar of tablets at the end of 2013 and wrote a review in January 2014.  This is an update to my previous January 2014 review.  It's now July, 2014, my supply is running out, so I am going to order another jar of these tablets, even though the price for a jar has gone up to $184 per jar.After I began taking this chlorella in January 2014, I noticed the difference right away between when I stopped taking it in July 2013 (developed digestive slowness, skin eruptions, low energy when I was without my daily dose of chlorella) and a couple of weeks after I began taking it again in January, 2014 (very noticeable improvements all around).UPDATED: MARCH 15, 2015Still the only Chlorella brand I use.  It's still the most expensive.  My body deserves the best.  Because it's the only one I have.  Anything you put in your mouth or on your skin (your skin is the largest organ in you and absorbes anything you put on it) should be the purest and cleanest you can find.  If you can afford a pair of $150 shoes, you can afford to put this chlorella to work for you.WHY BUY MADE IN GERMANY...EXPENSIVE BRAND?  I choose to buy this higher priced, MADE IN GERMANY brand because it is not grown in outdoor ponds that are open to the environment which has air pollution, bird droppings, impure sources of water, rainfall containing heavy metals, etc, etc.  If I'm going to ingest something to clean out toxins in my body, I want the purest form of chlorella.  IMHO, this German grown and German manufactured product is the best product available because of its purity and because of where it is grown and manufactured (which is reflected in its price).UPDATED JULY 02, 2014:  Yes, of course it is expensive....so are Made In Germany cars....like BMW and Mercedes and Porsche and Audi cars.  Yes, the price of this chlorella keeps going up....so does the Euro to US Dollar value.  I still think this product is the only one I will continue to put into my body....because I consider it as an investment in my continued good health (worth the price of this product).  This chlorella is grown in GERMANY.  It is not grown in China, Taiwan, Japan or South Korea.  I repeat....this chlorella is grown in GERMANY.  It is grown under strictly sanitized laboratory conditions, in a completely enclosed facility, in glass tubes, using clean, filtered water.YOUTUBE VIDEO YOU SHOULD WATCH:  You can watch how this product is seeded, grown, harvested and prepared in a youtube.com video entitled, Chlorella on Glass Tube, Echlorial France = Algomed Germany.  The narrator speaks in German which is voiced over in English.This is your only body.  And since you don't know what body you may inhabit in the other parallel universes, you may as well take the best care of the one you have in this universe.

DVD covers only a few breeds. Commentary is by individuals (breeders, owners who show their dogs, owners who are biased in favor of the breed they are talking about) who give their personal opinions about the breed shown.Would recommend the encyclopedic DOGS: THE ULTIMATE DICTIONARY OF OVER 1,000 DOG BREEDS (Desmond Morris) and WORLD ATLAS OF DOG BREEDS OF WORLD (Bonnie Wilcox).  Both books have over 900 pages of listings of dog breeds.After choosing a breed, I recommend PAWS TO CONSIDER: CHOOSING THE RIGHT DOG FOR YOUR FAMILY (Brian Kilcommons).Once you have narrowed your choice, I would recommend looking for a DVD about the dog breed you have chosen.

Previous reviewers have done a better critical write up than I can.  I'm not a writer or aspiring to become one...so I'm not basing my rating on the writing style of the author.  When I buy a book like this (I purchased my copy from the author at a Marin Humane Society lecture), I'm looking for information that is thorough, science based, well researched, and well organized and this book fills those requirements. I read scientific and medical journals for pleasure, so I'm not looking to be entertained by a certain writing "style".  I'm looking for valuable, useful, and applicable information. THE ULTIMATE BETRAYAL is an easy, fast, concise intelligent read.  I highly recommend it to anyone who is spending those extra bucks to buy "sustainably raised", "humane", "organic", "grass fed", "free range" so-called "happy meat". There's information on fish, also, for those of you who announce, "I'm vegetarian...but I eat fish". Suggestions:  You don't have to become strictly vegan to help.  You can do a "meatless Monday" or even less.  Just having two non-animal flesh meals per week will make a huge difference.

Product came without any leaks, which was a relief, because another reviewer complained about shoddy packing and that the product he/she received had sprung a leak.I ordered this gallon size so I could use it throughout our home in every single room.  We have five indoor pets who have full run of the house. It takes only one flea to infest an entire house.After vacuuming thoroughly, I sprayed a diluted mixture of this (in a bit of dish soap, rubbing alcohol for quick evaporation, some water for volume) in a sprayer bottle (dial it to mist) all over the house in every room, in every nook and corner.The whole place smells deliciously clean and fresh (to my sense of smell) and the fleas seem to have fled.For spraying directly onto my dog's beds, I add a bit of Lavender essential oil.  Dog beds smell wonderful and so do the dogs.

Describes my dog, who is undocked, with ears left whole (I disapprove of the practice of cutting off ears...important site of several crucial acupuncture/acupressure points...and docking of tails for cosmetic purposes).  Even the angle of her head is here. The facial expression is perfect...curious, alert, inquiring whether I want something of her or if her meal is ready so she can go to her mat and wait for me to bring her food to her after she's done her down-stay, wait, watch me, come to heel and then release.  I ascribe to the "nothing in life is free"  T-Touch and clicker training methods.  No choke chains, no shock collars, no hitting/yelling/grabbing/pushing.

This beautifully detailed rubber stamp captures the primary qualities I admire most about the Molosser (mastiff) breeds...in a massive, well muscled body, their quiet dignity, calm demeanor and alert awareness of all that goes on around them.This pose is so typical of my dog at rest, whether we are enrolled in training & obedience classes at our local animal shelter(The Marin Humane Society), or in our garden, or in our home.  Paws together, attentive expression, head held erect, massive body relaxed, always vigilant.I searched through several online suppliers of dog stamps and finally found this one that I felt I had to add to my special animals rubber stamp collection.

This particular cat rubber stamp impression resonates very well with all my cat loving friends and acquaintances who receive cards, letters and packages from me.  They all love this design, which evokes the best qualities of cats....grace, elegance, self-containment, serenity and beauty.  It is large enough to be noticeable and makes a wonderful border on my plain paper letters.  Also is a nice signal to the recipients of my letters/cards when I place it on the front of the envelope next to the addressee's name.

Very pleased with this stylish, well-designed overall.  I sew my own clothes and I'm impressed with the quality of construction the manufacturer put into this overall. Fits my dog comfortably, with enough room so, if I want to keep her really warm when we're in snow country in the mountains, I can dress her in the Hurtta waterproof fleece overalls and add this outer overall like an overcoat.  She has a very short, thin velvety coat. She hates going out in the rain, and she gets cold easily. I'm very happy with these Hurtta products.  There is another brand of dog outerwear that closely matches the quality of Hurtta.  I have lots of other high end , durable clothing made by an American company (Name begins with letter "R") but they don't make doggie overalls for athletic dogs. There are other makers of dog overalls, but those are almost all made for small/mini/toy size dogs, and they aren't made with the durability and protection I wanted for my 56 lb Staffie.

I've been taking this for over a week now and have already begun to feel the positive effects.  I'm in my eighth decade in age, and been suffering from back and hip stiffness, some minor digestive problems, some pain/discomfort in my joints (hands, wrist, feet), and slow healing from minor scratches & cuts.  I'm feeling much better; the wasp sting I had recently, healed in record time (compared to having been stung in the past), and my digestion is so much more efficient and becoming regular in bowel movements.  Highly recommend this product.

I take this every day.  I don't feel the aftereffects (burping with funny aftertaste) and I don't get a slightly heady "rush" that I've felt from other products (adult dosages)  that are meant to improve memory and brain function. I seem to remember more things and I also feel much calmer (I've been diagnosed with adult ADD).I give a capsule to my dogs each day.  The hyperactive one has calmed down measurably.  The other dog is not exhibiting as many symptoms of separation anxiety.

Nice poster size, great graphics, brilliant colors. I got it as a gift for a young man who's just started his Freshman year at university.  He's been working with robotics for years and has won prizes for his robotic creations in national competitions.  He plans to study mechanical and electrical engineering and apply those skills to inventing and creating robotic machines.

I've had numerous vaccinations for traveling to foreign "third world" countries.
