Best thing about it is the switch; a twist switch reduces the odds of having it fail and prevents it from activating in my pocket.So far the little Fenix has been completely reliable and easy to carry.  A bit more power would be nice but it's great for a single AAA cell (I use a lithium in mine) and battery life is superb.  In fact I think I've been running the same battery since I bought the light last October.All in all a superb small light!

I would have to say that the Garden No8 is my favorite Opinel overall.  Most I like the handle and the drop point knife shape.  It fits my hand better than any of the others and is the perfect size for me (large enough for most tasks yet compact enough to carry easily).  My Opinel collection numbers around fifteen knives, and I use this one the most.The only downside really is the blade steel- I've only ever seen it in INOX. INOX is the generic term for stainless steel in much of the world. Personally I prefer carbon for most things.  It's really a challenge to put the kind of edge on this knife that I like.  I can get it to push cut really well but no matter what I do I can't get the shaving edge that I can easily get on the carbon models.If Opinel would offer this same exact knife with a high carbon blade it would be a five star, out-of-the-park home run for me.  Perhaps they do but if so I can't find it, and there's nothing on the company website.  So I give it four stars, docking one because their INOX just isn't as good as their carbon.

Pretty disappointing.  They're decently made but the cut isn't good at all.  They're way too low and saggy in the back; they ride about 3" too low.  Not good at all, especially since they're supposed to keep you warm.  Not worth returning but I don't imagine I'll wear them much.

Appaloosa is one of the finest unsung westerns in my opinion.  Perhaps in the top five of the last 20 years.  There's not a lot to say that hasn't been said.  The cast is superb (with the exception of Renee Zellwegger; she's not terrible but I too feel she was miscast).  The direction by Harris is very solid.  The film transfer is very good and the sound is great.  I'd give this a solid four out of five for the technical aspects (ie sound and image) and five out of five for the actual film.  For my money it has some of the best gun battles ever committed to film- far more realistic than is typically portrayed.Don't miss out on this underrated gem, especially since the BD disc is currently under eight bucks!

There's not much to say about this adapter.  It's very solid, and it fits both the 9mm/40 USP and the slightly larger USP45.  The only minor complaint I have is that this rail adapter is much, much larger than it needs to be to do the job.  I can't imagine your sidearm will fit in any holster with this adapter on.  The GG&G adapter, on the other hand, is very slim and low profile; it's enough smaller that the USP will still fit some holsters with the adapter attached.Still, this is a minor issue if you don't plan to carry the firearm.  The ProMag rail adapter is well made and will do the job at about 40% of the cost of the GG&G.

Overall it's hard to find much to criticize about the GG&G rail adapter.  It's superbly designed and precisely manufactured, and about as sleek and low profile as you can get.  It adds virtually no bulk to the HK USP, and the gun will still fit many leather holsters with the adapter attached (no such luck with tightly molded kydex holsters, though).  It's also rock solid on the gun; it ain't going nowhere.I have only one serious criticism of the adapter, and it's enough for me to dock a star.  A Surefire X300 Ultra won't fit on this rail adapter.  Perhaps that's a fault of the light more than the adapter but since Surefire is the 'gold standard' for weapon mounted lights they should have designed it to work with that light.  Some rail keys will fit better than others but to really get it to work you have to mod the key of the light.  Not something I want to do to a $225 light.That said the GG&G works perfectly with the Inforce APL.  I actually prefer that light to the Surefire due to the smaller size and superior user interface.  I have read but cannot confirm myself that Streamlight units fit this rail just fine, too.If you have a light that fits this rail correctly it's a five star piece of gear.  If you have a Surefire you might be better off getting the ProMag or NCStar adapter.

There's not an awful lot to say about this magazine holster.  It does what it's supposed to do.  It's well constructed and the magazine fits fine.  It says it's for a Glock on the back. The magazine of my HK USP9 was a little snug at first but once it broke in it fits okay.  I wish I could give this 4.5 stars; there's really nothing functional to complain about but it's not as nice as the SHTF Gear Horizontal Mag Carrier.  The velcro is a little harder to get open than a snap.  The velcro belt attachment though is actually better than a snap since it allows some adjustment to different size belts.  The only minor ding I give it is that it's not all that nice looking, just a little rough and "cheap" in appearance.  A minor thing since it's designed to be concealed for the most part.  If anyone does see it they'll probably not recognize it as a pistol mag, but a better looking case would be easier to pass off as a holster for a cell or i-something.I highly recommend this model if it fits the mag you're trying to carry.  I'm not sure how many models they make but this one is a good fit for the average 15-17 round double stack 9mm mag.  A little more refined appearance would be nice but it's fully functional and seems to be built to last.  If you carry a pistol with a single stack mag I'd say the SHTF Gear model is better but this one's great if you carry a sidearm with a double stack mag.EDIT:  Okay, after using it a long time I'm bumping it up a star.  Whatever minor issues I had with the appearance it's clear that this is about as good as it gets for actual CCW.  The best feature of this thing- and one that I missed at first- is the ability to adjust the fit to very snug and solid on any size or thickness of belt.  This is awesome since I've purchased three new gunbelts since I started carrying this.Highly recommended!

After owning it for a couple months I must report that I really love this SHTF mag carrier!  It's extremely comfortable, so much so that it's easy to forget I'm wearing it.  Vertical carry is fine if you're wearing the mag at 8 or 9 o'clock but it jabs me in my [ample] gut if worn in the front.  But horizontally I can run with the mag between my belt buckle and left front pocket comfortably.  The design is really clever.  It's secured by one snap, making it easy to don and remove but mounts very solidly.  I'm not sure what belts it will fit but I generally wear mine over a 1.5" wide gun belt that's 1/4" thick it fits this just fine.  And since it completely covers the mag if my shirt rides up a bit it just looks like a cell phone case.The only minor complaint I have is really my own fault.  I ordered it with the intention of carrying a magazine for an HK USP9 mag, but that mag is a little too large for the pouch.  Rereading the description it does say 'for 13 round or smaller mags'.  I really do wish SHTF would offer a slightly larger version for service pistol type mags.One last thing I'd like to point out is that my Surefire E1B Backup flashlight also fits nicely in the carrier (although obviously not while you have mag in it).  I might pick up a second one just for carrying my flashlight.Great product, and great service from SHTF.  If you need to carry a spare mag, and that mag will fit this case, you can't go wrong.

I bought this canner for my mom and it's fantastic.  She's been canning everything you can imagine for at least fifty years, so she knows a few things about the process.  She'd been wanting a good pressure canner to replace a worn out Presto and this one fit the bill and more.  For the record, it works just fine with quart jars and also works just fine on her glass-topped electric range.  It's the best canner she's ever used, and she said the most surprising thing was how easy it was to regulate the pressure compared to the cheaper ones she's used in the past.  The only possible room for improvement would be for it to be larger, but of course the larger sizes wouldn't fit under the hood of her range.Five stars all the way!  I'm sure this canner will outlast me.

This is a really bizarre flashlight!  And it didn't make a very good first impression.  When I opened the envelope I found a blank white box with the light & lanyard in it.  There were no instructions of any kind in the box nor the envelope.  No markers as to how to insert the batteries.  Hell, it doesn't even indicate what batteries will fit!  Since it took 1 month and 3 days between ordering and receiving it I'd forgotten, and actually had to bring the listing up on Amazon to check.  That's not ideal.  I pulled the lanyard out of the box and the plastic/loop fell right off the cord.  Hmmm, that's not ideal either.Okay, the light itself if just weird.  It's got a weird fish-eye lens.  Initially I thought it was broken as the lens end spins freely and telescopes in and out (!).  Once I figured out what battery to use (AA, or 14500...more on that later...) it did function.  With the "tube" pulled all the way in the light is very diffused would work well as a candle.  And will tail stand, kinda sorta, in a weeble-wobble way.  Used as a regular flashlight it will illuminate an entire room.  When you pull the "tube" all the way out, however, it projects a very nice outline of the emitter on the wall!  As in, you can see see the chip as though it was a slide on an overhead projector!Suffice to say this light is of limited usefulness as anything but an oddity.  It would provide enough light to navigate your home in the event of a power outage; with the spot set to max flood it actually casts an incredibly wide beam, and is pretty bright.  It's virtually useless at any distance past 20 feet though, and the light is almost violet.  The outline of the face of the emitter chip is rendered in a very lovely shade of purple.Lastly, I a/ss/u/me-d that with a 14500 cell it would be appreciably brighter.  Well, not so much.  I couldn't tell any difference in output between a SAFT LS14500 and a regular Energizer.  Not that it would have much mattered given the bizarre output.Three stars is probably generous but to be fair, nothing in the description promises that it won't be truly bizarre.  And since it cost about four bucks when I ordered it I'm not out much.  It will be worth much that just to baffle and perplex people.  I can't wait to show this off to my fellow flashlight geeks!

All in all this is pretty good stuff.  I sometimes have trouble getting to sleep, and I've found it preferable to take Melatonin vs OTC sleep aids.  Melatonin doesn't give you that groggy, hung-over feeling that some stuff gives me (with dyphenhyromine being about the worst).Pretty good stuff at a good price.  Although I think the 10mg Natrol stuff is maybe a little more effective for me.  It's got a "time release" formula that's supposed to keep the melatonin levels up for 8 hours.  Maybe it's just in my head but it seems to work a little better for me than the drops.

A good product at a great price.  I waited for the lowest price over 3 months then locked in the price by subscribing.  The product itself is great.  Coconut flour is by nature a bit more "granular" than wheat flour but vastly healthier.  Since it has not gluten don't expect to have a crumb free, sturdy baked good like you get with even AP flour.  It won't happen.  This is best used for shortbread-type recipes or as a dredging material for frying (and in this role it can be a little "grainy").Compared to similar products this one is good.  And the price, while a little high, is competitive with anything I can get locally.  Just watch the price in our cart and pounce when you see a value!

There may be a few minor editing errors but this book rocks!  Tons of good info- spare & lean.  All killer, no filler.  The author really condenses a lot of facts into readable prose. Okay, it's occasionally a little too "folksy" or "aw, shucks" to suit me.  But the content is superb.  Disclosure:  I'm a green smooothie nOOb.  Maybe for someone better versed in this phenomenon the book might be simplistic.  But I think it was written for people like me.This is an accessible, simple K-book packed with info for just a few bucks.  Well worth the price to me.  I have a Blendtec Total Blender en route to me right now, due to touch down on the next Monday.  This book has prepared me with the basics I need to get started.What can I say?  For $3 I give it 5*****!

Pretty straight forward- this is just regular Ipubproen in single use packs.  For various legal reasons the individual packs are useful.  These are as good as the name brands and pretty economical given the single use format.  Just to clarify, you do get three boxes, each with 50 packets of 2 tabs for a total of 300 tablets.  The carton is designed in a way that ripping off the top makes it a dispenser of sorts.Again, it's not sexy- just solid meds in a necessary form factor at a good price.  Excellent for restocking first aid kits.

This product is the generic version of Benedryl in single serving packets.  For various legal reasons, the sealed packs are the way to go when traveling or assembling FAKs.  This particular product is a terrific deal at the price, rivaling the cost of buying bottles!  Diphen is great for the intended use and is coincidentally the same thing that is also marketed as a sleep aid.  It also has some usefulness in combating anaphalactic/allergic reactions.A great product, well packaged, and at a great price.  Not much more to say.

I have to say that SealStix work very well.  The one humorous thing is that there were no instructions; once you figure out how they work you go DUH!  But initially I was baffled as to how to use them.  Once I got it all was well.The purpose for purchasing them was to seal some Umai Drybag vacuum bags used for dry aging beef.  These seem to work but they're a tad shorter than would be idea, even the longest ones.  If this was 2" longer it would be perfect.  The Banana Seals are a bit better in this regard.  That said they do seal air tight and work perfectly.  I sealed a bag in a commercial chamber vac, applied the SealStix just below the seal and cut the top off the bag.  The SealStix has held 29" of vacuum for 24 hours.  Not bad!

So far I'm extremely pleased with the L'Equip.  First off the unit is built to very close tolerances.  It's nice to see that the trays snap together almost like Legos!  The next thing I noticed is that it heats almost instantly- very impressive.  And in operation it's almost dead silent.Airflow and drying is very uniform.  There's minimal need to swap trays around, but for long drying projects it will be helpful.  The variable temperature control is a good feature and it works quite well.  I was a bit concerned that a 500 watt machine might not produce enough heat but those fears were unfounded.  Perhaps it's the shape of the unit, or maybe the fact that it fits together so tightly, but it generates a lot of heat.  In fact, my first batch of jerky really got way too dry.  It was my fault; I didn't expect the meat to dry nearly so quickly as it did.  But so far I've done apples, peaches & bananas and all came out great.  As I write this I have some garden tomatoes and some zucchini drying.As some have noted, the included fruit-leather/catch trays warp pretty fast.  To this I say- so what?  They still do the job.  If you want to make a lot of leathers  you'll probably get a Sil-mat anyway.This is a great dryer.  The only minor knock I could give it is that the capacity isn't huge, but of course I knew that when I bought it.  It's supposed to be able drive a dozen trays, so it's expandable.  Of course, for the cost of six more trays I could simply buy a second unit!  Probably the best use of extra trays is incremental expansion.This is more of a unit for a hobbyist or someone who wants to experiment with stuff.  It's simply too small for someone who wants to preserve the output of a huge garden.  But for the size it's really superb.  The great ergonomics and near-silent operation will win you over.One last note; obviously I can't yet comment on if it will last for ten years.  But before purchasing the unit I did e-mail the seller.  I received a response within 10 hours.  So the provided e-mail address is valid and response is quick.

The first book of this "trilogy" was an unalloyed gem. I was blown away that this unknown writer had created such a compelling work.  True, the villain was a "Shnidely Whiplash" mustache-twirling cliche.  But overall the book was superb.  From what I've gathered it was meant as a single book, and one that McCarty was lucky to have published at all.  The second book, therefore, seemed perfunctory, yet I enjoyed it.I've looked for this third book for a decade with no luck, and for whatever reason I decided to search for it on Amazon.  I found it for a very good price!  It arrived in great condition and the seller shipped promptly.If you clicked on this looking for a review of the book I'm sorry to disappoint.  School and work keep me from reading it yet.  Plus, I think the point of these reviews, especially as regards older OOP books is to identify the good sellers.On that note, I give an A+.  The transaction was perfect.For my take on the further adventures of Palamon and Berengeria...stay tuned! ;-)

It appears that the second time is the charm!  I ordered MoKo Cover to replace a case that, while really nice, didn't really fit my Kindle.  This one is great!  There was no odor at all when I opened it.  I haven't had it long but it appears to be pretty well made.  I really love the bright purple color, too.  The main thing from my perspective is that it offers an absolutely flawless fit for my $79 basic 5-button Kindle.  It allows easy access to all the buttons as well as the micro USB port with no material impeding the operation of the Kindle.Lastly, the case is very functional.  It's just large enough to accommodate the Kindle with no wasted space (although there is a small flat pouch on the inside cover).  When in use the front cover folds completely flat against the back making it very easy to hold with one hand.  When not in use, magnets hold it firmly closed.  This is a great feature and much better than straps or snaps IMOHO.Overall there's nothing to complain about.  However, if they made a version that was identical in all respects but made of real leather I would gladly pay two or three times as much for it.

Not much to say; it works very well.  The local school district turns the AC off at 5:00 pm here, but my B.S. program starts at 6:15 pm.  Since it's been over 100 F almost every day for the last month, some type of fan is a must.  This one is great!  It's easy to aim and stays put.  It's pretty powerful for the size yet doesn't suck my laptop battery dry.  Overall this was well worth the money!

The case showed up the day before my Kindle, and I really fell in love with it.  The color is great, the construction seems solid...just a really nice product.  Unfortunately my Kindle really slops around in it.  I dunno, maybe it's my fault.  I read all the first few pages of reviews and really thought it would fit my $79 Kindle (not the Touch, not the version with the keyboard, but the one with 5 navigation buttons).  The Kindle is a good inch too short, and seems slightly too narrow.  Overall the device is usable but it's not ideal and constantly wants to move around.Maybe this is what I deserve for trying to save a few bucks.  My brother, sister & mom all have the Amazon covers with my sister's being the one with the light.  They all fit like they're part of the Kindle...but I'm not gonna pay $40 for a cover for an $80 device!  And the reviews are actually better for the Marware cover.Oh well.  I guess I'll use it for awhile and if it won't do the job I'll suck it up and buy a different one.  If you have the larger Kindle this is probably a five star case as so many have said.  But the smaller model simply doesn't fit it very well.

I jumped at the chance to review this. My husband and I live in Louisiana where bug bites are prevalent. He has a very difficult time with bites from any insect and when he gets a bite it swells and causes issues for days.He has been using this on his mosquito bites for approx. two weeks and is loving life. Aloe can be used to help calm the irritation, as well as for sun burns. Since I just came in from a visit to California, I am using this for my burn.This seems more water based than many aloe gels that I have used but it does soak into the skin very fast. I have spots of skin that seem like eczema, very dry, and have been using this on those spots as well. So far the results are great and we have barely used a quarter of this bottle. I feel like it will last a few months.The one downside is the smell. I would prefer something a bit like lemon, orange, or lavender.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

This book... With such a fabulous title I so wanted it to hit the spots! To grab me and to really help me see the sparkle in myself and in others too!Well, right out of the gate I had some issues.To begin with, I did enjoy the talk about trauma. Trauma is literally traumatic, so much so that it can stop someone in their tracks just by a trigger! I have some issues that are triggered out of nowhere so I was hoping this would be a positive experience. So many people are hurt by trauma and the drama that surrounds them.Sadly, it doesn't quite hit the point in her questionnaire. The Drama Quotient Quiz seemed a bit off. Things that I said yes to, like I enjoy watching reality television shows, do not seem really dramatic. A more pertinent question may have been if that reality show is mired in drama. I get her point but there is a difference. For the reality shows I watch, they are all art based. Project Runway DOES have drama but it is not based around drama. Neither is watching Pitbulls and Parolees. I love dogs and want to help them have a voice. Some drama in that one, but not enough for this list.Also, I am one of the hardest working people I know. This question definitely got a yes from me. I work hard and I enjoy putting in 100% effort. If I do not put in 100% effort I know it. Other people will know it. Again, I'm confused about this question as well and so many others.So, while the questionnaire was interesting, it also frustrated me and put me on alert. This book is supposed to be about losing the drama right?The book then continues to point out places where there may be drama in your life that you are choosing.•Choosing friends or romantic partners who have high-drama personalities•Focusing upon low-priorotiy activities, instead of working on what matters to you•Ignoring your inner knowingness, which is warning you to stay away from a person, behavior, or situation•Sending more money than your budget allows•Abusing substances that magnify your anxiety (for example, stimulants, including caffeine, nicotine, and sugar) or depression (depressants, including alcohol, for instance)•Not planning ahead and facing an impossible deadline that has you racing against the clock.While I agree that these can cause drama, she then says"This isn't to blame you (after all, blame never helps anyone or anything). Instead, it's call to engage in detective work to help you recover your beautiful sparkle and everything that goes with it: happiness, health, peace, abundance, and high self-esteem."I did agree with her idea on how some people just live for the drama. I have a few people in my life that are like that. Sometimes I am too. I prefer not to deal with drama but there are certain subjects, dogs for example, that I will do everything and anything for. There are people out here that would do anything and everything JUST for the drama of it all. Seems exhausting to me!Although I did start enjoying her points she wrote a book that seems to be pointed out for a younger audience. It's almost as if she is condescending and making things even more simple than they have to be.Something I am hoping to get my PhD in is Post Traumatic Stress Disorder and this portion really was my favorite. I love how she addresses this as a serious and overwhelming reaction to trauma that ANYONE can have. It is not just for those in the military. She talks about the reactions and what can be done about them. And most importantly, that anyone with PTSD can have a life!Prior to the PTSD chapter I was ready to quit reading. This chapter was the book saver for me. Everything that I've studied (so far) about PTSD she has in here.The diet chapter though. I understand needing to reduce sugar but some of these foods seemed interesting to me. Dieting is already hard enough and she is adding in egg whites and black tea, among many others! I have not done any studies on histamine but I feel like there is already so much out there that taking away all of these foods also, as well as KALE, I mean... we would starve due to not being able to eat anything. It isn't her fault that all these studies are out there but my goodness...Part two explains how to regain your sparkle but my goodness. After all of this now comes the positivity! I almost wish she would have edged some of the positivity into the beginning parts of the book. It may have felt like less to digest."Sometimes we have drama-filled lives because of fears that peace is boring."While I may not have believed this for myself, I totally felt this from a family member. My Dad cannot sit still for two minutes. And maybe that is why I hate drama so much. Both of my parents absolutely love drama in its various forms. I can see how this statement can be true, even if we do not know it is.For me, it is not that peace is boring but that, especially with the reality shows I watch, I want to see growth. That's why we go to films, or read books; to see the character arc. It does not have to be a horrible, drama filled character arc to be good either.Overall, I think the book was okay. I really enjoyed some portions and some really frustrated me but overall it was a good book. I'm curious about her other writings.Received from Hay House, via Netgalley, in exchange for an honest review.

While on vacation I received this so my sister and I decided to each try it. I have heart palpitations and she has very high blood pressure so we both have to watch what we ingest.That said, neither of us showed any adverse signs. We started with one pill and then worked up to one pill in the morning and one in the afternoon. After a week of feeling good and no negativity, we both decided to take two in the morning. Even on one pill I felt much better. Alert and energized. She did not get the same feeling but she also drinks 6 Red Bulls a day. I'm a one coffee and then strictly water type. I'm not sure if the Red Bull's throw off her system (probably!!) but we definitely did not get the same positive reactions.Having depression, I have to pay attention and prefer to not ingest anything I do not understand. This made me feel WONDERFUL! I'm sure it is the dosage of caffeine but it is nearly like what some call a happy pill. I feel much more energized and feel as if my mind is sharper.I realize this is for dieting but while on vacation neither of us have been watching our diet. So I cannot attest to the fact that it helps people lose weight but I did feel great! Planning on continuing my dosage of two a day with my other vitamins.Received in exchange for an honest review.

Received the mat very quickly after purchase. Sadly, it just is not what we were expecting.It feels exactly like it looks. The different pebbles are smooth, yet they still are very hard. I read some reviews prior to purchase and a lot of people said it was comforting. I can understand the message effect, but I was looking for something with more give. There is no sponginess at all. No give when you step onto the mat.We decided to replace it immediately but this may be the thing that someone else wants. We also did not detect a strong odor and my nose is quite sensitive!
Fantastic music. Definitely for fans of older rock. Not the soundtrack of the movie. This is just the compilation of the songs.

Having larger bosoms I was curious exactly how much support this would give. It covered but did not support as much as I hoped.I received a large and found it to be very comfy. I could even wear this to bed. The downside is that if I were to wear this outside of my house, I would need to know that I was supported. I did not feel comfortable wearing it anywhere but in the confines of my home.I think for those with smaller breasts, or that do not worry about the support, you will enjoy the comfort and may want to wear this all the time.The beige was great and was very difficult to see even with a see through shirt.Received in exchange for an honest review.

Being a book reviewer I rarely buy my own books. This sounded encouraging and exciting and fortunately not expensive so I thought, why not?I am so glad that I did. This does have some things that I have heard before. My husband is overweight and I am working on it. I'm only 15 pounds away from my goal but some days that feels like 100. I can tell that I am losing energy as I get older but especially since I now work from home.The insights into this are great. I love the working for your brain idea. I'm getting my degree in psychology and this just seems to make sense. There is so much that our brain can do for us, if only we let it! But most people do not even know how they are hurting their brains or what to do about it.This is a simple, yet effective way of introducing people to ideas that may be a bit beyond what they are used to. The biggest thing that hit me was all the talk about sugar. While watching my niece and nephew we went shopping and it seemed that everything they wanted had an inordinate amount of sugar in it! Why are we allowing this much sugar to get into our bodies?! And more importantly, why are we feeding our children this crap?Fortunately, I was in a store where they have a diverse selection of multiple items. After looking at juice I found one (ONE) that did not have sugar in it. Spaghetti sauce was the same way. Applesauce seemed like it had more sugar than apples. My niece and nephew now think I'm a health nut but I would much rather them think that than to ingest all the amounts of sugar that we are getting used to every day.This book is just a wake up call. It has an enormous amount of information that I found very appealing. It is also not that difficult to incorporate. Even for children!A must read if you care about your brain and what you're putting into your body!

The packaging could definitely be better. The moisture from the mud was leaking before I opened it. Once opened it leaks everywhere.This is my first mud mask and being that it is mud I expected a smell but this really smells. I am curious if others smell as strongly but after reading other reviews I am finding that no. I'm not sure why this is so pungent but I tried it anyway. Do not love the smell but it is not a deal breaker. Consumers just be prepared for a very muddy smell. I live in Louisiana and I could probably dig up some mud and it would smell similar.As for the mixture itself, it is easy to put on. A bit messy. The moisture and mud did not mix well so I mixed it with my fingers before applying. It does dry quickly so the five minutes was not a huge deal. After a few uses I do not see a real difference and it is uncomfortable enough that I do not see myself buying more in the future. I think had I been more aware of mud masks that I may use it more. That is going to have to be for each consumer to decide for themselves.Overall, it was not bad. Smelly but that is to be expected.I received this product free in exchange for my honest unbiased review.

I am an avid watcher of Hawaii Five-0. The soundtrack is diverse and fun! The music obviously fits the theme of the current show (like holiday music) but being able to buy all five seasons of great music for one low price is awesome. I don't even skip the holiday music because mostly it is just fun.Fabulously diverse soundtrack. Lots of upbeat music that you could exercise to, and Hawaiian music you could meditate to. Love it.

My husband received these as a gift last Christmas. He has worn them every single day but recently lost them. With his job he has to have some type of safety glasses. Of course you normally see those horrible clear plastic kind. They're for work so who cares right? Well, when he lost these we purchased them the very next day. He got so used to them and found them to be much comfier than others.To be honest, he has a huge head. Sounds funny, but it is totally true. I was quite surprised that these things fit him. I haven't tried them so I'm not sure if they are one size fits all, but they are great for men. When he loses these we'll be getting another pair.Colors do not fade after being in the sun nearly every day! Great style, good fit.

What a great second book. As thrilling and exciting as the first. Kept me on the edge of my seat.If you have not read the first recently you may feel compelled to do a quick re-read. I sadly did not have the time and there is very little in this one to remind the reader of the story in book one. There is a brief beginning which covers the first book but again, very brief and not much is in that.That said though, I was able to jump in and pick this up without many worries. I wish I had read book one recently but I still feel really good about the plot and the characters, which are amazing!Once again, Madeline is fighting for her life. She’s also fighting for the love of her life, Samuel. It is strange to have him seem so distant to her so I can only imagine how she feels.Ryan threw me off a little bit. But, as I warmed up to him, although he is not in a lot of the book, I grew more accustomed to his weird speech and way of holding himself. He talks to Madeline as I am sure she talks to Samuel. I like Ryan though and hope to see more of him in book three.As for the plot, this one takes Madeline back to Portugal. Going from cell phones and internets to medieval times I can only imagine how she feels. She’s constantly saying and doing things that they have to ask her about. You think she would e more quiet but she is too strong willed. I love that she uses frigging all the time. It throws everyone off and just makes me laugh. But, still… talk about not being aware of where you are at! In those times she could be burned as a witch just for her vocabulary!!As for her message this time, she is totally thrown off (as anyone would be) and is just trying to find her way in the world, when of course she sees Samuel. It is quite interesting to see him so different but the message was interesting. I think I would have preferred a few more clues in present day to go with her message. Just to help bring everything together.As it was, though, I loved it and the way Pamela Dumond is able to take someone from today and etch them back into time. The story is amazing and I cannot wait for the third. Time travel romance at its best. Very different and edgy and yet still has the soft romanticism.Received by the authors, through Xpresso Book Tours, for an honest review.

While I had a few hiccups at the beginning, this dystopian was a fantastic read!The first chapter was amazing and had me curious for more. As I read I had more and more questions but then had to dig through some less exciting information. I loved the narrator but the next couple of chapters kind of threw me.Fortunately for me, I stuck with it. Once Elian is added to the story, the plot really picks up. The characters are amazing but Elian wound up being a step above some of the others. Sadly, he also winds up being SO different that he gets not only himself, but everyone else, into trouble. Even so, I just loved the addition of Elian. He was a wild card that really needed to be added to stir things up.Greta is a bit two dimensional at first but Elian helps her to think differently than what she’s been taught. This side of her is compelling but dangerous. Their lives are always on the line and one step off of that line, they are tortured.Xie is also one of my favorites. She keeps herself in line but is different from the others. She walks the tightrope but dares to jump around when she can! Between her and Elian they really shake things up.The plot of the story was quite interesting. I want to compare this to Hunger Games but really it is its own story. There were a few hiccups where the story was a little slow but only small speed bumps. I was curious what dairy and goats had to do with the story but really the background to the story is what helps to create such a good plot.The ending was amazing. This is a love story of sorts but definitely was not what I imagined. I loved how it played out but the ending… the ENDING! Fortunately Erin Bow said on Goodreads that she is setting up another novel that will be a companion. Which is great because I want to know what happens next, and you will to!In short: Great read. Good dystopian. A nice addition to the YA dystopian genre.Received by publisher for an honest review.

Fun, flirty with a lot of philosophical ideals for pleasure.This is one of those that I picked up and had a completely different idea of what it was. I read the synopsis but for some reason didn’t get the LGBT thing from it. That doesn’t bother me, I’m not that much into it, nor erotica, but after I started reading I thought, why not go with it and see where it ends up. There wound up only being a very few parts where I skimmed.That being said, had I picked this up FOR the LGBT element, I may  have been more disappointed. There actually is not that much. What is there is sexy and enticing but it is a short book, just do not expect it to jump in and sizzle.The plot line is actually interesting. So easy to read that I got through this in one evening. I really like Ken. He’s stressing a bit and his leaky faucet is driving him crazy. Especially since he has to finish a paper soon. Insert sexy plumber. Having had a completely different idea of the plot I didn’t think of anything until Ken said the plumber was really sexy. Threw me a little but not enough to not be interested. But that portion wasn’t even until 36% in! Most of this was about Ken and his ideals, giving a really good idea of where he was coming from before Mark even enters the picture.The thoughts that go through Ken’s mind are just like any horny teen’s! I loved how he handled (or didn’t) the situation. He was really normal person with a crush.That said the plumber, Mark, was a bit more two dimensional. They talked a bit but I wanted to know more about him. Ken was stressed though and it came through in their conversation. Only portions that really felt stagnated.Sexy, fun, and very easy to all in love with. I loved the philosophical elements!Received by publisher for an honest review.

I did not realize when I saw this that it had so much to do with the book To Kill a Mockingbird. It was apropos since my family’s book club had decided on reading Harper Lee’s books this month.Upon starting I had not read To Kill a Mockingbird and put this on hold until I finished. Although that was not necessary since Matt Rawle gives a synopsis, and in some cases talks a bit more in depth about the book. I wanted to read To Kill a Mockingbird to get a good understand of where Matt was coming from but really, it is not required.Many of his chapters have to do with the characters and plot of the story but the main plot of this book is about loving one another. Matt Rawle constantly goes back to biblical passages to remind us what love is and how we can use the ideas of TKAMB and put them into our own lives.For those on the blog it is known that I am a new christian. I am not one that goes around professing my feelings but I do try to follow in Jesus’s footsteps. Or Mother Theresa’s, Buddha’s, etc. The people who really made a loving difference in this world are the ones that I look to for what to do. Matt is able to take the things that happened in the Jim Crowe times and adjust them to our beliefs and ideals of today in a Godly way.Jesus’s main idea while he walked this earth was one of peace and love so it saddens me to see so much violence today. TKAMB sheds some light on why the violence is prevalent but Matt Rawle is able to bring it all back around to biblical sense; to shed light on the problems and how to fix them within ourselves.In short: This is an amazing book. Even if I were not a Christian I would want to read this. The ideas are biblical but the message is transcendent. The message is clear if only we would open our minds to really listen.Received from publisher for an honest review.

This is set in Paris and the way Mary sets out the scenes it is nearly like you are there! Beautiful descriptions with a lot of French thrown in, which didn’t totally throw me off and was mostly fun!This is about a group of gals that are tap dancers set up to dance on July 14 on a riverboat! Can there be anything more fun?! The gals themselves are adorable. Each different in their own ways.Sadly, this is my first time reading Mary McHugh so although I loved the plot I was not totally into the book. It seems like it can be read (as I did) without reading any of the other books in the series but at times I felt like I was missing portions of the plot. Meeting the gals was a very quick moment and then the plot moves along. Although, having not read the synopsis for a while, I was curious if this was a first because there is a lot of background added in.It was cute enough for me to want to read the others in the series. I stopped about halfway through, not to DNF (do not finish) but because I really want to get to know the characters more and then I’ll come back to this one.Also!! I was surprised to find some recipes! A little gift from the author! They sound fabulous too!Received from the publisher for an honest review.

Well, this starts and if you have seen the film Aladdin you’re basically going to know the plot, verbatim. Sadly, it is like the author wrote it word for word from the movie. I love the move. LOVE the movie and have probably watched it with my daughter 100 times. Seriously. But, sadly it threw me off and as much as I loved the movie, the more the book was the same, the more bored I got.Sadly, it does not stop until about a quarter of the way in. This in itself turned me off a great deal. I think it was the fact that it would have been easier to just put the movie in! I can say the movie word for word so why would I need to read it? Liz Braswell does have a few things that are added in but it wasn’t enough to give more depth to the story like someone would want from a book. I wanted to really know the characters, not just the versions from the movie.This does have a twist where Jafar actually gets the lamp but I have to be honest. It came too late for me. It makes me a bit sad because my hopes were high for this one. I’m a huge Disney fan and normally love everything Disney but, like I said. It would have been easier just putting the movie in.Sadly, this will be DNF.Received by publisher for an honest review.

This is a great book full of different stories to explain how great and how scary prayer can be! Dangerous prayer is letting God know that you're ready to do as he wants and giving your life over but the dangerous part is asking.It's like that old adage be careful what you wish for. In the stories there were so many great things that happened because people were willing to ask how they could be used to help others.Out of the stories here, the one that resonated with me the most was the girl that had a really hard time after she became a teen. Her parents had a hard time as well trying to understand her, as all parents do during that time. They almost lost her when she tried to commit suicide. Fortunately they wanted to help her but they also knew that there were some things that they couldn't do without God.There are many stories like this one, that really delve into life and how hard it can be but how great it is to pray and surrender yourself.Very short, easy read that is an inspiration.

This was fabulous! Being a fan of Gail Carriger, I figured after reading the synopsis that I would love this. The main character is quirky but scientific and just really fun! Once I started reading I did not want to put it down.First of all, Veronica has a good head on her shoulders. She likes to think scientifically, gathering all evidence before forming a hypothesis, but is not always right. She’s even strong enough to say when she’s wrong!The beginning of this book showed that Veronica was going to be in for some hiccups with her new life. Her aunts just died and she is determined to take on the world, one butterfly at a time. While doing so she winds up getting into quite a bit of trouble and has to figure out a way out of the mess without digging herself in deeper.Then there is Stoker. They are like an old married couple, getting along one minute and grouching at each other the next. Always at odds I’m not sure where I was hoping their relationship would go. It is just another curiosity out of this outrageous, but fabulous plot.While they are not totally sure if their lives are in danger, they may be in danger of killing each other!It’s a fantastically wonderful tale with a lot of fun and drama thrown in. Just when I thought the plot was about to slow, something else would come from left field! But nothing truly was from left field. Lots of clues are left for the two to decipher.Fantastic!Received from publisher for an honest review.

Selfie stick with remote which makes taking selfies so much easier!I do not have an iPhone so I was really pleased to see that this fits any phone. There is an adjustable piece that allows the phone to fit securely into the holder. This is sturdy enough that kids can even use it!The stick length is also fantastic. It is nice being able to decide how far out or how close I want the stick to be. By adjusting the stick it can be extended quite far. Again, another great feature.Easy to use, very easy to set up.Received from company for an honest review.

This product works great. It took me a minute to actually work it but it is very easy to use. Once I got used to the rhythm I was much faster!Being someone that loves strawberries I can see this coming in handy when eating a lot of them.It does take some of the strawberry though. I prefer to cut off just the very green portion and leave the rest of the strawberry. Or just eat it whole and pull the stem off. I can see where this would come in handy for pies.Good product. It is not a HAVE to have type of product but it is useful.Received by the company for an honest review.
I liked the idea of it, until my mom came over and trying to open it, ripped it out of the wall.  Unless you have a stud EXACTLY where they say to install it, it'll be ripped out of your wall.
They are darling, and they fit; however, they gave my daughter the worst blister on her heel that I've ever seen. She had a scab for 2 months. She won't wear them now.

Who would have thought that something so simple would actually work?  No need to spend $$ on other stud finders that can be frustrating.I wish they would have made the bottom edge flat so you could rest it on things you are hanging and actually use the level.  I really don't get how it can help you the way it's designed.
It's a good shirt. It really hugs the love handle area though. My husband went up 1 size and it's still very tight.  It will be great for surfing though.

I had the old Phillips Sonicare brush (that I've used for almost 10 years).  It did work great and I loved it...except it would get nasty where the head connected to the wand. This design with the new head is much better!  It's skinnier, a better charging base, overall better design.  All the great features you need. Don't spend $$ on more expensive versions of basically this same toothbrush.  This is perfect.

How did I not know you could buy heads for your electric toothbrush for a fraction of the cost?  Do they work as well?  YES!I have a Phillips Sonicare EasyClean brush and these work just like the head it came with from the manufacturer.  Save $$ and order these!

I've tried other razors, and this one is just heads and shoulders above the rest.  Yes, the purple pads fall off after 2 weeks, but I still use the razor blade for about 1 month. You are paying for quality here, and to me, having smooth skin and no razor burn is worth it for me.
bright color, great fabric, no scratchy tags, 6 year old loves it!

I ordered 4 tankini tops to choose from and this one is my favorite!  So comfy. I actually like to use the halter strap or criss cross the straps in the back.  The gathering and ruffle is so comfy and flattering. I'm 5'3" and 115 pounds...with leftover baby weight...and maybe some cookie weight in my midsection and it hides that nicely. The Medium fits great on me.

I'm 5'3" and 115 pounds.  I bought a US-Small (in the Navy floral) and US-Medium (in the teal/green floral) to compare. While the Small fits, my personal preference is to go up a size so it's not too tight.I'm in love with this dress. I think I might wear it every day come summer. It has the comfort of a t-shirt and sweats but looks like a pretty dress.  -Thick fabric (don't need a slip, floral pattern hides unwanted lines).  -Color exactly as pictured (for both the green and navy floral)  -Length comes to the bottom of my knee

I always wondered why my kids didn't really get excited about play dough....it's because they didn't have fun tools to use with it.  My 6 and 2 year old played for a good 30 minutes with these tools and their play dough. Very fun!

***UPDATED Review After 6 Months...Amazon needs to fix the description. It states you can connect to the internet and send emails and add music.  THIS IS NOT TRUE for this particular product.  The only thing you can personalize is type your child's name when in parent mode.Other than the disappointment from the incorrect advertising, this was my 2 year old daughter's favorite toy from Christmas.  She calls it her Princess Computer.  There are some other options out there, but I am in love with the simplicity of the keyboard.  There is still many different modes and options so it doesn't get boring, but it's not too overwhelming. I was hoping the letter keys would be in the same place as a real computer, but they are in alphabetical order.  Maybe that is better for this age though.My 6 year old son and my 10 month old daughter also love to play with this.

This was all my 6 year old son wanted for his birthday.  The yellow top of the submarine opens up, so you can put little action figures inside.  We have used this in the bath so far, but he is excited to take it to the pool or the beach this summer.
I got this for my 2 year old daughter as a bath toy.  She loves it, as does my 10 month old and 6 year old son.  We want to take it to the beach this summer.

Our 2006 Nissan Pathfinder's hatch would no longer stay open.  It kept falling down and whacking us on the head (so painful!)  These were a quick fix.  It springs right up now and we have had no problems for the last 3 months.

This thing is awesome. It's as fun as you make it. I bought it for my 6 year old son.  So far, we've used it on the carpet, wood floor, and snow.  It's a little tricky to be able to sit on it with all the big snow gear for sledding, but when he feels comfortable enough to stand or kneel on it, i'm sure that will be fun.
I bought this for my 6 year old nephew who loves camp.  he LOVES it!

I got this for my 2 year old daughter.  She and my 6 year old son love to play with all the accessories. Their favorite is the ear scope that lights up.  I knocked off 1 stars because the robotics are pretty rudimentary. I am not sure how long they will last,  but for now it is fun.  I like how soft the horse is and not heavy (saves all of us pain when we are accidentally whacked with the toy :).
absolutely LOVE this book.  My 6 yr old giggled the whole time we read it together.
very convenient. My 5 yr old uses this for his belts and ties.

Kids of all ages love this toy.  I had to deduct a star for not having a QUIET setting.  We mom's live for that quiet setting on the toys, but this one is pretty loud. My 1 year old loves it and my 5 year old likes to tilt it sideways and shoot the balls out across the room.  Win/win for both of them.
Can't say enough about these spot it games! It's great for ANY age (starting with 3 and up). So much fun!
Random humor that we all love. Fun way to add to your family's collection. Our 4 year old loves it.

This is a good gate with a lot of sizing options - we have an awkward stair opening and this is the only one that could adjust to our size (41"). We use it at the top of the stairs (despite the warnings) and I know it has saved our mischievous daughter.I don't like how difficult it is to open.  I get that you don't want your baby to be able to open it, but it is not intuitive and any adult that comes by my house can't figure it out.  We've had this up for 1 1/2 years and it no longer swings all of the way closed by itself.  Granted, it gets opened and closed a lot by my 4 year old who isn't as careful and gentle as he should be. It still does it's job.This gate opens both ways, a necessity for mom's who are always carrying things/children up and down stairs.

I searched forever to find a quality humidifier and was considering spending some big bucks for one that I knew would help my sick kids.  This one was a fraction of the price and really delivers. I have been faithful about rinsing and airing it out every other day when it's in use and it has worked great for the last year.

My son got this for his 5th birthday and was most excited about this present. Even though it says for ages 7-12, he had no trouble putting it together all by himself! The pieces fit great together and instructions are easy for a child to understand.

I love that this fit great with plenty of room. It's very light-weight, which is great for my 4 yr old son who does not like getting hot!  It comes very wrinkly (as you can imagine) but you aren't supposed to iron it, so make sure you order it a couple days before you need it so you can hang it up and get those wrinkles out naturally.

I bought this as a gift for my mother. She LOVES it.  It is a little heavy but my mom says she likes that it is such good quality.  I think she always washes it by hand to keep it nice and it's been working great so far.
These are well made, heavier than I anticipated but well made.  Makes measuring so much better. Get the teaspoon as well.

If you are wondering whether you want a bigger size, just go for the bigger size, you won't regret it.  These are nice, but smaller than I was anticipating. Not enough room to chop in my opinion but a well made product.

I love this case because it's clear, so you can still see the color of the phone. Also like the bumper corners and the thinness of the case. It's comfortable to hold with a nice grip because the sides curve inward. Fits perfectly.

I actually use this mat in my bathroom and it works pretty well. Wish it was a little longer for the area I use it in but, it's not a deal breaker. The color and design is nice. It has a good cushion feel when standing on it.

I love the colors on this case. The feel of the case is more slippery than expected. Thought it would have more grip on the sides. It's not quite TPU material because it isn't that bendable. It also has some minor imperfections where the colors split. The material is raised around the power button and the charge area on the bottom and it feels razor sharp when holding the phone. I had to use a scissors/nail clip to try to smooth out those edges. Overall, not a bad case and fits perfectly.

I was looking for a suit/garment bag that was big and durable enough to fit a few dresses, shirts, and dress pants. Luckily, I was able to find this bag in a local store for much cheaper than this online price. I wasn't expecting to find a bag that could hold shoes as well but, this bag does and comes with a small shoe pouch which was a big plus. I was able to fit 1 suit jacket, 3 dresses, 4 pants, and 4 shirts into this bag. I had the hangers for the pants and shirts joined together. I probably could've fit more clothes in if needed. In addition, I was able to fit 2 pairs of pumps, 1 flat loafer, and 2 pairs of flat sandals in the front zipper compartment and still had room to fit more. I used the shoe pouch for both the sandals. Everything fit neat and perfectly in the bag without looking packed/bulky. I didn't notice until I was putting the bag away that it had a hook on the bottom for easy folding while the clothes are in it. That is another plus! This bag has a new  canvas smell when taken out the package. I let mines air out for a couple of days before putting my clothes in. The material is not soft but, feels strong enough to last for a while. This bag is a definite keeper!

This is a nice crop top. I was a little unsure if a large was going to be too big/small, but it fits perfectly for my bust size (36DD) so I can actually wear it without a bra. The material is soft and has decent stretch to it. It's cute enough to wear casually or dress it up for a night out. The zipper feels a little fragile when trying to zip it up but, it's not a deal breaker.
I didn't like this jumpsuit at all. You can see right through the material. The neck area ties at the side for some reason instead of the back. I am returning it.

This seems to be a decent jumpsuit. The material is okay and stretchy. Seller only had medium or large available and the medium was a little to big for me in the hip, crotch, & leg area. There were many gaps throughout. A small probably would've worked better if it was available. Therefore, I am returning it. The reason I gave it 3 stars is because jumpsuit had a very strong chemical smell coming from the material.

I really liked the way the back of this romper looks. The one size fit okay but, could've been a little tighter. I didn't like the shoulder area because it was not very snug. This made it a little difficult to stay on my shoulders. Plus, the romper came with 2 holes in the sleeves. Therefore, I am returning it.

Nice screen protector for the Note 4. It's very clear and smooth. The edges line up exactly to the front camera, ear speaker, and button. Had some difficulties with getting it on. When I would pull on the 2nd tab, it would lift the protector off the phone causing bubbles to appear & a little dust particles to get underneath. Other than that, it's nice & does the job.
This is a decent case for the Note 4. It's lightweight & doesn't weigh the phone down. Feels good in the palm while holding it. All pieces line up perfectly and easy to put on.

I've purchased many different brands of lotions (Avon, Aveeno, Body Butter, Palmers, etc.) to relieve my extra dry skin. Neither was able to fully moisturize my skin or last long enough to keep the ash away. I remembered using Nivea (blue bottle) years ago & wanted to give it another try. But, I saw this 48 hr extended lotion & decided to get it instead of the original. This lotion works wonders on my skin especially after a shower! I've noticed a difference in my skin not  becoming ashy after a couple hours at work...particularly on my elbows. The smell is nice & subtle, not overpowering. It goes on quick and easy without leaving any residue or stickiness. And it stops itchiness. Plus the cost is cheaper than some of those other brands in the local stores. I will definitely continue to use this lotion.

This dress looks good and is made out of decent material. However, it was too large for me and didn't fit as expected. I usually wear between a medium or size 6-8 depending on the cut of the clothing. But this dress was not as form fitting on me as I expected. The shoulders were loose and the dress had gaps of space down the sides, back, & front. I really liked & wish I could've kept it but, it was too loose. I requested a return.

Finally upgraded the memory in my Acer AS7750-6423 laptop from 4GB to 8GB with these Crucial memory sticks. I was a little skeptical due to some of the previous reviews stating the sticks were DOA or failed after a couple of months. But, I couldn't find any other affordable options so decided to give it a try anyway & hope for the best. So far, so good. I have noticed that the laptop boots up faster than before. Any application that I click on opens faster as well.UPDATE 10/30/2014: Lasted for 1 week & 1 day! Today, I tried to start my laptop with the Crucial RAMs but, I consistently received what they call "the blue screen of death". I tried 3 times & each time the laptop would show "connecting" for 3 mins, then "welcome" for 2 mins. The laptop would boot for another minute showing my desktop screen then, the blue memory dump screen appeared. Luckily, I kept the old memory stick. I took out the Crucials and put my old stick back in. The laptop indicated to boot in safe mode which I did, then I restarted normally. Thankfully, my laptop came back up as normal! I was on the verge of being very upset if those sticks killed my laptop. I will be submitting a refund request to Amazon. Now, I am back at 4GB of RAM when I really would've preferred 8GB. Changed rating from 4 stars to 1.
The story was so short I couldn't believe that I reached the end so quickly. The ending really left me hanging, wanting to know what was going to happen next.
Quick read...Wish this story was longer. I did enjoy the theme of the story. It is a page turner because I didn't stop reading until it was at the end. Waiting for part 2 to be free.

I purchased this handle to replace the Moen 100710 shower knobs that keeps breaking on the inside. I didn't want to waste money on another one of those knobs. I found this and another brand (Danco) while shopping around for longer lasting alternatives. The Danco brand has metal adapters but,  I wasn't fond of the shape/design of the handle. So, I was a bit skeptical when I read previous reviews for the Moen mention that the inside pieces/adapters were plastic. I thought it was made of the same material as the knobs but, it seems to be more durable because it is a hard plastic versus acrylic like the knobs. Installation was simple only because I found instructions on which adapter to use online. Would've been nice if instructions were included in the box. The handle looks a bit weird because the opening is a little wide, plus I'm use to the knob fitting closely. Otherwise, it's working good for now. I just hope that the plastic adapter holds up.

The gooseneck was not long enough. When attached to my windshield, I still had to stretch my arms & body quite a bit to reach the phone. I was looking for something that is within arms length (reach), without having to stretch at all. Also, the product images kind of makes you think that you are getting all the other attachments (dash & lighter connections) with the holder but, that is not the case.

These knobs really don't last. The inside of these knobs should not be made out of plastic. I just replaced this less than a year ago and it has broken already. I refused to purchase another one of these cheap plastic knobs. So, I started to look for alternatives that would last. I went to my local hardware store and it seemed like I was stuck with purchasing this again UNTIL I saw a metal lever style handle.

I purchased this because I wanted to be able to carry my phone to a pool or beach, take pictures, and not worry about it getting water damage. I got it from a local store because I needed it for a trip and it gave me a chance to make sure it was big enough for my phone. I have the Note 3 & this pouch is an exact fit. Therefore, you have to take off any cases you have on the phone before putting it in the pouch. To be on the safe side, I put my phone in a ziplock bag, put it in the pouch then, tested it in a sink full of water first. It floated just as described and no water leaked into the case. The inner material is clingy (making it a bit difficult to put the phone in), but for a reason. If you put your hand in the case first to separate the plastic then, you can drop your phone in. You have to be sure to press the case down against the phone to squeeze out the air and seal the pouch to the phone and seal the closure flap together. Then you fold & velcro close. Would've preferred if it had a different material closure instead of velcro but, this will do for now.UPDATE 9/10/2014 - I used this case on my trip and it worked GREAT!!!! This case allowed me to carry my phone to the pool and beach while taking pictures with no worries. Every picture and video I took came out clear with no blur as if it wasn't in the case. I am so glad I decided to get this to capture every moment of the trip.

I found this product when I was in my local grocery store doing my usual weekly greens & fruit purchases to make my morning green juices. Recently, I've been cutting down on the fruits and additional veggies that I would normally purchase because it gets expensive. Also, some of the items spoil before I have a chance to finish it. As I walked pass the refrigerator aisle, I noticed this green juice. I read the label and saw that it included many of the things I like to juice. Then, I looked at the cost and compared it to all the items in my shopping cart. It was definitely cheaper, so I decided to give it a try. I did not expect it to taste so good. It's sweeter than I expected it to be but it definitely tastes better than the raw veggies and fruits that I normally juice. The only things missing from the ingredients are flaxseed and ginger. I will continue to drink this instead of juicing.

I haven't heard of this gel until my hairdresser tried it in my natural hair to see if it will make my curls wavy and shiny. To my surprise it did just that and it HOLDS! It's very thick and best used mixed with a little water because it may begin to flake when applied on dry hair. It really keeps your style or whatever you're trying to do in tact. Unlike other well known gels I've tried (S-Curl and Eco). Those gels did nothing to hold my curly edges down, my hair up, or straight (made my hair more curly when I wanted a slick look).I love this Gummy Gel product but it's best to find in a local beauty supply if possible because the packaging when shipped is poor. This is disappointing because my hairdresser advised she hasn't seen it in the local stores. It appears so because it's not a known brand like Eco which could easily be found anywhere. :-(

After many years of relaxers, hair pulling, brushing, and braiding, I never paid much attention to my edges until now. I decided to go natural and take the big chop plunge which took some getting use to. Therefore, I would use lots of headbands and braids in my hair until I reached a decent amount of growth. However, the last time I got braids it made my edges break so bad because they were too tight. I was highly upset!I did so much research on products that say it will make edges grow, such as, Dr. Miracle, ORS, Soft Sheen, Jamaican Castor Oil (this I actually tried), etc. Then, a friend introduced me to BB Pine Tar and I've been using it ever since. It's cheaper to buy from a local beauty store. It's not the best smelling but it's not unbearable either as others make it seem. You get use to it after the first couple weeks. I only use the Pine Tar on my edges. In the beginning I would use a different hairdress on my scalp to help counteract the smell but now it doesn't bother me. The results may be slow depending on your hair growth pattern, but it definitely works with consistent use. The directions says to use 3 times a week, but some weeks I use every day or 5 days a week. Plus, I am more careful with how I wear my hair making sure not to pull it back too tight, I comb instead of brushing the front of my hair, and no more braids.

This is the second brand of Flaxseed that I've tried and I love it!! The previous brand, Sundown Naturals, started to clump together after a couple weeks which made it difficult for juicing. Then, I found Flax USA in my local Sams Club for a great price. I've been using it daily now for 2 months with no signs of clumping!! It blends very well with my green juice. Having such a huge package makes it last longer, which is a big plus! I will definitely continue to purchase this brand.

I was a bit skeptical about purchasing this conditioner after reading some bad reviews. Plus, it wasn't easy finding a local store for purchase. Eventually, I was able to find it after calling a few local beauty supply stores.It's been a challenge finding deep treatments for my natural hair that doesn't cause tangling. I used the Cantu Deep Treatment Masque on my dry hair after pulling out cornrows. It felt very soft and smooth during application. And it smells soooo good. However, it is a bit oily/greasy on the hands and takes a little effort to wash off. Then, I put on a shower cap and slept with it overnight. My hair wasn't tangled and I was able to easily finger comb it. The treatment rinsed out of my hair with no problem. In the end, my hair felt soft and moisturized. I will definitely add this to my Cantu products collection.

I've been using the Cantu Leave-In Conditioning Repair Cream and loved how well it worked for my natural hair. So, I decided to try this rinse out conditioner as well. It has exceeded my expectations! It makes my hair easy to comb through, provides much needed moisture and it smells GRRREEEAAAATTTT!!! When I walk into a room, people can smell it from a mile away. I love this product so much that I'm looking at others that Cantu has to offer.Highly recommend!

My newly natural curly hair LOVES this leave in conditioner! It makes my hair soft and easy to comb through. It works well with my color treated hair and, it smells sooooooooooooo good! When I use it regularly, I notice my hair is stronger with less breakage.I highly recommend this product, especially for naturals with hard to manage hair.

Found this at my local supermarket for much cheaper. Purchased to use in my green juice to add more nutrition. Blends well and tastes good. Definitely recommend using the powder versus taking the pills.October 2013 Update: I no longer use this product because it began clumping in the container after half of it was used. I was constantly using butter knives to break it apart and no longer blended well. I'm using a much better product now (Flax USA). Therefore, I changed my original 4-star rating to 2-stars.

I recently started to go natural and did the 'Big Chop' a few months ago. Since then, I've been trying out many different products to see which ones work best for my color treated, curly hair texture. I've been using the As I Am Twist Cream and decided to look at other products within that brand. For a while, I've seen and heard of people doing co-washes with conditioner versus using shampoo. But, I always figured that conditioner alone could not do the job of a shampoo. I understand that there are some shampoos out there that strips the hair of moisture/oils, etc. For that reason, I have at least tried to purchase shampoos that are sulfate-free, such as Carol's Daughter.I read the product info and reviews for this co-wash, then decided to give it a try. First thing I noticed was how smooth it felt on my hair. I could also feel that it was actually cleaning the buildup from my hair and scalp. The best part of this cowash is it doesn't tangle. Combing out my hair with this product is amazing! It makes the process so much easier than other products I've tried.I'm still not totally sold on co-washing and may use shampoo occasionally. But, this Coconut CoWash will be a staple for my natural hair care products.
This bar is just okay, it could be better. I'll have one every other day as a snack but I don't think I'll repurchase after it's finish.

I just recently started trying this brand of bars. The cinnamon roll bar is a must. This cookie dough bar is a not a must. It was awful. There was no cookie dough taste or texture to this bar. It does not look like what you see on the box. It's very mushy and gooey. I wish I could return it to my local store and get my money back.

I recently had a cinnamon bun bar from a Nutrisystem kit and was shocked on how good it was. I didn't like everything in the kit but I wanted more of those bars. So, I did a google search on cinnamon bun bars and found this brand on Walmart's website. I purchased it from my local store and was so happy that it tasted just as great as the Nutrisystem bar. I was even happier that it was cheaper! Now, I'm google searching if it's healthy to eat one of these everyday because I'm so hooked! LOL. I have frequent sweet cravens and this really helps to subdue it. Plus, I figure it's a lot healthier than eating snickers or cookies early in the morning. Every time I go to the store I stock up on these because I don't want to run out. Good stuff!
Good mouse pad. Perfect size for daily use. The gel wrist pad is comfortable. Not too hard, not too soft. Another plus is it has a skid proof material on the bottom to keep it from moving around.

I was forced to read this book for a college course. It's soooooo boring that I fell asleep every time I read it. Why do colleges subject us to these uninteresting textbooks???? Way too much technical jargon that don't make sense.

I was doing some research on connecting my laptop to my LCD tv. At first, I thought doing it wirelessly would be cool. But I couldn't decide on which device would be the best to purchase. I did google searches on Imation, Netgear, Veedom, etc. However, I wasn't sure if I wanted to spend $60+ at the moment for something I was unsure about. So I watched a CNET review on connecting via HDMI. Seemed simple enough, only draw back would be the cord stretching across the room.I looked on local store websites to see where I could go to get one today (because I'm impatient...lol). So, I drove to a tech store and the sales clerk was showing me higher prices ($19.99+ for 6ft & up) that I did not see on the store site (less than $10.00). I looked around on my own and found only 1 Xtreme HDMI 12ft package just laying on the bottom of a rack. The packaging is different than what you see on Amazon but its the same brand. Since there was no price tag, I assumed it was going to be costly. I took my chances and asked the cashier for a price check. She said it was $3.97!!! I couldn't believe it. I immediately said, I'LL TAKE IT!Got home, plugged it into my laptop, then tv and voila...it instantly connected. I'm able to extend my screens to have 2 different things up at the same time (Internet, Office, or Videos). Plus, the picture quality is good and the sound works. Wish the cord was a little bit longer but for $3.97 can't complain.

I have an old HP Photosmart C6180 All-In-One that decided to fade and add lines on my scanned docs. I came to the conclusion that it would cost just as much to repair vs buying a new scanner/printer, so the hunt began with...The Epson WF3520 I purchased about 2 days ago (from a local dept store) & I wrote a good review on it. As much as I loved that printer, I returned it to get an actual touch screen model vs a touch panel (which is what the WF3520 had).So, I purchased this HP PS7520 thinking I was getting a better quality/more updated multifunction than the WF3520. BOY WAS I WRONG! It had a full touch screen & scan to email (without PC), but that's as far as it goes. There was no automatic double side scan, you have to manually flip the papers & put them back in the feeder. Every fax test I did failed for "Not Using Correct Type of Phone Cord with Fax". I tried using the 1 cord from the box and it still failed. The android HP ePrint app is lacking basic features. The HP ePrintCenter apps for the printer are a JOKE and does not live up to claims of having access to Bing Maps & Facebook. For each app, you still need to go on your PC to the actual website for set up. Not to mention, the size of the printer is HUGE! Once again, I was on the hunt and back at the customer service counter doing another return.I do not recommend this product...

I have an old HP Photosmart C6180 All-In-One that decided to fade and add lines on my scanned docs. I came to the conclusion that it would cost just as much to repair vs buying a new scanner/printer, so the hunt began with...The Epson WF3520 I purchased about 2 days ago (from a local dept store) & I wrote a good review on it. As much as I loved that printer, I returned it to get an actual touch screen model vs a touch panel (which is what the WF3520 had).So, I purchased the HP PS7520 thinking I was getting a better quality/more updated multifunction than the WF3520. Boy was I wrong! It had a full touch screen & scan to email (without PC), but that's as far as it goes. There was no automatic double side scan, you had to manually flip the papers & put them back in the feeder. The HP web apps are a joke and the size of the printer is HUGE! Once again, I was on the hunt and back at the customer service counter doing another return.Then came the Epson XP 800. I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PRINTER. The price could've been a little bit cheaper but that's just me. Set up was a breeze. It flawlessly connected with my Windows 7 PC, Google Drive, Cloud Print, and Dropbox. The features are great and easy to use. I'm going to have a blast with the CD/DVD printing! I use the Epson iPrint app on my Samsung Galaxy S3 to scan & print docs. The ePrint feature to a customized email address is pretty cool. The automatic double side scan is the best and the automatic output tray is an added bonus. I do agree with other reviews I've seen about the output tray retracting. However, I'm assuming the printer would need a sensor to know when the printed docs are removed in order to retract. Otherwise, where would the printed docs go...I'll leave it up to Epson to implement that on the next model.Overall, it's a great product! I hope this was my last trip to the return counter...LOL. So if you're on the hunt like I was for an all-in-one replacement, look no further...Epson XP 800 is the way to go!

I've owned 1 of these chambers for 14+ years and it's never worn out. I was unable to get the coordination of the head tilting, breathing, and pumping the inhaler all at the same time. Therefore, I rarely got the air into my lungs. But with this chamber, I don't have to worry about the coordination. Just pump air into the chamber and breathe in from the other end. I purchased this product for my niece who was having the same issue as me and she loves it. It's not the most portable/travel friendly piece of equipment but it's definitely a great product to own for inhaler users.

I originally purchased an S-type clear TPU case for my Sprint Galaxy S3, but I really wanted a case with a stand. At the time, I only saw cases where the stand part was hard plastic.
